game is a waste of time

author: {'steamid': '76561198091361041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1594691081}
review: I played this game for a very long time on here and the launcher. it used to be an amazing game before they gutted the ascension atlas which honestly completely ruined the game. I was in a full pantheon and almost everyone quit the same day they changed it. the old ascension atlas you had to actually grind various things to increase making it so you could see actual progress. in addition each class had a lot more customization to them where you could actually pick abilities to a limited degree which made each class good for certain areas. ie lightbenders being used for big 12 man runs or (I think) alchemist allowing for massive debuff allowing for burst units like gunner and cryomancer to absolutely shred bosses. my last log in there was not a single player in the main hub which the log in prior had had thousands of players. I may take a look again but I can not in good conscience advise anyone to play this game especially since they have not rolled back some of the worst changes that destroyed the game

review: New player here. I am quite enjoying the gameplay loop. Graphics are pretty nice. Runs mostly smooth with a few glitches here and there with the paladin during combat. I quite enjoy the action combat aspect and the classes that I am able to play at this stage feel pretty good. The goal for now is to unlock the other classes. It seems to be pretty grindy but my 9000+ hours on Warframe says that's fine, nothing to see here, folks :-) I probably will spend money in future on this and play this with my buddies as a few of them are also interested to do some content. Give it a bash, it is free (with all that f2p entails).

review: Meh... The game start okey, but quickly scrambling into pieces... Character creator was good for the time game comes out, art stile too. But devs/publisher realy slaps you fast with the paywalls. After first cople missions and opend world sections game litterly imposible without carry or paying for dmg( yes you can buy some bonuses, like boost for GOD form and bla bla bla). Launcher bad too, sometimes you lucky if it works... Tickrate for servers bad too, if you miss your tick for skill, mob that you fighting will atack twice and you will miss your atack... And generly game become worse and worse the more you playing it in every aspect... Go play warframe or something better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970943885', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1694855320}
{'steamid': '76561198062728174', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4552, 'last_played': 1701327519}
review:
Preface; I played this on the separate launcher version, so my time here is not reflective of my total game time.

TL:DR; Game is on life support and you should look somewhere else, despite the interesting setting.

-----

This game is honestly quite sad.

What currently exists feels like something that'd be in the game's launch year, not over eight or so years after the fact, while the content that [i]used[/i] to be in it was far more fulfilling.

There used to be a fairly large skill tree, the Ascension Atlas, which made progression feel worthwhile even with the grind. They got rid of that.

You could enter a 'personal' temple that you could interact with your adepts, to send them out on adventures. They got rid of that, in place of a streamlined/dumbed down version of it.

The world used to be fairly open and thus let you pick through areas that you had the sufficient power rating for. They neutered it, making the world map feel barren in exchange for a far more linear railroad that honestly has the ordering of every region out of whack. There's even dialogue that acts like you got your ascended/god form in one of the current version regions, a good bit before you actually get said form.

I can't even remember the story of the game, doubly so since they, for whatever reason, moved them to be post junior god quest instead of running along the main path leading up to said form.

What all was shoved in thanks to the gutting of the content? All of the nickle-and-diming macrotransactions they feel they could get away with.

The playerbase reflects it as well, since I remember the game being a lot more lively back then, but heard that a number of them quit once the atlas was removed. As it stands, SteamDB states that there are on average a hundred players on this game on a daily basis. What's worse is that this is a game that has the playerbase split between here and the separate launcher version, but I feel that the woes are the same over on the launcher version.

Even more egregious is that [b]player progression[/b] is split as well. If you played the game and even invested in it on the launcher version and decided to play it here, you're s*** outta luck and have to start over, and the devs have stated years ago that there is no intention of syncing them up at all, if ever.

Goodbye Skyforge. You were fun while it lasted, but holy s*** do I regret sinking time into this due to how barren it feels now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153892991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2002, 'last_played': 1701247603}
review: 33 horas de juego ya, a un 70% de la campaña y todavia no pude comprar ni una clase nueva. Las dungeons son imposibles para hacerlas solo, que es lo que mas "sparks" te dá en el juego paara comprar otras clases. Cuando pasas la interminable campaña te dan dinero para comprar una sola de las aproximadamente 12 que hay. Todo lo haces mucho mas rapido pagando, pero el hecho de que tengas que esperar mas de 30 horas de juego para poder obtener la clase que mas te guste me parece ridiculo ya. Quise darle una buena oportunidad al juego y probe todas las maneras posibles que averigué para farmear esa moneda y comprar alguna clase que no sea las míseras 3 que te dan de entrada, pero ya me cansé. Pongan más clases de entrada, o almenos que se desbloquee una tras cada provincia liberada, jugar con una clase qe no te gusta para conseguir una que si es tortuoso, no divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998094494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1588129565}
review:
To be honest, i cannot recommend it anymore. It went from having it's own custom thing, to being just as linear and simple as every other mmo. It used to have a big amazing skill tree, and that went away. It got rid of the early follower/religion thing (since i've yet to see it), and it just feels like just a shell of it's former self, like everything was sucked out of it.

Honestly, it's not worth the money. Company just driven the entire game into the ground. Better off just ignoring it and playing another mmo. You'll probably get the same plain shell feeling like any other.

If only companies actually cared about their games anymore, and stopped removing everything that made it fun. But, i guess companies just don't want customers anymore. Oh well.

For anyone who's played the game when everything was in, i'm sure you all know how fun that was, and seeing how plain, simple, and hollow this game became in the future, you'll know what i mean.

Goodbye Skyforge. It's a shame you went the way Star Wars Galaxies did, by a company that just wants it the same as any other mmo out there. Maybe they'll bring it all back and make it a unique and fun experience again.

review: Много лет назад играл с самого старта, тогда ещё через игровой клиент mail.ru . Была интересная и понятная система прокачки, рейды. Спустя долгое время решил попробовать опять, раз уж она появилась в steam вместе с достижениями. Какое разочарование - чат мертвый, авто-подбор матчей мертвый, и из игры будто вырезали  самое интересное. Сколько играю уже, а до сих пор не разобрался что делать и в чем смысл. По ощущениям онлайн составляет десяток или десятки человек. Не знаю почему проект ещё не закрыли.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047269909', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1700098493}
review:
It takes around 15 hours of the main story and little else to unlock 1 new class of your choice as long as it isnt one of the classes which cost more like bounty hunter.

It had a weird level issue around rank 30ish~ where it drops you into a rank 40 instance as part of the main story and then proceeds to go back to rank 34 when you finish that quest.

Fairly good bosses & a very enjoyable end boss but completely overshadowed by groups of ads that you can find in a couple missions being able to do more damage than the end boss in 2 normal hits.

Also if you want to get every steam achievement then you must play a female to unlock "Weird Science", oddly no male counterpart. Though it was fun to figure out that roughly 1/3 of the steam player base made a female.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022039830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2157, 'last_played': 1694928468}
review:
Really fun missions and bosses, horrendously grinding open worlds and laughable acting (on some of the characters).

Game is separated into 1-3 player missions, 1 player missions (both fun). Then there's the open world missions that are super grindy. There's also 5 and 10 man dungeons but I did not get to those in my playthrough. My goal is to 'beat' a lot of MMOs before they go under so I played only the main storyline and had fun. Still has somewhat of an active user base during peak times and there's guilds out there if you want to go forward.

I ran into serious payment concerns on another game (Warface) by this studio so I'd just say be careful. But it is an overall enjoyable experience. Took about 35ish hours to beat the main story and become a lesser god. You could keep going to become a god then an elder god. But for a coop story campaign it's not bad if you just want to play until the god portion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198996478824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1651123406}
review:
aqui na steam tenho poucas horas de jogo, porém eu tive muitas e muitas horas por outro launcher no qual joguei de 2017 até em torno de 2021, e uma coisa que observei em várias mudanças que fizeram no jogo me fizeram chegar na seguinte conclusão: esse jogo já foi bom.
motivos de dizer isso, simplesmente quiseram simplificar demais ao ponto de tirar inúmeras funções que tornavam o jogo muito motivador. Havia um sistema em que você tinha que farmar aqueles cristais de habilidades para desbloquear classes e poderes em uma espécie de "mapa astral" (parecido com Final Fantasy X), os mapas e missões eram muito legais, dava pra jogar solo e conseguir muita coisa. O sistema de habilidades também, a forma que voce poderia equipar e escolher as variações.
De repente, fizeram esse sistema EXTREMAMENTE MONÓTOMO de "provinces" que é usado pra conseguir skills e classes, pra liberar os mapas também, as habilidades nos slots são pré definidas pra um modo q elas alternam entre modos pvp e pve tirando totalmente a liberdade criativa que havia aí.
Esse é um problema que, me perdoem a palavra, mas voces CAGARAM esse jogo todo, entao a resposta é: nao vale mais a pena jogar hoje em dia, você pode até achar legal no começo mas depois fica uma MERDA TOTAL, sem falar q uma hora será obrigado a jogar com gente chata pra crlh.

review:
A Game From Russia

Huh.

Brillant

The Russian's have shown they know excatly what it take to make a good video game

the classes are the most unqiue archtypes in the mmo industy

the sound of the game is an instant classic

the amibent brightness is slick

each class is easy to get into 

there's one for every one

none of the classes play like a typical mmo

and there are 14

but they all work

yes that's right

if you are sick of the standard class types in mmos

look no further

you have arrived at the right place

trust me this game won't disappoint you

it's ui is well made and functions properly to the excat speications required of the genre

easily accessiable even by a controller

and mirco transcations are fair and generious

a fair deal for both you and the delvoper

author: {'steamid': '76561199037597393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2239, 'last_played': 1697844586}
review:
5/10 game a lot of potential but extremely greedy every single aspect of this game has been neutered to push you to the cash shop want your mount to be permanent and not be limited to a few hours cash shop, want to unlock new classes at a reasonable rate that inst one new class every 30h of game play cash shop, want to skip the repetitive filler bastion quests stimulant it in the cash shop want to skip the time gates for 2 of the main ways to get might cash shop it ever single aspect of this game is worsened for the sake of pushing you to spend money
Another issue is that because it tries to be a multiplayer game but you spend most of the time alone and the servers suck ass in a week the servers have died over 20 times.

TLDR a lot of potential with good graphics/combat ruined by greedy monetization, and garbage servers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117343348', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 7461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7461, 'last_played': 1656324109}
review:
Skyforge - это массовая многопользовательская онлайн-игра, игроки будут играть в роли бессмертных богов, борющихся против разных угроз.
Одна из самых ярких особенностей Skyforge - это его непрерывное развитие персонажа. Игроки начинают с выбора одного из трех классов, а затем могут свободно переключаться между классами, разблокируя новые способности и навыки. Это позволяет адаптировать свой стиль игры к различным ситуациям и битвам.
В Skyforge также доступны разные виды PvP-боев, включая дуэли, схватки на арене и войны гильдий. Игроки могут сражаться друг с другом или объединяться во взводы для противостояния более масштабным противникам.
Графическое исполнение Skyforge великолепно, с красочными мирами и детализированными персонажами. В это игре есть также сложные рейдовые подземелья и эпические боссы, которые требуют от игроков хорошей командной работы и координации.
В целом, Skyforge - это интересная MMORPG с гибким системой развития персонажа, динамичными PvP-боями и впечатляющими визуальными эффектами. Это отличный выбор для любителей фэнтезийных онлайн-игр и тех, кто ищет новый опыт в мире MMORPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013828501', 'num_games_owned': 1, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1707032318}
review:
Skyforge - это MMORPG проект от отечественных разработчиков Allods Team, авторов знаменитых Аллодов и американских разработчиков Obsidian Entertainment. Любители sci-fi и необычного фентези будут в полном восторге от атмосферы, царящей в мире Элиона. Невероятная цивилизация осталась без покровительства, а полчища врагов ринулись разрушать все на своем пути. Этот проект выделяется среди других представителей жанра не только особенной качественной графикой. Много ли вы знаете игр, где магия столь изящно переплетается с техникой, а боги живут среди людей?
Планета Элион поражает своими пейзажами до мельчайших деталей и сюда действительно хочется возвращаться снова и снова. Не смотря на то, что мир игры нельзя назвать с уверенностью открытым, жаждущие больших пространств геймеры всё же найдут несколько довольно крупных локаций. Удобное и интуитивно понятное управление позволит быстро адаптироваться даже самому неопытному игроку. Заметим, что умения тут можно переключать автоматически между PvP и PvE режимами, не меняя каждый раз раскладку навыков, а так же с легкостью можно попробовать себя в любом классе. Механика и геймплей при этом у каждого класса существенно разнятся, что делает игру максимально интересной. Работа с квестами также предельно удобная. Больше не нужно возвращаться к NPC, чтобы сдать задание!

author: {'steamid': '76561198888679510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2429, 'last_played': 1690188869}
review:
An Immortal's Journey - Skyforge Impressed Me!

Skyforge has swept me off my feet and catapulted me into a captivating world of divine power and thrilling battles. As a newcomer to this celestial universe, I was immediately drawn in by its stunning visuals, seamless gameplay, and an immersive storyline that kept me hooked from the very beginning.

The character customization options are simply impressive, allowing me to create a hero that truly represents my unique playstyle and personality. From wielding legendary weapons to unleashing awe-inspiring abilities, the sense of empowerment as an immortal deity is unparalleled.

The game's class system is a true gem, giving me the freedom to switch between various classes on the fly, mastering each one as I progress. This dynamic approach to character development adds depth and keeps the gameplay fresh and exciting.

Exploring the diverse realms of Aelion is an experience in itself. Whether soaring through the skies or delving into dark dungeons, every environment exudes a distinct charm and grandeur. The attention to detail is commendable, making each location feel alive and brimming with secrets waiting to be uncovered.

But what truly sets Skyforge apart is its strong community and cooperative gameplay. Teaming up with fellow immortals to take on powerful foes and epic raids is a pure thrill. The camaraderie and support from other players foster a sense of unity, creating a truly engaging multiplayer experience.

Of course, no game is without its flaws, but the developers' dedication to improving and refining the game is evident in the frequent updates and active community engagement.

In conclusion, Skyforge has surpassed my expectations and emerged as a true gem in the vast sea of MMORPGs. Whether you're a fan of intense combat, intriguing lore, or simply want to feel like a god, this game has it all. I wholeheartedly recommend Skyforge to anyone seeking an unforgettable journey into the realm of the divine!

Rating: ★★★★★

author: {'steamid': '76561198191966854', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1697, 'last_played': 1699653783}
review:
девочк и мальчики с машиной времени: разработчик скайфорджа, не удаляй из игры атлас и храм с последователями, не меняй их интерфейс на мобильный гейминг (новичков казуалов это не приведёт, а старички уйдут из игры...) 

в первую очередь, скайфордж всегда меня покупал своим геймдизайном: я буквально ждала эту игру несколько лет, следя за новостями,  и из-за чего? из-за его концепт-артов: мобов, локаций, лора с богами, транспорта. я не могу назвать ни одну другую ммо, на которую местная фауна была бы похожа. возможно, потому что игрой занимались очень вдохновлённые по моему мнению люди - те же, что и делали аллоды, в чьи локации и детали всегда хотелось залипать без остановки
к сожалению, факт того, что эта игра была под крылом майла, очевидно отталкивала от погружения в хай-энд контент: либо гринд, либо донат. поэтому эта ммо останется в моём сердечке в первую очередь из-за чудесной атмосферы, качественной русской озвучки, приятной боёвки в которой будет приятен даже гринд и уйму не заезженных классов (монах, друид, стрелок, алхимик, ведьмаки, богатырь, гитарист и т. д.) тем более, их всех можно открыть, не прокачивая кучу аккаунтов с нуля, как в других ммо
чуть не забыла упомянуть атмосферу во время ивентов: новый год, хэллоуин, 14 февраля... город меняется и у нпс можно подслушать очень милые озвученные диалоги
отдельное "вау" я ощутила от промо-роликов, хотя просмотров у них на ютубе очень мало
п.с. Флавий краш

author: {'steamid': '76561198150708957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 60266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47729, 'last_played': 1704686434}
review:
[h1] Overall: 6.11/10 [/h1]
[b] TLDR [/b]: Dynamic combat with multi-class system. Self-sufficient game, all things are earned by oneself (no in-game Marketplace). Mounts, wings, and nice collectibles. Gameplay changes in interesting ways every new season (~3-4 months). As of mid 2023, VERY low playerbase in NA and decent playerbase in EU. Full of bugs, and termed "bug-forge". Ways to earn cash shop currency ("Argents") by just playing consistently.

[b] My Personal Rating:  7.25/10 [/b]
[list][*]Based only on Combat, Class Variance, PvE, and Collectibles [/list]

[b] Combat: 6/10 [/b]
[list]
	[*]Pro: New weapons, new abilities, new strengths.
	[*]Pro: Multiple classes with unique dynamic and utility in combat.
	[*]Pro: Ways to change classes/roles mid dungeon or fight.
	[*]Pro: Multiple ways to unlock new perks/abilities that enhances your combat experience.
	[*]Pro: With each new invasion, there are new ways to use your classes. Keeps things exciting.
	[*]Pro: There's are stat based customized playthroughs. I.e: Companion build vs raw damage vs progressive damage increase, etc.
	[*]Con: Some weapons make the class. Getting the weapon to show up in the shop can take several weeks.
	[*]Con: Classes seem to be more challenging to learn than imagined.
	[*]Con: Clunky combat, not a seamless experience.
	[*]Con: Heavy reliance on CDs for DPS. Good DPS = Burst damage rotations.
	[*]Con: Even though there is a Holy Trinity (DPS, Support, Tank), there is no healer. Everyone has to efficiently play their parts in order to survive.
	[*]Con: No buffs/debuffs symbols listed in Party UI.
	[*]Con: Healing is trash in this game. Sources of heal: self-heal ability (long CD), item pot (one-time use per fight), healing orbs (drops from enemies based on damage offset), and very few class or class weapon abilities grant healing.
[/list]
FYI: Most buffs in this game have pretty large cool downs and they only last an average of ~12 seconds. Proper rotation is getting the whole party to buff in 3-4 seconds, and make use of the buffs for 8-10 seconds. Then wait another ~30 seconds to do another set of buffs, and repeat.


[b] Class Variance: 9/10 [/b]
[list]
	[*]Pro: 19 classes total. 3 Tanks, 3 Supports, 5 Magic DPS, 4 Long-ranged DPS (archer, gunner, etc.), 4 melee DPS (berserker, monk, etc.).
	[*]Pro: All classes playable with same character.
	[*]Con: Not much lore related to the classes.
[/list]


[b] Char Customization: 6/10 [/b]
[list]
	[*]Pro: No gender locking.
	[*]Pro: Can wear hats, face accessories (glasses, masks), outfits, back pieces (wings, capes, tails), halos, and earrings.
	[*]Pro: Can change glamour from anywhere.
	[*]Pro: Can change your character design and in-game name.
	[*]Con: Minimal character customization during character creation.
	[*]Con: No different species, all human.	
	[*]Con: No dyeing. Only piece-specific color sets. When a glamour item is earned more than once, different color sets options are added in for that glamour item.
	[*]Con: Outfits are made of top, bottom, belt, shoes, sleeves/gloves. Not individual pieces.
	[*]Neutral: There is no true armor set, just glamour. (No sarcasm)
	[*]Neutral: ONE CHAR PER ACCOUNT.
[/list]


[b] PvE: 5/10 [/b]
[list]
	[*]Pro: Top tier gear is not required to play the game's content.
	[*]Pro: Gearing is relatively easy to understand, but costly.
	[*]Pro: End-game changes every 3-4 months, 5-6 new raids per season/invasion.
	[*]Pro: There's tons of challenging ("Nightmare") battles to do with parties of 3 or 5.
	[*]Pro: No Marketplace, and thus all items are earned by the player somehow, someway.
	[*]Pro: Storyline after unlocking Junior God is not required. This is great for players who just want to get into the meat of things without being held back by forced storylines.
	[*]Pro: Drop rates are within reason compared to other games.
	[*]Pro: No RNG in upgrading gear to higher quality.
	[*]Pro: Have ability to stat roll main gear (jewlery / gems) without needing to farm them again. (Rolls have RNG)
	[*]Con: Early game makes no sense. Power-creep is insane.
	[*]Con: Earning money is extremely slow until end-game.
	[*]Con: Challenging raids, such as Distortions, can range from 10 minutes to 8+ hours of persistence. Subject to boss mechanics, invasion, and party (gear, strategy, perks unlocked).
	[*]Con: It is impossible for casual players to expect to solo end-game content (raids and nightmares) until perhaps the last week of the invasion. (Bad for solo, casual players)
	[*]Con: Being useful in parties can take up to 4 months, mostly because of resource restrictions (daily limits) and end-game power-creep.
	[*]Con: Loads of combat and movement related bugs. Very consistent. Thus termed "Bug-forge".
	[*]Con: Some perks and gears feel required in order to succeed on a certain class, no matter how good you are.
	[*]Neutral: Party-sizes available: 1-man, 3-man, 5-man, and 10-man.
	[*]Neutral: No crafting or gathering system in this game, just drops.
	[*]Neutral: No weapon or armor enhancement system, but you can upgrade older tier gear into current tier using rare items earned in-game.
	[*]Neutral: No leveling system, just "Might". Where resources like followers, knowledge of enemies, and gear determine what overall rank you are.
[/list]


[b] PvP: 8/10 [/b]
[list]
	[*]Pro: Varied PVP methods: 1v1 duels, 3v3 Small Battles (team deathmatch), 5v5 Battle of Golems (destroy enemy towers), 10v10 Massive Battles (Capture the Flag, Move the Payload, or Hold Bases).
	[*]Pro: Fair fighting between most classes.
	[*]Pro: PvP earns great rewards useful for both PvE and PvP content.
	[*]Pro: There are "Happy Hour" incentives that give more rewards per battle completed.
	[*]Con: The most important stat for for PvP can only be achieved by playing PvP, "Honor Points". Without it you'll just die instantly.
	[*]Con: Like PvE, there's lots of bells and whistles, that make you a better player. Skill is just a small portion of it.
	[*]Con: PvP is absolutely dead in NA.
[/list]


[b] "Tutorial"/New Player Experience: 2/10 [/b]
[list]
	[*]Pro: The "tutorial" part of the game can be cleared within a few hours of playing. (~8 dedicated hours)
	[*]Con: There's absolutely no guidance anywhere in the game besides the few things at the start of the game.
	[*]Con: Low player base, and therefore, little support unless you join one of the top 3 or 4 guilds ("pantheons").
	[*]Con: Power creep is as insane as it gets for any game. Can take up to like 4 months for you to even make an impact in end-game content. Even more if you expect to lead raids.
	[*]Con: Players are almost forced to play broken classes like Grovewalker, self-healing tank with high dps output, to survive on their own up until end-game.
	[*]Con: Divine form, an overpowered self transformation used commonly in mid-game, often leads to players never learning their class rotations (or roles).
[/list]


[b] Adventure/Exploration: 6/10 [/b]
[list]
	[*]Pro: There are 12+ "regions" you can explore, and nice sceneries to see. The rest are instanced based dungeons/raids.
	[*]Pro: There is jumping, gliding and floating.
	[*]Con: Mostly linear and instanced based.
	[*]Con: Can only be on land.  No submarine exploration, swimming, or flying. Water kills you.
	[*]Con: Divine form movement and jumping can often lead to so many frustrating moments.
[/list]


[b] Storyline: 4/10 [/b]
[list]
	[*]Pro: Plenty of voice acting.
	[*]Con: The lore is a bit uninteresting.
	[*]Con: Little cinematics.
[/list]


[b] Collectibles: 9/10 [/b]
[list]
	[*]Pro: Can collect mounts (bikes, monsters, floating devices, winged creatures, exoskeleton suits), companion skins, titles, emblems, outfits, emotes (acted out), wings, tails, capes, and weapons.
	[*]Pro: Almost all cash items can be bought with Argents (cash currency) that can also be earned in-game.
	[*]Con: No pets.
	[*]Con: Most collectibles like mounts cannot be earned from PvE, but instead from limited time events or through cash shops.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198079203513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1692407769}
review:
I would recommend it as something to pass the time, but would suggest you not get it on PC. My partner plays it on switch and legitimately has a great time. 

It's a single player experience claiming to be an MMO. I really cannot stress that enough. You are almost always in your own instance, alone, with no one else. When you are off in the world with other players, you might as well still be alone ngl. sometimes you see people around spawn locations but thats about it.

And before you ask: 
No, there is no crossplay between consoles. Which really sucks, because my partner and I got this to play cross-platform. 
No, you can't transfer characters from one console to another, or from pc to console, or from console to pc.
Yes, the MMO world is dead, but considering its more of a single-player/co-op experience than an MMO anyway, that really doesn't matter.

Weirdly enough I actually like the character design and outfits, i think the art team did a good job all things considered. However, you're basically running around like an anime protag in a mini-skirt and wedges/heels all the time if you play a female character. Which i mean, is fine i guess, but the lack of options is real. 

Thats... basically my entire review. Which should be telling. There is nothing else worth talking about in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199068505713', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1685078362}
review:
Ok, so as an avid RPG player, I was looking for a new ftp rpg to play and came across this game, the concept and idea is there, but when I tell you there is literally NO DIFFICULTY! I mean it, the first 2 bosses you come across you can literally stand still and just hack and slash/cast your way to victory Every. Single. Time.

What I will say is positive I guess, the game itself graphically, is beautiful.

But, as for an FTP RPG to play, ehhhh

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198430518246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1665426454}
review: I'll be honest it got me hooked during corona (played from launcher not steam). For one and a half years. The basic idea and gameplay is very fun and I loved it. Graphics are very beautiful for a 2015 game. Unfortunately the population is very low, so right now there will be only more and more pay2win while no new content coming out. The new overpowered weapons, the eidos multipliers and more, that's all pay2win. Don't get me wrong you can also achieve a lot of things by playing without paying but ofc it will take way longer and for me this includes pay2win. You can only be succesful in pvp if you have the good gear. In Pve due to the small community you definitely need an experienced group you can always play with to do the endgame content. The game has 6 invasions and each lasts 2 months. Every invasion offers different raid bosses which is pretty fun. But if you do your math you only have new content for 1 year. After that it starts repeating, the only difference will be a different pay2win meta weapon and class. (There is also other fun endgame content called inghar and nightmares but guess what after more than a year it gets boring too.) A lot of the "new" costumes are recolours, so not only the invasions are repetitive. If they would actually put effort into the game or maybe they just don't earn enough money but like... if they would add new invasions with new boss mechanics, maybe new inghar mechanics >and not only new pay2win stuff< fix bugs, never add "new" recolor costumes again but actual new costumes,  it would actually be an awesome game. Due to the cool people I met there and the fun I had it was one of the best game experiences ever, that's why I put a "recommend" but I stopped playing more than a year ago because of the things I mentioned above. In the state it is right now I am actually not sure I would not recommend but still had fun so

author: {'steamid': '76561198827351100', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 6045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5986, 'last_played': 1685657492}
review:
Skyforge es un MMORPG único que ofrece un sistema de progresión de personajes flexible, combate emocionante y un entorno visualmente impresionante. Aunque puede volverse repetitivo y las microtransacciones pueden ser un obstáculo para algunos jugadores, aquellos que disfrutan de los juegos de acción y fantasía encontrarán en Skyforge una experiencia divertida y desafiante.

En términos de gráficos y diseño artístico, Es impresionante. Los entornos están detallados y visualmente atractivos, y los efectos especiales durante las batallas son espectaculares. La música y el sonido también contribuyen a crear una atmósfera envolvente.

El combate es dinámico y lleno de acción. Los jugadores se enfrentarán a enemigos desafiantes en una variedad de entornos, desde mazmorras hasta zonas abiertas. Además, el juego ofrece contenido jugador contra jugador (PvP), donde los jugadores pueden enfrentarse en batallas competitivas.

*Vale la pena probarlo.*

author: {'steamid': '76561198403198660', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 17007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16827, 'last_played': 1706184137}
review:
RECEITA DO BOLO DE LARANJA

INGREDIENTES
6 ovos M
200 g açúcar
100 ml sumo de laranja
1 c. sopa raspa de laranja
120 g farinha com fermento
PREPARAÇÃO
1. Pré-aqueça o forno a 180º C.
2. Numa tigela bata os ovos e o açúcar durante 5 minutos até formar um creme esbranquiçado.
3. Junte o sumo e a raspa de laranja e misture bem.
4. Adicione a farinha cuidadosamente.
5. Coloque numa forma de bolos forrada com papel vegetal e leve ao forno 45 minutos a 170º C.
6. Retire do forno, desenforme e deixe arrefecer antes de servir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034628323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1585699137}
review: I played this game through the Skyforge launcher, not Steam, so the hours played is incorrect. I have hundreds of hours in this game. I played under the same name. I wonder if these guys regret the Ascension "update" yet . . . that is the worst decision I've seen made in a game. This game was INSANELY amazing when it first came out. I still think it was the greatest game I've ever played. I've not had more fun in my entire life than when I was playing this game with the people I met in it. Sure, it was still a little pay-to-win, but it felt worth it when you spent, and it's not like you were competing with others. Spending HOURS grinding the Avatars once you'd already beaten them to get other people their books, and even eventually soloing those Avatars felt SO good. Unlimited advancement . . . . and then Ascension happened. It's been so long that I don't even remember the changes that took place, only the feeling of loss as people quickly lost interest and started dropping for other games. Before, nobody was even talking about any kind of problems with the game, at least the players I was interacting with. We just played, and loved it. Maybe I'm a loser for feeling this way over a game, but this is still one of my saddest memories. As far as I'm concerned, you had the greatest game ever created . . . . and you threw it away. I just looked up the player numbers, and I genuinely want to know if they regret their decisions. I would even come back if you brought back the original game, but as it is, this game is a sad shadow of the beautiful thing it once was.

author: {'steamid': '76561199245951268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1681022972}
review:
Когда-то давно я играла в неё, ещё на мэйл.ру. Где-то в 2016-2018 году. Игра была для меня весьма интересной и затягивала. Графика радовала глаз, было приятно побегать в одиночку или в группе, пройти какой-нибудь данж. Детализация, кстати, была весьма неплохой.

Но, увы, с каждым обновлением игра становилась всё хуже и хуже. Куча ужасных и непонятных нововведений. 

Со временем, нужда в фарме становилась всё больше и суровее. А если не хочешь - донать.

Отвратительная прокачка персонажа. Чтобы его прокачать, нужно вкладывать ресурсы в какую-то чёртову башню. Какой бред. 

Персонаж на ровном месте может застрять в текстурах. 
Сюжет вообще не заметила. По началу, мне было интересно, но потом просто перестала его замечать. Ничего не потеряла от этого.

русский язык отсутствует напрочь. Это же типа наша россиянская игра. На мэйле всё было, здесь - ничерта. Даже этот поганый лаунчер на английском. 

Не поняла, как зайти в свой старый аккаунт, ничего не получилось. В общем, в стиме эта игра - полное !@#$%

author: {'steamid': '76561198303407589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 4212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4212, 'last_played': 1677759584}
review:
Die Klassen sind im Grund Tank . Suporter und Damage aufgeteilt. Mit etwas unterschiedlichen Fähigkeiten. Die Wlt besteht aus Instanzen alla Guild Wars eins. Vorteile hier die Instanzen haben keine Spielerbeschränkung. In Skyforge kann man jederzeit seine Charakterklasse wechseln. Negativ ist  dass die Charakterfortschritte wöchentlich limitiert sind. Das artet eher in Charakter Grind dann aus. Jede Woche kann man im Spiel nämlich nur eine ganz bestimmte Menge Punkte für den Charakterfortschritt und eine fest vorgegebene Summe an Spielwährung sammeln. Ist dieser Punkt erreicht, ist erst mal Feierabend. Der Held wird nicht mehr stärker, kann darum auch keine mächtigere Ausrüstung anlegen oder Zutritt zu neuen Missionen und Gebieten freischalten. So wird das Spiel ziemlich schnell langweillig. Am Anfang hat es mir Spaß gemacht weil ich mit Freunden gezockt habe. Mittlerweike haben wir alle das at ackta gelegt.

Zum Schluss sei noch gesagt ohne Einsatz von Geld werdet ihr später ausgebremst und könnt alleine nichts mehr reissen was mich traurig macht ich habe das Erstlingswerk Allods gespiekt da ist das mit einem spöteren Patch auch so extrem geworden. Hier ist der selbe Fehler wieder zahl oder spiel bis du Tod umfllst aber nur inerhalb deine Täglichen Limits. Oder das Spiel geht auch irgenwann unter weil es niemand mehr spielt sehr bedauerlich.

Vorteile
- Free to Play
- Für Gelegenheitsspieler
- Gute Grafik 7 von 10
- Intressante Story

Nachteile
- Niedriges Tageslimt für Normale Spieler
- Ab bestimmten Levels ist wochenlanger Grind angesagt
- Schlechter Kundendiennst
- Man wartet Monate auf neuen Kontent

author: {'steamid': '76561197981603111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1678754554}
review:
This game is downright awful....Where do I even start?...No healing class whatsoever so say goodbye to any real MMO dynamic between players. It's all DPS. You can change classes whenever you want and be any class so there goes actually working towards building a high end specific character. They generalized and muddied the whole concept of classes to the point they server no purpose. 

It technically supports controllers but enabling "controller mode" screws the menus all up and makes them completely unresponsive. If you try to revert back to kb&m then your character gets stuck running in crazy directions when you press forward. The whole thing is very glitchy.

I didn't think you could straight up ruin the MMORPG genre but they did...I don't even really consider this an MMORPG. It's just not. The "story" is terrible. The voices and dialog are 2nd grader bs. Seriously, just don't play this...They even have the audacity to offer a "premium" P2W thing for anyone dumb enough to do that...Find another MMO if you actually want to play an MMORPG like I was looking for.

review: O jogo tem muitos atrativos como gráficos lindíssimos, uma sistema de combate muito bom, as trocas de classes e personalização do seu personagem, Porém, é praticamente impossível jogar solo, o que para jogadores que não curtem entrar em guildas ou jogar com outras pessoas como eu é completamente frustante... Você so consegue fazer quests e evoluir sozinho até certo ponto, e não muito longe no jogo, depois disso so consegue fazer as quests se for em party, o que é péssimo, pois tira completamente a diversão do jogo, pois tem que está o tempo todo procurando alguém disposto a te ajudar

review:
Game starts with the 3D engine at 240p.   Its so blocky you can't see anything when trying to make your character.  You cannot access the menu until you have created a character.

You can only ever create one character. you can never have a second or restart.  

Enjoy not being able to see the character you are creating that you'll be stuck with forever  and enjoy the opening cut scene at ridiculously low resolution

author: {'steamid': '76561198153689662', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 12183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11432, 'last_played': 1675154686}
review:
Skyforge is... a game. It exists. There's a lot to it that is messy at best, and while it is a free to play game, that of course comes with some drawbacks.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
- It is technically free
- Some of the designs, especially for the NPCs, are pretty good
- Lots of classes to try, and some of them are pretty fun

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
- It's pay to win, of course. You could grind for several days to get what you're aiming for, but if you wanna just get to the fun stuff then you should just spend money of course!
- No one is ever online except for the people who have grinded to the top ranks on everything or people who are just starting. Partyfinders are pretty much useless.
- Pathing is weird, and getting anywhere on anything is a struggle. The amount of times where I'm trying to just jump a gap but for some reason I can't jump on my mount unless I'm already in motion for however long or something, I don't know.
- THERE IS A CURRENCY FOR EVERYTHING. You wanna try a new class? You need 10,000 sparks of transformation, and the most you usually get of those in a stack is 250. You wanna do more damage or just not die from every higher level enemy? You need to increase your rank, which is a combo of your might and superiority. Might is increased by using knowledge of enemies at the lab thing and credits to host rituals at your cathedral. Superiority is increased by upgrading your gear, which requires credits and upgrade mats. Want a specific outfit? You can gather the currency for it, rare crystallite, but the items you can buy with this rare crystallite are either 800 or 1200 each, and when you pick up rare crystallite, you get 1-6 from each node. Of course, you can always just bypass any of this by using the argent currency, but if you run out of those, you can always pay your actual money to get some more, and is it obvious that I don't recommend this game? I didn't even list all the possible currencies because I don't remember them all.
- Even at high rank, you still can feel like you do no damage. If you want to really be able to do damage and complete missions in a timely manner, especially while alone, you need to use your divine form, which costs faith, [i]yet another currency[/i] which is gained by sending out your adepts (followers) on journeys. The journeys take forever, and then they need to sleep for several IRL hours. I don't know the actual amount but genuinely you will need to just wait for the next day at the very least for them to be ready for another journey.
- Almost every drawback can be removed/lessened with having a premium account, which you can purchase with argents, which, again, can be purchased with your IRL money. Your adepts won't need to rest, you get bonus amounts on some currencies, teleportation in regions is free rather than 750 each time, and you get chests for being a premium account, which will contain credits, knowledge of enemies, healing items, or damage items. And to clarify, I don't mean it drops equipment, it drops 'jar of acid' or 'paralyzing dart'. It's not that useful. I usually just sell them for victor's medals (yet another currency!).

[h1]OTHER SHIT AKA NOT A PRO OR A CON BUT WORTH NOTING:[/h1]
- The jiggle physics in this game are insane. Boobs do not work like that. They are not like jello. I get a phantom pain from looking at the jiggle physics in this game and I'm a dude. It can be a funny thing at times, but mostly it just makes me sigh and wonder why I'm still playing.
- Why do all the ladies absolutely HAVE to wear heels? C'mon man, I just want my dope paladin girl to have some boots but you gotta slap on some tall heels that literally ruin the look entirely. It's not even 'hot' or anything it just makes me feel like some weirdo rich person who financially supported the game said the women weren't hot enough and demanded they all wear heels. 
- The voice acting sucks. I will commend them for trying, though.
- Most of the NPCs all look the same, honestly. The customization is already limited, but it's like opening a box of assorted entertainment crackers when you line up a bunch of NPCs, if you know what I mean.
- A lot of the outfits are actually kind of ugly as fuck. Of course, if you want a GOOD outfit you could always grind, or if you don't have the time and/or patience, try spending your actual money :)))))

[h1]WHY ARE YOU STILL PLAYING THIS GAME, BRO?[/h1]
I'm stupid and I got attached. Don't play this game. I farmed for hours to get enough rare crystallite for not one, not two, THREE outfits. Ballin', but at what cost?

[h1]I'M STILL GONNA PLAY IT THOUGH, SO WHAT TIPS CAN YOU GIVE ME?[/h1]
- First off, good luck and gods speed.
- Mute the voices.
- Try to join a pantheon (guild) quickly. There are of course the big ones, Original Sin for example, but I guarantee that you'll have a much easier time of literally anything if you have a pantheon with active members who you can chat with or ask for carries.
- Your gear's generation isn't important. That's just how recently it was earned. As long as it works well, use it.
- I play Paladin mostly, and I dabble in Witch, Cryomancer, Outlaw, Berserker, and Soundweaver. Lightbinder was boring as fuck, and otherwise I haven't gotten the sparks of transformation to be able to try something new.
- I have no idea otherwise, honestly. I'm not the person to be able to give good tips. Use your AOEs, I guess?

[h1]CLOSING NOTES[/h1]
Everything in this game has boobs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392347492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 11309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7747, 'last_played': 1669870466}
review:
This is 1 with a difference, whether the difference works is another story. Short version recommended but only the first part of the game. 5.5/10

So you have become an immortal but being an immortal does not mean you are a god/goddess. To get to that later part is what the game is about. So part 1 is getting from an immortal to a junior divinity. part 2 is about getting to elder divinity.

You start off with how you became an immortal & then the beginning of your immortal trip. You choose your major class but you can switch any time with no cost to any of the 2 others you have access to at that point. You can access other classes later in game via in game currency you earn or real $. Apparently there are 15+ in the game.

So your trip to junior divinity involves a story over several areas of the planet. So story wise this game gets full points.

Playability is more or less ok. Of the 3 classes you start with, they of course have their weaknesses & strengths of which you have to figure as you play. You have the simple to the one with all kinda combos to the one in between the 2. So there is much to play with here. The continent produces all kinda enemies with all kinda different attacks whether singly or in groups to mini to major bosses. So there is enough variety from the typical just go kill this & that group.

Graphics & sound are passable but there is all kinda issues with voice overs and matching conversation facial graphics. Sometimes you don't get the sound of the conversation at all. Otherwise graphics and sound are ok.

Bugs are few but the occasional freeze up but those are rare.

They are generous with the drops with even premium level membership for a few days when you finish a region.

All in all the 1st part is typical rpg format with on ongoing in depth story up until you get to achieving your junior divinity. It will take numerous hours to get to this stage & to be honest that is almost a whole game right there. After that it doesn't just go down hill, it plummets.

When you achieve junior divinity you more or less will be around level 50 or so. However now enemies start around 450. As if that isn't enough. After all you do to achieve your status, you can only be at junior divine level for a few minutes at a time. See there is this faith system which is not at the immortal level. It costs faith to become divine which only lasts so long, & we not talking like 1/2 hour.....far less. No where near enough to deal with a region, even the small ones. So you try fighting enemies several levels way up your level with only a few minutes of divinity. So when it runs out then, what??? High level enemies don't go away. If you happen to be in a region without a portal, the game doesn't let you leave the area until you finish the area. However if you too weak to finish the area, well you stuck. I will add you do get weapons that significantly increase in damage once you get to junior divinity. However that simply is not enough to fight levels 8-10 times your level.

So all in all the 1st part is good. The major amount of limitations in the other parts just takes away from the game. What limitations, the severe drop in the speed in which you level up and gain might/strength are HUGE ones. 

Anyway don't take my word for it. If you like rpgs, try out the first part.

author: {'steamid': '76561199318882155', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1668698332}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035234024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1659029392}
review:
Has a great premise of being an immortal, pretty graphics, a lot of its foundations I thought were brilliant and innovative, unfortunately the game fell victim to typical cash shop nonsense, milked its players for every dollar, and is clearly dying so it's not worth investing yourself into it, they also omitted features that I thought were quite unique when the game was new, such as having your own worshipers and a room you could visit to physically see and recruit them for your cause, whereas now they're reduced to an impersonal number/stat.

I thought at the time that the game was quite innovative, but the cash shop presence overshadowed the whole game and it never seemed to let up. I had fun in the beginning but the game is clearly on the way to the grave and I can't access a lot of content due to it requiring groups, game could only be revived if they overhauled it, abolished the pay to win elements, made content more accessible and rewarding to all players, made solo-play more fun/engaging and feel less lonely (by introducing companions/follower content maybe?), and found a way to attract new players (possibly through a rebranding to accompany the overhaul?).

Really wanted to see this game succeed but I can't recommend it as it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967143584', 'num_games_owned': 1673, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4230, 'last_played': 1665707438}
review:
Avoid.  Don't even start.

Story is boring.
Characters are forgetful.
Chat is dead.
World is dead.
Game is dead. 
The beginning of endgame is really hard.

I've yet to experience any group play.  There are supposedly invasions, battles, and trials that I've queued for.  The queues have never popped.  Even for the first available 5 man, I waited in queue for 4 hours and did not get a pop.

Once you hit end game, when you unlock divine form, you have to suffer through terribly implemented world scaling.  Mobs are now much harder to kill and the game seems to be tuned around utilizing Divine Form, which you have extremely limited usage of.  To put things in perspective: 1-3 man missions which were initially completed in 3-4 minutes now take 20+ minutes.  Even some of the 1-3 man missions are impossible without divine form.

Perhaps I'm doing things wrong, but I'm limited to waiting for resources to activate Divine Form.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336043359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8320, 'last_played': 1666212409}
review:
I have to say this game is not for everyone. There is alot of grind and considering its not an open world, it gets repetitive.
However...this game is very unique in everything else. The mechanics of big bosses are so mindblowing, one mistake and the whole party is doomed. This aspect of the game i really like, it gets challenging, especially if you fall behind on gear and pantheons are very useful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032443196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 3724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3065, 'last_played': 1665300750}
review:
Jo, im Grunde ist es recht cool mit den vielen Kassen und Instanzen.

In der Praxis ist es jedoch tot. 
Die Spieler die es noch spielen sind alle über 400 und man findet keine Leute für normale Instanzen weil es halt einfach keine gibt. 
Die Leute hören auf mit dem Spiel auf (Gemäss Karteiliechen in den beiden Panteons stets auf Stufe 50) wohl dann wenn sie merken das es egal ist ob sie nackt oder mit Ausrüstung in eine Instanz gehen das Spiel skaliert dich entsprechend so, dass es immer gleich schwer ist. 
Also von der Göttlichkeit ist man hier sehr weit weg.

Alles easy könnte man sagen dann levle ich halt über 400 und da sind dann schon ein paar Leute die was machen wollen.... Das stimmt soweit.
Aber wer das vor hat ohne Kreditkarte und Gruppe der wird das in 2 Jahren nicht erreicht haben. ich habe in den letzten 30Stunden nämlich NULL Vortschritt gemacht also wirklich NULL

author: {'steamid': '76561198172925593', 'num_games_owned': 14023, 'num_reviews': 4533, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1659873890}
review:
一款免费MMORPG
玩法上基本可以理解为单人/组队打副本，有多个职业可以切换选择，不同职业玩法各不相同
没有中文，这点就可以劝退挺多人的，而且虽然steam里下载时只显示100多M，但实际上只是一个启动下载器，还要再下载个20多G
玩法核心就是刷刷刷（肝），不过氪金能直接购买别人肝很久的道具，所以感觉并不完全属于Free 2 Win，靠卖外观的游戏
没啥太深入的体验，至少初期1、2个小时没有太大的与众不同，大致中评

author: {'steamid': '76561198107323899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1694896334}
review:
Graphics are amazingly beautiful and run at pretty high FPS without taxing the hardware. Also storyline is a fine one. One character is all it takes, and you can switch to any class you want on the same one whenever you want. So no slogging on one and then on another. Loving the game so far...
---
Okay, so I hit a roadblock. I went to make an ingame purchase and realized there is no option to buy using steam wallet or via steam.
So i picked the paypal way... but then, why would they need my physical address for an in-game purchase? There is nothing being delivered to me physically.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065544746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 4731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4486, 'last_played': 1671411088}
review:
This game is great up to the point of becoming a lesser god.  The list of things that you have to do is so overly complicated and much of the stuff is much too difficult for your character to beat.  I got this game with my 3 budz and there is literally no 4 player missions so we all could never play together and the 5 man missions were way too tough.  I don't know why they structured it around 3 man, just odd.  

Pay wall after lesser god.  Very low pop and people who are sarcastic and don't speak english when you have real questions which there are many...

review: Mano sendo bem sincero, esse jogo é um dos piores mmorpg que eu já joguei na minha vida, no tempo que eu passei com esse jogo eu já teria desbloqueado umas 5 classes diferentes em outros jogos do genero. A progressão é muito chata, vc não pode desbloquear novas classes sozinhos por causa da dificuldade das missões que dão a moeda usada para desbloquear os templos, o combate é beeeeem lento (tem um boss que eu desisti de enfrentar porque ele fica recuperando vida e com o quão lento vc é não dá nem para desviar dos ataques dele direito, vc até consegue resolver isso parcialmente usando a classe Lightbender mas até ele é lento demais), mas o fato que vc precisa gastar 25.000 de uma moeda que vc mal consegue obter no jogo para poder desbloaquear uma nova classe foi o que selou a minha senteça a esse jogo. Esse jogo precisa facilitar o processo de obtenção de novas classes porque do contrario o jogo fica muito sem graça, eu mesmo não gostei nem do paladino e nem do cryomancer, e já estou farto de jogar com o lightbender. E eu não to nem mensionando a falta de traduçao para o português, a falta de servidores na america latina (isso eu senti e muito já que o ping sempre fica na casa dos 200ms, o que torna o combate ainda mais irritante já que as suas habilidades tem delay). Isso é decepcionante porque o conceito do jogo é interessante, mas a execução foi pessima.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963046518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1687808902}
review:
Loved the game long ago, but I haven't been able to play it.
Some sort of event happened where you could 'demo' the other classes, so i did with every single one released up to that point, like the gunslinger, and maxed out their class lines to get full skill and costume unlock. I got to keep them afterwards which i thought rocked. 
Might score is what levels used to be, and it apparently skyrocketed mine without me realizing it, but wouldn't match it with my stats or equipment drops. 
I logged in to find they changed the system, I am level 59, all my quests are locked at level 420-430, the game is literally unplayable and unenjoyable.

I loved this game and want to love it again, but it broke and doesn't give me any way to fix it, even with new gear boxes.
7/10, would play if it weren't borked

author: {'steamid': '76561198166291930', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4469, 'last_played': 1680148911}
review:
Pros vs Cons

pros:
+Great Combat feel 
+Great New Player Exp
+Interesting class choices
+Amazing graphics on high or above
+Alana voice actor was great

Cons:
-Main Story/ RPG element doesn't feel cohesive.
-the voice acting was 1 out 5 you couldn't feel the emotion from the voice actors .
examples: during scenes where intense moments happen such as running for your life or extreme joy you feel like OK I beat the end boss the crowd is cheering but the council just feels dry except Alana very good job on your part.
-not an mmorpg feels more like an instance based action game at best
-mobile game in a port to PC feel.
-high end PC required for decent experience.
-grinding doesn't feel worth it.

For these reasons I'm not recommending  this game to Story Grinders or hardcore mmorpg players. 

But will recommend it to people who don't have a lot of time to sink into mmorpg but love instance based action games with a bit of story with hints of a online presence.

review:
Tenia unas 1000 horas jugadas cuando este juego era de mygames, el árbol de habilidades y las invasiones eran increíbles, la dificultad era mayor ya que era un árbol de habilidades mas de el doble que el path,con unos 10 arboles de habilidades distintos (de clase, general, de cada invasion, el de forma de dios...), fue cambiar para consolas y no dar opciones de builds y no he podido jugar mas de 24 horas en las 4 veces que lo he instalado para ver si habían cambios, en lo que antaño fue mi juego favorito.
Si algún día volvieran a ser un mmo con más complejidad y no tan de farmeo puro avisar que volveremos seguro!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042500573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1652972790}
review:
I used to play this game like crazy when it came out, came back recently to check it out because I was surprised that it actually still existed. It's very different than before. Some aspects are better some are worse. The story is still shit, the gameplay is still fun. The game has it's problems, sure, most F2P games do.  So walk over to that download button and touch it, it's free, it's not gonna cost you anything.

Edit; Fair warning, the game is pretty dead. Most of early game group content is almost impossible to find a group for. Maybe it's the hours I'm playing at but I highly suggest to bring some friends if you wanna do harder dungeons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346217106', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1651654986}
review:
honestly it just kinda sucks, extremely bland and uninspired. i could only really get through the tutorial before getting bored out of my mind but just from that i've got some thoughts.

A. i know i was just in the tutorial but everything was *so* easy, no effort whatsoever.
B. the boob physics suck, why are they so straight, why does literally the lowest setting for "bust" change absolutely nothing?
C. dialogue is very clunky, i understand weird pauses cause of differing timing for russian and english, but the characters move weird, you have to press space to advance it, and why do they even let you choose your character's voice, they never speak.
D. character customization is weak, it would probably take less than a day to just make every combo manually, unlike other games of this type where it would take a couple weeks.

review:
Skyforge has nice graphic, nice monster design, and half opened world and mechanic of monsters, but that is all of pros. Cons:  This game HAD nice technology/skill tree, where player had to lvl up to unlock new classes and could upgrade character how he would like to, but for some reason developers completely destroyed this and change it for something reeeeeeaaaly simple. To be honest game before 6-5 years was much better. In my opinion, it was livelier. Now it has maybe half or quarter of players then 2015-2018.
 If i supposed decide if recommended game to anybody how it is right now, that i couldn't recommend. IT would be sorry that. PS: As my opinion: It's sad what they did to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134651839', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1650644795}
review:
Habe da Spiel jetzt eine Stunde gezockt und muss sagen, dass es mir grafisch sehr gefällt. Jeder NPC der was mit der Story zu tun hat wurde sehr gut synchronisiert und haben eine gutes Charakteraussehen. Was mir nicht so in den Sinn kommt und mich stört ist, dass das Game kein Open World ist. Man hat eine Questkarte, wo man immer im gradlinigen Stil die Monster töten muss die NPC´s rettet und die Quest absolviert um danach Punkte zu bekommen und seinen Charakter auszubauen. 
Fazit:
Im großen und ganzen ist das Spiel anschaulich sehr gut. Mir würde es noch besser gefallen, wenn es statt einer Questkarte eine Open World gibt wo man überall hinkommt um die Quests zu machen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297507437', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1650474586}

author: {'steamid': '76561198216163891', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 25065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19498, 'last_played': 1655307133}
review:
Skyforge est-il le M.M.O.R.P.G. de vos rêves ?

La réponse dépendra du joueur que vous êtes.
Si vous cherchez des parties rapides avec un système de combat fondé sur l’action, alors n’hésitez pas et foncez les yeux fermés.
Si vous cherchez une expérience orientée R.P.G et réellement massive, alors il vous décevra certainement. Son pôle central accompagné de ses instances séparées nuit grandement à l’immersion et empêche de se rapprocher des joueurs dans le jeu.

Skyforge est un C.O.R.P.G., sous-genre du M.M.O.R.P.G. dont la principale différence tient au fait que nous ne voyageons pas librement dans un immense monde ouvert comme sur TESO par exemple, nous voyageons plutôt de missions en missions à partir d’un hub central. Une mission, une fois commencée, n’appartient qu’au joueur qui l’a lancée, à aucun moment il ne peut être rejoint, on parle d’instance. De même si un groupe de joueurs se lance dans un raid, il ne pourra être rejoint par un autre groupe.

Maintenant le jeu est gratuit, ça ne vous coûtera rien de le télécharger et de le découvrir par vous même !

author: {'steamid': '76561198044983798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1630370787}
review: It's hard to really capture in words why I decided to drop the game after 20 hours played. It feels pretty competently made, with a good-enough story, good-enough music, good-enough graphics, and good-enough gameplay. It just kind of felt lifeless and uncreative, uninspired. If you're looking to burn some time, you could do worse than this, but I can't imagine the person for whom this would be an amazing experience, unless it was their first RPG or MMO. It feels like the original creators worked hard and had a vision for the world and storyline, but there was no budget and no real creative direction and they released a middle-of-the-road game for people who wear a lot of beige and whose favorite desert is supermarket vanilla ice cream with no toppings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093545625', 'num_games_owned': 3014, 'num_reviews': 1146, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1608827024}
review:
Плюсы:
+ Дизайн мира,окружения,противников и шмота. (Единственное что осталось хорошим это дизайн. Спасибо всем дизайнерам за всё)
+ Лор. Хоть он и не велик но он интересен.
+ Смена классов почти в любой момент.
+ Возможность принимать божественные формы.
+ Механика боя с боссами, особенно с аватарами и противниками из искажения.
Минусы:
- Бесконечный бессмысленный фарм. Фарм ради фарма.
- Прокачка персонажа за счет башни знаний и бастионов. Почему бы просто не сделать одну кнопку "услилить персонажа" и тыкать только в нее. Перс будет качаться за ресы получаемые за задания и не надо менять вкладки, всё в одном месте ? Так ведь еще проще. А лучше вовсе пусть игра сама все делает ты просто ходи на задания.
- Механика экипировки. Пожалуй самая больная тема для меня. Обновлять шмотки каждые 2 месяца ? Серьезно ? Фармить и прокачивать шмот, подбирая статы под класс, затрачивая кучу времени и кредитов в течени 2 месяцев, что бы ходить на задания вторжения а потом все заного? В игре где класс можно сменить и уметь играть сразу за 3 роли, собирать 3 разных сета когда с одним то мучения ? Благодарю но нет. И да кому то это нравиться, не спорю.
- Ну и типичный минус это донат .Я конечно все понимаю, кушать всем хочется, но почему в продаже оружие и релики влияющие на игру и упрощающие её? Так точно деньги оставят в проекте ? Ну да, конечно,это ж логично, чего это я.
- Отсутствие вариативности. Классовые способности мало того что повырезали, так еще и привязали к пве и пвп. Не давая выбора вовсе.
------Ну и вишенка, Куда дели русский?

author: {'steamid': '76561198161001670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1711998388}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095001217', 'num_games_owned': 1330, 'num_reviews': 634, 'playtime_forever': 4879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4256, 'last_played': 1644385833}
review:
Not recommended if you're not from or near EU/NA regions. And even if you are, it's not a very fun MMORPG either.

The ping is way too high for any form of enjoyable gameplay; 300+ ping on a good day and 1000+ when the server is quite "populated" makes the game literally unplayable. Skills don't register, dodging attacks is pointless, constant connection losses and error codes, etc and this is on top of the bugs in regular gameplay; keyboard shortcuts randomly stop working, constant 'ability not found' messages appearing on screen for no reason, your character sometimes randomly auto-attacking nearby enemies when walking near them, animation glitches and loss of UI functionality (like damage numbers randomly stop showing up) and countless more. Also, the server seemingly goes into maintenance for several hours every single day, but there is no news on the launcher nor the website about it happening; it just happens when it feels like it. There isn't even a notice in game before the server is closed so if you're doing any activity and the game suddenly stops working, congratulations, now go redo what you just did again.

As a MMO, it is also fairly lackluster. Progression is extremely slow, even by MMO standards and incredibly boring. Unlocking classes take literally forever, with finishing the main story only granting you enough currency to buy ONE basic class. Once you unlock the class, it takes about a few hours at most of killing mobs to fully unlock the class abilities and there is no system for dynamic and creative builds as each class only has a fixed set of class abilities so you basically perform the same rotation over and over again for every fight. In terms of loot drops, it appears to be incredibly hard to get anything good. Most of the story missions drop only the most basic of loot which you end up disassembling about 99% of it. Getting any form of upgrade requires you to farm either the dungeons or the harder versions of the story missions you already completed, effectively making you repeat boring, dreary content again. Difficulty is overtuned in dungeons; there is a scaling system but it's flawed. Group finder doesn't work since the game population is way too small for it to pop quickly so it's very hard to find a group to do low-level content for gear upgrades as a new player. So what you end up trying to do is to solo them, except because of the flawed scaling system, you are effectively a potato trying to go against hordes of bullet-sponge basic enemies that hit like trucks, which makes for incredibly frustrating and boring gameplay.

Microtransactions are egregious. The fact that you can buy what is effectively end-game level of gear in the Market (the game's equivalent of a Cash Shop) should raise some red flags. It goes beyond selling cosmetics too, offering basically almost every essential currency that is typically time-gated if acquired through regular gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057433985', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1643189393}
review:
[b]Skyforge an Essay[/b]

[b]TL;DR[/b] Skyforge is a game of great potential burdened by uncaring, tone-deaf devs.

First things first, don't let my playtime fool you, I have clocked well over 2000 hrs on standalone client of Skyforge since open beta.

Now that we got that out of the way...  I have always been in a love/hate relationship with this game, quitting for a year or two and returning to see if game has changed for the better. And I must say... It has always been the opposite. Mechanics and systems that used to make game interesting and enjoyable - removed or replaced by a completely dumbed down versions of them. Classes losing multiple skills and skill customization options just so game could be pushed into console market. Simple bugs that haven't been addressed ever since initial release. Main story line that has been put on halt for more than 4 years now. End game content that just gets recycled every single year, actually not only the end game content, but all content just gets increase of scaling when new season lands. PvP in this game is a joke, all you see are same 3 classes with same P2W weapons being abused most of the time. If you want to play with friends right of the bat, you can simply forget about it, since you have to complete the story first, which is a feat on its own, since it’s lengthy and poorly balanced for the newcomers, not to mention that after it you'll have to be carried until you catch up with the current seasons scaling. You enjoy voice acting in games? Well, you won’t find this here either, majority of games content is not even voiced, not to mention that some stuff in game is poorly translated from Russian or not translated at all. Got an in-game issue? You can forget about support ever helping you, most of the time tickets get closed before being answered. Game has stunning graphics for its age, unlimited story and mechanics potential but the devs simple refuse to listen to the community, admit their mistakes or do justice for this game and its community. The only thing that keeps pulling me back to this game is passionate community and friends I made along the way.

Oh, I almost forgot… The most recent Pantheon War (Guild vs Guild) was a total sh*t-show, the so called “fully automated system that works as intended” weren’t working as intended and it costed us the 1st place. Devs only admitted there ever being a bug only after the winner has been decided and all they could tell us was that they can’t do anything about it because it’s “fully automated system” and that “you should have contacted us sooner” although literally 50 support tickets from various pantheon members got closed without ever being answered.

So, in all honesty, please, avoid this game at all cost or really any product by this company if you treasure your sanity. And even if you decide to take a stroll down the rabbit hole…
DON’T SUPPORT THEM IN ANY SHAPE OR FORM!!!

review: Used data to download, in South Africa that's not cheap to start with.  After downloading was finished the game installed and then updated again using more data.  After the update I ran all the tests from the my.games window and then tried to run /play the game. NO NO NO NO !!!!! Nothing happened from my.games so I decided to start through Steam, again NO NO NO NO !!!!!  It gave me the startup screen and the just closed everything.  What a waste of time and data.  Actually spoke to a few of my friends and they too had the same issue.  I am uninstalling the game and never reinstalling at least not via internet.  No CD no installation.  Sorry for the news, I don't like leaving a bad review but money is money.
