review:
While the game does have a nice story line and allows for F2P, catching up with the top requires dedication and months of time, by one of the players whcih have allready reached that far. The powerlevel gap can not be breached in any healthy ammount of time solo and catching up alone may take almost a year of repeated failure in active playtime as the game does not give any adjusted content for the inbetween of low lvel  and end level equipment which is statisticaly exponential.
My recommendation is, play it either for the story, or find somebody who allready is at the top to help you over the gap.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978423860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8997, 'last_played': 1642029752}
review:
Let me start by saying that for the first 30-40 hours or so, I was enjoying this game a great deal. It has a pretty solid early-to-mid-game. The action-RPG combat is a bit barebones, but satisfying and briskly paced. It caters to fans of "sci-fantasy" MMOs who, let's face it, don't have a lot of options to go with. And the "D-" English localization was unintentionally hilarious with lots of abrupt breaks and long pauses in dialogue, due to no one lifting a finger to edit the script in order to fit the animation timing. Remember: this game bills itself as a "triple-A MMO", and yet, they can't be bothered to not let their game look and sound like an old kung-fu movie. 

But all of that fun came to a screeching halt when I finished the main story and unlocked the ability to anime transform into MY FINAL FORM of a sci-fantasy deity. While thrilling and gratifying at first, I noticed something very... off... when I went into a mission and noticed that now [b]literally every enemy, even the "trash mobs", were now damage sponges that hit like trucks[/b]. Turns out, without a word of warning, Skyforge had booted me into a scaled level system where, despite being about level 52-ish, I'm automatically scaled up to roughly level 370. But the thing is, they scaled all the enemies up to level 390, and in this game, twenty levels is a huge difference in power.

This puts players like myself, [u]at the time of posting/playing, January 2022[/u], in an extremely awkward situation. To be fair, the game provides daily quests with increased rewards to try and fast track you through the level gap. [b]But the thing is, thanks to that scaled level gap, it now takes half an hour to finish a solo mission you used to be able to plow through in about five to ten minutes.[/b] And that's if you're lucky and get one where the enemies are 390. [b]For some brain-scouring reason, the daily quest system can assign you missions and open-world "Regions" where the enemies are level 400 or more![/b] 

Oh, and these overpowered Regions will task you with doing randomly assigned mini-quests that force you to try to find areas open enough where you can safely pull one enemy at a time, because pulling more than one leads to certain death - or taking part in public events where you'll get immediately swarmed and killed without counting a single point of your damage dealt or healing done as contribution! [i]Woah, slow down, Skyforge! I'm having WAY too much fun, sitting here, watching Netflix on my second monitor, NOT PLAYING THE GAME, and waiting for the one, and only, public event to spawn that I can solo AND get credit for in this Region. And I'm on the edge of my seat here, waiting the 10-15 minutes for it to spawn again, because it's literally the only thing I can do, solo, in this Region that counts towards the daily quest! I think I'm going to hurl from all this excitement![/i]

Needless to say, it was at this point that I realized I wasn't having fun anymore. Literally everything there is to do in Skyforge became a tedious, teeth-grinding chore. And as far as I could see, there were only two ways to move forward. Either I limit myself to playing one or two dailies a day, steamrolling through them with MY FINAL FORM (the "one or two a day" being because your god form uses up a resource that is time-gated and totally random how much you receive every day). Or I sit around in the lobby, spamming LFG and begging any kind soul who will listen to carry me, which from my experience isn't likely, given how small and unresponsive the community (at least on the NA server) is. 

I could go on, listing off all the smaller instances of baffling design. Like how once you reach level 50, the game just turns off the in-game guild finder. Because that's what Skyforge needs - less tools for players to be active in the community. Or how the game suddenly tosses over a dozen different currencies at you to keep track of and to grind for, some of which do literally nothing more than block your progress through a different currency's grind, AND can only be obtained on certain days/times, AND require a premade group to obtain (Avatar Trophies, looking at you!). Or how that level scaling gap making the combat feel like chipping away at a glacier with a nail clipper just draws a line under how under-designed and lopsided many of the character classes are, taking all the thrill out of unlocking them. Or how laughable it is that in order to delete your character or make a new one, you, instead, need to make a whole new account and start all over from scratch, [i]when other "triple-A MMOs", like FF14 and PSO2, are SOMEHOW able to let you have more than one character per server, per account.[/i] [b]Or how I have this sneaking suspicion that the level scaling gap is intentional, as it will presumably frustrate players into paying real world money for overpowered weapons from the in-game shop.[/b]

But when all is said and done, Skyforge is a great time until it either - depending on your perspective - dropped the ball and became a dumpster fire of poorly designed late-game progression that's actively hostile to solo players, or dropped the mask and revealed itself to be a cynical aggravation simulator, preying on the player's sunk cost fallacy and starvation for content in a largely ignored niche genre. Either way, I just can't justify continuing to play this game when it's trying so hard to convince me that it's something that it's not. It needs some serious reworks to smooth out the bloated and convoluted late-game, and maybe even NPC companions to fill spots in group content that you just can't fill with other players from the game's scarce player base. [i]I mean, "triple-A MMOs" like FF14 and PSO2 provide players with these systems, so why can't Skyforge, also a "triple-A MMO", provide the same level of quality as it's competition?[/i]

[b]Oh, and Skyforge doesn't come with an uninstaller.[/b] Uninstalling through Steam just uninstalls the 100MB launcher. The 20GB game will still be on your harddrive, requiring you to hunt down and manually delete every trace of it. Pettiness or incompetence? You be the judge!

review:
Наиграл я много репы на мыле, забил на игру "уникальные решения" разработчиков не шибко радовали. Тут вижу стим, ну в стиме хоть что то думаю, а тут бац мыло со стимом не связано. Хош играть начинай с начало, только "песенка не хороша" с начало не хочу. 
Предупрежу заранее тех кто не знает, хотя знает уже каждый: скай донатная помойка. 
Но кое что меня рассмешило! Вот это: "Не поддерживается русский язык" - я играл с русским языком на мыле XD
Стим я могу сказать только спасибо, спасибо за то что ты не связан с мылом, не знаю какой черт меня дернул ещё раз поиграть, но мыло держит руку на пульсе говоря :  не надо, мы спецом не связали с мыло чтоб у тебя даже желания не былоXD - за это спасибо!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082326450', 'num_games_owned': 745, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1591418724}
review:
I used to play outside of Steam a few years back so my steam stat don't reflect the reality of my experience with this game.

A grind fest who's truly interesting and inovative feature (the giant ascension atlas), that pulled me into the game, has been nerfed to hell and beyond a few years ago. The game isn't bad per say but to me, seeing the ascension atlas butchered is saddening and a disappointement.

On a positive note, it has an interesting world, the pantheon system and the ascension atlas (may you rest in peace) were really innovative and unique in the mmo genre. A lot of costume are obtainable in game through a bit of grind but really not that much which is quite surprising considering this is a f2p mmo that want you to spend money. Oh and free premium is fairly easy to get which is nice. The story isn't bad but it's not crazy either, it's lukewarm i guess, better than most f2p but not worth a dime next to some bigger title, but i also likely gave up before the truly juicy part.

Gameplay wise... how do i put it, it's like a action-type with a slight clunk to it. The combat range from "this is way too easy" to "why did this attack hit me when i was nowhere near its range" yeah i still can't figure that one out either. The game is a mix between a few open maps and a dungeon crawler, for those familiar with Warframe this is nothing new except that open maps tend to be much easier than in Warframe.

Play this more as a solo game than a multiplayer one, the queue time for any low and mid level content is just... let's say that FF14 frontline queue on down time need less time to find 72 players (will take you more than 4h) than this game to find 3 others players which is a feast in of itself.

The original ascension atlas (an angel gone too soon), had a real feel of customization, you could chose what you were aiming for and work your way towards that specific objective accross what felt like an endless skill tree, it would often remind me of the sphere grid system of Final Fantasy 10 but a lot bigger and for a single character.

All in all, i don't recommend it because while it get you hooked at the beginning when you start hitting walls after walls of grind it become quickly tiring to endlessly do the same things, i'd go so far to say the grind in this game is worse than in Black Desert Online and Warframe combined. My calling for the ascension atlas (you'll never be forgotten) grind was worth it initially but as i said, it's nerf ruined all motivation for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052765159', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1643179947}
review:
This is a very fun game. As solo player there is constantly a ton to do and there's very little that can't be done solo. Here's my breakdown - 

Combat: Very engaging MMO style combat. A somewhat more fluid version of tab-style targeting. Very fluid with lot abilities that need to be strategically used and all have an impact on combat. 

Characters: A wide variety of classes each with a unique and varied play style. All of them see viable although some are clearly better at soloing. 

Story and questing: The story is decent. But the questing - once you finish the main story - is excellent. It's a largely instanced hub based game and there are simply tons of things to do - each with tangible rewards.. And while there is quite a bit that would normally require a group - there is a very interesting concept of "god mode" where - after earning enough "faith" points, you can temporarily (10-15min) turn into a god and easily clear most group content solo.

Grind: People complain about the grinding....not sure why. This is one of the charms of the game. It gives you a very long list of things you can accomplish and things for which to strive. You made steady and noticeable progress throughout. There are lots of ways to upgrade your character. 

My only complaint about the game is how hard it is to unlock new classes. There are like 20 of them and you start with 3. You can pay $13 to unlock a class or collect "sparks of transformation". Those are somewhat difficult to obtain. Although - it does get easier when you complete the story and get the god mode for you class. With that you can start periodically doing group content solo and gather sparks more quickly. Still - it will take at least a week or two to unlock each class. 

In all - while this will not be a game for everyone - it's one of my favorite MMOs for the way I like to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198750154874', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 9679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9461, 'last_played': 1705450443}
review:
After playing this game for over 150+hours, I think I can finally write a review. 

If you asked me if this game was worth downloading 2 years ago, I would probably say yes.
But now it's definitely not worth installing anymore.

The game has some of the worst Voice Lines that I have ever seen, most of the time they don't match the subtitles or the voice just cuts out mid-sentences, and also the voice lines show near no emotion at all expect the God Of Science (Flavius). 

The graphics, sounds and even the combat are almost perfect, but the voice lines and transitions are horrible. At one moment you could be fighting hoards of monsters in an epic cut scene but right after it ends you are placed in the game like none of that ever happened just standing there not actually experiencing any of it.

-Here are some good examples: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vYDYwa_l5cM
0:00-0:40
1:18-2:10


Another big problem is the balance of power, the early game goes smoothly without any issues, but soon as you hit around rank 10 it becomes almost impossible to solo some levels and becomes very frustrating and annoying to progress. Well of course there is the dungeon finder, right? Nope. Literally no one is using it these days, you could be lined up for days and still nothing happens… The best way to get help with this game is to join one of the best pantheons.

Then there is the cash shop, Yeah I get that games need to make money and stuff like that, but after every dungeon the game is displaying what the "V.I.P" users would have gotten for the rewards is just scummy. The prices of the shop are also intentionally put there so what ever you buy, you are always left with some extra currency that you cannot spend on anything, forcing you to spend more money in the game.

So I would not recommend to download this game as a new player in 2022. The devs no longer care about the game, and it's at last near its end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056722608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 14053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12108, 'last_played': 1650587151}
review:
I enjoy the combat mechanics, the theme (godhood, hell yeh!), and the graphics aren't terrible for a hack'n'slash-esque game.

That said, the graphics still aren't GREAT, its less of a MMO and more of a shared instance cell'ed map, the community is almost dead except for a few dedicated players, and worst of all it is very pay to win in just about every way they could conceivably make it so.

I love the game, but I hate the framework it is laying on. I will recommend it if only because I feel it's unique theme makes it worthy of a playthrough, even if the horrifically predatory monetization practices scare you off before you get too far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080353271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4997, 'last_played': 1642036527}
review:
Where to start with this game...

I guess I'll start by saying this ISN'T a bad game, in fact I would say far from it that the game is immensely unique in many ways using not just one but many systems no other MMORPG I've seen have done, with the exception of Allods which coincidentally is another game made by these same developers lol. Both of the games have seemingly gone through similar stages in their life-times and before I get into the details I really do want to express just how impressed I am with these developers as I've been sincerely impressed by their innovation in both of these titles. But that being said their creativity and general competence does not make either of the game free from issues. But let me refocus on Skyforge specifically as Allods is its own beast to tackle.

Pros:

-The game uses a unique mechanic for measuring and gaining strength for your character. Rather than tradition levels it is instead measured two stats the first being "Might" and the second being "Superiority." For the first part of the game, a relatively short story quest which may take you a few days to get through or less is essentially a build up to the main body of the game which is the post story endgame content, Might is going to be the only thing you have to worry about. Your might is calculated based many factors such as your number of worshipers, the level of your tower of knowledge, the level of your bastions, the trophies or advancements you have unlocked in your temple and tower of knowledge, etc. All of which are leveled up using different currencies you can earn in the game

-The story is one that doesn't seem to unique originally but one that you quickly realize to be far more unique that you originally give it credit for

-The deeper lore outside of the main story is positively fascinating with so much going on that it may originally be a little difficult to warp your head around

-Unique gameplay mechanics with ascending to divine forms and later Aspects of Higher Divinity

-The visuals while now a bit dated are still pleasant to look at

-A large variety of playable classes that for the most part all feel very different from each other

Cons:

-While the complexity of the game has been significantly dumbed down from the games original incarnation a more casual player may still find the game overwhelming. Levels in the tower of knowledge need to be raised by using the resource Knowledge of Enemies which can be obtained from killing enemies, completing regions (open world areas), and squad (story scripted linear sections that are not terrible long) missions for the first time as well as group adventures and operations which are essentially dungeons and lower tier raids respectively. Leveling up your Temple required followers which are earned by completing the story, having your followers perform rituals (which costs credits), or rescuing civilians. Getting the above mentioned trophies and achievements requires medals which are also earned by completing the story, unlocking classes requires sparks of transformation, argents are the premium game currency which can be used for basically everything, rare crystals are a material farmed by collecting specific items in each unique region that can be exchanged for certain times, and events usually have their own special currency as well. And all of this are just the ones you need to worry about before getting past the story. Afterwards you can add Invasion Focai, sparks of the king, assassin, judge, etc to the list, as well as divine deeds, avatar trophies, do you see my point yet? Its a lot to keep track of even after being significantly dumbed down over the years.

-Paywalls everywhere, unfortunately this game is largely P2W progress is absolutely agonizingly slow if you don't post the main storyline. Directive do a little bit to help with the difference but you will likely find yourself not being able to complete many of the objectives due to another con lower coming up on this list

-Massive difficulty spike. Due to the servers getting progressively harder with each invasion once you are outside of the main story you will smacked in the face with a huge difficulty increase where all of the enemies will suddenly vastly over power you on all the new content that opened up. Even after bulking up a bit you will find that most of these cannot be done without a group to assist you or using your Divine Form which both have their own issues

-Divine form: While the idea behind the divine form and mechanics are fun and unique, when originally receiving it, it feels like a toy inside of boy that you can't get open... or maybe like one that your parents will only let you play with 1 hour a day. The problem is that using your divine form requires a resource called faith, which can only be earned by sending your adepts (8 select followers that can go on pilgrimages in your name) and hope that RNG says  they gather that resource for you while they are out for the next several hours doing so, or if you are lucky an easier directive may offer you as a reward as well though I wouldn't count on that with any consistency same with possibly find a focus of faith in operations. Originally the with assuming the form can be resolved by using the divine deeds to upgrade your temple of deeds to be able to assume the form for less resources but starting out it costs so much that you can almost never use it, and with only 1 use per run of a dungeon/raid you will find yourself using up that option very quickly.

-So if the divine form is only something you can rely on one or twice a day then the obvious solution is find groups to do things with right? Well maybe at one point yes... but now no. The game is pretty much dead. Very few people playing or queuing up in the group finders meaning this option is pretty much off the table. If you are lucky you might be able to find a group in chat after about 20 minutes for the lower tier stuff and for higher tier stuff? Well you damn well better hope you are part of pantheon or you aren't ever going to get into any of those, which is especially a problem for newer players as it means they likely won't be able to get Avatar trophies which would mean they would be hard locked in the Hall of Deeds meaning their Divine Form would not be able to be cheaper to use with time and the ultimate goal of become an elder god would be all but impossible.

All of this is to say I believe this game is coming close to the end of its life cycle and I'm not sure becoming invested at it at this point is worth it. However keeping an eye on the developer for their next game is. As stated I've been very impressed with both Allods and this title even if both did have some heavy P2W mechanics in them. I've jumped in and out of this game 3 times total. I was there near the start where I more or less came to a dead end due to lacking a pantheon and being unable to become an elder god, started a new account because I came back in the middle of the games life cycle and found so many things had changed but again ran into the same problem, couldn't find a good pantheon and got locked out of being able to be an Elder God, and now again where I can't even be bother to get that far because the game is so dead I am more or less soft locked before even reaching that point.

Do yourselves a favor and keep an eye out for the Allods teams next project because this one likely won't last to much longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071627204', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1638125591}
review:
Ich versuche nach mittlerweile 3 Guides und diversen Anleitungen die erste verf***te Mission oder irgendwas zu starten aber es passiert einfach NIX... 
Im Chat war auch tote Hose... und im Spiel selbst findet man nirgends einen hinweis wohin man muss oder was genau man machen muss um sich endlich mal zu "Kloppen" (umgangssprachlich) oder mal in eine ebene zu wechseln oder so... aber ich hänge seid stunden in dieser dämlichen Starthalle fest und nix passiert.

Also Anfänger freundlich sieht für mich anders aus.
Da gibt es wesentlich bessere Games.
Danke für Nix...

Und ja kann sein das ich dem Spiel hier so keine Chance gebe und grad etwas mein Frust freien lauf lasse, aber es kann doch nicht so schwierig sein so ein Spiel zum laufen zu bekommen oder auch mal eine "Einzige" Mission zu starten... 

Also vorerst, und das voraussichtlich für laaaange Zeit, kein Skyforge mehr.

review:
Игра затягивает, но есть несколько но:
1 - В игре огромное кол-во классов, но все их вы сможете получить только под конец сюжетной линии ( Или задонать )
2 - В игре есть премиум который существенно ускорит процесс фарма ( Но нужно задонатить ) 
3 - В игре нету брони как какой-то механики, это всё чистая внешка ( что я считаю для mmorpg не очень)
4 - За донат можно купить практически всё что тебе нужно ( что не удивительно ведь игра от my games)
5.5 криомантов из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198255795269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1631327386}
review:
Very limited game play unless you break out your wallet and unlock other classes. You can choose from three generic ones, and all the others are locked behind paywalls. 

Also, when you look at gear and abilities on other players, and then check out how you get that you see that you need to pay money.. you realize very quickly the p2w aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120365823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 278208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238795, 'last_played': 1640322830}
review: Skyforge is what happens when a bad mobile game company is the publisher of an MMORPG. You get extreme amounts of micro-transactions and pay-2-win content, effectively ruining the game. The NA server has an absolutely abysmal population because of it, which is filled whale-players who are the only ones managing to keep it afloat. They're the type that buy every new legendary weapon upon release and whatever else that gives them that slight advantage. For this reason, never have I seen in any other game a bigger power gap between new and veteran players. For you to even catch up to these older players without investing money into the game, it would take you at least a literal, entire year, of playing daily. Even the developers seem to not know what to do with the game to make it better. Several months ago one of their biggest updates was the addition of a new class to the game, the Bounty Hunter. But it's horrendously bad. Visually and gameplay-wise it feels like a Destiny rip-off. Which isn't surprising because the publisher probably thinks Destiny is their best and closest target audience for game design and profit. Another reason it's bad is because many other classes fill the exact same role as it already (i.e. ranged DPS) and it doesn't do anything better than any other one class. And all this is not even getting into all the other, specific issues the game has had for years (especially in the bug/glitch department). My advice? It's free to play, play it for as long as you still enjoy it, then play something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254254491', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1644599217}
review: I really like this game and I feel like it's quite underrated. The free-to-play, pay-for-convenience Warframe-esque model is a little annoying, and the game gets quite difficult pretty fast, but it's worth it imo. I recently got into New World and after a number of hours in that game I found myself thinking about Skyforge more and more, so here I am again. My only other complaint is that I was unable to carry over my progress from my PS4 account to my new PC one, but w/e. Try it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128660903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6599, 'last_played': 1633478012}
review:
Combat - Fun I very much enjoyed it
Story - I was actually really invested in it
Different Classes/Play-styles - Again really enjoyed, love how you can just swap around easily

"Leveling up" - Not really a fan of, It's not based on experience points which I guess is unique it's just incredibly grindy too get stronger
Gameplay - Really pushes for that cooperative play-style, So it's often hard to do things solo, but it's hard to find people to play with when you join to get stronger but they will kick you out for not being "as strong", like that's why I'm here?

Divine Form(God mode) - Really fun to use and is basically what it says "god mode" damage output is crazy and you take so less damage, just wish it wasn't so expensive to use. Later in harder missions (for me personally) I sometimes find it difficult to do anything without using god mode, but I might just be bad xD

Has a lot of bugs and glitches that need to be patched. Like sometimes cut-scenes would freak out, or the fact I got an achievement for falling through the world. Like there are some aspects that make this game feel.. unfinished

Another gripe I have is the excessive micro transactions, but hey free MMOs gotta make money somehow I guess.

Still an overall fun experience by the end of the day, at least I had fun. I just feels it needs some tweaking

author: {'steamid': '76561198321064478', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 122488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110944, 'last_played': 1706877526}
review:
Non je ne le recommande pas. J'y ai un peu joué ( LOL ), et non je ne le recommande pas. Pourquoi ? Déséquilibre des classes ( qu'un mec qui a jouer 100h dessus vienne me le dire et je le t**e sur place ! ) dans tout, PVP et PVE. AUCUNE amélioration dans les quêtes, bug a foison ( vas-y que je bloque dans un mur, vas-y que je perds ma forme god, vas-y que le jeu bouge tout seul ect ect. ), RIEN de nouveau depuis.... 3 ans.... Ouais 3/4 classes ajoutées... Ouais.... Et le contenue ? Mais qu'est ce que c'est que ce mot rachid ! Il est tabou voyons ! Bref rien, pour avoir mit ZERO argent dedans, il m'a fallu près un peu + de 1800h pour avoir... Le tier de ce que tu peux avoir sans payer... PAY TO WIN du côté du PVP ( les autres je vous entends et oui c'est PAY TO WIN IN PVP ) C'est très dur pour un joueur LAMBDA qui ne paye pas les armes dans les boutiques ( je précise dans le doute, AVEC DE l'ARGENT REELE BIEN ÉVIDEMENT ) D'arrivé à un niveau de farm où tu peux avoir à chaque invasion les armes légendaires de tout les personnages, c'est IMPOSSIBLE de tous les avoirs à chaque saisons sans payer. En parlant d'invasion, c'est les mêmes depuis 4 ans, rien à changé, les mêmes bugs depuis 4 ans, ils augmentent juste le levels des mobs et ils s'en battent tellement les cou**lles, qu'ils oublient peut être qu'on peut plus les tuer peut importe le stuff MDR, évidemment ils l'ont patch...... A la fin de l'invasion bien sur sinon c'est pas drôle ( je précise que c'est pas la premières fois.... 
Point positifs 
Si tu es chomeur et que tu es prêt à perdre ton temps au lieu de te trouver un/e copain/copine ou de t'occuper de celle actuel, c'est le bon jeu
Côté graphisme, étant bigleux, Ouais, c'est beau... Fin y'a que ça de bien quoi....

Avis personnel, un jeu qui aurait été excellent voir insane, s'ils corrigeait leur bug, et leur problème avec l'ajout de réelle contenue, parce que rajouté un personnage ou renflouer les caisses lors d'une levé de fond, je trouve ça trop facile.
Leur débilité mental à ne pas écouter la communauté font que ce jeu est dans la catégories " même pas passable " Alors qu'il a un potentiel de dingue. Dommage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040131763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1685, 'last_played': 1632964518}
review: The game is simply too grindy, removing key features such as testing classes in the training room before you buy them, and the talents within the classes has created an even less enjoyable playing experience. I played Skyforge on a different account on the mygames launcher before it had come to steam. Skyforge was the only game I had downloaded the launcher for. I even bought a founders pack I believe, however, that account is long gone and I decided to try the game again after it popped up on steam. I put a long time into the game when I had played previously and wanted to start over with some friends. Unfortunately the changes that have been made create a very un-fun grindfest that is mobile game-esque. The core gameplay is very fun, but without the ability to unlock new classes/the classes you want at a decent rate it starts to get dull FAST, especially without the PVP which I had remembered being very fun. The progression overall feels like it's designed to sell the core game to the player through ingame currencies instead of being what it's advertised as, an mmo. There aren't enough people playing the game for any events to work, nobody wants to invest their time or money into this game because there's simply no reward in doing so. Please save this game, the memories I have of this game were great, playing the ninja in pvp are what made me recommend the game to friends in the first place. Without players, progression, or pvp, I simply have no reason to continue playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017207154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 15170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3234, 'last_played': 1655680542}
review:
Best MMO combat of any I have ever played (and I've played a bunch)! If you just want to stand still and press buttons in a certain order 95% of the time, this is not the MMO for you. However, if you love action combat where you have to move and dodge all while dealing epic DPS using your unique class skills, this is the MMO you've been waiting for! Don't listen to players who claim the game is "pay to win", there is no content locked behind paywalls! Yes, you can buy costumes, consumables, and even gold if you want, but it's completely optional.

And beyond all that, the graphics are gorgeous! 

52 hours in now, and loving it. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198124845447', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1659381230}
review:
Ho giocato a skyforge dalla prima beta, all'inizio il gioco con il sistema atlas era stupendo, una sfereografia stile final fantasy X su un gioco del genere dove sbloccare abilita e classi non richiedeva tutto questo farming estremo, l'ho rigiocato quando hanno tolto questa bellissima feature ma vabbe. 
Succede questo, avvi il gioco e ti ritrovi in un loop infinito sulla schermata di loading, contatto il supporto, inesistente, non rispondono e non ti aiutano a risolvere il problema, inutile mettere il gioco su pc ps4 switch ecc... se poi la voglia di tenerlo vivo ed aiutare le persone che hanno problemi a giocarlo non vengono aiutati, solito gioco che mira a far soldi e basta se ti funziona ti godi l'esperienza videoludica, se non ti funziona amen tanto loro ci guadagnano lo stesso, per ora

author: {'steamid': '76561198092025447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3603, 'last_played': 1618225809}
review:
I check the steam matrix every so often to see how this does is doing and here is why.
First off, I really enjoyed the game and how the fighting and skills operate, when I started it got me going real quick and the game kind of gears you towards main story to get your Pantheon/ god for. Which sounds cool right? Well it was, that is until you got your god form in which you are pretty much content locked.
What I mean by this is how dependent you are on Pantheons aka clans/guilds, and what is not told to you is if you have not joined any prior to getting to a predetermined point I.E the god form quest you are utterly boned, why and how you might be asking? Well I will tell you as this is exactly what happened to me.
I get to the actual content of the game by beating the main story, god form, yada yada cool beans. Well the games player count is so low match making is a no go, further no one talks. and there is like 3-4 Pantheons that actually have numbers to do the big boy/gril content. I mean 82 players, playing as of an hour prior to this post.
(The last Update 2023) Above the daily player count was at 86 now the daily average is 26, sadly and with sadness I can say this game is officially deader then a door nail. If someone wishes to try this game out do so with caution, and for God sake do not put a single penny into this game. The reason is simply the game is just no longer worth any form of investment this is strictly the fault of the *DEVS* They have mismanaged this game into the ground and it shows, they have aggressive forms of monetization on the level of some mobile games this is simply a single issue in a vast caverns worth of issues and failures from the company, I had a decent time and enjoyed the game for what it was however all things come to an end.
Update Mar 2024: The audacity of the Devs to think we care about their new trash game, they should scrap that failure and fix the game they have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198363954842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 128547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122756, 'last_played': 1671478262}
review:
This game is extremely good, but the business model is extremely disappointing. The problem is that the server increases in difficulty every 2 months (55 days per invasion season). What this means is that while you may make effort to raise your character's rank/level, the monsters you will be fighting against get raised by 10 ranks every season.

This means that if you do not raise your character's rank, eventually the monsters will out-level you and you will struggle to be able to beat them. Name any other mmo or rpg where the world around you gets constantly more difficult; effectively making your character get weaker over time. This is a situation the player can find themselves in if they ever choose to take a break from the game, after playing it seriously every day for a year, for example. Yes, eventually you will be too weak to fight anything and make any progress, if you dare to take a break from the game.

What is the alternative, to play the game religiously every day for the rest of your life, in fear of taking a break that will negate your efforts? That isn't how MMOs should be. In any other mmo I have played, you make effort, you keep your progress. MMO servers typically use auto-saving features so that all your progress is saved server-side. That technology also exists in Skyforge, but it is cancelled out since the server gets progressively more difficult.

There are many classes in Skyforge, and they all feel different to each other, enough to justify multiple classes, but they are not balanced. They are not equal in damage output. Yes, there are different class groups, such as Defence, Support DPS, Magic Attack (Melee & 30meters), Range (30meters), but they are not equal in damage output within the class groups. For example, you get given Paladin (Defence), Cryomancer (Magic Attack), Lightbinder (Support) for free, but the Paladin is out-done in damage output and survivability by the Grovewalker (Defence). The Cryomancer is out-done by the Firestarter (Magic Attack). The Lightbinder is out-done by the Soundweaver (Support DPS). Meaning if you were to go 1v1 against a player using the aforementioned classes that out-do them, you'll likely be playing from a position of stat-based disadvantage.

This is what I mean by the classes are not balanced. What's worse is, and I am speculating here - the reason the classes seem not to be balanced, is to incentivize players into unlocking the other classes, since one is a free unlock and the other is behind a paywall - yes this can be covered with in-game currency (typically 25,000 Sparks of Transformation to unlock a class, in some cases 35,000); however this in game currency paywall can be completely bypassed by the special offers which rotate every 2 days, where you can purchase a class unlock with a legendary weapon, for 12,000 Argents (purchased with real world money). I personally have unlocked every class in the game & I have tested legendary weapons for every class, except the newly released Bounty Hunter class, which currently costs 35,000 Sparks or 12,000 Argents.

There are many things you can optionally unlock in the Hall of Trophies, which actually function as permanent unlocks fortunately, which can help you to increase your damage output and augment your build, which technically allows you to tweak classes to make up for whatever they are lacking. However, if you want to do this, you will need to farm victor medals, another currency.

If you want to farm a currency in Skyforge, the only thing stopping you is your own motivation, but one of the reasons it is quite difficult to do is because the game is quite limited in what you can do to farm these currencies. There are Squad missions, Group missions and Regions. Regions do not rise in difficulty level, they remain constant, but they offer highly limited amounts of Knowledge of Enemies, which is a resource that functions like 'XP' (experience points) in other mmos. Essentially, a lot of work for a little progress. Difficult to do every day.

You get a lot more KoE from Squad and even more from Group Directives (Directives are where the game will suggest to you what missions to do and when, and by doing them within the 24 hour window, you get increased rewards.) Sometimes, because of this feature you will end up repeating the exact same mission more than once in the same 24 hour period. You would have a lot more variety if you chose which missions to do for yourself, but then you would lose out on progress efficiency since the rewards would be lower.

I have spent about £1000 on this game after about a year of playing on and off, I have uninstalled & re-installed it around 15 times, I currently don't have it installed since I uninstalled it yesterday, intending to quit playing it, because I do not like the need to spend money on a game when I've already spent so much already - a buy to play game is usually no more than £60, so I just don't approve of this need to spend more after spending so much - but Skyforge IS a unique game, I really love using the Witch & Necromancer classes, since I enjoy using Damage over Time, and that isn't a feature found in every mmo.

So I continue with it. But that is not without frustration & annoyance at a business model that basically ruins one of the best mmorpgs I've found so far. I have many others installed yet I find myself playing Skyforge regularly. You'll enjoy it if you can afford to continually pay to assist your progress, and you don't take too many breaks from the game and waste your efforts.

One other thing I should mention is, since the server gets more difficult by 10 ranks per season, if you choose to buy a legendary weapon, it will have 10% less damage every 55 days. The purpose of buying a legendary weapon is because they do at least 100% more damage than a rare weapon you can get for free in game, so this means, after 550 days, you have lost the £10 you spent on a legendary weapon. Multiply this by the 18(+1) classes in the game, that's potentially £180 every 550 days just on legendary weapons.

Some players will argue that you can get Epic weapons in game for free (an Epic weapon's damage is in between Rare and Legendary), by doing certain high level content, but this content is locked behind the difficulty wall, since you cannot solo it - make sure you join a pantheon that doesn't mind carrying you through difficult content. If you were strong enough to not need carrying, you wouldn't be trying to get a free Epic weapon, would you?

The game looks really nice but the animation can be a bit dodgy and un-immersive, so it looks amazing in screenshots, but watch a video and you'll have a better understanding of the quality. It has been around since 2017 so it is starting to get a bit dated, but this is fine if you aren't new to it right now.

I am going to re-install this game and continue playing it because I don't want to waste the money I've already spent on it, and while I'm not saying you won't enjoy some aspects of this game, I'm not going to recommend it, because I should have listened to the reviews I saw when I was first considering trying it myself, that warned me the business model is very pay2win.  They didn't explain in enough detail for me to see why that is a problem, so I had to try it for myself to see the issue first-hand.

I have not explained every feature in the game, in fact I was told yesterday that there is something called 'Terra' where you can do end-game missions that get you a lot of Knowledge of Enemies, but I have avoided it for a year since I was under the impression from watching some youtube videos that Terra farming is a pvp area, so I wasn't interested due to this game's lack of balance between classes, which makes the pvp battles not very much fun in my opinion, and that is when all player's rank is matched to rank 70 -  a pvp area that lets players come in without any rank matching seems like a bad idea to me. Worth trying, it's not the worst.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983304204', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1630265499}
review:
I have been playing in the my.games launcher.

The game is dead, the first 20 hours are fine, but after you finish the main campaing, and you are rank 50, you can do anything.

PC is in season 33, around Rank 350, the only way you can do missions Rank 350 to get rewards that level up your Rank are, being carried by someone (somehow they need to be nice enough to let you be the group leader so you can complete the directive), or pay 30-40€ and buy premium gear.

Thats it, there is nothing else you can do, if you have a high level friend, you can make it, if you are a solo player you cant do shit except pay money.

The community sucks, there are like 6 guilds, and they wont help you, they will tell you "wait 5 minutes and i help you", then they will leave and make fun of you in the discord, they are soviet trolls.

Just ignore this game.

You have two option, being powerleveled by

author: {'steamid': '76561197994258997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1630609833}
review: В разное время игра цепляла и заставляла к себе возвращаться. У неё есть неповторимая концепция и она единственная вам вообще объясняет, почему вы избранный и бессмертный, который должен всем помогать. Но мои возвращения, думаю, закончились на том, что в из игры пропала поддержка русского языка как в озвучке, которая была прекрасна, так и даже и из субтитров. Я знаю про танцы с бубном и подмену архивов, русский язык в которых авторы продолжают зачем-то обновлять, хоть выбрать его обычным образом нельзя, но каждое обновление файлы игры обновляются и стучать в бубен приходится заново. Учитывая то, что это мморпг, то обновления бывают часто, и даже такие нехитрые манёвры быстро начинают утомлять. Поэтому, пока не вернётся мой родной язык, даже при том, что я неплохо знаю английский и немецкий, играть не хочется.

author: {'steamid': '76561199037671936', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1709635193}
review:
I used to play this game on xbox. Of course have to start from scratch again on PC, but the game has significantly improved since I last played it. Most NPCs have voices now and there are more cut scenes which improves the graphics in-game.

I have seen reviews saying that it takes "forever" to level up and especially to get to rank 30, However if you play the game the right way you have no issues, played 17 hours at the moment and already rank 24. Make sure to use the tower of knowledge as much as you can as that increases rank. And don't worry about the other classes, paladin cryomancer and lightbinder are enough to get you started.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183697578', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2344, 'last_played': 1631676509}
review: So a lot of people say this game is bad or that its p2p. I've even seen people compare this to a glorified mobile game. They are exactly right. It is a really pretty, action based mobile game that you play on the pc. Its fun, you can play it in short bursts do the missions collect currencies increase your rank slowly and slowly but surely unlock a new toon and rinse and repeat. I enjoy this game loop and i'm even willing to spend money to speed things up. Even if you don't spend money you can still enjoy it. If you are looking for pvp, don't play this game. If you want a super active community do not play this game. but if you want solid game loops, lots of playable classes and nice graphics  then you should give it a shot. Ignore all the bad reviews they are super misleading and prevent people from giving a good game a shot.

review: Horrible game. Three times now i have been in combat and controls just STOP working all around. Couldn't target, couldn't attack, couldn't dodge. I just had to stand there and die. Menus wouldn't open at all either. Hell, I had to ctrl+alt+del to exit the game. Story line is crap, voice acting sucks. Audio for voice cuts out during cut scenes. This game has been out for how long? It's a hot mess. Don't waste your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131036323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 32642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32572, 'last_played': 1695899753}
review: i spent 542 hours in this game with some of my friends. What can i say.. it's a very funny game to play together but you shouldn't play it alone, it gets boring fast. You can buy lots of classes for your character and each one of them is amazing in my opinion. The worst part is that the higher your level is, the harder is gonna take you to kill enemies (and i'm talking like 30/35 levels of difference, which trust me you can imagine how hard it could become XD). If you think you can play like 1/2 time a week don't think you'll become strong because you really need to spend days to farm everything you need.

author: {'steamid': '76561199067257955', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7468, 'last_played': 1638585095}
review: At first, the game was incredible fun. Interesting story-line, wide arrange of classes, but that was until you beat the first story. After that, the game is unrealistically hard. I wanted to try and push thru it, but I kept failing mission after mission. If you want a game to pick up and immediately drop in two days, this is the game. I wish this game wasn't so hard or I could enjoy myself more. Honestly, don't spend time or money on this game if you want to find some new enjoyment on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254433589', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1625252203}
review:
TLDR: Had a blast for the duration of the campaign because of the fun gameplay mechanics - even though it has the most telegraphed story ever. I do recommend playing the main story, but I'd strongly advice to not buy anything until after you've tried the content after the story.

First off, the gameplay mechanics in this game are extremely cool. Of the classes I've tried, each felt unique and all but one were a real joy to learn and play.

The story is okay-ish. It's really neither good nor bad, but it has got to be the most telegraphed story I've ever encountered. Two hours into the game, it's already pretty obvious what happened and what will happen in the end.

I've encountered quite a few bugs, especially with audio in cut scenes, but nothing major or game-breaking. It did get annoying at times though.

Lastly, I've made the mistake of purchasing some ingame items that I now wished I hadn't. I had a blast playing the story, really. I know after a bit more than 20 hours, I shouldn't really describe it as "endgame content", but it just wasn't fun anymore. In part, there certainly was a fair bit of disappointment that the story didn't have any twists and indeed ended as I expected. But anything I tried after finishing the main story felt like nothing new happened. Just a painfully grindy chore, that the fun mechanics don't help to balance out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981584030', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1696047754}
review:
Great mmo, has actual decent feeling melee combat (how many actually do?) , has combos, has great Illuminati dialogue,

 just starting off but hopefully I can play and beat it multiple times,

 It has really nice bright ambiance and huge large characters, again something in short supply nowadays in mmos.

 It's very much like a cross between Tabula Rasa and something like Tera, which are all very good things.

 I suggest playing a game like this if you're sick of all the trash steam games  (or 'insect' view / dark depressing type games),

 Another game that flew under the radar for years, but glad I'm getting a chance to play it.

 Please note one of the downsides of the game is it might be a bit too easy, but that's a generic problem of all mmos nowadays and I'm new to the game,

 not sure how it will pan out in the long run.

 I suggest you give it a try now if you've been putting it off, it's a lot better than expected and a great change of pace from steam games.


 ALSO !!  -- REAL TIME ACTION COMBAT HAS FULL CONTROLLER SUPPORT !!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198895401758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3658, 'last_played': 1630751707}
review:
C'est un jeu pay to levelup qui va nous inciter grandement à payer pour s'améliorer rapidement et accéder à des contenus très alléchant dans la boutique. Sincèrement par rapport à l'histoire et au gameplay, je ne trouve pas du tout
l'intérêt ni le ressenti d'un MMO et surtout MMORPG. Le seul moment ou vous êtes MMORPG, c'est dans dans la salle de l'observatoire qui est un lieu "d'attente" dans laquelle beaucoup de joueurs sont réuni. Vous avez la possibilité de faire des raid
et des instances de groupes, le problème c'est que vous allez galérer à trouver des joueurs car il n'y plus grand monde sur le jeu et surtout pas grand monde s'intéressant aux grosses instances. Votre évolution se fait dans des
instances avec chargement... Niveau gameplay c'est très arcade, pas beaucoup d'actions de disponibles contrairement à d'autre jeux du même style. 
Il est vrai que le jeu est gratuit et ça va vous permettre de le tester et de faire votre propre avis.

Au départ on va consacré du temps sur le jeu et après quelques heures 'D'évolutions' on va finir par se connecter une fois par jour, histoire de faire une ou deux quêtes vite fait, de prendre quelques récompenses et après on quitte.

Personnellement je ne recommande pas ce jeu qui pour moi n'est pas du tout MMORPG ni semi MMO, j'ai également beaucoup de mal à y consacré plus de temps vu l'intérêt et la répétition des actions. 

Le travail d'animation , de texturing, level design et malgré tout bien travailler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800768736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 13211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1630442248}
review:
Game is great fun with a friend.  There is a lot of hours of gameplay for this game so if thats something your looking for this game is definitely for you.

Edit: After playing skyforge for over 200 hours I can say skyforge is a great game if grinding is what you enjoy in a MMO like I do.  That being said if grinding is not something you enjoy todo I would recommend against this game if that was the case, however this game can be less grind intensive by simply spending some cash on a good mount to get around while in combat, or a nice pack from one of the weekly sales they have.  This game has been a lot of fun for me and it  only gets better the higher your Might (level) gets as content gets more challenging and you start unlocking god status it really opens up the game and you can easily get into groups with other players.  Skyforge has a group system however players in skyforge do not use this group system very often, in this game you need to type in chat and share your group for others to join in.  The NA server has around 500 daily players at time of review due to the new gen 33 that just released.

To sum it up game is great fun buckle up and get ready for a grind.

author: {'steamid': '76561199138390397', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1626303655}
review:
(Updated 7/4/2021, after playing some more).

I wanted to like this game, I really did. The combat is bar none the best in any MMO I've ever tried (and I've tried a lot), especially if you use a controller. It's great to sit on the couch and play with the TV and GeForce Now. With a combat mount, you can pull half a zone worth of mobs, kite them into a chokepoint, and then use an AOE to blast all of them at once, transform into a treant, and smash the few survivors. Combat is fast-paced, dynamic, reactive, tactical, and overall loads better than the bad old hotbar days. The graphics are gorgeous, everything from environments to characters to effects to animations. I wish all MMOs looked this good.

Sadly, that's about all the good I can say about the game. The main issue is that the progression system is absolutely whack. I don't know how it used to be, but I started in 2021 and it was completely pay-to-win. Actually, not even pay-to-win (which implies that people who pay more end up on top) but actually pay-to-progress, meaning it's more like a mobile base-building game than a proper MMO. It's not that other people will be more powerful if they pay more, it's that there isn't really any meaningful progression that happens through gameplay. You HAVE topay if you want to grow your character. This isn't an RPG as much as a currency market where you level up your stats by buying different alt-coins.

For reference, let's consider how Diablo 3 does progression: you start out as a weak character with 1 or 2 starting abilities, then over time you gain more abilities, sub-abilities that you can use with one another, then various specializations. Itemization is likewise terrific, with rares and above giving you fun modifiers, legendaries giving you unique abilities, and set items to round it all out, allowing unique playstyles. Lastly, there is a crafting-lite system that adds to the fun if you need a break from combat. Other, proper MMOs also have similar RPG-like mechanics.

Sadly, not Skyforge. Whatever soul of an RPG it might've once had was completely corrupted by the monetization model. There is no meaningful progression in this game that I can see, at least for the first 20 hours. You get ALL of your class's abilities within the first hour or two (they unlock really quickly, and there's 6-10 of them depending on your class). That's it. No more abilities; that's your class progression. Vertical progression beyond that is in the form of having to pay various alternate currencies (credits, tomes of knowledge, etc.) on an exponential scale to various buildings/temples, like a gacha mobile game that makes you level up buildings. The buildings give you additional might (attack damage, basically) and various minor stats boosts... just like the boring jewelry, but worse, and far more expensive.

Horizontal progression comes in the form of unlocking the other classes. Your one character can eventually play all the classes if you grind enough or pay enough. But after 20 hours, I have yet to unlock a single other class... it seems like finishing the campaign will get you enough class credit to unlock 1 single other class out of the 18. Unlocking them all would probably take years, but honestly, most of the classes are trash. They are completely unbalanced, with Grovewalker and Revenant being superpowered and everything else being mediocre to trash.

Itemization? Monsters drop various pieces of jewelry, but all they do is add minor (2-10%) stats boosts to boring stats. They don't change gameplay at all. The ONLY fun items are legendary weapons, which come with the Collectors' Editions or can be bought with real money in the in-game store. I've never seen any creature drop anything even remotely resembling fun, and I've killed thousands of them. It's not a rarity thing; itemization in this game is simply dependent on real money. And there is no crafting system. There aren't even proper merchants in the game. You can sell unneeded loot for one of a dozen types of secondary currencies, then use them to level up your boring buildings which then level up your boring stats.

If you pay money, you can pretty much powerlevel yourself straight into godhood.* All the buildings can be leveled up by paying real money and buying secondary currencies. You can buy legendary weapons directly with real money, along with the fastest mounts. There are even mounts you can use in combat, like big mechs, but firing their abilities cost real money. Yes, that's right, you have to pay $$$ for ammunition.

That's how screwed up the progression and monetization system is here. There is no real gameplay beyond the first (admittedly very fun!) few hours. Because while you can fight and combat is fun, you get the gist of it after a few hours, and the remaining grind -- years worth of it -- is solely dependent on how much money you're willing to spend.

And because of that, there is no real community either. The game is dead, except for a few super-gods who stick around presumably because they've sunk a buttload of money in this game. There are no groups to be found organically, but if you're in one of the remaining 2-3 super-guilds, they will sometimes powerlevel you by one-shotting everything in the instanced adventures. (Nobody does the open-world zones anymore, because all the daily/weeklies are tied to instanced dungeons). The only social hub is nearly always silent, with people standing around just waiting for their guilds to start the next instanced adventure. There is no level scaling, there are no group adventures in the regular campaign, no sense of community. There is really only the overwhelming loneliness and the money grind. Maybe this is what day trading in the stock market is like, with prettier graphics.

*Speaking of "godhood", yes, part of the premise of the game is that after you finish the first part of the campaign, you became a junior god and can start the endgame. Problem is, the endgame isn't much better than the early game, and definitely not worth the midgame grind to get there. Once you achieve your first taste of divinity, you use yet another alternate currency ("faith") in order to make your avatar bigger, stronger, faster, and more boring and more expensive. The god-you fights in dungeons that are scaled up in difficulty, but with the same monsters, and mostly the same abilities. So basically all the numbers get multiplied by some factor, and now you're a peasant in a god's clothes. Same boring grind, just more expensive since now you have to start farming (read: buying with real $$$) faith in order to keep progressing. Divine form comes with some abilities and new weapons, granted, but they're mostly just minor DoTs or stats boosts, nothing fun or different enough to be worth the tedium of the midgame.

Long story short... this game had so much potential. I don't know how it got this bad. But do yourself a favor and skip it or at most try it for a couple of hours just for the early-game fun. The mid and end games are absolute trash. I tried WOW again the other day, and my god, even a decade later, it got so many more of the fundamentals right that Skyforge didn't... namely, a sense of community and progress. And there are just so many other better F2P MMOs out there that have a better balance of gameplay and monetization: Elder Scrolls Online, Lord of the Rings Online, Albion Online, etc. There is really no reason to invest time or money in Skyforge. I hate to say that, because it could've been so much better. Somebody loved this game at some point, but then some financiers took it over and gutted it and applied mobile cashgrab tactics to it and forever killed it :(

Check out the free version for the combat if you'd like. Enjoy the graphics for a while. Then leave before spending any money. This game is dead, killed by sheer greed.

review: Spielspass garantiert! Spreche natürlich für mich... ein super Kampfsystem! Es macht richtig Spass die vielen Klassen freizuschalten , bzw. auszuprobieren! Mit einer Gilde /Pantheon natürlich noch mehr Spass, wobei selbst die Hauptstory sehr viele Stunden Spielspass garantiert. Den habe ich weit mehr, als bei manchen Spielen mit Abosystem. Habe auch noch kein Premiumzugang kaufen müssen... selbst sowas kannst zumindest während der Hauptstory als Belohnung erspielen. Kostüme gibst auch massig, alles erspielbar... Mein Fazit: Schaue nicht immer auf die Bewertungen eines Spieles!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001363421', 'num_games_owned': 646, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1623636655}
review:
I came back to Skyforge after many, many years; I had 20+ hours on the non-Steam version. It's very different, yet very similar to the first version I played back when it was in early access. It's different because it does have some new stuff since I last played. Lots of classes and new zones, which is good. But it feels like the game lost its "godly" aspect, you end up killing plants and some random mobs instead of actually building your deity...

Yet the game is still mostly the same. A loooooot of barely significant grinding hiding behind class and zone quests. It's built like a mobile game, there are tons of systems and things to upgrade in order to gain slight amounts of power-ups. It's quite embarassing to be pushed with promotions and new cash shop items inbetween missions...

Overall, won't be putting more time of it, already feel like I wasted half a day playing this game. It's a shame that it doesn't push the "godlike" aspect more than it is currently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284954831', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11921, 'last_played': 1630657916}
review:
Is it a good game ? Once upon a time in a far away land yes , it would be , but not in the present 
Combat system ? Decent
Visuals ? Stunning
User friendly UI ? *Wheeze* Maybe when you play the game upside down you can keep it from spilling out all the sub menus 
Free to play ? Oh sure if you call scavenging the bottom of the barrel free to play 
Can it be Played Solo ? If i was asked this same question 3 years from now , i'd have said yes , you can , Now ? You'll be lucky if you reach rank 30 
does it have a Group Finder ? Yes , Does anyone ever think of using it ? Nope 
Is it Pay to win ? yes , yes , yes and , ....Yes
Can you unlock things without having to pay money for them ? 
Here's a helmet , here's your vest , here's your pick axe and good luck in the mines because you're gonna need it for all the grinding you're going to do 

In short , Dont bother with this game , if you're a casual type of man like myself , dont let the pretty visuals fool you 
It aint worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198002925741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1506919742}
review: The game was amazing when it first launched. But then they did an entire overhaul of the system and ruined it IMO.  Before you had a massive skill tree to build your characters and quests meant something.  Unlocking classes were part of the skill tree, which gave you something to play for.  Now you either have to buy them in the in game shop or grind crazy resources to unlock them.  It use to make since what you were suppose to do when it came to the story, now everything is just rinse repeat instances. Also, after the overhaul that added too many other micromanagement things to do to get all the different type of resources need for all things to unlock in game. Plus, when they did the overhaul, there was no tutorial for all the new things that you now have to manage. Or you could just spend real money to avoid the grind.  The best part was playing all the way up to the first big boss fight to unlock your god form and then after that, nothing epic, just grind. Like how we now have classic WoW servers, I would play on a classic Skyforge server. But the old ways are dead for this game, which is very unfortunate.  Original Skyforge would have been highly recommended, but modern Skyforge is a big no go these days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016484030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 6840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6840, 'last_played': 1611516862}
review:
Nota: Inaceptable.
(Base de notas según mi criterio. Desastroso, inaceptable, Aceptable, bien, Recomendado, Totalmente recomendado)
Es uno de esos juegos que a mi me gustan, mas arcade tirando a dar cates, buenos gráficos con pocos bugs.
Los constantes cambios del juego que han terminado por convertirlo en basura, desde que salio no pararon de hacerle cambios para peor.
Un juego online sin gente = a nada. Todas las mazmorras cooperativas abandonadas (actualmente salio también para consolas posiblemente tenga algo mas de población)
Gran parte de la historia del juego tienes que jugarlo solo ya que no se puede jugar en cooperativo (esto al principio no era asi).
Una vez transformado en dios el juego se vuelve injugable con una dificultad absurda (actualmente la bajaron un poco por el tema de las quejas al ponerlo en consolas - pero sigue siendo absurda-mente alto) Se supone que al ser dios las misiones tienes que jugarlas transformándote cosa que es muy complicado ya que necesitas unos puntos los cuales se tarden mucho en conseguir. (jugaras un apartida como dios de cada barios días de juego)

review: Bon bah après une bonne douzaine d'heure, et bien j'ai lâché le jeu. C'est vrai que c'est beau, y'a pas mal de classe. La boutique est pas trop intrusive, si vous êtes patient. Mais... C'est chiant à mourir! Les combats sont d'une pauvreté légendaire! Tu donnes 3-4 coups, hop, coups spécial et ainsi de suite jusqu'à mettre à terre l'ennemi, on se fait vite c*** à la longue. Les quêtes sont pas intéressantes, et puis... Bah j'ai rien à dire de plus... c'est dire la pauvreté du jeu... Faites vous votre propre avis car c'est gratuit, s'il vous intéresse vraiment. Sinon passez votre chemin.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962612042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1621955888}
review:
If you have more than one monitor there is a known bug that has been around for YEARS, where the game will start on any other monitor than your primary monitor. Every time I start the game, I have to go to video settings, change to windowed mode, drag game to appropriate monitor, then change to full screen windowed mode. After a few attempts it will eventually stick, if the game doesn't crash first. This is the only game in the history of games I've played where this sort of issue couldn't be resolved, and I'm fucking too old to be dealing with this shit every fucking time I play the game. That's why I don't recommend this game.

As far as actual game play goes, it's fairly smooth and the visuals are decent. I found myself skipping every cut scene, where normally I wouldn't. I could care less about the story arc in this game. Perhaps it's because the game pisses me off before I begin. I'm still going to be playing it to see  if it get's any better, but I suspect it won't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334779766', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1621573623}
review:
Is this game fun?
Well yes it is but there are things that are pretty corp like... 
With that I mean they are a bit like EA when its about the shop.
By the way to get a new Character you either buy them with real money (10$)
or you finish the main Story to unlock 1 Character.... yes one..... The rewards for 
those that are still at the beginning or midway are not good. And dont try quickplay in anything,
you wont find anything. Just ask others for help and everything should be fine.

Good Stuff in this game is the Design and the Characters or Classes. First of all yes you create your own
Character Male or Female.... when its about classes I have to say that I was surprised at first. because they all feel different and special. the designs are awesome aswell. Combat is like MMOS are with these specials and all so use them all the time ;)

Some levels in the Story feel the same but at the same time they are there own.
The Bosses in this game have there own patterns even though some of themm are unfair and unbalanced.
But when you do it you feel great or worse.... always depends really.

Graphics in MMO standard 10/10
Gameplay 8/10
Story 5/10
Multiplayer I dont know/10
Loot 6/10
Design 9/10
Enemies 7/10

Overhaul the game is a 7.5/10 
So give it a try when you like fantasy stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383949136', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3936, 'last_played': 1710190799}
review: A fun game but very grindy and it can be pay 2 win. I've played for about 65 hours now and i'm rank 289. There's some weird level scaling. Like when you complete the campaign all the enemies get way stronger to the point where you'll keep dying over and over, so you'll need your divine form to defeat them. Of course this costs energy and you'll have to wait for your adepts to collect it for you. There are also lot of microtransactions so be carefull if you're one of those players who likes fancy costumes or equipment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006950606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1620152384}
review:
У меня вообще не получилось поиграть через стим на моём старом акке, которому уже лет 6 как. 
Ибо игра вышла в 2015, а не в 2017. 

Визуальный стиль - приятный, мне понравилось. Анимация тоже вполне себе. С учётом того, что игра бесплатная.

НеТу рускава изыка, адназначна минус.

Сама по себе игра - красивая, но скучная. Нужно очень много гриндить.
В игру захожу 1 раз в 3-4 месяца. Глянуть, что там за обновы повыходили. В общем, полный шлак. Да, раньше было лучше.  

Пати на 5 тел не найти вообще, приходилось ждать по 5-10 минут, потом снова запускать поиск. Пришлось проходить в соло, в божественной форме. Но вот какая досада, персонаж 2 раза застрял при рывке, класс, божественная форма потратилась, а энергию для неё добывать ох как не легко. 

Озвучка никакая, играя без звука - вы ничего не потеряете. ПиВиПи НИАЧОМ. Вообще не понравилось. Даже не знаю, что именно. Просто не понравилось абсолютно всё. 

В общем, поставлю 2 оценки игре:

[h1]Версия в Steam 
1 из 10.

Версия MY.GAMES
5 из 10. [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198058222992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 194574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22223, 'last_played': 1711008904}
review:
A game with a lot of action, more or less all the time - depending on yourself and the area you're in.
If you've got questions, just ask in the main chat - there's always someone who's ready to answer, or even help you with your quests.
Some of the quests in the main story are difficult, but when you learn some tricks and get help - in the areas where it's possible - it's easier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128228399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 714, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1622648580}
review:
a proposta do jogo é bem legal, mas tem alguns pontos negativos
Um deles é a falta de legendas PTBR e tambem a falta de dublagem PTBR
E o pior de todos é que o jogo tinha tudo pra ser show de bola com partidas em grupo e tal, mas infelizmente o jogo é SOLO, nao tem como voce formar aquele duo ou clã com seus amigos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092468636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2845, 'last_played': 1678076791}
review:
There's a lot of people that have a lot to complain about with this game.

And yes, it absolutely has it's problems.

But it's a beautiful game, the world is this absolutely lovely mix of fantasy and science fiction, which makes me want to dig into it more and more with each hour I spend playing it.

The American server is sadly under populated, which does make doing some things very difficult, and there have absolutely been changes to the game lately that leave a sour taste in the mouth.

All in all, I think it's worth playing, maybe not as a hard core player, but if you have some friends and some time to kill and you want to hang out and play with them, this isn't a bad place to do that.

From everything I've seen, the game doesn't feel like it's meant for hard core players either. Casual players will find plenty of fun to be had in between other things. It's great if you only have 30 min to an hour to play, and there's plenty of fun to be had with all the classes, though building up to those classes is certainly a grind.


My final take on it is that it is enjoyable, but should be enjoyed with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064496726', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1618270026}
review:
When you don't follow conventions you need to very clearly state the differences up front.
For example, there is NO character deletion. There is appearance modification, but NO name change.
Many people who are just trying out a game might make a "throwaway" character to run the tutorial and basically not put too much thought into it, like name or whatever. In pretty much every other game you can delete the character and start over.
But not here. You can't delete your account. You can't delete your character. You can't rename your character.
