author: {'steamid': '76561198199029249', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 197754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158746, 'last_played': 1615617809}
review:
List of known skyforge bugs:
1. Easily get stuck in every wall
2. sometimes cant dash
3. sometimes cameras is lower then it should be
4. sometimes the entire differnt sections of the abaities tab is missing
5. sometimes the sound stops working and often starts again fragmented and amplified
6. using soundweaver untimate and guds authority completely distorts the screen, sometimes keeping it that way
7. chat often takes a long time to load
8. using the witch/warlock "transformaion" on gods compltely compressed them into a disformed figure
9. almost every invisible wall is able to be jumped over
10. going into a 1v1 can allow players to access "unplayable areas" as it will bypass the deathwall that says "you have left the playable area"
11. some animations when the necromancer uses its left clicks are the wrong animation, sometimes throwing off the player on which attack will come next in the combo
12. using a taunt while jumping will contunue to use said taunt while moving around
13. using a mount/taunt that has a delayed animation (bat transformation, witch broom mount, spider legs mount etc.) while jumping can freeze the player in said position
14. when timed out and kickd from the game, it is always impossible to press start to rejoin, the game must be restarted
15. when joining skyforge, if start isent pressed and enough time passes, you cannot press start to begin the game, a restart is required
16. sometimes you can dash off edges, causing the player to levatate in the air briefly, this can somewhat be exploited to dash in the air for a long time to reach impossible place
17. when starting a mission while another player i joining the group can cause the joining player to not be in the mission but also be in the group
18. sometimes when using invulnerabality to avoid a lengthy stun it can cause said boss to display wrong or cause the player to display wrong
19. the second boss in mantide caves can be skipped if you bring the boss to the invisible wall, the boss can then push you through the wall
20. sometimes it is impossible to sell items
21. sometimes the elite near the last boss will respawn or "reset" for no reason
22. sometimes on toxic wasteland near the laste phase of the mission the progress will be stuck on "retrieve secret data [1/2]"
23. often times while interacting with a object in combat the player is interrupted for reason "interrupted by movement" while the player is compeltely still, this bug tends to happen
while dashing then interact with said object
24. If one person activates the light drone in akonidas avatar right before teleporting to the before boss chamber, said light drone can follow the team down to the boss fight and kill everyone
25. the revenaut c and gunners 3 abality can possibly be used to get out of bounds
26. the shift + z toggle can be kept up by pressing shift + z, k, then esc
27. some cosmedics that have their own physics do not display as smoothly as intended when combined with other cosmedics with custom player animations example: skeleton costume and 
cuttrought cloak
28. the character tab always has a ! over it at all times while no new content can be found
29. sometimes while trying to use a finishing attack it will instead pull out the divine weapon if it is avaliable
30. some of the mines in toxic wasteland are undetectable
31. sometimes a mount cannot fit through a certain space while other times it can, this is most noticeable in regions
32. while the characters hold some weapons ( revenaut phytonite axe ) it can be seen that the characters fingers phase into the weapon
33. sometimes it is impossible to type in group chat/ custom chats
34. sometimes when targeting enemies the "path wont be found" even if there is direct line of sight, causeing players not be avaliable to attack the unit
35. when using the bezerker 2 abality on machavann or machavann aspects the player can become stuck inside the boss, unable to escape
36. when leaveing groups, sometimes the group memebers can still be visible, and createing new groups and starting missions becomes impossible for reason " invalid number of players"
37. sometimes the firestarter will be stuck looking like its cat form, and will move slow and be unable to dash, the cat form is the side of the mount, not the normal size
38. during the winter scateing race sometimes teh camera dont turn and the player will fall off the map
39. sometimes when skateing on the winter event the player can fall off and not repsawn back on the track
40. after the prothous fight in the oceanid avatar fight if the player is holding a weapon they wont be riding a khelp in the next scene
41. sometimes the character dashes in the completely wrong direction
42. sometimes the characters has the wrong class animations

These are just a couple of bugs i can remember off the top of my head, there area PLENTY more that i cant specifically remember but surely will run into again just because this game is so unbelieveably unstable
developer_response:
Thanks for taking the time to put this list together, we will take a look over it.

Many current known issues are mentioned in our weekly patch notes and updates: https://sf.my.games/en/patchnotes

If you do notice any bugs, please be sure to report them including as much detail as possible to our support team so we can have them investigated. https://support.my.games/sf_int

author: {'steamid': '76561198085192613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1599694122}
review:
Okay, this is my reason for not recommending this game. It may sound cheesy, but Support totally sucks:

I didn't even get to play one minute, as after installing, it loads on the wrong screen. I run multiple screens and the game did not load onto my default screen. Unfortunately, Windows sucks compared to Linux where you can rt click on the tab on the task bar and choose which screen you want to run it on. I saw no settings before the game loads to choose a screen.

I tried contacting support, but they automatically want a screenshot before they will even open a ticket. How the !*%$ do you take a screenshot of something not being loaded on the correct screen? So, it's a dump for me. If support sucks, then that tells me the product sucks.



Edit: One of the developers commented within hours of posting this review:


[EN-CM] Skoll  [developer] Posted: Sep 10 @ 6:55am
Hello, sorry to hear about this issue, we will be happy to take a look into it with you and investigate further.

If you are having problems creating a ticket without a screenshot you can use this link and just tick screenshot "attached" with out adding one.

https://support.my.games/sf_int/tech/138/newticket

Apologies for any confusion.


So, I did as instructed. Yep, I still haven't heard back from anyone. Nice try though. So for now, I still stand behind my review. The game is still completely useless to me.
developer_response:
Hello, sorry to hear about this issue, we will be happy to take a look into it with you and investigate further.

If you are having problems creating a ticket without a screenshot you can use this link and just tick screenshot "attached" with out adding one.

https://support.my.games/sf_int/tech/138/newticket

Apologies for any confusion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144760941', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1597372582}
review:
TL:DR - If you wan't a crazy Godlike power fantasy, just play Warframe.

Pros: 
-Looks good
-Plays good
that's about it

Cons:
You either have played since day 1 or don't bother

If you're a returning player that hasn't gone too far don't bother coming back since the scaling system is abhorrent

-Your first run, AKA the tutorial, will be enjoyable enough because you can actually fight groups of enemies without much hassle. The scaling will then be bloated absolutely out of the zone of playability.
-Most 'guide' videos you'll find online are either outdated or about to be outdated
-The OFFICIAL game discord is basically Dead while having thousands of users, don't bother asking anyone for help. You won't be given much
-There is a dedicated Party finder for Dungeons/Events which literally nobody uses forcing you to go to the HUB area, ask and hope that people join you on your Low level Dungeon which you can't Solo since you're outscaled by the tiniest most insignificant mobs
-The extent of help you'll receive is this: ''Oi mate, so uh yeah I know I've been playing this for years but I can't be bothered to really help you in this dungeon BUT what you can do is login everyday at a certain hour and queue for PVP, cheers.''
-Ah yes, PVP the one place where you fight Veterans who outscale you easily, the one gamemode which you MUST do if you want to progress and potentially unlock other classes.
-Oh and uh, you wanna play a specific class? Too bad! People will literally flame you for wanting to play a specific class, will tell you to play 1 of 3 classes that are currently META and as a cherry to the cake, if you REALLY are stubborn enough to play a class that's not META that you Enjoy, get ready to spend actual Money for their equipments.

Horrible P2W, Horrible beginner experience. If you really wanna give this a go, go ahead and play the 5-10 hours it'll take you to finish the ''Tutorial''

I enjoy the story line immensely. This is a good game to play to relax and work through a map or hit up some squads. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100002739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1596412346}
review:
New players beware: Here's something you can feel.

I've playing this game outside of steam but felt the need to review it here, why? Because I'm being punished for being a new player.

How the fudge is that even possible? Well, as soon as you complete the glorified tutorial that they call the first run through the whole map you are trown in a situation where you suddenly can't do anything you could just a few minutes before just because the scaling is so broken it's not even a bad joke.
You have low stats with a high number they call "rank" attached to your character, its like when you play a game and it says you're level 50 but you only have stats, hp, damage and skills of a level 1 character, making it absolutelly meaningless.

There is what they call a "catch up system" which is nothing more than consumables that speed you through the grind everyone else have already done, but they're attached to daily quests on the content you were doing before but cannot complete anymore because they're scaled to the level of a veteran player instead and you have to deal with the scaling I already talked about, making you stuck unless you have help from the stronger veteran players.

Since I started on the daily quests, they're called directives, which will send you to a place in the game, be it a dungeon, trial, mission or invasion mission, sometimes you get something achieavable as a new player, most of the times not because you're on your own with no experience, no power of your own and literally having to beg to the stronger players to carry you through most if not all of them.

But wait, THERE IS MORE! You have the wonderful God form, making you all mighty, poweful aaaaand its really dependant on having  unlocked a lot of stuff that requires the catch up to properly work, otherwise its just a glorified "get big character" button.

As a cherry on top, the game's systems get's revamped, changed and reworked so often there is little to no useful information online, save for a few times where youtube can barely help and unless someone knows what you have to do and is willing to give you the information, you're stuck trying to find it on your own.

Oh, but you're a new player and there are public places where you can go help to.. nope, there are places where as a low level player you're a hinderance and instead of helping you get in the way just by being a new player because you buff the enemies making them stronger and harder to kill for the veterans, basicly punishing everyone with your existence because you're supposed to get stronger before going to certain places, but to get strong you NEED to go to those places to do what you have to do, doesn't it sound contraditory enough?

You can cry Pay to win, lack of ballance,unfair pricing and monetization that favor whales, excessive grind to unlock anything, but none of those are the real problems of this game, The real culpriy for the failiure they call "game" here is the  nonsencical contraditory design that punishes you for not being strong enough while doing all it can to stop you from trying to get strong simply because you're not strong already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065709045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 17190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16024, 'last_played': 1604927315}
review: A questão de ser free não quer dizer que seja tudo de graça , realmente gosto deste jogo mas não gosto de como a forma que a empresa esteja planejando o seu objetivo como por exemplo de faturar alguma grana a mais do que realmente precisa desfazendo dos players que estão gastando não só o seu dinheiro mas seu tempo para alcançar certo nível no skyforge por exemplo: no pvp o nivel ainda é desbalanceado, existem alguns players que são fortes o suficiente pra levar uma grupo inteiro sem cair em quase todos enfrentamentos, então pra alcançar os players mais fortes ou desafios mais altos ainda está muito difícil e demorado embora não seja impossível alcançar, mas a empresa acaba aproveitando disso para que os players fiquem com sede de chegar mais rápido pra enfrentar alguém mais forte ou um desafio mais alto para poder ficar no topo que gastam seu dinheiro para obter privilégios para encurtar mais o caminho que levaria muito tempo. Pela minha opinião nunca houve vendas de armas lendárias no skyforge e nem era vendido packs para liberar classes, há um tempo atrás os players liberavam quase tudo dentro do game , sem falar da questão de que me sinto obrigado a comprar victor medal é outra moeda no jogo que pela minha opinião não deveria existir. Não estou reclamando do game mas das coisas que a empresa fez e tem feito visando o lucro simplesmente, por isso digo de antemão podem até recomendar o skyforge por ser um ótimo jogo, mas tem muita coisa que precisam fazer para não prejudicar os players quem está jogando todos os dias e gastando seu dinheiro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052231863', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1619885645}
review:
Côté gameplay je trouve qu'il ne s'explique pas assez malgré mes nombreuses heures de jeu (hors Steam). Même en étant gratuit, je trouve que le farm est vraiment trop présent : les classes coûtent trop chères en points que l'on gagne en petite quantité. Les quêtes de classes ne requiert seulement de tuer des monstres, rien de plus éducatif.

Gros point noir sur le fait que l'on ne peut pas changer de forme divine ainsi que ses recolors après l'avoir choisi alors que l'on peut changer sa forme normale (contre argent réelle même pour changer de coupe de cheveux) et que l'on a accès à BEAUCOUP de vêtements.

Ce jeu a donc un énorme potentiel pour le Jeu-de-Rôle, mais une bonne moitié des vêtements requiert de l'argent réel.
Visuellement : c'est une pépite, rien à redire. L'histoire est très intéressante aussi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198756847402', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1598127157}
review:
En casa nos encanta la pasta, es simplemente escuchar pasta y ponernos a salivar y a pensar en cuantas combinaciones se pueden preparar y a cual más rica. Con la pasta se puede innovar hasta donde se quiera y eso me encanta pero reconozco que cuando pienso en las recetas más clásicas siempre me apetece prepararlas, como la de hoy.

Prepara con nuestra receta unos deliciosos espaghetti a la boloñesa, sin duda una receta de pasta para triunfar y que suele gustar a todo el mundo. Es una auténtica maravilla la combinación de un sofrito de verduras, carne picada de buena calidad y la salsa de tomate, además de hierbas y especias que le dan el toque definitivo y lo mejor de todo, lo fácil que es de preparar.

Y es que no solo con spaghetti, la salsa boloñesa es de lo más versátil y por eso me encanta preparar una gran cantidad para congelarla en porciones y tenerla siempre disponible ya que se puede utilizar en multitud de recetas como por ejemplo para elaborar unos champiñones rellenos al horno, cocinar berenjenas rellenas de carne picada al microondas o lanzarte a la cocina internacional y preparar una sabrosa musaka o moussaka griega o una pizza calzone casera con salsa boloñesa y verduras.

Si te encanta la pasta vas a disfrutar con nuestra selección de recetas de pasta, entre las que se encuentra otra muy similar a ésta, los rigatoni con salsa boloñesa, además de otras tan populares como la lasaña de carne a la boloñesa, la lasaña de verduras, los macarrones al horno gratinados, los clásicos espaguetis a la carbonara (y la versión no tradicional de espaguetis a la carbonara con nata), los macarrones con salsa roquefort, los espaguetis con gambas, la pasta Alfredo con su famosa Salsa, los canelones de carne picada con pasta fresca y una receta muy especial con salsa casera, los tagliatelle con salsa pesto. Incluso puedes aprender cómo elaborar tu propia pasta fresca en casa y mi receta más especial, los macarrones de Escándalo con bechamel de mostaza y queso, ¡deliciosos!

 

Ingredientes para preparar la receta de spaghetti a la boloñesa (4 personas):
400 gr de spaghetti. Una ración puede ir entre 80 y 120 gr por persona, según gustos y si es plato único o no en tu menú.
300 gr de carne picada (100 de magro de cerdo y 200 de babilla de ternera). La mejor carne picada es la que tú eliges en la carnicería y te la pican en el momento, olvídate de las que ya están envasadas.
1 zanahoria.
1 cebolla.
100 ml de vino blanco.
200 gr de salsa de tomate o tomate frito. Pero si te gusta con más proporción de salsa puedes incluso duplicar la cantidad de salsa de tomate.
50 ml de leche.
Orégano.
Unas hojas de albahaca para decorar.
Aceite de oliva, sal y pimienta negra recién molida.
 

Preparación, cómo hacer spaghetti a la boloñesa:
Para empezar a preparar la salsa boloñesa primero pela la cebolla y pícala bien finita.
Pela la zanahoria con ayuda de un pelapatatas, córtala por en medio y pícala fina al igual que has hecho con la cebolla.
Para cocinar la salsa te recomiendo utilizar una olla porque, además de cocinar en ella la salsa, me gusta añadir la pasta al final para mezclarlo todo junto ahí y poder servirla directamente en los platos de los comensales.
En la olla echa un poco de aceite y ponla a fuego medio-suave. Cuando el aceite esté caliente incorpora la cebolla y la zanahoria junto con un poco de sal y cocínalas durante unos 10 minutos o hasta que estén tiernas. La idea es que apenas se doren así que si eso ocurre y todavía no están tiernas, baja la temperatura del fuego. Si se te va un poco de las manos y se están dorando demasiado o quemando siempre puedes, además de bajar el fuego, echar un poco de agua.
Sofrito de verduras para salsa bolonesa
PREPARAMOS EL SOFRITO DE VERDURAS PARA LA SALSA BOLOÑESA

Añade la carne picada, mézclala con el resto de ingredientes y ayúdate de una espátula para ir separándola y que no quede pegada en trozos grandes. Échale sal, pimienta negra recién molida y orégano al gusto.
Cuando la carne deje de estar rosada sube el fuego para que esté alto, añade el vino blanco y espera a que se evapore el alcohol, tardará solamente 2-3 minutos.
Baja el fuego para que esté suave e incorpora la salsa de tomate y la leche y déjalo cocer todo durante 20 minutos para que los sabores se fusionen y la carne quede tierna. Si conforme avanza la cocción quieres añadirle más salsa de tomate no hay problema en echársela en el momento que prefieras. Y cuando ya la tengas lista no te olvides de probarla por si hay que rectificarla de sal o añadirle más orégano o pimienta.
Salsa bolonesa casera
SALSA BOLOÑESA CASERA

Cuando ya casi esté lista la salsa boloñesa puedes ponerte a preparar la pasta. Pon abundante agua a cocer en una olla a fuego fuerte.
Cuando hierva el agua echa una cucharadita de postre de sal y los spaghetti, y en cuanto hierva el agua de nuevo (tardará muy poco) empieza a contar los minutos que indique el paquete. En mi caso han sido 8 minutos.
Spaguetti cocidos
COCEMOS LOS SPAGHETTI EN ABUNDANTE AGUA HIRVIENDO

Cuando los spaghetti estén listos échalos sobre un escurridor en el fregadero para que suelten el agua.
Incorpora los spaghetti a la olla de la salsa boloñesa con el fuego ya apagado, mézclalo todo bien y ya los tienes listos.
 

Tiempo: 1 hora
Dificultad: fácil
 

Sirve y degusta:
Estos espaghetti a la boloñesa pueden prepararse justo antes de servirlos pero también el día de antes e incluso con algún día más de antelación ya que aguantan fenomenal 3-4 días en la nevera y, al menos a mi me lo parece, si están reposados están aún más sabrosos. Eso si, que lleguen a la mesa bien calientes así que para ello nada mejor que encender un poco el fuego a temperatura media-baja y que se calienten los espaghetti con la salsa boloñesa.

Sírvelos en los platos de los comensales y decora con unas hojitas de albahaca fresca aunque también puedes espolvorear más orégano seco o pimienta negra recién molida por encima. Por supuesto también les va genial un poco de queso rallado por encima como el parmesano o el grana padano. Es un platazo de pasta de auténtico… ¡escándalo!

Receta de spaguetti a la bolonesa para triunfar
SPAGHETTI A LA BOLOÑESA, UNA RECETA DE PASTA PARA TRIUNFAR

 

Variantes de la receta de spaghetti a la boloñesa:
Si prefieres optar por un sabor más natural puedes utilizar tomate triturado e incluso tomate tamizado que ya venden en conserva y que no tiene ni pieles ni pepitas. Todo depende de si te gusta con grumos o, por el contrario, prefieres una textura más líquida y homogénea.

Te animo a que adaptes el sofrito a tu gusto e incluso que lo vayas cambiando en cada ocasión para descubrir nuevos matices. Unos ajos cocinados junto a la cebolla y la zanahoria les van fenomenal, al igual que un poco de guindilla para darle un puntito picante e incluso añadir especias como comino o el curry para obtener un sabor diferente.

 

Consejos:
Lo de la «pasta al dente» no es ni más ni menos que no sobrecocer la pasta. De forma general estamos acostumbrados en España a consumir la pasta un punto más cocida que en Italia pero, sobre todo cuando después se va a mezclar durante unos minutos con alguna salsa caliente o similar, procura cocerla los minutos que indica el paquete y no más porque con la salsa se ablandará todavía un poco más.

Yo suelo preparar una gran cantidad de salsa boloñesa y la congelo en porciones. De esta forma puedo tener en cualquier momento un plato de pasta de lo más completo y elaborado simplemente descongelando la salsa y cociendo pasta del tipo que sea.

review:
Summary:  I played this in Beta years ago.  It popped up so I thought I'd try it.  Large changes have been made.  Eventually, I felt I had nothing to do so I just would log off.  I didn't get to end game, but I wasn't really motivated to do so.

Review:  It seemed OK at first, but then my progress was halted because I wasn't strong enough to beat the dungeon several levels above me.  Searching for a party yielded nothing.  The only way to get stronger is to get more followers, conduct research or upgrade your stronghold.  These activities are basically limited each day and only take maybe 20 minutes to do.  After that there is no motivation to even grid for money.  Gear only drops or is in the cash shop... yes it is pay to win.  

The progression system was drastically changed from the early days.  It used to be a node system where you would plot a course to unlock new classes, etc.  Now classes, except for the initial three, are pretty much locked behind a pay wall.  That said, I did receive one other class for free.  I'm not aware if others unlock for free.  The game makes no mention of it.  

Another thing that bugged me was that, as a god, you receive a "Hall of Followers", basically your church.  It used to be an actual place you could go.  It had a statue of your character and your followers that are applying to be Adepts.  You could select a few Adepts and send them on missions.  They had their own characteristics, abilities and artifacts they could use.  It made the "god" theme more plausible.  Without it, to me, it seems immersion breaking.  

The combat did seem to be better than what i remember.

Basic game info:
Character creator:  5/10.  Moderate amount of options available.  No library or way to save a character appearance.
Appearance options: 3/10.  Fixed full outfits with set color patterns available.
Graphics:  Static is good but animation is about fair.
World (Open/instance): instances with quests.  Some areas are linear dungeons, others are larger areas that could have many players.
Targeting: action - mouse aimed with targets snapped onto enabling use of skills.  
Adversaries: PvE but consentual PvP available in skirmishes that are 5x5, 10x10, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215447905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1595287366}
review: O jogo é promissor, bons gráficos, 18 classes, jogabilidade é boa. O problema está em não conseguir jogar com os amigos até terminar a campanha, assim até dá, porém somente em mapas que foi concluído no modo solo. Então você fica de mais de 10 horas de jogo, jogando sozinho. Desisti do jogo justamente por isso, queria jogar com os amigos e não dava. Estou com 11 horas de jogo e ainda não terminei a campanha, fora que agora as missões da campanha estão mais difíceis, e mais demoradas. E tem o p2w ainda!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095826013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1594638830}
review:
If you have ANY friend to play with you - STOP right here, search another game, ANY other multiplayer game. 
This is a single player game disguised as a multiplayer. You can ONLY play missions with a friend if any of you have already done it before. You CAN play side maps with your friends, but even tho you are in a GROUP your quests WILL COUNT INDIVIDUALLY AND NOT IN A GROUP!
Its funny
Its really funny how the developers can make such a cool looking game, with fun combat, implement multiplayer and COMPLETELY RUIN THE EXPERIENCE.
How dumb must you be to not let players discover new missions together? There are countless games on the market that has group cutscenes and group main storylines with no problem.
Skyforge is a SINGLE player that happens to let you see your friends, and pretend you are doing sh1t together

author: {'steamid': '76561198118998372', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1594607129}
review:
o jogo e bom tem grande potencial, ótimos gráficos, gameplay envolvente, várias classes únicas e diferente uma das outras, um história ok, e vários outros pontos positivos, 
porem tudo isso não adianta sem o matchmaking funcionando, pois esta  desativado pra tudo,( exceto em horários específico so para o pvp ), 
 tendo que busca ajuda de pessoas mais forte para te carregar em mapa de modo história pq o matchmaking não  coloca vc em um time para fazer, atualmente o jogo funciona por temporadas onde a cada temporada a dificuldade  sobe, ate mesmo nos mapas tutoriais onde os novatos começa,  fazendo assim  quase impossível   deles sair de la, e impossibilitando a entrada de novos jogadores

author: {'steamid': '76561198290916002', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2433, 'last_played': 1657995377}
review: I want to give this game a thumbs up, but their decisions make it an absolute no. The fact that you can't group with friends until later in the game( In an MMO, this is a huge no)  Then the fact that they like to bandwagon with what seems to be popular, even if it may not fit the original design of the game.. All issues point towards them being more money hungry than caring if you actually play the game. I would have enjoyed the game  thoroughly if they'd just have fixed these issues, I had high hopes for it early on, when you could actually group up with friends for your missions, but for whatever reason they chose to remove that function and force you to solo your way through the "Story" if you can even call it that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999538087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2205, 'last_played': 1594443676}
review: This game is the worst MMO I've ever tried... Don't get me wrong, it has alot of potentiel, gameplay and graphics are good... But it is a straight rip off & pure Pay to win. They put it in your face all the time, it's a fake mmo there is no world to explore, just a map, with things you can go to, gated quests & pvp, the quests are the most linear and repetitive I've ever done in my life, sometimes you go to ''zones'' but nothing to explore at all, you just go braindead from one circle to another killing packs of enemies & it feels worthless, there is no magic in it. The items are really boring and not interesting, they are all the same with useless stats. There is 0 character customization, no possibility to choose your stats, abilities etc, you just... unlock them, it is really annoying, there is no depth in the progression of your character and it feels even more frustrating with the ''ranks'' because you don't really feel like you're leveling at all. Like I said, it is a fake mmo that plays like a mobile game more then anything else, they just made it pretty to lure people in. It's a horrible game not worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561199065674110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1603904345}
review:
Very fun game, simple and easy to play. I was hesitant to get it as I broke my wrist and had surgery. However, this game is perfect for me right now. I'm in a removable cast so I am able to take it off a few times a day and lightly use my wrist. So now this game is part of my Physical Therapy. 

There is such an abundance of classes that you can unlock I can't wait to try a few more. My favorites are Outlaw and Soundweaver right now. It is a great game to play solo, or with a friend. My older brother and I play together. I'm 28 years old and really enjoy this game, if you are on the edge about it I really think you should just give it a try.    

The story is actually a lot of fun it's not one of those run back and forth games, in the free roam areas there are multiple quest lines you can follow. My brother and I playing together for two hours we didn't even half finish a free roam area, but did multiple quests

review: 游戏是好玩。但是就是没有中文。没简体中文的话，来个。繁体中文也行啊！是没错人，英文我只能看懂一点点。一点点。只能看懂。能不能搞个简体中文？不能搞简体中文搞个。繁体中文也行。找个繁体中文也行啊。这个游戏特别坑爹的一点。猪猪，他下的是客户端。不是。游戏的主体。他要从客户端里面下游戏的主体。真麻烦呢。特别是网速贼他妈慢。贼烦。这到底是啥设定。都出了三年多了。你们真是抠门。来一个繁体中文也行啊。真是太抠了。咱能给我来个繁体中文补丁。我不需要你准备游戏汉化完全，我只需要看懂这个组见面就行了。游戏的主界面，特别是对话选一下。看不懂，所以乱选。我稍微能看懂一点点。鉴于主见面，主界面的英文我能看得懂。游戏里面的，因为我看不懂。

author: {'steamid': '76561198028262189', 'num_games_owned': 1089, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 2367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2154, 'last_played': 1594115902}
review:
This MMORPG has the worst progression system I've ever seen!
No matter how much you farm there is no exp only gear drops with very bad drop rates.
I've reached a point in the storyline where I am rank 40 and must try to pass rank 45 missions with mobs that become harder than bosses because the rank system gives you 50% less dmg and armour vs higher rank mobs.
That is really bad because the combat, class system and style customization are actually good.
Don't spend any money in a F2P game that blocks your game progress in the worst way possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152313026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1609648194}
review:
I broke the game by trying to install it on a drive not called C:  . Had to delete it from library and start over.

Edit: Originally I had this game as Not recommended, but I think that was just annoyance at the persnickety coding that required it to be installed on C: and not D:, and this was after it wouldn't let me log into Skyforge (non steam account)  so I had to start from nothing again and delete the non-steam skyforge. I, as a default select d: for bigger files and in doing so it caught me in a loop where I had to tell steam I no longer wanted Skyforge in my library altogether in order to reassign the installation destination  it to c: drive. Annoying, but not worth trashing the game rating over. Also I got a response from a developer within 24 hours on my review, which definitely impressed me.

On to my opinion of the actual, functional, installed game. It's really fun. It does have some freemium elements but I personally don't find it onerous to not pay and given the quality of gameplay I'm ok with paying a little for the Premium membership. I played this game either early in its launch or when it was in beta years ago and the strides this game has made is impressive. There are something like 18 classes (you will need to do a little grinding for them, tbh). the combat plays similar to Black Desert Online but also responds to tab targeting in some circumstances.  I got the free Outlaw class DLC from steam and I'm currently catching up to the nonsteam account at a very fast pace :)
developer_response:
Hey sorry to hear about this issue, could we ask that you reach out to our support team please and let them know what happened so we can investigate further.

https://support.my.games/sf_int/tech/138/newticket

review:

I was so happy to get my "god" mode, then verry disappointed because except for the look all the rest stays. It's like playing with the same character but with an other costume.

The only target is to try to unblock the other characters..... by farming or paying, but farming solo is impossible so we are stuck.

review: The scaling is soo far off, you can get killed by a single mob which are usually in groups.   Imagine playing wow as a level 100 and getting killed by a rat, never mind theirs a pack with a captain, it takes only one or two.  You die after focusing on killing one of them, then they respawn to a full group.  Used to be awesome, but now, move on unless you want to be carried which means standing around looking for a group.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007656506', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1638977293}
review:
O jogo é razoavel, mas apresenta diversos problemas.
Na 1º vez que instalei joguei normalmente, até ficar preso em um mapa após finaliza-lo e não conseguir sair, sem suporte, depois de 1 semana desinstalei.
Na 2º vez que instalei, tive outro problema, como uso 2 monitores, o jogo abriu no meu monitor secundario, quando mudei na configuração para o principal, ficou fora da resolução, e perdi a possibilidade de acesso aos botões pra acertar. 
Trabalho demais pela possibilidade de testar o jogo, teria que pesquisar em sites em ingles por uma solução ou teria que apagar tudo e reinstalar novamente (copiar os 20gb de novo).

Boa sorte pra quem tem paciencia de ficar acertando jogo pra fazer funcionar, eu estou fora

author: {'steamid': '76561198076660571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4426, 'last_played': 1596227194}
review: When I first played this when it came out, I never made it to god level.  It was extremely difficult/challenging.  I came back to the game a year or two later and found that they changed the way progressing in the game worked.  Until you become a junior god, it is less defeatist in zones.  I didn't get frustrated as I did before being killed over and over.  I was able to progress and level without feeling defeated at every turn.  After hitting junior god, the game became challenging, but still tolerable in progression.  Just wish the "looking for group" was used, and I wasn't forced to join a pantheon, but after I did, it isn't too bad.  Hitting "end level" or senior god requires teaming to get the resources to level, but if you find the right pantheon to help, it isn't bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198869152026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 15317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1707182870}
review: Gosto do game, as classes são muito bem feitas e divertidas de jogar, os gráficos são realmente bons para um jogo gratuito como o Skyforge. Mas pela parte negativa, depois que se completa as missões da província, voce é obrigado a jogar em partidas online sendo carregado pelos players mais fortes, e pegar os itens do chão. Ainda tem vários bugs que não concertam, não consigo mais entrar no game por causa de uma parada de ''verificando arquivos'', o tempo inteiro isso, e nunca entra no jogo (não sei se mais gente tá com esse problema ou se é o meu PC que tá assim). Queria que resolvessem os erros, por que é um dos meus mmos favoritos, e gostaria que continuasse sendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004396105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1886, 'last_played': 1592755533}
review:
Also das Spiel ist der größte Bullshit, den ich in 15 Jahren MMORPG jemals gesehen habe. So ein einsteigerunfreundlicher Dreck ist mir noch nie unter die Augen gekommen. Da quälst dich zum Junior-God, legst Items an (joa, man will ja auch stärker werden nicht?) - und was macht das Game? Genau, skaliert dann den Schwierigkeitsgrad ins Unermessliche. Wir reden hier nicht von Dark Souls Style. Wir reden hier von absolut unschaffbar, weil Mobs dich komplett zerf****. Du brauchst also irgendwelche Leute, die sich erbarmen dich zu carryen. Allerdings ist auch das bei einer Community, die wenige hundert Leute umfasst und auch wiederum zu Anfängern einfach nur ekelhaft ist, unmöglich. Groupfinder? Geht nicht. Logo. Spiel ist ja auch erst seit kurzem draußen, Kappa. 

Kein Wunder, dass diesen Mist kein Mensch spielt.

review: Ogólnie jest ok, nie ma się za bardzo do czego przyczepić. Można narzekać, że questy mają mylące opisy lub wręcz ich nie mają i trzeba szukać po internetach, co właściwie trzeba zrobić. Można narzekać, że rozstaw klawiszy dla skilli w walce jest debilny bo gdzie numeryczne skille a gdzie "c" "v" itp i jak walczysz, to średnio chcesz szukać odpowiedniego przycisku na klawiaturze, można i ponarzekać, że dialogi zrywa i średnio fajnie to wygląda. Ale wg mnie to są pierdoły i można z tym żyć i grać i jeszcze nawet mieć trochę przyjemności. P.S. Jestem typowym użyszkodnikiem i nie majtałam w ustawieniach gry, poza zmianą klawiszy pod questy czy otwieraniem inventory. Zostałam skrzywdzona przez wowa za młodu i nie wyobrażam sobie szukania ekwipunku gdzie indziej niż pod "b". Wszystkim, których zachęcił mój komentarz, życzę miłej gry. Hek.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963472189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1591588524}
review:
I really want to like the game but it feels only half done and is not very enjoyable to play past the first couple days. I think the biggest challenge is it doesn't feel like you have any real choices. Your only choice is to just do the content in the order laid out by the game Dev's and you cannot modify you character in any meaningful way to make it different than another players character. There doesn't seem to be any sort of consequences or benefits for anything you do for what you can choose.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[b]Look & Feel[/b] - Game looks great and you have an amazing amount of character look customization. Good voice acting and smooth/reactive  play control. I love the special effects as well.
[b]Environment[/b] - Maps are beautiful and have a great atmosphere both in combat and non-combat areas.
[b]Community[/b] - Community is small but very helpful. The only downside is everyone on the game appears to be top tier veterans that i can't really interact with in game since i just started and am low level. Very few new players on the game. so i have only been able to solo and have not been able to party in an instance with anyone yet.
[b]Indicators[/b] - It is clear where the game wants you to go without throwing it in your face.

[h1]Cons[/h1] 
[b]Tutorials and Menus[/b] - The menus are not intuitive and are disjointed. Reminder to game Devlopers that players do not want tutorials! we just want intuitive and well designed interfaces that make sense! Because the menus are unclear it makes it difficult to really understand what we should be doing at a high level when you get to the city of the gods. I also had trouble trying to access my sidekick/pet and mount. If half the energy that was used for tutorials was instead used for the menu design the tutorials would not be needed.
[b]Key Binding[/b] - Certain commands cant be bound to certain keys and mouse buttons which is frustrating. I want to have move forward be bound to my mouse right click but the game prevents it!
[b]Boring Linear Game Play[/b] - The game play is far too linear. You can't choose which area to go to when.. everything is gated and you have to do it in a way that follows a pre-set story instead of being an open world. All the game activities are grindy as opposed to having non-combat related optional diversions like in other games such as crafting gear/items, fishing, harvesting, cooking, etc like in almost all mmorpg's.
[b]Character Diversification[/b] - All the characters are identical clones of each other. The only two things that matter are gear (which appears to be an automatic drop) and a high level things like might. The gear does not have random stats, you do not have skill points that make your character unique, there is no significant gear or character choices. Basically everyone gets the same gear and there are no penalties for dumb choices. Anything that actually does give you bonuses such as might is very hard to level as well.

[h1]Other Thoughts[/h1] 
[b]Story concept[/b] - it is great but some story-line is not believable especially with the situation of how you are a god/goddess and you destroy all the enemies but get knocked out easily early on. Great cinematic cut scenes with the listeners characters body language, and good camera angles helps but the story line feels very synthetic/forced. NPC's have depth though which makes it more engaging.
[b]Classes[/b] - I do like the idea how your character can have different skill sets but I don't like the actual execution of the classes system or how you swap between them. 
[b]NPCs and Map Depth[/b] I would like to see more NPC's and/or things we can interact with in a meaningful way so we can explore more as opposed to just going from point A to B. The non-combat areas are huge and great looking but also there are very few characters and things we can interact with which means lots of dead time traveling between areas instead of utilizing the space for something interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987876566', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 18362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11519, 'last_played': 1594201117}
review:
[i]TL:DR - WhaleForge has heavy pay2win mechanics with Legendary weapons being sold for IRL currency as well as half of the season challenge rewards being behind a “season pass”, premium currency is presented as a method to bypass grindwalls.[/i]

Skyforge has been out for a number of years and the game now is quite different that when it was originally released with a vastly shortened main campaign and a total overhaul on how classes are unlocked being two of the most notable changes since release.

The premium currency (Argents) can be used to purchase cosmetic costumes, buy “Victor’s Medals” which in turn are used for a great many powerful unlocks, purchase ‘stimulants’ which increase the quality of the rewards from Directive missions.

Argents and Victor’s Medals can be acquired in the game in limited quantities, but the gameplay balance pushes the player towards purchased power as the game’s difficulty scaling can be quite brutal at times, most notably when the player first acquires their “god form” and the beginning of new invasions.

Balance between the various classes is laughable, with clear favour being given to the newer classes that cost more class sparks to unlock (an attempt to encourage the player to just spend Argents to gain access to the class).

Combat is a hybrid between tab and aim combat that is reasonably comfortable to use, though naturally lacks the granularity of target acquisition that tab targeting can present and occasionally results in sticky aiming that a true aimed targeting system wouldn’t suffer from. The classes revolve mainly around the traditional concepts of tank and DPS, with support having minimal healing capability and instead focusing on buffing and shields.

The scaling system needs comment in that while it will scale the player’s ‘Rank’ (and therefore their HP and damage) up and down relative to the intended rank of the content, there is a noticeable discontinuity if you compare the difficulty of zones where you are scaled to below Rank 100 to zones where you are being scaled up to the current season’s cap with enemies getting several times more difficult, resulting in a jarring experience for the new player.

The implementation of a dungeon finder system is fairly primitive and outside of the PvP queues is rarely used by the playerbase. This has given rise to many players congregating in a hub area and using that region’s chat to advertise for groups, with at least one unofficial group-finding chat channel being formed by enterprising players looking for a better solution.

The community is mostly friendly enough, but like any online game you will encounter toxic elements and the lack of an easy in-game reporting function can be seen as a detriment. Thankfully, the chat interface at least allows the option to mute individuals if you feel the need.

The interface can feel cludgy at times, particularly in relation to the chat system which feels more like the developers bolted a fork of Facebook Chat into the game which is understandable given that the game originally had a very rich and complex community system that in many ways mirrored social media platforms like Facebook.

In summary, Skyforge can often come across as feeling like an unfinished game and it can be argued that it is as several sections of the game have been cut away in the name of trying to streamline the experience. The result leaves an MMO that in many ways feels more like a browser game or early mobile MMO in terms of its depth, complexity, design and profit model. Although I’ll probably keep playing the game off and on due to having lucked into a friendly pantheon (the game's term for a guild), I can’t in good conscience recommend  it to new players when there are far better MMO games out there.

... seriously, go play FFXIV instead of this game ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198065735063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3860, 'last_played': 1660021319}
review:
TLDR: While not comparable to other MMO's in terms of playerbase, content, etc, Skyforge has a rewarding combat system that makes you feel like a badass and everything is attainable by working in-game.

Skyforge thrives based off of one thing: the really freaking awesome concept of becoming a god. Many games hint at this, or even let you achieve it as a story ending, but this is one of the few where a majority of your playtime is spent as a god. 

The class system is limiting -- You are only allowed to use the one weapon that class can use, and your baseline class skills are immutable (unchangeable). However, you can switch classes at any point, and any Symbols (read: extra skills available regardless of class) that you earn can be used across all of your classes. 
Once you unlock your Divine Form, gameplay opens up. 
**NOTE**: What many people think of as the "main story" is actually the tutorial. The tutorial ends when you achieve your divine form, which happens around level 50-53.

- While the class system can be slightly limiting (very few classes get a choice in their weapon -- if any choice at all), the game has a rewarding feel. 
- You have to do matchmaking yourself, but it leads you to meet new players. 
- The community isn't as large as many MMO's, but because of that you frequently end up playing with the same people, which helps you to work together better. Also, the small community means that most players are on average nicer than many other online communities.
- You don't get to choose your class skills, but you do unlock "Symbols", which are sets of mix-and-match buffs, skills, etc. that have varying effects. (NOTE: There are sets of "Class Symbols" you can unlock that grant access to class-specific extra skills -- late game unlock)

author: {'steamid': '76561198191129109', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1729, 'last_played': 1633881971}
review:
O jogo é muito bom,com uma jogabilidade maneira,muitos jogadores que vc encontra online são bem legais e te ensinam mt(Ainda mais os Br).Poderia falar que o jogo poderia ser um World of Warcraft com elementos de Hack and Slash.Engraçado que eu encontrei esse game na pura cagada junto com um amigo meu.Nós baixamos e jogamos durante 15 horas sem parar kkkkkkkk.O game é muito bom e vc pode zerar o jogo sem ter quer pagar com o dinheiro real.
Agora algumas coisas que me deixaram tristes foi: De fato o jogo tem muitas classes,16 no total(acho),mas para conseguir,vc vai ter que conseguir jogar pra krlh,pq é um tipo de dinheiro diferente.Mas vc pode conseguir mais jogando em Dungeons mais díficies(aliais vc começa fodão kkkk e mais pra frente vai receber só lapada,num vai achando que é o Saitama não) ou indo em BOG(Battle of Golem que seria um Legue of legends da vida) ou indo em pvp de 3x3 5x5 e 10x vc ganha muita coisa boa :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032089073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 10024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3084, 'last_played': 1596937855}
review:
It's a good romp. However, difficulty scaling is all kinds of messed up, so make sure to take advantage of PvP Happy Hour to stock up on good gear: you WILL need it. Take note, PvP is also much lower stress compared to PvP in many other games as it isn't Winner Take All.
-
Review edit: I reviewed early, it seems. The level scaling for new players is terrible, and there are not nearly enough opportunities to level up. If that weren't enough, the max levels go up every few months... Along with the max levels on the mobs. As dated as it is, even Star Trek Online has FAR better gameplay than Skyforge, all because of this terrible level scaling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017395029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 16439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16439, 'last_played': 1590842795}
review:
Gameplay? Love it, it's got style and personality, individuality, control.
Matchmaking?  Abysmal.  You need groups for a lot of stuff, which means parking your butt in the capital fishing in chat and hoping you get lucky.  Might help if you could queue for multiple missions at once, people might actually use the group finder.
Progression?  Brilliant.  Until you become a god.  Then everything gets 80 levels slapped onto it and godmode is basically required for everything just to level the playing field.  Which might be okay if godmode wasn't a time-gated resource.

They have a brilliant algorithm for scaling enemy level so it always presents the perfect challenge, the right amount of time and effort investment.
And then you become a god and they use the algorithm against you, requiring you to leech off of other high level players for weeks on end just to catch up to the curve.
And don't you dare stop playing, because they'll eventually introduce an update or three and you'll be so far behind the curve you have to leech again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045256546', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1590, 'last_played': 1614386942}
review:
Mind you, I'm playing on the EU servers, so my opinion about the active player count or what have you will differ from those playing in the NA server. That being said, there is an active player base but I wouldn't put it up against some other MMO out there like FF14 or ESO. It's enough to where you can see other players in both the main hub and sometimes in the field.

So far, I'm been playing with a keyboard and mouse and feel like I should have been using a controller - as I had when I was playing this back on the PS4. Felt more comfortable pulling off moves and combos but that's just personal preference. The key input response has been great and when it isn't is whenever I'm lagging (again, I'm in the US playing in the EU server - because I'm smart like that).

The story... well, it's there and I just don't care for it because there isn't enough emphases or effort from the devs to drive home the point that whatever is going on is important (see how the devs work that greatly in FF14). The graphics aren't too jarring and kinda pleasing to the eye - especially with the character maker/customization. Although, I wish that the devs had put in more time to create more varying skins/costumes that belong to the world than something pulled out of our own (ie modern day dress, business suit attire, etc). 

The music is alright but nothing memorable. Turn on something else like Reel Big Fish or Rob Zombie to pass the time of grinding. Speaking of which, the grind in this game isn't all that bad. It is mainly your typical go here and kill XYZ for X amount of times. Nothing worth taking any mental notes or having to write down.

All in all, it's a decent MMO RPG that does have potential to be better, and the monetization practice isn't all that bad either with the exception of obtaining new classes. I honestly wish they would lower the cost of those by half, mainly because it's so freaking easy to master them in such a short amount of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147016950', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1597804088}
review: Jogo muito bom, superou minhas expectativas, a um bom tempo eu estava procurando um jogo de MMORPG que me divertisse e não me deixaria morrendo de tédio cumprindo quests tediosas e afins, diferentemente disso este jogo é repleto de ação, combos e bons gráficos, sua história é bem construída com um enredo bem elucidativo que trás todo entendimento da história para o jogador, simplesmente fantástico, e eu não posso esquecer de elogiar a dublagem e o áudio que é impecável, mesmo não possuindo legendas em Português, fica fácil o entendimento de quem tem pelo menos o mínimo de inglês, uma coisa que eu achei um ponto muito positivo, foi a customização de roupas, brincos, tatuagens e chapéis no menu do personagem, sem precisar de cash ou nada do tipo, é totalmente livre, com certeza esse jogo tem tudo para ser um dos maiores MMO free to play da atualidade, só faltou um server na América do sul, mas não não presenciei nenhum lag jogando nos servidores na América do norte.

review: Skyforge jest dziwny raz mi się bardzo przyjemnie grało a raz okropnie źle,Gra ogólnie nie jest masterpiece'em (nawet dobre nie jest) moim zdaniem jest to średniak,Fajnie że nie muszę tworzyć alt'ów ale po przejściu fabuły miałem tylko podstawowe klasy a żeby zdobyć item do odblokowania klas potrzebuję ludzi i to tych początkujących których prawie w ogóle nie ma (i oczywiście może kupić klasy za argenty które są płatną walutą)Rozumiem że gra jest p2w ponieważ jest to gra bezpłatna,Walka jest okej nie jest to Soulworker bądź Bdo ale może być,Kreator postaci też nie jest jakiś wymyślny (co akurat mi się średnio podoba),Grafika jest bardzo ładna,w sumie to ocena 5/10 ponieważ do wszystkiego potrzebujesz ludzi (wiem to mmo więc powinno się grać z ludźmi ale ja jestem typem samotnika)Kontent nie jest trudny ale nie jest łatwy a z ludźmi jest pewnie łatwiej tylko że czekałem z 30 minut i nie znalazłem żadnego.(a jest dużooo Grindu jak nie będziesz płacił)

author: {'steamid': '76561198130824302', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7059, 'playtime_at_review': 8179, 'last_played': 1712388879}
review: I'm a returning player from open beta, and I'm pleased to discover the game is vastly different. The core gameplay loop is pretty solid - although I had to learn how to perform many tasks on my own, which hurt my early progression after the main campaign was completed. Overall, though, it's worth the trouble, moreso if you find a Pantheon (guild) to answer your questions and help you with your missions.

review:
About time I reviewed this game. I'll keep it short.

Good combat, good graphics, fun classes, decent story, and gives you the premium currency without needing to buy it.

Biggest problem, grinding, and the new updates that get added to the game which keep changing systems that didn't need to be changed but improved upon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112364901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3172, 'last_played': 1590074079}
review:
There's so much untapped potential here it almost hurts. This game could be fun, and it used to be a couple of years ago, but for some reason the decision was made to put literally anything remotely fun behind an absurd power requirement post-tutorial (and oh boy, that tutorial; my 52 hours of playtime? Yeah, about 70% of that is tutorial). You have to have good gear to even survive post-tutorial, and to get that good gear you have to do missions that you need good gear to do. You can theoretically find a group to help, but the player base refuses to use the built-in matchmaking for some stupid reason, so if you want a group your only real opportunity to do so is to hang around in the Divine Observatory and shout for one.

TL;DR - Don't waste your time.

review:
Зашёл играть только потому, что давно, ещё на выходе, игра зацепила, сидел в ней на мыле и вот решил вспомнить опять, тем более, в Стиме.
Серьёзно, придти на мировую игровую площадку и не занести остальные языки, я уж молчу про русский, в довольно известную игру? 
Ну и как обычно, бочка фекалий в ложке мёда - упоротый донат, лезущий буквально отовсюду. Впрочем, отдадим должное, тут может из сундука выпасть донатная валюта, да и спустя долгие часы гринда сможете пооткрывать классы, но согласитесь, кому нужны эти лыжи летом?

author: {'steamid': '76561198061000429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1588681275}
review:
This can be one of the best games people can play today if they follow a few tips of advice upon reaching Jr. God Form. There are 3 ways to level up in this game from Rank 100+:  

The quickest way would be PvP; if playing during EU/NA prime time.  

The second would be making or having friends in a Pantheon who don't mind carrying you through the heavy content.  If you see someone in your Pantheon or Region Chat post an invite and put "Free" on the end of it, don't hesitate to join; they people are offering to carry players through missions that are impossible for them to otherwise complete.    

The third, which I prefer to do in between PvP is to run the 3 man Campaign missions like: Saiban Archipelago.  This mission has 3 bosses and all 3 drop Gen 24 loot.  This will get a player from Rank 100 to about Rank 190.  If you are unsure, restart your Gravedigger storyline and it will naturally guide you through the campaign missions; the first mission will be Rank 40 fodder but for people with the Search and Rescue companion perk, they will find that they can get about 300 Cathedral followers just by doing this mission again in Jr. God form and simply picking them up as they spawn and flag on the map.

I have not yet verified it but i am hoping that Starting the 2nd Storyline will help me from Rank 190 to Rank 300.

If you do all this and follow the YouTube videos on what classes to unlock first, you can enjoy the game the way it's meant to be played; I highly recommend having at least 1 unlocked class build for each class type in game because versatility is essential to groups.

The Cons of the endgame:
After playing a bit deeper into the endgame content. I find some things very annoying about the game.  
#1.  It's a very complex system of strategies for every monster that can be easily missed when playing with ultra strong players.  Yet, they all expect you to know things about the game that can't be Googled or Youtubed.  Also, the game for whatever reason does not have an Encyclopedia.

#2. It's quite common for the game to lose audio  all the time.

#3.  I absolutely feel that their Lootbox system is a casino; you can't simply buy what you want from the store.

#4. The NA and EU Servers are completely separate entities; which IMO is just another way to fleece money from players who wish to play on both servers to enhance their experience in between prime time hours across the planet.  I've never seen any other game expect you to pay for these 2 server options.

review:
ač jsem tuto hru hrál pře lety když byla ještě v betě a krátce poté.....byla mnohem lepší než aktuální výsledný produkt.
má úžasný příběh, na f2p pěknou grafiku a celkem dobrý bojový systém....
velkou nevýhodou je však již zmíněná "f2p" část hry......samozřejmě je vše otevřené pro všechny hráče ale hra funguje na principu daily time-locku.....takže budete buď stovky hodin bezcílně "grindit" pořád ty samé lokace a mise protože se zaseknete v půlce tutoriálové kampaně a nebo do hry naházíte nějaké ty šustivé dolárky a boostnete se..........tkaže pro všechny kdo uvažujete nad hrou zhodnoťte či chcete buď náházet realné peníze do hry a nebo vážně stovky hodin grindit dokola ty samé lokace nebo najít jiné....zábavnější rpg.

Za mě dávám 3/10.....v Betě bych dal tak 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009466371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1603645114}
review:
Super défouloir héhé ( pour un pistoléro en tout cas : c'est ce que je joue )

Sympa

Les graphismes sont moyens, mais pas moches non plus..
Juste le début très difficile car on y comprends rien : s'il existe un tuto : il faut encore savoir comment y accéder....

Je vous recommande vivement d'aller voir des infos et tutoriel sur You-tube

Sinon rien à redire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064374374', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1689838668}
review:
Too bad...This game looks great. I like the premise. But, the cash grab feels like it's insulting my intelligence.
There's a lot of classes to be...But you are only going to choose 1 of 3.
Paladin,Lightbinder, and Cryomancer.
But...I want to be a Necromancer,and see it has a Necromancer class.
I went along for the ride a bit to see if this was a tutorial thing but it's not.
If you want to cast spells.It's going to make you swing melee sword at the start.
If you want to cast spells (Magic dps) you'll be using ice magic.
If you want to be an other classes you will be grinding.
You will grind to get that class so you can grind that class to be maxed at that class.
Alot of grinding it looks....Unless you pay money for the class unlock.
I see a future in this game filled with alot of private server emulators...
Too much investment to find out you may not enjoy the class you want to play on this.
Not for me.
Overall the introduction as a new player into this left me with a bad impression.
It crashed once and a  few times npc's stood over my characters head floating.
Quite Unpolished for a game trying to get the kind of money they're asking with a class unlock costing 6000 of their ingame currency equalling around 6 euros rounded down.
Average player probably needs 4 or 5 class unlocks to find one they like? perhaps?
You'd be purchasing a whole game without a whole game since there will be more restrictions in-game hiding under cash grabs.
The grinding for some other kind of point system in-game to unlock classes was way higher costing 25k.
By this point I wasn't paying attention anymore to how much it would take to unlock this way since viewing a 25k vs. 6k in points will tempt anyone to go for the lesser.

Pay money while knowing it will lead to dissatisfaction and regret.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198047429409', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1588571020}
review:
Un MMORPG de qualité, d'une rare beauté graphique et d'une recherche de l'esthétisme aboutie.
Le gameplay est simple, mais élaboré et intéressant, relativement facile au début et accessible,
le jeu propose une campagne scénarisée avec narration de qualité, seulement en anglais cependant sous titré français.
Différents modes de jeu sont disponibles, notamment des maps bonus événementielles et des missions dynamiques publiques.
Un scénario plutot linéaire en mode campagne, les maps ne sont pas en "monde ouvert" mais plutot en zones  instanciées, pas possible de se perdre, mais pas possible non plus d'explorer infiniment.
Un gameplay qui se concentre sur le combat plutot de type "ARPG multijoueur" en vous évitant de perdre du temps a looter partout des coffres ou d'autres composants superflus.
Le jeu n'est pas pay to win selon moi, mais un cash shop est cependant disponible en jeu et vous permet d'acheter surtout des cosmétiques ayant parfois quelques bonus, que ce soit des skins, des montures, des compagnons interactifs, mais aussi les différentes devises du jeu.
Le jeu est gratuit mais ne dispose que de 3 classes jouables en free to play.
Les développeurs sont rémunérés via la proposition d'achat en jeu d'autres différentes classes, vraiment uniques, surprenantes et parfois inédites par rapport à d'autres jeux.
Ainsi, pour varier le gameplay, votre personnage peut changer de classe quand bon lui semble, mais ce service est payant.
La possibilité aussi de souscrire a un abonnement "premium" qui aura pour effet de doubler toutes les récompenses obtenues, devises, consommables et autres, durant votre progression.
C'est certes un avantage conséquent, mais ne s'adressant qu'aux joueurs réguliers et assidus.
Je recommande donc ce jeu vivement, qui m'a satisfait en m'impressionnant.
De beaux moments contemplatifs des paysages et architectures de l'univers sci-fi.
Ne vous fiez pas aux avis mitigés (évaluations "moyennes"), faites vous votre avis en l'essayant, c'est gratuit et sans contraintes. Et surtout le jeu ne vous incite pas de manière agressive a passer à la caisse, comme certains autres jeux free to play ou mobiles le feraient sans aucune gène.
Merci, et bon jeu.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198105658463', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1587510679}
review:
Very linear progression, except for your class (which you will have to farm for for some reason), you get stronger with a bigger stat called might, better tankiness, better dps. That's all. Nothing special about it.
No choice is given to the player, you'll be exactly like everyone else.

And cherry on the cake it seems to be a huge P2W.

The only things going for itself are its visual quality and the decent gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106031137', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1989, 'last_played': 1587488251}
review: Hra je po grafické a hratelné části super. Objevují se zde ale větší nedostatky v podobě nedostatečného odměňování hráče. V pozdější části hry můžete přijít na to že některé úrovně jsou nesmyslně těžké a nehratelné. Pokud se tomuto chcete vyvarovat musíte se přidat do guildy či školy jak chcete, aby jste mohly chodit s dalšími lidmi do speciálních částí hry. Tyto části nejdou udělat pouze se 2 kamarády, ale potřebujete rovnou 9 dalších lidí. Pokud hru ohodnotím hratelností a vizualizací tak je naprosto v pořádku. Ovšem mě trápí tento nedostatek že musíte chodit do dungeonů s nepřáteli kteří mají okolo 150 miliónů HP a nemáte žádnou šanci je porazit s hráči na stejném runku jako jste vy. Tudíž zapomeňte jen na hraní s přáteli... Musí vás potahat jiní hráči, kteří po 80% herního času jen stojí na spawnu a chlubí se jejich runky. Nebo si můžete za peníze koupit vylepšováky. Je to na vás vím že takhle fungují hry na podobný způsob, ale příjde mi to někdy otravný :/ To ještě nezmiňuju dlouhou tutorialovou kampaň, kterou nemůžete hrát Co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198980172741', 'num_games_owned': 11, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1614636631}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985566716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4070, 'last_played': 1587048290}
review:
Le jeu est simplement cassé. Une progression en dent de scie sans aucun sens et une fois votre forme divine débloquée, rien n'est faisable en petit groupe de même niveau ou solo. Dommage pourtant, le jeu a encore de sacré atouts mais tellement mal exploité qu'ils ne compensent pas les nombreux défaut.

Entre autre l'UI complètement chaotique, l'absence d'explications claires, des mécaniques modifiées trop de fois qui finissent pas ne plus avoir de sens pour personne (même des joueurs chevronnés ont du mal à nous expliquer)...

Bref, à éviter si vous voulez vous investir. Sinon Vous passerez 3 jours sympas à monter votre perso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339941688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1608, 'last_played': 1587214827}
review:
Re-installed forgetting why i left in the first place, very pay to win, especially for unlocking characters and can't even earn the sparks of transformation needed because you have to do it in a group but matchmaking is basically non-existent.

Also was playing on EU server for about 2 hours, so i logged out, swapped to NA server and when i launched the game it shutdown my PC, had to unplug it get it to turn back on, now that i'm back my PC is super slow, and the game apparently uninstalled itself on steam, but still shows on my desktop. Launching the NA server messed up my PC somehow and then uninstalled the game from my steam account...

Edit: My PC continued to be super slow after the incident, so i slowly made my way to removing the game completely off my PC and the moment i did my PC went back to normal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420755145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 21131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19595, 'last_played': 1589013040}
review: Si le jeu était une perle rare du MMO a une époque , ce n'est clairement plus le cas aujourd'hui , centré avant tout sur la rentabilité au point d'étouffer le jeu et le manque de volonté clairement établi de punir les tricheurs en masse . Plusieurs classes de personnage sont bonne a revoir pour l'équilibre entre celles ci sans compter que certains vont en contrario avec l'essence même du jeu .. Conclusion : avec une bonne équipe il ne semblerait pas difficile de refaire quelque chose de bien avec ce jeu mais depuis la fin de ça seconde année d'ouverture publique l'ont peut aisément le considérer a l'abandon et exclusivement pour les HL , sans rush intense vous êtes foutus . Ces points fort d'autrefois ? : Ce jeu Osait ! Pas de soigneur , pas de regain de santé ou trés peut contrairement a aujourd'hui , pour un jeu ce voulant "sans" cela c'est une sacré tache , a l'époque le jeu était bien plus accessible pour les nouveaux joueurs , aujourd'hui sans rush c'est impossible . Plusieurs cartes immenses du jeu ne servent plus a RIEN et pourraient être recycler pour des donjons ou autre . Le Mode histoire semble avoir été fait par deux personnes en opposition tant celui ci peut ce montrer confus sur certains sujets , trés dommage car c'est une histoire très agréable a suivre jusqu'à la fin de la saison deux , la dernière étant une horreur sans réel contenu et c'est très peut de le dire . Enormement de choses sont a revoir ou faire , soyez sur que quand les HL payeurs ce seront lassés ce jeu fermera par manque de nouveau joueurs .

author: {'steamid': '76561198062166907', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1587011024}
review:
Honestly reading the other reviews I was a little concerned but to my surprise it's been good. 
I'd give it a solid 6/10 with a ton of potential and room to grow.

I am in early game so that's what I'll comment on.
The game looks great and handles well, not perfect but well. It's not as fluid but for an MMO it's fantastic. 
A lot of reviews say you have to have a group and it scales to way higher difficulties and bullet sponges. I have not seen that. Things still seem to die with in a couple hits like any Darksiders/God of War/Devil May Cry style games. 
I played Paladin for the starting class and my time to kill were like...
Regular Mob groups=  10 seconds
Stronger Mob= 1 minute
Bosses=5 minutes
and that's all solo, so I'm not quite sure what others had meant NEEDING GROUPS. 
The Shop isn't pushy but there are a ton of different currencies in the game (only 1 being PAID that I can see and it's for cosmetics and new classes)
Speaking of other Classes!! It is looking like it'll be a grind to get them. I really truly wish, they made classes less grindy or not cost near as much real money. I get it's a free to play game, but some prices are way to much imo. 
There are some hitches and bugs with dialogue randomly cutting out and messing up but not enough to kill the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006550873', 'num_games_owned': 715, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1344, 'last_played': 1586767819}
review:
Took a break from the game and came back to find that I could no longer solo anything. Everything was super high level and the "boost" the game gives you to "help" basically does nothing. Normal trash mobs are beyond even Division 2's level of bullet sponge and the community tells me that I have to find someone to carry me through stuff for weeks in order to catch up and play the game "normally" again. 

I tried making a new account  (only way to re-roll a character) to compare the new player experience and the tutorial section of the game is perfectly playable. However upon completing the tutorial and obtaining your god form everything becomes extremely over scaled, to the point that you can't even complete the same missions you were doing earlier. Which leads to what I said earlier, having to find someone of a much, much, much higher level to carry you through the game. Its a shame as the gameplay is fun but its ruined by this forced scaling and terribly run progression system, which is also time gated.

Do yourself a favor and run away, never look back.
