author: {'steamid': '76561198098394418', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1587969823}
review:
FR
SkyForge est un très bon MMORPG/Action. Il est gratuit et propose beaucoup de contenu, graphiquement  beau avec un univers peu courant dans ce type de jeu: de la SF fantastique. En plus de ça il est cross plateform ( vous pouvez donc jouer avec vos amis qu'il soeint sur PS4 , PC ou XBox)
Parfois un brin complexe à comprendre mais cela vaut le coup de s'accrocher pour en percer tous les secrets et avancer dans une aventure vous faisant passer de simple héros à une divinité à part entière, devant gérer tous les tracas de ses fidèles.

Pour moi l'un des meilleurs jeu Gratuit.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Eng

SkyForge is a very good MMORPG / Action. It is free and offers a lot of content, is cross platform, graphically beautiful with an uncommon universe in this type of game: fantastic SF.
Sometimes a bit complex to understand but it is worth it to hang on to uncover all the secrets and advance in an adventure making you pass from simple hero to a full-fledged divinity, having to manage all the hassles of his followers.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Japanese

SkyForgeは非常に優れたMMORPG /アクションです。これは無料で、多くのコンテンツを提供し、クロスプラットフォームであり、このタイプのゲームでは珍しい宇宙でグラフィック的に美しく、素晴らしいSFです。
時には理解するのが少し複雑ですが、すべての秘密を明らかにし、単純なヒーローから本格的な神性へと続く冒険に進み、彼の信者のすべての煩わしさを管理しなければならないことは価値があります。

author: {'steamid': '76561198275706277', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4631, 'last_played': 1590835972}
review:
Şu ana kadar oynadığım en kötü MMORPG oyunu oyunu kaç saat oynadığının ne kadar ilerlediğinin bir önemi yok oyuna 3 kişi başladık 1 hafta içerisinde 3 kere oyundaki herhangi bir mapi yapamaz hale geldik sürekli olarak şunu kassak rahatlarız şöyle yapsak biraz daha rahat oynarız diye diye oynadık oyunu ama divine özelliğini açtıktan sonra bir kez haritada divine  olmana izin veriyor onun dışında bir daha divine olabilmen için adeptlerini toplamaya gönderiyorsun sana bir günde belki bir kere divine olabilme hakkı verecek kadar puan getiriyorlar ve divine olamadan herhangi bir mapi yardımsız yapamıyorsunuz en son umudumuzdu divine olup rahatlamak onu kasınca hepten kilitlendik ve oyunu bırakmak zorunda kaldık.

- Oyunda neyi nerden düşürürüm diye aramaya kalktığınızda internette kayboluyorsunuz bu oyunla ilgili herhangi bir dilde anlatıcı bir video izlemek isterseniz en yakın atılmış video 6 ay önce anlattığı şeylerde 6 ay içerisinde gelen güncellemelerle kalkmış durumda 

-Oyunun wikisi adeta bir çöplük nerden ne elde edebileceğiniz hakkinda bir bilgi yok oyunda fareyi üstüne götürdüğünüzde elde edebileceğiniz bilgileri wikiye yazmışlar sadece

-Oyun sizden hiç bir şekilde emek istemiyor emeğin karşılığını kesinlikle alamayacağınızı belirteyim oyun tek bir şekilde oynanabilir günde 1 kere girip 1 saat oynanarak benim bildiğim MMORPG mantığına aşırı ters

-Oyuna kesinlikle 1 saatinizi bile ayırıp denemeyin bile benim ve 2 arkadaşımın 1 haftası gitti sizin gitmesin :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198013306703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1623135465}
review:
It is a nice looking game with an interesting idea, being a god and such, but the game is sooo badly designed is just funny. 
There are no "level" in this game, instead you have "rank" that doesn't go up with exp, but does go up with equips and with development of your "buildings". The problem is that there is a limitation on number of times you can level these "buildings" in a day. You get equips from advancing the story, but they only get you so far. I eventually hit a "rank" wall in wich I couldn't go foward in the main story and couldn't upgrade my buildings, making me just stuck. The dungeon system didn't help, since no one uses que Dungeon Queue system, cus its just stupidly made, nobody wants to do early content and I never even managed to make a group the old way, the player base is just too small. The cherry on top is that the best way to farm gear is doing PvP, there is even a system that differs skills you can use in pvp grom pve, but pvp and pve uses the same gear.... sign*.
It doesn't even matter if it is pay to win, its just a silly game with silly design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109613879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1586596716}
review: Das Spiel versucht euch schon bevor ihr es spielen könnt zu verarschen. Kaum auf Steam die 20GB Spieldatei runtergeladen und auf "Spielen" geklickt, schon öffnet sich ein anderer Launcher "My.Games Game Center" und überprüft die Spieldatei. Der Witz dabei, Steam sagt du hast die 20GB geladen, der My.Games-Launcher sagt dass es nur 15GB sind und fängt also an die "fehlenden" 5GB zu laden. Während dem (wieder-)Download des Games lässt Steam die "Spielzeit" laufen obwohl man nur auf den Launcher glotzt. Im Grunde genommen keine Große Sache, aber wenn man in nem Kaff hockt und von LTE an begrenztes Datenvolumen monatlich gebunden ist, dann ist sowas schon richtig mies, vorallem als Gamer. Die Zeit für den sinnlosen Downloads dieses Spieles hätte ich mir echt sparen können und das sag ich nicht umsonst bei einer Downloadgeschwindigkeit von max. 1Mb/s (y) Klasse

author: {'steamid': '76561198010633637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 7150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7150, 'last_played': 1570585757}
review:
It's a decently stupid game, that requires others to progress when it shouldn't. At the time i played it, the game forced you to rely on heavily geared people to cake walk you through instances. When they weren't available, you were totally fucked, in your leveling process, their were few things you could do alone, and they were hugely repetitive oh and did i mention boring. 

I'm guessing the idea was to que for instances, like normal mmo's, sadly it was very very unavailable. If you make it to junior god before a friend you will have to hear about it from him or her for the rest of your life or until that asshole levels, in my case it was for the rest of my life, as their wasn't any level syncing of any kind bosses become elite rather then regulars.

We've gotten the game out of the way mostly, now it's time for the company it's self. They had something i wanted i purchased currency and they short changed me. When i confronted them about it, they shrugged it off like i didn't matter.

Avoid these conartist at all cost, their are so many different MMO clones out there these days, it's not to hard to find something better then this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340134847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6150, 'last_played': 1586101557}
review:
SHORT VERSION:
Don't waste your time even thinking of this game.

LONGER VERSION:
There are 2 important things to mention about the game: stunning system and graphic as well as fucking impossible to play. Let's start with positives.

The surrounding area is breath-taking. Characters look so overwhelming comapring to other games. I've never seen so good effects in such kind of game. My first impressin into the game was amazing. I thought it's gona be worth spending time with. Character creation includes so many details you can "build" a human from a scrath. Skills are beautiful, as simply as that. BUT THERE IS HUGE NO!

The game is impossible to play and get better with time if you're new to the game. Sounds crazy, right? But that's the truth about this game. It took me 100 god blessed hours to beat TUTORIAL! What's the best I couldn't do it by myself. To beat tutorial I've asked some people for advices with no outcome, I've asked for some help in beating the map - still with no outcome. So basically I had to BEG for help from high elo players. I've done literally everything that game offered me at certain point in time and still wasn't able to pass TUTORIAL(???). 

Difficulty level in this game should be simply described: "BEG HIGH ELO PEOPLE FOR HELP". Devs are just fucking around with people offering something unachieveable at this moment. I'm still wandering of:

WHY IS ANYONE MAKING TUTORIAL THAT REQUIRES HELP FROM OTHER PLAYERS TO PASS?
And the best part:
All the gameplay after tutorial starts around lvl 280. The weakest creature I met had lvl 280. Right after ascending into god my lvl was calculated around 114. The difference in lvls is described this way:
- When your lvl is higher than your opponent your dmg and resistance are 1% higher 
BUT
- When you lvl is lower than your opponent your dmg dealt to this enemy and resistances against his attacks are reduced by 10% <- 10% not 1%
Based on that and some quick maths:
280-114=166
166*10=1660
So right after tutorial weakest creature in game has 1660% resistances to my attacks and deals me 1660% increased dmg. GOOD JOB DEVS <3

I gave it a try. I thougt it's challenging which I like. It's not. It's just waste of time.  

Conclusion is:
Don't waste your time even thinking of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055606389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 44453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43030, 'last_played': 1605720592}
review:
O jogo é incrivelmente interesante, o combate é diferente de qualquer outro mmorpg que eu já joguei, e o jeito que eles explicão as mecanicas do jogo, com por exemplo, o respawn? Brilhante.
O jog é divertido e você fica entertido, pelos menos até o level 30, a partir dai, o jogo se torna absurdamente dificil, já que os mobs que aparecem nas missões solo, vem de acordo com o seu level, o que não deixa você se sentir como um deus, que é a ideia principal do jogo.
Mas ainda sim, recomendo esse jogo, pelo simples motivo de que é diferente e divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013899852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3238, 'last_played': 1585576041}
review: The game is easy to enjoy, but VERY difficult as a new player; you are given little guidance as to what to do, and when you have a quest to complete as a prerequisite, it doesnt give you the ACTUAL name of the quest. Until you complete what looks like many hours of solo play, you CANT even join a group or have people invite you...needless to say I had to uninstall the game despite loving it. 100s of people online and I did find one person who tried to help, but since all they can do is instant message you, it's 995 useless. I am uninstalling the game now. Disappointed, as the CRIPPLING of new players, poor instructions, and no clue as how to complete a quest or even GET the quest to advance my play makes this game a steaming pile of crap

review: An MMORPG without an open world? I directly removed when I realized. Combat mechanics and skill animations are great, one of the best I have seen in MMORPG's but there is nothing to do in the game except fighting in campaigns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127914859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 71828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20306, 'last_played': 1599703698}
review:
Nuevos jugadores: 

Al inicio es muy solitario para los nuevos jugadores ya que el tutorial (campaña) es mejor jugar en solo o que te carree un veterano amigo, para desbloquear el contenido total del juego debes completar los tutoriales principales ya que estos te restringen el jugar en grupos de manera libre.

EndGame:

Llevo mas de 300hrs de juego y apenas me puedo considerar un jugador promedio ya que aun no llego a desbloquear todo el contenido del juego, pero se muy repetitivo despues de un tiempo ya que necesitas recursos para seguir aumentando tu poder y niverlarte al nivel del juego, por ejemplo el juego es en promedio poder 280 y tu acabas la campaña con 50-60 asi que esas 200hrs son para tener los 280 de poder base, asi que para alguien obsesivo como yo en los MMO no es tanto tiempo.

PayToWin???:

Hay ciertas caractaristicas que dan una ventaja leve en combate, pero el hecho de comprar paquetes que te hacen reducir esas 300 hrs es muy tentativo para los que comienzan el juego, es recomendable comprarlos cuando ya terminaste los tutoriales para que te den los objetos a un nivel alto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026093466', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1545867048}
review:
I started playing this game when it first came out years ago and it had an amazing skill tree system. It was probably the most customizable games I've ever seen. Game play was amazing, intricate, and extremely fun. And then the developers "updated" the game, and I use the term loosely. They killed the skill tree, killed how you advance, and completely barnified the game. It's complete trash compared to what it was on release. I've tried 3 different times to "give it a second chance" and each time I wound up hating it more than the last. 

If the developers actually read this: Bring back the Ascention Atlas, it was what made your game better than the rest. Making it simple for the people who don't take time to learn a game is what drives your fan base away.

review:
I'm 40+ and enjoy gaming from  time to time.  During the 17 hours of play on steam, i've been enjoying myself.   While grouping can be satisfying, I also enjoy the satisfaction of questing about on my own.   The ability to change classes outside combat is growing on me.  
I would have loved to try this when the community was larger, but currently I am recommending to my gaming friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082267465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2384, 'last_played': 1583995156}
review: Despite all the reviews i hopped right into the game and it blew my mind. Game is nowhere near as bad/difficult as the entire steam community is crying about. It has a good medium-hard difficulty which really lets you enjoy the game compared to most mmo's nowadays where you kill everything with 1 hit... Love the game and would recommend it highly to any player whether you're new to the genre or a veteran player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014074971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5809, 'last_played': 1583757469}
review: Don't waste your time unless you have friends to play with. After you become a god you can't do anything on your own or get new gear without being carried, or spending money. Heaven forbid you play a melee class either, you'll get nuked after the "tutorial" of becoming a god. Never has becoming a God made me feel like an ant to be crushed undertow. There are guides out there for getting stronger, but if I have to spend a whole afternoon to get my Might up by one point, yeah, nah. Time is valuable, don't spend it here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132246737', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 9165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1976, 'last_played': 1591144113}
review:
Vraiment pas mal petit MMO Action RPG assez agréable dans l'ensemble j'ai passer de nombreuse heures a farmer les étincelle me permettant d'obtenir ma première classe, car oui dans ce jeux les classes ne sont pas donner il va faloir les obtenir vous même, et sa ne se fera clairement pas en 20min, surtout que les matchmaking son deserts et que c'est le principal moyen d'obtenir ces fameuse étincelle, se qui est pour moi la grosse faiblesse de ce jeux car farmer oui pourquoi pas mais quand faut attendre 2h pour faire un donjon en offrant en moyenne 1200 alors que le débloquage d'une classe en coûte 25 000/35 000 sa vous refroidis vite.

Malgré ça et le fait que le rooster ne possède que 4/5 tank/support, les mécanique de combat sont le grand fort de ce jeux que je recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985542821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1331, 'last_played': 1583362496}
review:
Hi Leute.
Zu Anfang muss ich sagen das ich 2 Accounts habe ein alten ohne steam  und habe es sehr lange gezockt. Nach dem ich jetzt eine weile nicht mehr reingeschaut habe muss ich leider sagen vergleich zu früher ist das Game nur noch Müll. Das ausgefallene skill bzw lvl system das sehr stark an ff10 oder path of exil erinnerte wurde komplett heraus genommen. author: {'steamid': '76561198028173243', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 10520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10510, 'last_played': 1583271992}
review:
Basically been playing for 2 weeks straight. Every negative comment advising not to play this game is basically on point.

Completely newbie unfriendly in both game design and community. Also, apparently, scaling after the tutorial is based upon people who attack enemies in dungeons? But everyone in a group is pulled into combat the moment 1 member enters combat. So how the hell does that bit of developing and coding work?

Personally, no one explained anything to me about community unwritten rules of how to do things or why they do things and I get kicked from a Pantheon (guild) because I made mistakes no one ever bothered to explain to newbies not to make.

TL;DR: If you're a returning player, get ready to be disappointed. If you're a new player, get ready to be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069076219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 33635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33185, 'last_played': 1607567705}
review:
The primary game play loop is pretty fun.  You're an Immortal with access to vast powers (but not true flight, since that would keep them from using knee-high walls to block progress, plus water deeper than your knees automatically kills you), and you can earn every class through play if you're persistent.  But once you're through the main storyline, it's just grinding the same few dozen missions over and over and over again.  It's a decent time-waster in that regard, and if "repeated raids to improve gear" or repeated PVP matches are your thing, you'll still enjoy this game.  But in many regards, it barely counts as an MMO.

Aesthetically, it's decent, although all women have breasts that bounce as if their clothing is massless, which you may find a plus or a minus (there's a handful of armored costumes that will prevent the gainaxing, but clearly immortals have never discovered sports bra technology).

My high hour count comes mostly from the fact that I'm in a bit of a dry spell in terms of new games that I find any better.  I've gotten to the power level that I can just sort of cruise through most of the content in literal god mode as long as I don't play too much each week (and my work schedule guarantees some off days to recover divine power).  It's like lukewarm pizza...it'll do when nothing better is around, and I haven't gotten completely sick of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987598158', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4561, 'last_played': 1590284328}
review:
I held off writing a review until I had finished the single-player tutorial missions - which is essentially a single-player campaign unto itself that unlocks all the end-game content/abilities while teaching you how to play the game. 

THE GOOD
(Surprisingly) Great music, great environments - each is unique, very fun and engaging combat coupled with excellent animations.  The best of all is the setting - its a science-fantasy Greco-Roman future world.  Very unique and what originally drew me to the game. 

THE BAD
Though the game is not pay-to-win - you can earn everything in-game if you desire without causing your eyes to bleed -classes are too grindy to earn.  My only recommendation would be to reduce the number of sparks required for a class the older the class is. On the flip side, I recognize the need to have something to achieve in-game - especially an MMO.  The other issues are the dungeons and raids.  Most of the server population is mature and to the dev’s credit, they have put in catchup mechanics for new players.  However, I feel that the lower level dungeons/raids should be incentivized for veteran players to join and help noobs.  Not sure how to do this, but it would go a long way to making the dungeon content usable again. Currently, the queue times are so long they are effectively infinite.  Though it's relatively easy to get a group using chat/discord it would still be nice to have group-finder working.  

So, I would recommend giving the game a go - at least through the single-player campaign if nothing else - and you will know pretty quickly if its a game you will like or not.  I think fans of Warframe and Terra, in particular, would like it.

Overall +1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046621760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1569822671}
review:
This has been said many times before and will be said many times afterward, but I'll say it again.  This game is only worth it if you have two friends or more willing to jump in and grind it out with you.

The game starts out great right at the start.  Standard MMO stuff, introducing you to the Tank/DPS/Support roles with what you get as well as letting you unlock others easily and switch them on the fly, with that one character.

Combat feels solid and is great to pull off combos and use abilities.

The only problem?  Backwards Progression.  What do I mean?  Well...

The story of the game has you become an Immortal, and eventually turn into a God that's revered by the people and who regularly stops the invasions of the enemies.  The tutorial of the game is essentially from the start, when you're originally thought to just be a Mortal, to becoming a Junior God, when you finally unlock the ability to use your God form at the cost of Faith.

The problem is that, once you've become a Junior God, everything in the game scales far above you and requires you to either go in with groups (hence the needing a couple of friends to play with you), use your God form to solo content easily, or do open-world maps over and over and over, which each have a set rank everyone is set at for that open-world instance.

When you get to the end of a game's elongated tutorial only to be de-powered in comparison to your enemies, you know you've done something wrong somewhere.  I know they want you to group up and fight with your friends or randoms, but when the LFG function takes hours to find a group because of how dead an MMO is, then it's a sign of a bad MMO system.  And don't get me started on the grind needed to unlock other classes.  I didn't even bother trying to go for them because once you're done with the tutorial, you're done without friends.

Skip this MMO unless if you have a couple of friends to join up with you and take each of the roles.  There're far better MMOs out there that work for both solo and multi-player settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031300721', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 28197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5633, 'last_played': 1589392570}
review:
Tried this game for a couple days, and whoever designed this game have NO idea how to make a game.

Here's my situation:

In this game, your rank is equivalent to level in other games. If you're 1 rank ahead of the dungeon's rank, then you have 1% extra damage and defense, but if you're behind, you do 10% LESS damage and have 10% LESS defense PER rank.

At the moment, I'm rank 37, and the next Story mode dungeon requires rank 45 (Yes, I crawled my way through higher rank dungeons until this point). Which means I'm doing 80% less damage and take 80% more damage, so I'm stuck here. 

To level up my rank, I need to do directives, which is a randomly picked dungeon that gives the materials required to level up my rank. Guess what? That random dungeon is the one that I'm stuck at. 

The other stuffs (tower, cathedral, etc.) that increase my rank has a daily cap, so I can't do that either. 

Get better gear? Nope, I need higher rank for the better gear to drop. Even when I'm doing high level dungeons with my friend, the stuff that dropped there are useless.

So in other words, I'm now stuck in the TUTORIAL with no way to move forward, unless I wait a day for the daily cap to reset OR I spent real life money to reset the cap (sounds familiar?). And I heard it's even worse once you're done with the tutorial missions. 

So if you're a new solo player or someone who doesn't like leeching off people, DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080182041', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2799, 'last_played': 1626479320}

review:
I like this game.

If you are wondering if you should try a few words.

This game is a grinder but not a looter.

It does not have a big open world it has instances.

You have acess to all classes in one character but many of those are locked behind the grind.

The english voice acting it's a "hit or miss" (more misses than hits) but not as bad as earth defense force (damn you giant insects!)

You get to play as a god and gain followers to increase your power, but most mechanics related are akin to a mobile game.

What it's there is fun but could use more of the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987129114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1581212621}
review:
I've had this game for a few years and saw a friend playing it on steam so I decided to integrate my account to steam and play with them. Turns out sometime ago they turned their servers into EU/NA and for some reason my account was filed under EU. Curious... since I live in America... Anyways after talking to their Customer Support over 8 hours whenever they bothered to respond they told me it was my problem and that they wouldn't be able to help me out. I mean they literally ONLY have a spot under their customer service tickets SPECIFIC to this EXACT problem so it can't just be me...

It's literally one of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had. I bought a founder pack years ago and to get treated like that?? If you're on the fence about this game, just don't. Don't sink a penny into it. Don't play a minute of it. There are better free to play games with better support that don't mindlessly screw over their own customers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019186645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1586937365}
review:
the graphics and the gameplay is nice, but once you get access to the godform you basically cant solo anything as your gearscore level will be way too low for the current enemy score (which is around 290) for every 1 point you are below it you deal 10% less damage and receive 10% less damage. with a gearscore around 50 after finishing the tutorials and no way to gain more gear other than pvp, since you can not do pve content with that low of a gearscore (240*10% less damage dealt and 240*10% more damage taken). still, even when you get some gear from pve you will end up around 190 gearscore at most, since you are lacking rescources for permanent upgrades which are towers and temples in your campaign tab. in the end you either have to wait for your adepts to give you enough faith for activating your godform to even do solo content or you simply have to rely on other players carrying you through all content until you have enough gearscore to really start playing the game. groupfinder isnt used for anything other than pvp so you wont get into any groups unless you find some good-hearted players that love carrying new players.
 tldr: this games current build is not for new player, only for the existing playerbase

review: I really do love this game, but the thing that's off i don't like is how you have to wait a LONG X amount of time to get or to play a new class. I get it's something to work towards which every game needs, but they need to make it to were its enjoyable an not a cluster fuk of a grind. What i would recommend instead of putting it 35k up front, i'd do this for example: Put the first one 100 then 500 then 1000 then 1,500 etc that way the grind is still there, but your being rewarded as while. This way it helps enjoy the game better but most importantly it helps beginner players have a better experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052929365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2860, 'last_played': 1581786773}
review:
Oh look.. it's the steam version of skyforge.. yay

"All MMOs are fundamentally good games, until they remind you that they are MMOs"

Long review. TDLR: This game is worth maybe 48 hours of your time at most, then uninstall. 

So good things out the ways first. Game looks good. Combat feels good at the start. Did I mention the game looks good? I was on a region map where it started to rain and yay puddles and wet clothes, then it started to snow and cover the grass and stuff in a layer of white powder. There are very few MMOs out there that do dynamic weather to that level of detail. The character system is pretty unique and at this point in the review, well thought out. It's still standard tank/dps/support but while you make one character per account you have access to a handful of classes with the ability to unlock more classes as you progress, with the ability to switch around almost on the fly. That's cool.

The tutorial is ok at the start, if you consider it's an MMO you'll probably spend the first few days learning the various mechanics of the various enemies and areas and mission types etc. And then you get GOD MODE, which is cool for exactly one mission, and it is at this point where Skyforge 2020 transforms from an ok gaming experience, to an MMO brick wall held together with mortar made of feces, no.. that's actually unfair to legitimate houses made using of brick and mud fortified with cow pat and blood, and as such, I actually have no meaningful way to describe just how bad Skyforge 2020 becomes after you unlock GOD MODE.

So at this point in the game, a lot of standard content will magically scale to something way beyond your character strength. The only real ways to make progress from this point on would be to either take on content in groups or blast through with your GOD MODE. 

Unfortunately, there are huge problems with both of these options. Firstly, the game is dead. Do not let any other player or dev tell you otherwise about joining Pantheons (guilds) or jumping in the discord servers to find groups. This game has a built in LFG/Dungeon Queue system. If you're sitting in any MMOs LFG queue for more then 3 hours to do BABIES FIRST GROUP DUNGEON, your game is dead. dead. dead. dead.  

Ok so what about GOD MODE. Okay I can go into those instances solo, pop GOD MODE and clear that same madly scaled babies first dungeon with barely any effort. Unfortunately, GOD MODE is heavily reliant on a seriously precious currency, FAITH, which depending on how your adepts' missions go, some days you'll be able to stuff, and some days not. 

At this point due to the way scaling works, a lot of content is basically impossible, requiring either social politic or GOD mode to make progress. And yes you can go into balls hard content solo in your base form and actually kill and complete some things (yep I wasted some time doing that) but its ultimately just not worth is. There are also many other ways to fool players into character progression from Flavious Lab, to Strongholds, to Cathedral and Tower of Knowledge, but all of those add up to nothing really, as there are pretty hard caps to how much any of those can progress per day. Even if you skipped/rushed/bought them out you'll literally be spending your entire day in menus, not really playing the game, and still not making meaningful progress.

This MMO actively defecates on the idea of making any real progress when playing solo, and probably on progress in general, with the "active" player base bending over backwards to try what they can to make things function but, they really shouldn't, its unfair. The bottom line is whatever the Skyforge devs did between initial launch and 2020, they messed up.. hard. BTW thank you to all Community and Pantheons leaders/officers who invited me to join them. I only declined to make a point of seeing what Skyforge is currently without community bias. Grind is ok in MMOs, but social politic grinds for carries (I'm ok grinding by myself as long as I'm not pissing off other players) and ages of rare GOD MODE uses to make progress to get your character strength up enough to reasonably do "babies first dungeon" which at this point isn't worth it anymore. 

Now for the jank..  lol, at this point I'm still working on the tutorial quest lines according to the game, which leads to a jank problem with the games quest tracker. Tutorial and Main Quests are always tracked by your quest tracker, BUT of course you get to GOD MODE and now the game sends you to wildly scaled areas, halting your progression (IN THE TUTORIAL) without always being able to pop GOD MODE to make progress, then it sends you to wildly scaled areas where you actually cannot use GOD MODE lol wtf, nice "tutorial". So okay, you go to complete region areas since that's the only content you can actually do but now the tutorial and main quests that you cannot do eat up your quest tracker, and now you're kinda doing your regions blind, having to rely solely on the map. 

The controller support is good? It works well but there's a little bit of jank where it's possible open menus while still controlling your character blind, running off cliffs and into puddles while trying to sort your inventory. Though if I cared and really had to guess this is a larger problem with how the game generally registers inputs. There are horror stories of people unintentionally popping valuable GOD MODE while alt-tabbing to a Youtube video or something. Honestly though I could be ok with the jank, if the scaling issues up top weren't as bad.

PVP is another potential option for character progression, but people will always be divided on pvp in MMOs, especially if they're essential for progression. Think I fell asleep in the Battle Royal Queue waiting for nothing. May give that avenue another try, but this games hours are numbered imo.

Oh yeah, I played Skyforge before, at launch, when the in-game LFG was active and the scaling didn't screw people over when they got GOD MODE, and remembered fondly how great this game looked and how it felt to play. I have no idea wtf the devs and publishers have done to this game between then and now and sadly I'm going to say that if you didn't play this around it's initial launch, you've missed out completely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026736559', 'num_games_owned': 956, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1581467515}
review:
Woke up one day to see that I gotta go kill rats, I kill those rats and then bigger rat emerges so I kill big rat. Big rat falls and I remain victorious. Bad co-workers come by after making me slaughter rats to take my glory away only to be slaughtered by some mage guy. Bad guy I say then i saw purple orb fly to my face. Bad orb, hurts my face. I need my beauty sleep so I sleep and they took me to cave. This is dark cave and my bed was those bad co-workers who wanted me to do all the work. Good riddance I say. I wake up with my sword and then I see rat so I stab rat...a lot of rats. So many rats, why are there so many rats? Who even wants to lead an army of rats? Could've chose squirrels, pigs, cows but nooo its god damn rats. I slaughter the rats with ease. I then see more rats. Terrible times. Terrible rats gang up on ole SaladSpam Spaghetti and then they beat me up. I know secret power and then I became pokeman and used hidden power. Killed all the bad rats in one go and bad mage is left. Bad mage no happy I kill his rats. Stupid Mage didn't expect me to kill bad rats so I stab bad mage but he flees? I don't remember but I did stab bad mage at least three times. Very good results, man walks in and says I am immortal. No I just eat my daily spam ya damn idiot.

Play game if you like spam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144027077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3041, 'last_played': 1581449613}
review:
I have played many mmos, but I have never played a game this unfriendly towards new players. As you can see by my playtime I REALLY wanted to like this game, but I finally gave up.

The game starts well enough, with a fun combat system, good graphics, even free costumes. At the beginning you have to go trough a tutorial, which is a series of soloable and easy (maybe too easy) instanced missions. You also have some fun open-world stuff. You go trough provinces, play missions, unlock more things and finish tutorial with an epic boss fight.

That's when things start to fall apart.

After the tutorial the "real" game begins, more stuff gets unlocked and you can't wait to try new things. Your character unlocks a special "divine form", which is a massive powerup. But soon you realise that almost everything (both the new stuff and the OLD stuff, that you did during tutorial) uses some kind of scaling. No longer are things too easy, now they are way too hard. You start to deal little to no damage and die extremely quickly. Stuff becomes either extremely hard and long to complete or outright impossible. The same mission I could complete during tutorial in 5 minutes later required over 40 minutes! Very boring 40 minutes, full of attacking bullet-sponges.

Divine form isn't some kind of cool powerup, but suddenly a necessary thing to complete almost anything. Alternatively you can get carried by longtime veterans, while being next to useless yourself.

You try to progress, thinking that it's just some kind of early game hell, but no matter what items you get (through the use of the divine form, or being carried) you don't become stronger. Scaling overwrites main stats of your character. Progress is some kind of unholy abomination of various system, but you are never sure if what you are gathering is actually helpful or not. Some things don't matter, because weird scaling overwrites them, others matter only sometimes, others seem to sabotage your character etc. I would get better equipment and get less health, for example.

Oh, by the way, divine form requires a resource that you have to gather quite slowly (at least at the beginning), allowing you roughly one transformation per day. Later it's more, but still...

People write it's one of a kind game and I agree: I have never seen such a convoluted and unfriendly mess of a game. I can't even say it's Pay2Win, because, frankly, I wouldn't even be sure what are you really supposed to buy to ease your "progress". I don't mind grindy games, but this one is just neither fun nor satisfying.

It's free so try it, but if you are serious about playing this game find some veteran players and guild ASAP. And remember that tutorial doesn't represent the game properly at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198399741575', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 16664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8037, 'last_played': 1603998948}
review:
--> Pros (maybe?):
This game is DIFFERENT from others MMOS, and its particular way to level and progres with the gameplay of the different classes and their skills makes this game wonderfull, dynamic and with an interesting story on background.
But the devs have to take care of Disconnessions problems which are for sure made from when this game has been part of Steam, and like many games Steam ruins something on compatibilities process...
You guys have to be patient at start, and many times you'll need help so go to find a PANTHEON (a sort of guild to be with) have friends and have fun! many events, many things to do and farm the necessary to buy a mount! is very fun.

--> Cons (TO MANY):

1)  The way the game envelop the gamplay context turn the gamers into selfish lazy peoples which stay at Main hall to do nothing and looking continuously for help.

2)  The structure of difficulties at Campaign finished and you being a New God leaves you too early an insane mountain to climb without a property balanced grow-progress of contents avaiable. Many mobs too strong while you still growing and cannot effort without even a trans to GOD avaiable or even enought strong.

--- 2.1) The faith gained needed to trans in GOD is litteraly NOTHING compared to how mutch you need (considering you have no passives, and no trees skilled to ammortise the cost).
This makes the growing proces very painfull constricting you to ask for help continuausly.
TODAY this problem is DECUPLICATED cause of the lack of community that abbandoned this game for that reasons and below im writing for you here.
 
3) This toxic game behavior only let you do normal progress with an insane effort to handle which makes frustrating a good part of play meaning. The fault of this lacks is to few things:
----- Mounts:
Only buyable with Argents. Costs INSANELY HIGHT compared to sources of income which let you to gain more argents (the icon is like a ddamn gem but maybe they hated so simple definition........... ). So you are forced to spend real money just for a ddamn mount or just you can spend like120-180 H of gameplay to earn a mount after the whole
campaign painfully passed and looner like.
----- Currencies:
With so less players online the costs in VICTOR'S MEDALS are felt more excessives, and is another painfull problem for who is new to the game = Forget the passives for your minipet, forget passives for your Capital, forget to empower one tree of your GOD FORM. You are luck to earn at least what you need to buy an item.
----- Infos, details and Descriptions
NOTHING on game give's you any info about World Bosses.
Devs won't read or consider any feedback through feedback section how's peoples says.
Be aware of oneshots in PVP.

review:
Only 60h Hours in. 
It is a simplified MMorpg. It is a 6/10 game with semi decent mechanics, much grind etc. There is something however that pleases me. Perhaps it is the idea of non intrusive mmorpg, or just the fact I am drawn to sci-fi setting of this. 
Game is far from perfect and quite outdated, but hey if it does provides you with more fun during gameplay than most AAA titles these days then you should not feel guilty playing. And it is free so shut your traphole complaining after 300+ hours that game is imbalanced and devs do not care... clearly there was something in the game to keep you playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982570604', 'num_games_owned': 2219, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1580193307}
review:
Playtime is on standalone, even though I've played it on steam it has none so?

There's some potential in this game, but I don't see any fixes for major core issues ever coming and currently the annoyances of trying to play do not outweigh the enjoyment.

You can't do the initial story line quests with a friend. You can't do basically anything after you hit the pinnacle moment of becoming a junior god since the entire world scales up to around 100 ranks higher than you, requiring you to beg people to group with you just for basic squad missions. Nobody uses group finder, so you have to sit in the observatory spamming chat just to try to do dungeons - not against this but feels annoying with the need to chain run constantly to try to get stuff done after hitting JG. 

You'll be forced into PvP which would be fine if there was any sort of normalization involved, instead most matches consist of you getting literally one shot and spawn camped. There doesn't appear to be any win conditions outside of the stupid MOBA map, so expect to sit around for 10 to 20 minutes in your spawn just to get some reward chests. Not engaging or fun at all. 

A lot of the core issues with beginning end-game progression can be alleviated by being social I guess and begging for help, or playing the game with a group of friends. However if you're a solo, or duo player - then I would just go play Warframe, Neverwinter, PSO2, or any other game that actually has a player base since at least you can progress your new character at your own pace and group for progressively difficult content at a reasonable pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109058524', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6803, 'last_played': 1587663769}
review:
I have encountered way too many bugs in this game to be able to recommend it.
 Sure, it looks nice, the system is not bad, although it is hard to catch up for new player. There is not much story in the game, It is mostly farming. But that all is alright and possibly good. Even getting stuck constantly on some maps is not such an issue. It can be played without investing any money, that is another plus of the game. But bugs occur to me many times a day. Some layers of sound tend to disappear after some gaming time, many times in pvp I re-spawned with invisible character, sometimes, I wasnt able to sell things from my inventory unless I re-logged, audio suddenly turned Russian, I was standing in front of the npc unable to interact with it. Often re-log solves the issue, but I can handle just so many of them per day before enraging. Also bug reporting is buged, so it seems hopeless.
developer_response:
Thanks for your feedback, we are unsure if you experienced issues reporting bugs in game or via the website.

You should be able to report any bugs you encounter via the following link: https://support.my.games/sf_int/games/125

review: Graficamente es el mmorpg mas potente que he probado, y tecnicamente esta perfectamente optimizado, el gameplay es una delicia va super fino sin lag ni ningun tipo de errores, ademas todo se puede conseguir sin pagar nada, es decir no es pay to win como muchos otros mmorpgs, y a pesar de que esta en ingles es muy intuitivo a la hora de completar misiones incluso tiene un modo battle royal aunque de momento aun no lo e probado asi que no puedo opinar al respecto pero aun asi merece cada minuto del tiempo que le puedas dedicar asi que es super recomendable si te gustan los mmorpgs ademas ahi muchisimos bosses y los mapas son gigantescos ademas de que no hay dos mapas iguales cada uno tiene sus propios monstruos desde bestias salvajes a robots pasando por mercenarios entre muchos otros tipos de enemigos que iras descubriendo a medida que avances, es  100% recomendable

author: {'steamid': '76561198180510757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2605, 'last_played': 1580849906}
review:
Good graphics, good combat, not a bad game overall. The only issue is that there are a few points during the tutorial (clearing provinces) where you will get stuck. Might is hard to get unless you wait for the daily resets so progression becomes impossible. 

Might seems to scale very fast so a point or two difference between your might and the mission's might will make it impossible. Grouping up won't help unless you're getting carried. 

They could easily fix this and it would make the new player experience a lot smoother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026809127', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3973, 'last_played': 1589898406}
review:
3 / 10 is what i would rate this game, why? 
It has the Worst new player experience i have found in any game i have ever played. 
The games "tutorial" takes days to complete. Other players can NOT help new players complete it.

Nearly all of your combat potential is determined by how much "might" you have to the point where a two (2) rank difference between the players character and the Ai results in a difficulty increase you would normally only see with a 20 or 40+ level difference in a standard MMO.

IF you play long enough to suffer through finishing the "tutorial" the ai strength then skyrockets again to the point where even a 1v1 fight against a standard AI enemy is as hard as mid to late boss fights in the "tutorial". 

Why does this happen? because the AI jumps from rank 40-45 at the highest all the way up to 280-290 as the base level you encounter where the player, even assuming exceptional luck, will only be around rank 160-190. (remember that one rank difference from before try 80-110 ranks difference )

what the game did right ? the graphics are good the combat ( when on equal terms ) is acceptable. the player isn't swamped with 30 or 40 different skills to control all at once or gimmicks like only a specific damage type affecting enemies. and the ability to change your class and thus combat style at almost any time or location is nice. 

the player community is good, one of the best i've seen. they are willing to give information and help other players ( when the game lets them )

If you like to suffer, have the AI one shot you when it shouldn't be possible or reasonable, repeatedly fail simple objectives and 1 on 1 fights as well as struggle to actually learn anything about the game from what the game calls its "tutorial". Then i absolutely say play this game. 

however if any of those things mentioned above are not what you are looking for.. AVOID this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118225873', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1578642474}
review: Fun based combat makes the game enjoyable, you can change your class whenever in solo mode(not sure about group maps) which is inturresting. sadly the classes unlock with in game tokens that are obtained throughout the world while playing, which is nice bu t the classes cost a decentamount. you unlock more as you play through the store, which so far has been easy on the starting classes. there are visual glitches at points of conversations that are more delightful then aggrovating such as a character slowly going down and then popping back up into view. some of the voice acting is hard to coup with as it isnt the best, and cuts out or drops the volume  low on itself. the community seems non-toxic at the start and people seem cheery. the games not over all complex and a mix of Destiny FFXIV and TERA. played for 9 hours plan to play more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060355664', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1629935124}
review: This game is fun for a bit but falls short later. Impossible to get random dungeons done due to such a small player base and the devs want you to use discord to find parties instead of trying to optimize the dungeon search's for better queues. The videos they use to show off their new classes or old classes is laughable because most the time you don't even use or have to use half the abilities they show off because everything dies no matter what you use except if you are doing a raid or a dungeon.. but good luck getting a group for that content. Its a pay to win game trying to be a free to play.. reason being is some of the missions that give some of the best rewards requires you to use special currency in order to do them, but then starts the obscenely long timer before you can do another one unless you pay more of that currency which is pretty pricey. Unlocking characters is actually free thankfully.. Atleast they didn't lock those behind a pay wall .. oh wait they did? OOF.. you can unlock them in game if you are willing to grind out the missions and challenges required to get them .. but also requires you to do some dungeons and other stuff and again good luck getting groups .. may as well just pay for it all. I can't recommend this game anymore because of the low player base and the bad MTX choices. It was fun back when the servers were alive though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029796140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1578200915}
review:
DO NOT, and I'm repeating, DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME ON THIS GAME. It's not open world, it's instance based. So if you wanna invest in an instanced game, go to Vindictus, or even Kritika. 

The developers has no idea what they are doing here. To progress just through the STORYLINE, you need to be carried, HARD. I was in one of the most, if not the most, active guild and I still can't progress. After being carried through the storyline, everything just get super beefy. It is impossible to play because the contents are designed for group play, BUT THEY DON'T HAVE THE PLAYER BASE TO SUPPORT IT. It's a completely dying game with easy fix but they are just so far disconnected from the game.

DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME ON THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079711121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3953, 'last_played': 1578181869}
review: Used to like this game then stopped playing. Now i returned and am leaving again, the game has changed the way to get new classes and even upped the price a bit for them to be unlocked which is fine, the worst thing is to get ingame currency to unlock classes you need to do either new maps or participate in dungeons that are basically dead as group finder in 30 minutes couldnt find 5 people to do one dungeon. There are only a few players in each map and the game seems o be more dying than ever before.

review: The game is visually exciting and the combat system is vibrant and engaging. Every encounter is one to look forward to, until... you achieve divinity and establish yourself as a Junior God. After this, progress seems to virtually halt. Most of the important quests that contain relevant substance are scaled up to a level that is near impossible to solo in a reasonable amount of time. Yes, improving your gear can help you achieve a higher rank but the gear that would make a significant difference isn't easy to come by. The aforementioned paves a way to speak on the group finding system. The group finding system doesn't seem to yield much of a result when used, you're best bet is to join a pantheon and hope to find other players that have an interest in continuing to progress. It was a fun game while I felt the rewards of progression! Instant gratification is all the rave these days.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997128755', 'num_games_owned': 1077, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1577819628}
review:
As a returning player, I found out my.games account was wiped out so I might as well start anew via Steam. And man, this game has change so much but not for the better. I cannot for the life of me understand why they've made some of these changes from many years ago. Back in the day, you could upgrade gear by collecting more of the same item. Now? I just have to hope 1 that randomly drops, is good enough to use. Back in the day, I could select a mission, party up with a mate and select a difficulty we wanted to try. Now? I can select the mission and that's it. The "Campagin" missions used to have difficulties. Those allowed you to make it more worthwhile to play while slowly getting your arse kicked if you werent good enough. The only thing I can see with a Difficulty selection is the Dungeon (What they now call GROUPS) content.

I really can't be arsed to play it much longer; It's so easy and boring. The literal only thing interesting are the classes. I'd love to try them all out and unlock everything I can. But the game seems so P2W it's unreal. It has SO MANY options to buy stuff with the same year 1 content to earn in a F2P manner. Back in the day, they had a stupidly large talent tree to unlock classes which you needed to grind whatever you wanted to unlock them. Now? I need to do PvP to unlock them. FFS that's stupid. As a person who likes PvE, I'd rather not touch PvP ever. And their one time reward for completing each mission doesn't exactly help the grind.

Overall, the game could've been something great. They keep adding to it which is always nice. The problem lies in all the Jankiness of animations and mouths, the insanely boring grind of maps and areas that are too easy to care about and the sheer amount of microtrasactions. Seriously, it has lootboxes, season passes, Limited Time Events you can "buy" your way through. Outragously overpriced costumes. You name it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046103998', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5667, 'last_played': 1681395753}
review:
okay so, where to begin, back when i first started i started out on steam, got the outlaw class for free and unlocked a couple of extra classes over time and a whole lot of grinding, bought the revenant collectors pack and it quickly became my favorite class due to it's abilities and massive scythe weapon

anyways

once you clear the first storyline you have to do the continuation of the main questline which is basically the villian dude coming to his senses, getting arrested and then becoming all powerful and evil all over again, after that there's another questline you have to do, after that guess what, another questline, once all the questlines get done it's time to venture out into the open worlds for a huge grindfest

in short for a grind this long and not very rewarding you'd be better off playing destiny 2 or warframe

review: Impressive character customization at the start with modest visuals that run on entry level equipment. Even cut scenes feature your customised character. review: This is basically going to be a very negative review since I played this game for a long time. First things first, this game had a TON of potential. I think it could of been up there with WoW. I played this game when it actually had a skill tree. Now since they did their "BIG" update, all the skill needed to play was lowered to basically nothing, the skill three is gone and it is simple. This developer has the worst support I have ever tried to use. They are not helpful and they really don't seem to care about helping get the game fixed. I will sum this up to make this fast. Game is not bad until the end of the campaign. After that, navigating through the trash menu is disgusting. Greed has ruined this game and it is basically dead thanks to the devs not properly maintaining the game and not listening to the players. Do not give any money to this Dev. Play the game for the story and then let it go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095905395', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1505157370}
review:
Score:
=========================
Dead Pay-to-Win game, with a lot of potential and a terrible execution.

Score: 3/10

Summary:
==========================
☑ Graphics: Very nice!
☑ Sound/Music: Ok
☑ Difficulty: not so skill-based as gear-based
☑ Game time: Long (10+ hours)
☑ Story: You die and resurrect as an inmortal god. Shenanigans happen before and after that.
☑ Game modes: Multiplayer (PvE and PvP).

Additional comments:
==========================
The game has a lot of classes, and each class is kind of unique/special... There are several factions but you get used to them very quickly and they become boring. The game requires you to run missions in scenaries (meaning: they have scenaries and mission types, they combine them and boom! a lot of different stuff, but it is not so different).

Most of the stuff can be done in group, and HAS to be done in group because the content is intently difficult because of the gear based requirements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144890353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1486, 'last_played': 1575659841}
review:
The idea is an interesting one for sure, and I likely would have kept playing if it wasn't for the absurd grind walls. My gripes with this game fall entirely on the grind they put in to promote the idea of speeding things up via microtransactions, it's truly ridiculous. The game's campaign goes great for a long while, you're growing stronger, passing missions without too many issues, then you drive right into a wall at full speed. I reached the point i was grinding for two days off and on, gaining nothing in return for my time, before I gave up.

In the time I played the game, and this isn't the first time I've played, mind you, here's what I accomplished:

I got through three quarters of the game's campaign
I spent real money trying to make any kind of progress

That's it. The grind comes from a lack of drops. You can clear entire missions, dungeons, even open worlds, and get absolutely no new Might (The game's measurement of character strength.) As mentioned prior, I spent around 6-8 hours of continuous gameplay, just trying to gain a couple points of might so i could try to run the next campaign mission, but it just wasn't possible for me to reach it. I was playing with a guy that also didn't understand why I wasn't gaining Might, as I was picking up purples that didn't change anything on my character.

It's pay to win as hell, and not worth your time. You want a free to play sci-fi game that isn't going around with its hand in your wallet? Go play Warframe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025168893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3279, 'last_played': 1575988215}
review: The tutorial is the fun part once you actually reach Godhood the game becomes almost unplayable. Long grinds to gain any real strength but youre too weak to grind and the game is almost anti-group with how hard it is to find one for most content.
developer_response:
Hello Oni, I'm sorry to hear that you feel that way.
Have you tried joining our official Discords? This is the link for the PC one. https://discord.gg/skyforgepc
Lot of players are chatting on it and it's a good way to find help and form groups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389792223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 30266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 757, 'playtime_at_review': 4582, 'last_played': 1712445925}
review: This game was good 5+ years ago, but in 2024 this game is terrible for anyone new starting the game. Story stuff = totally playable. Graphics = absolutely stunning. Music/audio = very good. Unfortunately, that's it tho. The game is largely dead, with very few players actively playing the game, group and squad related quests are impossible to do by yourself, even with god form, you simply cannot do it alone. The few players that are active are not willing to help you at all, even when the quests would be a simple walk through for them as a lot of them are very high ranks. You can completely forget about joining a Pantheon, again their just filled with high ranks that mostly do quests that you can't access and regardless to how many times you may send group invites in the Pantheon, they won't help you. The game is simply unplayable if your main goal is to get strong, you can't and you won't. Maybe in the future when these higher ranks start to actually care about new players, the game could be playable, but right now, the higher ranks ruin this game for new players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037951927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 3773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1575771216}
review:
Stop whatever you are doing and get Skyforge. Even if you played this many years ago, everything has improved and many things changed. The overall start of this game is pure genius. There is science fiction classes, Fantasy classes and the best part is that you can switch to any class you want.  You become immortal in this game, and are one of the rare chosen souls to gain this privledge.  From there you pick 1 of 3 starting classes. The way classes work, is that you gain abilities and master the class, then you can unlock other classes. Once you mastered a class, you gain permanent stats and become stronger. But anytime you can flip to a class as you wish. 

So there's making 18 different alts and having your 1 main.  The game is great

author: {'steamid': '76561198418900643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2595, 'last_played': 1577904834}
review:
Its fun for 30 - 40 ranks (12 hours solo) but after that it becomes a grind that, because its a different kind of mmorpg game, people get confused and leave.  

1. If you are a solo styled mmorpg player, this game is not for you.  
* there is no soloable content between rank 50 (like gear level 50) and rank 270, you will need your group (guild) to carry you through 5 and 10 man dungeons where you will get upgraded gear.  Later on down the road you will have nice gear and god mode and you will then carry others through for the same purpose.

2. The group finder never finds groups (the culture of the game doesn't use it)
* but don't let this turn you off.  Early on you can apply this this games guild at a low level and automatically be accepted.  It is important that you have an active guild of people ranked 260 or better. 

3. The game creators could do a better job at creating a linear tutorial that would explain how to progress.  The population is a lot lower than it should be due to the lack of information and direction in progression, leading many to believe that its a pay to win / play, but it's poorly managed / planned for the common new player.

4. The graphics are amazing. The ability to earn or purchase new god characters that are all unique on the same toon/account is awesome.  Being able to switch between them as needed (similar to the failed Firefall).  Sharing gear and gear set tabs included.  There are a lot of pluses to the game if you give it a chance.

review:
Igazából ez egy tök kreatív és egyedi RPG, de egyszerűen annyi sebből vérzik, hogy nem tudom ajánlani. A lobbyk halottak, a sztori lapos és sivár, a tizen akárhány kasztból csak 3 van ingyen, a 3 legrosszabb ráadásul..
Az optimalizáltság elég gyenge, az endgame üres. Kivittem a játékot, és utána már csak a jól megszokott repetitív grindelés van. Nem éri meg időt pazarolni erre a játékra.

review: This game is....OK. Once you hit junior god there is a GIANT pay wall or time gating for you to be on current level w/ everyone else. You have to beg to get carried on almost all missions to get gear and this "upgraded" gear is a generation behind everyone else so once you get said gear you will now have to pump money into the game to get your stronghold and cathedral so your might can be high enough to get current invasion gear for you to be somewhat close to end game and to be able to run invasion. The scaling system in regions and mission are just terrible. Imagine you become a god at the end of the tutorial only to be ROFL stomped by some low tier fox thing you had no issues before killing prior to god hood. Yea this game gets a 3/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063974788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1574033842}
review: Very glitchy and just overall gameplay is not that good. Combat is a bit clunky. I reminds me of Old Republic and how bad the combat system was in that when I played it years ago. This one is just not user friendly and hit boxes on you from the enemy are just not realistic. It was super easy but I can definitely see how it can be obnoxious later on. NPC chat is horrible. I also was pretty tired of the "follow your heart" bs but that's more personal preference I guess. It's still annoying. The storyline itself was interesting and the concept of the game is good. Execution is just terrible. I didn't even make it to paywalls or issues unlocking stuff. The core game makes this game not worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088326893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6421, 'last_played': 1573666426}
review:
Garbage progression System. The entire game progression revolves around you as a newbie waiting around in the main city hub area, looking for a high lvl player rushing your newbie butt through content. If you try to solo, it will take ages to get any decent progression with tons of roadblock which is next to impossible to complete without god mode. You can chill with friends and have some fun here and there, but when it comes to having a proper progression system, this game rating is 0/10. 

There are far superior f2p games out th ere that you can enjoy way more then this game. Destiny 2, Warframe just to name a few. Don't waste your time in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061759820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3338, 'last_played': 1572818752}
review:
É um jogo bem legal, com uma historia relativamente boa e com belos gráficos.  Contudo, o jogo já é bem antigo e é considerado morto. Eu gostei muito mas eu nunca vi um jogo tão desbalanceado como esse. O jogo te prende muito no sentido de você não poder usar a classe que quiser, porque simplesmente é fraca.  
 Atualmente (2019) existem 3 classes que vale a pena jogar e isso é frustrante.    
 As animações e diálogos são bugados, as vezes a dublagem é interrompida ou não funciona.
 A comunidade é legal, mas não muito prestativa.
 A dificuldade do jogo aumenta de acordo com seu nível, contudo, em diversos momentos os inimigos ficam extremamente fortes em comparação a você, o que te força a parar a linha de quest para conseguir novos equipamentos ou pedir ajuda a alguém.
  O jogo é um pouco complexo, foge um pouco do padrão MMORpg e os tutoriais não são muito eficientes, por isso é melhor procurar uma Pantheon (guillda).
 
  Em conclusão é um jogo divertido, com um sistema de batalha bem legal, bons gráficos e boa história. Mas não te deixa muito livre sobre o que fazer e como jogar =/

author: {'steamid': '76561198122952368', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1571917544}
review:
Игра убита. И убита во младенчестве. Убита оказуаливанием и донатом
Я начинал играть в Skyforge ещё в бете. И тогда она была куда лучше, разнообразней, интересней. Хотя в то время моё железо плохо тянуло её и пришлось оставить игру.
А когда вернулся меня ожидало разочарование. Вместо гигантского общего древа развития (Где ты повышал свою статистику и открывал новые классы) у игры только пару башен в которые ты вливаешь и ресурсы и время на выполнение квестов, чтобы стать сильнее. 
Классовые деревья навыков переехали в ещё одни башенки, в которых ты сначала открываешь те самые классы а потом одной дорожкой без развилок ты прокачиваешь их, не выбирая те или иные ветви развития.
Всеобщий "Глобус" на котором было все активности игры стал теперь просто небольшим декором. А большая часть активностей ушла на линейную карту вместе с "Башенками класса" где ты идешь поэтапно. Не сказал бы что уж совсем плохо. Но такая линейная дорожка бы больше пригодилась бы для "сюжетных данжей" после прохождения которых эти данжи открывались на глобусе. Но никак не для всего. 
Хотя такие изменения в глобусе куда меньшая проблема.
Куда более серьёзная проблема донат, хотя чего ещё было ожидать от игромыла. Во "Младенчестве" игры донатеры и обычные игроки были почти на одном уровне. Но вот сейчас донатеры стоят над обычными игроками. Ибо тем чтобы добится чего-то близкого нужно убивать много времени в игре. Каждодневно заходить, потеть на каждом эвенте и выполнять(забивать квестами и ресурсами) каждые задания, диррективы(башенки развития) когда в то же время донатеры могут купить бустеры и прокачать все башенки через них
В общем, как говорится, начали за здравие а закончили за упокой. А ведь у игры были хорошие шансы стать чем-то большим (Совместная работа Allods team и Obsidian как никак), большим чем очередной насос для доната в руках игромыла. Хотя так почти со всеми играми от игромыла

author: {'steamid': '76561198016073999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1571885329}
review:
If you want to play through the game with a friend you're poop out of luck, you have to complete a campaign mission in order to play it with friends. No, I don't mean you have to complete a few missions to unlock group content (you also have to do that), unless both (or all three of you) have completed a mission, you cannot play through it as a group. 

Why, you ask? Good question. Reasons, maybe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028226017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1573351538}
review:
For a free game its very good. have enjoied my time so far and fully plan on giving them money as a reward for not being crappy. the current holiday event is fun, fair, and has lots of rewards you can earn for free. its not perfect, no free game is but of the many ive played this is like on par with warframe for quality. Lots of bad blood because they changed the systems in game to make stuff work better for xbox and ps4 a while back but i was not there for that part so im not part of the bitter group.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095274951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3190, 'last_played': 1571334054}
review:
Du stehst drauf dich zu quälen?
Du hast UNGLAUBLICHEN spaß daran an TRASHMOBS zu sterben?
Dann ist Skyforge etwas für dich!

Wie komme ich zu dieser Aussage?

• Das Spiel beginnt recht harmlos und führt in die Welt des spiels ein. Der gesamte Campagnen Modus ist ein riesiges Tutorial.
Man levelt nicht auf im Klassischem Sinne, man sammelt MACHT an um damit seine Basiswerte zu steigern.
Nun, nach dem erreichen eines gewissen Ranges in der Kathedrale, der Forschung und der Bastion ist dieses Macht bekommen extrem begrenzt (4x am Tag für Forschung/Kathedrale) und somit ist es wahrlich SEHR schwer an Macht heran zu kommen
Besonders dann zum Ende des "Tutorials" etwa gegen anfang des vorletzten Kapitels wird es dann langsam etwas krepelig wenn man selbst eine Machtstufe von 30 hat, die gegner aber bereits 39 oder höher sind. Bosskämpfe werden zur reinen Qual und manchmal auch zur völligen Glückssache da ihre Mechaniken so unübersichtlich und ohne vorwarnung sind das man beim besten willen nicht ausweichen KANN (oder Hitboxen treffen dich wo du eigentlich nicht getroffen werden dürftest!)


• Was kann man tun um mehr Macht zu erhalten?

Erstens: Das spiel in die Ecke stellen und nur einmal am Tag 4x Kathedrale und Forschung verbessern. Das ganze über die nächsten 5 wochen.

Zweitens: Sich ziehen lassen von leuten die bereits Rang 260+ haben. (Spaß!)

Anders als ziehen lassen wird man zu nichts kommen. Keine Rüstungen da die Rüstgegenstände aus den Missionen sehr bedürftig sind und deine Macht nur SEHR geringfügig steigern. 

Und sollte man es wie durch ein Wunder sich irgendwie durch diese Storymodes gequält haben erwartet einen nicht etwa eine Richtlinie was man zu tun hat

Nope!


• Nun beginnt das "wahre" spiel
Grinden, grinden, grinden, grinden.

Gut, jetzt nichts neues für ein Free to Play MMO, doch spaß sieht anders aus. 
Nachdem man also nun tausende arme Kreaturen massakriert hat, hat man immer noch keine Rüstung und ein bisschen Mehr damage und leben. Weiterhin muss man sich ziehen lassen


Ach ja! 
• Dungeons? Keine Chance

Die Queue ist tod, da hilft kein zetern, kein bitten. Auch Tank oder Heiler zu spielen hilft da gar nichts (Wobei der Lightbinder alles aber kein heiler ist, einen Heiler in dem Sinne gibt es soweit ich es gesehen habe nicht. Nur einen "Support")



• PVP? 

Schlechter, und damit meine ich so RICHTIG schlechter Smite abklatsch in nem 5 v 5 oder auch abwechslungsweise ein 10 v 10 wo die gruppe gewinnt die mehr firestarter am start haben. 
Der absolut lächerliche schaden dieser klasse mit ferngesteuerten feuerbällen die auf entfernung nur mehr schaden machen sind sicher unglaublich lustig, aber Balance Technisch ist das der absolute Horror.
Du hast Spaß am Pyroblast von Kael'Tas aus Heroes of the Storm? Dann kannst du hier und heute mit dem Firestarter den Pyroblast SPAMMEN!


•  Nicht zu vergessen der Obligatorische "BATTLE ROYAL!!!!!"

Nicht angetestet und nein danke, der Hype ist völlig an mir vorbei gezogen


• Auch Klassentechnisch.

Du magst den Mönch? Der Mönch ist nutzlos. Du spielst lieber einen Assassinen(Slayer)? Schieb den Zum Monk.
Im Moment gibt es ganze 3 Spielbare Klassen, den rest kann man durchaus in die Tonne schieben.
Revenant: Der Edgy Boy mit der riesen Axt. Wers mag, ich nicht.
Grovewalker: Wolltest du schon immer mal ein baumkuschler sein? Jetzt WIRST du zum BAUM! No Thanks...
Firestarter: Der Clown mit den 2 Fackeln. Sieht affig aus, springt als flammender Tiger durch Reifen und ist die aktuell neueste Klasse, entsprechend völlig overpowered um die Käufe an zu kurbeln. 

Alles in Allem:
Keine Empfehlung

review: У этой игры был огромный потенциал. Она могла бы подняться на уровень, если и не ВоВ, то хотя бы популярных корейских ММО-игр...Но она была в руках мэйлсру, которая только и умеет что сpать. В результате ее нет даже в сотне по онлайну в статистике. Все интересные механики, которые я видел в бете, были благополучно пpоcраны. Классы и развитие урезали. Вместо шикарного прогресса и рывка в российском игропроме, для которых были все предпосылки, эту игру превратили в "слышь, купи" на каждом шагу или спи за компом 24/7 и все равно "слышь, купи"....
