author: {'steamid': '76561198100599212', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1596608523}
review:
So I saw this game on steam searching for some MMORPG game to spend my "free gaming time" (when I'm not playing MOBAs or FPS games), I came across this awesome title. Looks beautiful, has a unique combat and leveling system with a lot of classes that you can change immediately, based on the group's needs, your playstyle or favorite class. Combat could be a little bit more fluid, but it's really different (in a nice way) already comapring it to the "classic" mmorpg single target style combat system, since Skyforge features non-target/multi-target melee system, and single target basic attacks/spells combined with AoE spells for ranged.
The campaign is great, story seems nice at this point, quests are multi-parters, wich means in order to clear a sector, you must complete a lot of tasks one after another or simultaneously in the current area.
I'll try to play more and update this review with my feelings about the game.

Thanks for reading! :)

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198292152191', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1569376956}
review: This game has potential to be a good MMO. I like the sci-fi aesthetic which sold me on the game. After about 15 hours of playing, I finally uninstalled it. The game isn't very co-op for an MMO. You have to go through the campaign alone quite a bit before you can do anything together. I don't know about you but the point of an MMO for me is to experience a game together. But instead, this game wants you to play alone first. When you finally party up for anything, don't expect to share quest progress either. So regardless, you're splitting up or spending even more time than necessary trying to complete your missions. And you know all those cool classes like the Witch and Necromancer? You're looking at grinding 20+ hours before you can play anything besides Paladin, Lightbinder or Cryo. Hope you like your options.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144783197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1658709770}
review:
I love playing this game. (I have more hours on the my.games app launcher thing, around 500 to 1000 hours played, can't remember exactly).

I really liked the combat system, only thing which bothers me is that when an team mate enters combat everyone is in combat mode which means you're dismounted off your mount/vehicle. When you finally achieve the power to transform, it's an amazing experience. The maps are really huge and a bit empty for my taste, there's a lot of different places to load into, lots of quests and things to keep yourself occupied, and then there's some dungeons you can load into, and in my opinion is a bit hard to do when you're at higher levels. Requiring you to transform, very costly on resources and so on.

Sadly, there's a point in the game were you can't really progress too far ahead and takes a lot of time and pretty tough to break through at this point. (Unless you go pay to win/progress faster)

A game worth experiencing and trying out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001523789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1567738360}
review:
Sadly, it's a dead game. I think the max players per day is somewhere around 200?  

It's not a bad game, but it advertises all these classes, but only lets you start with 3 and you have to GRIND for another one. I started playing because I wanted to be the Necromancer, but I quit because I was forced to play a class I didn't like for too long and got extremely burnt out in only 3 hours.

The game play is pretty repetative. The classes don't really offer a lot of customization. You get a set 6ish skills and that's it. 

The game would be better if it gave you 1 class of your choice when you begin so you can actually have fun with what you want instead of being forced to play something you hate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085644250', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1567995517}
review:
This is just... a very fun game to play, sure the monetization scheme is not the best it could be, but it's not P2W in my view, it's mostly Pay to Progress faster, it's still plenty manageable to just play for free without spending anything, hell, you can even earn premium currency for free in-game by participating in events and such. So it's really not as bad as the negative reviewers make it out to be, at least in my view.

If you're interested in trying this out please... do not hesitate this is a very fun game to play and despite the flawed monetization scheme, it can be easily circumvented by playing a lot, just like you would with any MMO's, plus, It's free, you lose nothing but a bit of your time by trying it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023316333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 7349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1664, 'last_played': 1664840922}
review:
I played this game a few years ago on PS4, around when the Revenant first came out, I pre-ordered that.

I loved the game and reached max level then quit playing on PS4 and got a gaming PC, now that I've got a gaming PC I've recently decided to return to Skyforge about a few days ago, and today I'm pretty much already done with it, they broke the game I used to love and play for hours on end.

The main issue, scaling, if you want to continue having fun playing the game. DO NOT BECOME A JUNIOR GOD, DO NOT FINISH THE TUTORIAL. It will break your game and you cannot progress any further without some high level popping Divine form and killing everything for you.

After getting my divine form in the game, everything scaled up to rank 250 or so. I'm currently at rank 147. All trash mobs inside squad missions, group missions, or any missions at all, instantly kill me. I can no longer do directives, I did as many as I could up until all of them switched to missions that scaled up to 250+ even the regions put me in Antean Wastes which scales as well.

That in mind the only thing I can do is attempt to queue up for PvP which pretty much never happens I've sat for several hours while doing other things waiting for a match and nothing happened.

At this point I'm rank locked in place and have no missions or things I can do to continue progressing in the game and it's very demoralizing for me since I cannot beat any levels the game has become unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119338485', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1542359756}
review:
Not sure what I could say about this game. I have 2.2 hours on record and have no recollection of ever installing, playing, nor removing this game from my library. 

What is it? What does it entail? Graphics are good? Gameplay mechanics? 

I couldn't answer a single question about this game, and I am only reviewing it because it popped up on the Steam recommended thing when I first opened the software and I clicked it only to find I've played it before. I think the fact I can't remember a single detail, even after looking at the example pictures and videos on this page, is a good sign of whether or not you should play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271606300', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1570, 'last_played': 1570765193}
review:
Oh yeah, in short don't play, in long don't play it.

The reason is mainly because once you reach jurion god, the game is over, every enemy scale to 250+ might and if you are lucky you will be stuck at 100, so even those rats you killed on the first map can kill you in seconds now, nice way to make you feel like a god.

After ascension everything went to shit, this used to be a great game, was even one of my favorites, but the developers just fuck it up, now its just a shadow of his former self, more like a glorified pc mobile game.

so much wasted potential.

P.S: the game is monetized up the ass as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077393199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1567359094}
review:
it was really promising. the combat was fun, the graphics were awesome, and i was excited to play as a god.  sure the facial animation was awful but i was willing to overlook it.
then i got to class selection.
i can understand like 4 or so classes being unavailable, but almost ALL of them? they restrict you to just three classes, two of them being magic users.  and from what im told, unlocking just ONE class is tedious.  i WOULD reccomend this game, but the super restrictive class selection at the beginning combined with the tedious class unlocking is really working against this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047611589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1567113026}
review: This game is broken from the start. First enemy model didn't load at all until it died. Before cutscenes it just freezes. All you can do is look at your character walking in place while you wait for the cutscene, which takes like 10-15 seconds for no reason. Each time. Then on a second mini-boss fight it was left frozen like this, the controls were frozen, character continued to walk in place, but mashing the primary attack did the trick, the boss died. Wait for the cutscene. Cutscene ends, one sentence of dialogue plays in game, then it got frozen again before another cutscene. That did it, Alt-F4 and uninstall.
developer_response:
Hello ygreg,

we are sorry to hear that you had some technical problems with the game. Our Support team would be interested to hear more about this issue. We would be more than happy to help, so please feel free to reach out to us:
https://support.my.com/games/kbPage/409?code=en_US

author: {'steamid': '76561198289599811', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 24477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22675, 'last_played': 1636332029}
review:
[h1] If you're looking for a diferent MMORPG with the sci-fi theme, you can try Skyforge. [/h1]

[b] With the MMO trinity system, and dungeon grinding, you'll need help from players in this game, but dont worry about that. Despite being a little known game, it still gets constant updates with new classes and some maps and theres lot of people playing it too. [/b]

[i] Become immortal, fight for human kind and with commitment, you will become a god ! [/i]

Forget about creating many characters, here you can access the classes all in one, but know the farm will PAINFULL! This MMO have a good story and I hope you enjoy it. Questing in this game can be rewarding but never stay focused doing just one thing. Make your guild, or become member of one with many players as possible

The most fun thing i've found in this game is the ability to use objects, enemy pieces, and guns as a temporary weapon.

And the worst in this game is the difficult at the beginning, dungeons can be complicated even more if you're playing without friends... The grind get boring or too hard for newbies, but not impossible.

This game is free to play, so expect a store that benefit buyers... This is not p2w because this game is almost full coop. If you willing to pay, you can boost your progression and get in a higher rank very faster. But for it, you have to invest lot of money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239713998', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1525036840}

I'm not coming back to this game unless they change the UI and everything back to something close to what it used to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149044517', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1579477407}
review:
O jogo é bacana, porém é recomendado jogar com amigos. O servidor NA é vazio, recomendo a jogar o Europeu se for jogar solo.

Dica: Passe todos os mapas mas não faça o último mapa do boss. Porque quando você ganha ele ativa o modo Deus e o level dos mobs sobem para o level 260. Antes, faça missões que te dê equipamentos, vai ser fácil porque os mobs estarão level baixo

Não se preocupe com o Rank, quanto maior, mais difícil o game. Se preocupe em aumentar o might, aumentando os fiéis e dropando equips de geração 21

A steam tem uma dlc grátis que dá a classe Outlaw (bandido que usa 2 pistolas)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040954013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1501, 'last_played': 1626282451}
review:
Total waste of time.The game doesn't offer ingenuity , mount system is disaster you can't even go through some of the areas with mount ,character movements are laggy and off , you have to wait an entire day to progress in the game as if its some sort of browser game , in the open world areas every single quest is the same and they designed open world areas as if they are some sort of maze.The tutorial you have to do to start playing the actual game doesn't give enough items for you to progress so most of the time you are under powered therefore tutorial dungeons are taking way to long to finish on top of that i have had a bug where i literally cant gain rank (level) and support team is also bunch of inbred degenerate crackheads so it took me 8 hours , 3 tickets and 9 screenshots to explain the problem i am having even then they couldn't even give me a proper response about the problem i am having.
Oh addition to that you basically have to pay your way in if you don't want to wait an entire day to progress in the game.So basically its not even pay to win , its a pay to play kind of game.Bosses and dungeons doesn't offer any mechanics you either evade the attacks of bosses its really easy because they literally take 6 seconds to wind up their attack or they spit on you and you take damage which you can't evade or dodge away.
Most of the content in the game is dead you search for dungeon party you queue up and it takes 11 minutes or so to find a party then everyone is leaving when there are no ridiculously strong party members.Or you join a group via chat spam  and when they realize you don't have overpowered items they kick you out of the party anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999428912', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1564863576}
review:
J'aurais vraiment voulu recommander ce jeu, mais je ne peux pas. Les graphismes sont très bons pour un jeu de 2015, les sensations du combat sont au dessus de la moyenne des MMO action, mais il n'y a rien qui vous poussera véritablement à continuer. J'ai joué ~8h en ligne droite, sans lire aucun texte ni regarder aucune cinématique (soit l'équivalent des 3 premières zones  PvE du jeu) et je suis déjà incroyablement lassé.

Vous rentrez dans une carte instanciée, vous tuez un groupe de mobs, et vous passez au suivant. Parfois un boss sac à PV viendra "perturber" votre progression, ou vous aurez des plantes à ramasser voire même des ordinateurs à activer... mais c'est tout. C'est du grinding long et inintéressant, dans un monde insipide. Il y aura aussi de grandes "zones" à compléter, avec plusieurs dizaines de quêtes qui sont EXACTEMENT les mêmes : péter des insectes, des robots ou des animaux.

Les mécaniques de classe sont sympathiques, mais une fois que vous avez débloqué vos compétences principales, c'est la croix et la bannière pour avoir de nouveaux passifs qui rendraient l'expérience un peu moins monotone. Surtout que les systèmes comme le temple dans lequel vous dépensez votre argent en échange de fidèles sentent le F2P mobile et le time-gating à plein nez.

Bref, difficile de vous le conseiller, à moins que vous aimiez vraiment le grind de monstres de plus en plus longs à tuer... car il n'y a guère que ça à faire de ce que j'en ai vu pendant mes sessions de jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048847463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1565481299}
review:
Какого xeра?
Какого, я вас спрашиваю, xeра?!
Эту игру разрабатывала российская компания, эту игру издаёт [strike] Мэйлру	[/strike] раковая опухоль, но в этой игре нет русского языка - какого чёpтa?! Русской версии в Стиме нет, она является, как бы, отдельной игрой и для игры необходимо создать аккаунт на Мэйлру, где необходимо указать имя/фамилию/СНИЛС/ИНН и день рождения своего хомячка! Если у вас нет акка на Мылесру или  Одноглазниках - то xpeн тебе, а не игра - в отличие от [i] иностранной	[/i], Стимовской версии - Стим просто автоматом, за пару секунд, создаёт какой-то подаккаунт, без всяких анкет! Чей изъеденный альцгеймером разум родил эту схему?!

 Теперь о самой "игре" - это смазливый, но лишённый всякого смысла донатоориентированный кусок кода. Кампания - серия коротких "приключений" на крошечных кишкообразных картах. Кроме этого существуют "рейды" (как бы мне их развидеть-то?), также есть горсть небольших карт с "открытым миром" и кучками однотипных заданий. Ну и пвп, которое дepьмо во всех играх где есть донат. Впрочем, там где его нет - тоже, чаще всего.
О, нет - я ничего не имею против ПвП-шников - все люди разные, кому-то подавай сюжеты, интересных персонажей, диалоги, завораживающие локации, а кто-то способен двадцать лет полировать своей жoпoй одну и ту же карту в КС и танчиках с другими такими же выдающимися, разносторонне развитыми личностями.
Каждому - своё.

 Последней каплей стали праздничные "гонки". Я, избалован нормальными играми, где на эвентах проводятся всякие конкурсы, но эта "игра" сказала - "братишка, я тебе покушать принёс" - потому что я никак не ожидал увидеть, в 2019 году, xepoвый, слепленный на коленке, безруким слабоумным инвалидом, который в своей короткой, наполненной страданиями и лишениями жизни не видел ни одной игры, блядcкий РАННЕР. РАННЕР, cyкa! Корявый раннер в ММО!

Нaxyй это yёбище, удалить и забыть как страшный сон.

P.S.
 Мне что-то страшно стало - что там на остальных эвентах раздают - "три-в-ряд"? Автокликер? Тетрис? Какой-нибудь клон "Ветвистика"?

author: {'steamid': '76561198365500563', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7739, 'last_played': 1637866373}
review: It's a fun game, at first. However, it is very time-consuming to unlock even 1 new class. And the game, as well as it's events, are not totally friendly to F2P purists, or to new players. While fun at first, the difficulty spike on high level missions besides the campaign is insane, practically forcing you to do a majority of missions before to get the proper gear. Fun game, but very time-consuming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084716766', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 229524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4895, 'last_played': 1708896090}
review:
dont waste your time with this game , it may looks good and appealing , but its completely flawed with bugs of numerous sort , and worst thing , the scaling all goes screwed at some point rendering the game unplayable .

i will explain why , im not sincerely a pro on MMORPG, though i did play quite a few of corean like blade and soul and black desert , but got rapidly bored due to the non sense fighting mob dolls that just sit there doing nothing ,

Dragons dogma is for me a reference when it comes to combat RPG , and the shut down of the online version forced me on finding a successor , that when i heard about skyforge and its combat .
it is i a sense a not bad at all combat game,  its has certainly potential , the classes are great and the mobs do offer some resistance making combat thrilling and interesting .

my first 80 hours playing was a enjoyement , getting that outlaw unlocking and was aiming at revenant after it , but felt completely discouraged with that 35000 sparks farming just for a fringing class while most others sits a 25000.
the campaign was a great journey , getting your rank and might up doing missions and directives here and there , i hit a difficulty spike coming at rank 40-42 doing the factorium mission , but finaly managed to get that boss by learning its patterns right . then 
proceeded to meeting thanatos and defeating him in a interesting fight and got my junior god form in the process ......

......then like brad would say "that when things got out of control " , got my hands on a couple of gen 20 jewely from doing a directive mission that needed me to finish a dungeons with my freshly divine form , i was like 'wow' finally my might goes up beyond levels and my rank push me above 100 . great i was , i tought i could continue on farming directives and bastions now they were unlocked , i was terribly wrong , the scaling pushed EVERY missions to rank 256 (?) on warmup (?) , impossible to pass even DANKIT with trash mobs obliterating me , even though i was prepared with jewels to boost my damage and defense , tried paladin , cryo , outlaw , no way to accomplish any of the bastions missions , and same for directives and tutorials missions from the observatory ...

i tried to lower down my prestige by equipping low grade gear , but its seems the game only cap your MAX possible might rather than your ACTUAL might , making things completely worhtless , what a rude design of progression , i dont know how the devs would want the newbees catch up in these conditions ...

its a shame though , cause the game is rather good in some department , i was really looking forward using the god form , but i didnt expect that the game would force me to play god form on every missions to get over the crazy scaling , and forcing even more farming for faith on top of that ... thats artificial difficulty that render the game very cheap and discouraging .

anyway , it your new player and want to give it a try , you can taste and aprecciate the first few hours with some enjoyement until you get your divine form , then if your goal is to catch up , prepare yourself for a lot of desillusions ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198010602855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1869, 'last_played': 1621187032}
review:
Absolutely beautiful graphics and art style, The game-play mechanics are satisfying and the sound design for abilities is really good. The translation for NPC dialogue is alright, funny at times but it works.

One of the best things to do is press CTRL+ U to disable the HUD / Ui and just enjoy the beauty of the game. It is truly a work of art.

Sadly i am running into a problem with the game crashing 1 or 2 seconds after it starts, so i am unable to play it for now. hoping they fix this for the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037826507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5230, 'last_played': 1585750662}
review: Gra jest ciekawa ale tylko do pewnego momentu. Gdy już przejdzie się główną fabułę postać zdobywa tytuł młodego boga lub coś w tym stylu. Wydaje się że daje to mnóstwo nowych możliwości i tak jest ale jest jeden duży haczyk. Gracz musi w jakiś sposób dobić do 250 poziomu mimo że od tego momentu wszystkie potwory mają ten poziom z wyjątkiem tylko tych na większości pól bitewnych które mają maksymalnie 50 poziom. Jedynym wyjściem jest więc pvp na którym postać niema szans z bardziej doświadczonymi graczami lub rozgrywanie misji w grupie co również bywa czasochłonne bo często trzeba długo czekać aż znajdą się odpowiednio silni gracze. W grze jest też dużo specjalnych walut które szczególnie po przejściu głównej fabuły są wyjątkowo ciężkie do zdobycia ale też niezbędne do odblokowania nowych postaci lub odblokowania niezbędnych umiejętności.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059430069', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 25763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2249, 'last_played': 1619716425}
review:
La verdad que el juego está bastante bien.

Pro:
Muchas clases para elegir, algunas bastante interesantes.
Buena jugabilidad, historia y ambientación.
Bastante variedad de contenido (aunque podría tener más).

Contra:
Le falta gente, algo que jode mucho en mid-game/late-game.
Tiene un salto de dificultad absurdo al terminar la "campaña", lo que complica mucho la progresión luego de eso.
El desbloqueo de nuevas clases es MUY lento.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326557432', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 103480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 27, 'playtime_at_review': 77211, 'last_played': 1712267743}
review: It's a good game for the start and the story, later on though you need to enter a pantheon and stqart to learn how to grow and become stronger. Afterwards you unlock even more stuff and again have to grind to beecome stronger again. But then after that you can take parts in raids and... more grind...... Yup this is a game of grinding. also has PVP

author: {'steamid': '76561198391816862', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1905, 'last_played': 1576872676}
review:
Ну, раньше было лучше.
Раньше в этой игре можно было открывать классы просто получая некий опыт и открывая ветки, дающие разные плюшки. Теперь надо фармить какую-то хуету, которая очень сильно растягивает  ''''ГЕЙмплей''''.
Сейчас играть не советую, но можете попробовать.

review: One of those disappointing MMO's that forgets the second M. Pretty graphics and a competent gameplay loop but why are the story missions only playable in coop on a second play through? ridiculous!

author: {'steamid': '76561198817687105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 12465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12465, 'last_played': 1559825975}
review:
Гра по сонові PVE але і є PVP тільки арени і певні локації, Графіка на висоті 10 з 10, непогані івенти доволі часто бувають, донат якщо живете в Європі то витративши 100 євро можна смачне купити і не паритися фармом просто грати, ну і можна без дона але потрібно в рейтинг PVE бути в топі, а це просто не лінуйся ходити в данжі. Сама гра чудова але читаков тута повно особливо на арені що навіть паті з 10 ігроков не можуть 1 читера слити, і багов повно особливо застрягати в текстурі, велика перевага 1 персонаж і всі можна професії мати на ньому, а не купу твінів.
Гра сама дуже не погана, грали з френдом поки уже ці читаки не надоїли. І краще в неї грати з другом а то соло сама не дуже підходить, а то попадуть олені в данжі і єдині хто живий до ласт боса ми з другом.

review: If you  are looking for a game where you can change types of fighters called classes and numerous outfits as well as armors and weapons plus ability to switch classes during a mission then this will be a nice one to get involved with building.It takes time and reading as well as watching some videos and it helps to join a pantheon but game knowledge will come as you play for a week or two so do not get discouraged too quickly.If you have patience and a few bucks to spend then you will be doing nicely after a month or so of playing.The more you learn and play the better you will do as you progress to elder god.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254042068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1587979049}
review:
Замечательная гриндилка, полностью руссифицирована, большое количество классов, неплохой сюжет в купе с эпичными боссами и толпами врагов заставляют залипнуть на долгие часы, но когда выясняется что эта игра гринд ради гринда, бесцельно потраченные часы в этой игре становиться жаль, время это самый дорогой ресурс и на мир Skyforge не рекомендую тратить много времени, ведь как бы разработчики не старались, ничего нового и интересного ждать не приходиться.
PS
Рекомендую не задерживаться в этой игре надолго, но немного побегать особенно с друзьями стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287760902', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1567960417}
review:
É um jogo bonito, mas acho que a maioria não entende. Não é um MMORPG, não é de todo! Não faço ideia do porque o MMORPG está nas tags. É um crawler de masmorra, muito parecido com Warframe, etc. O jogo é puramente baseado em moagem e combate, então se você gosta de jogos como esse, tente isso. É grátis, nada a perder a não ser tempo.
Alguma controvérsia em relação aos aspectos do p2w. Eu pessoalmente não senti isso em minhas 23 horas de jogo, então não posso comentar sobre isso.

Prós
-Bonita procura!
-Combat é bom
-Plays bem, fps sólidos
-É grátis!
Criação de personagem -Nice

Contras
-Você pode pular moagem, pagando dinheiro real. Não tenho certeza qual é o caso com p2w nos dias de hoje.
-Alguém disse que só há servidores para a Europa e NA. Se ainda é esse o caso, é um grande problema para as pessoas que moram em outro lugar
- Entendido como um MMORPG

author: {'steamid': '76561198343947645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1548427489}
review: Однообразный pve. Захочешь в определённую зону, убиваешь 10-15 врагов и идёшь в другую зону делать тоже самое. Или в больших картах убиваешь по 5 определённых врагов и всё, задание выполнено. Я не спорю что это нормально для игр как это, но так ещё и способностей вообще мало, а чтоб открыть новые классы тебе придётся по сотню раз проходить одни и те же задания чтобы открыть класс или тупо задонатить

author: {'steamid': '76561197988020757', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 37398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11952, 'last_played': 1581447178}
review: Game has amazing potential if they removed every little part of pay to win aspect that would costs thousands. The support staff is very helpful and so is Juriel who seems to help run their discord. I have big hopes for this game I believe they can make it way better than it is now. I especially love the cosmetics and character customization which is what drew my attention at first being able to look fab cute and pretty in a game. The game is pretty active lots of pantheons to join which are guilds in MMO's there are raids and yearly seasonal events like this summer is racing and I got me a new fab bikini.   XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198253974393', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11949, 'last_played': 1511717674}
review: Like most games grindy AF! but fairly fun, and a great community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058700778', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1603032935}
review:
Skyforge e un gioco molto semplice e intuitivo, forse fin troppo, da ciò che mi ricordavo dalla beta che provai all'inizio quando il gioco era stato creato non esiste più nulla, molti sistemi sono stati semplificati drasticamente, facendo ridurre il gioco "quasi ad una specie di platform a livelli, dove si deve completare il livello per andare avanti fino al boss finale di quel mondo... un pò quasi come in Super Mario, la personalizazione è molto scarsa e non ce molta libertà di personalizazione degli outfit e del prorio personaggio in sè, tutto si riduce al completamento di missioni continue senza un momento per fermarsi, sulla comunity che dire..sembra che non esiste, nessuna interazione con altri giocatori in mappa insomma...se stato giocando a Skyforge per la comunity be allora vi consiglio vivamente di non giocarci allora, perche e completamene assente, oppure c'e ma solo per i contenuti di fine gioco credo.

L'unico lato positivo che trovo in questo gioco ed un sistema di classi molto libero, dove non si è perforza legati ad una sola classe e ruolo ma puoi cambiare classe in qualsiasi momento quarsivoglia senza dover creare nuovi personaggio eprchè il presonaggio che crei e praticamente il tuo account.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077161722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1755, 'last_played': 1560671163}
review:
TL;DR: Great game, but held back by its bad Business Model, with some other minor flaws like Dialogue System cutting out words due to FPS, and bad/tedious farming to get Freemium cosmetics.

Normal review: Skyforge, quite amazing looking and nice to play, unfortunately I cannot recommend it.

Its business strategy is what makes it a bad game. Everything up to Main Rank (basically your level) ~35 gets really stale in terms of what you can do, since the dungeons are Rank 220+, so you'll have to be a liability for the rest of the group. In addition, the class unlocking is quite the grind, meaning if you were to only play for Free, you'd have to grind 25k something of transformation, and you get between 100 to 300 depending on drop and reward. Or you can fork out some cash... 

There are some pay-to-win mechanics, such as the 10k crystal Argents (if I recall correctly) to get some great weapons (haven't tested as I detest such businesses), but there are some grindable cosmetics, but are extremely tedious (1000 to 1200 rare crystaline sort of item) where you get between 1 to 4 per gathering/kill (depending on location).

So, there are some minor loopholes to get through... but they just make you want to skip them in the end, as it's so demanding on you to pay for them. Otherwise Skyforge looks excellent, and is only held back by its business model, and ever-increasing difficulty, making it hard to get back into, as the Rank for enemies scale something about 20 every 2nd week. Another bad thing is the Dialogue System cutting out words of the conversations as its somehow tied to the FPS...

author: {'steamid': '76561198227868952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2808, 'last_played': 1560640283}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086796541', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 1291, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1700785024}
review: It still holds up to this day, I maxed leveled a cryomancer female wayyyy before this game ever came to steam. Just popped in for two hours through on a fresh account to see what was new. Lots of things changed, a better intro for one thing. The battle royal mode is dead as hell as I couldnt get more than 3 people to que up after waiting for an hour but the practice mode seemed pretty shit. I wonder how long before WOW puts a battle royal mode in, now THAT would be hilarious. Even fallout 76 is doing this shit. Its time to stop. lol
developer_response: Hey there! Glad to hear you're enjoying the game! Lots of new features have arrived with the New Horizons update and a lot more to come in the near future!

review: you see bad reviews FUCK THAT so i tried after reading alot of comments and i LOVE THE GAME, there is multiplayer so you can play with friends but you need to finish few missions,i only have 3 hours when im typing this comment but so far i love the game and im no near the end of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872220379', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1708792873}
review:
I highly recommend this game, it may be a time eater, it's not one of those casual things, tough. Combat is pretty fun, quests, missions, progression and overall aspect of the game including graphics is beautiful, even tough it's an old game.
The ability to switch classes mid-game and the class variety is also very interesting. You start with Cryomancer, Paladin and Lightbinder. These are the first three classes available. The other ones may be hard to get, as i mentioned earlier, it may be a time eater. 
Please be aware that i am talking from the perspective of a casual gamer, as for me these aspects don't matter.
I am not gonna relate to anything regarding the P2W aspect, i repeat, i am a casual gamer, i may fully progress this game next year.
The downside is, it may be a pretty hard at times, the challenge is there, it is real.
As for anything else, press the install button and see for yourself.
Have a nice day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005406191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1238, 'last_played': 1560028071}
review:
Greetings again!  I seem to be getting back into the swing of things and today I’ll be reviewing Skyforge an MMO that is free to play and that caught my eye a few days ago with its sci-fi meets Greek Pantheon aesthetic.  Throughout my gaming life I’ve been a huge fan of MMO’s but have (tried to) put them aside for the betterment of this ‘real-life’ thing so I walked into this game with a mountain of examples of what to do and what not to do.  But, that aside…is Skyforge worth your time?

Too Godly:  Hands down this game has the most engaging combat I’ve ever played in an MMO; it uses a combo oriented and contextual system that turns, what is for most MMOs, thirty abilities into eight.  The layout being more like a MOBA (LC, RC, 1-3, R, C, V) and playing more like a third person hack and slash and less like a typical MMO; it also adds a combo system where continued clicks of an ability will cause additional effects and finishing moves.  Overall, the combat alone makes this game, which is great because there is so little else to enjoy.

Final Sci-fi…ity:  The world of this game reminds me of more a classic Final Fantasy, there is a good deal of science fiction but the world is built around a more medieval swords and castles style and the basic story being that you died (spoilers) and discovered you were actually an Immortal and on your path of becoming a god.  It all sounds great, and it could be…if only someone would take the time to clean up the game.

An Ocean of Mud:  This game could be amazing, everything above is great but the problem arises with the terrible voice acting.  Let me be fair, the voice lines themselves aren’t terrible but it is the delivery; the lip-sync is terrible (they have programs that do this for you now) and the timing of the lines is off frequently to a jarring degree.  Sometimes it will move to the next line midway through or the lines will have nothing to do with what is being said, it left me with a feeling that they just pasted in the text and voice over from one language to another without fixing the lip-syncing, timing or checking the script.  Add to this there are abilities in the game that have been bugged for over two years, even simple things like tooltips that haven’t been fixed in just as long.  I’ve more to say, so I will but I really need to emphasize how great this game could be if only someone would clean up some of these issues.

Revenge of the Terrible:  When you are queued up for group content you are really restricted on what you can and can’t do, you can’t go into the training room to practice your combos, you can’t go do story and you can’t queue up for multiple things.  Maybe FFXIV and WoW just spoiled me but these should be baseline for an MMO.  Additionally, you can’t trial any class before buying it; note I don’t mind paying for classes on a F2P game but at least let me try them out before buying them.  Continuing, the support does still exist in this game but there is little they seem to be able to do, the server defaults to Europe and they can’t change you over so you lose everything you’ve done and when you don’t get the item you are supposed to I get an “I’m sorry nothing we can do” answer.  The game isn’t dead but feels like it has a terminal disease.

Ultimately, this game isn’t bad due to any core fundamental issue or bad mechanics, its bad simply because the developers don’t seem to care about simple, small, easily fixable things.  These issues start as ‘that sucks, but I love the combat’ and end with the game being tearfully uninstalled because of what could have been.  I don’t recommend this game; it’s free and the micro-transactions are reasonable but it appears to have been abandoned in the worse way.  There continues to be new content, so they haven’t forgotten but the simple issues mentioned above just make the game an unplayable sad experience as I think of how little work it would take to fix it.  This game is worse than a bad game, it shows you what could be...then does nothing.  Enjoy!

review: Очередная некомпетентность компании Allods Team. Российская игра с русскими разработчиками сделала игру без русского языка. Моя духовная скрепа истерично катается в слезах. Ставить отдельно лаунчер для умственно-неполноценных людей у меня желания нет, а махинации со сменой название pak файлов уже не прокает. В дополнение - большая часть времени в игре проходила на установке. Это творение отбросов общества не стоит ничего.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029718607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1559914904}
review:
I´ve played this game a lot in the old Version. ( over 1000 hours definitelly )
Now i came back to see, if it is enjoyable again.

Dont missunderstand me, i pretty much loved this game, the old one.

Now its really pointless to even start it, because you actually cant do anything anymore.
They removed so much, no more Leveling System, no Skill tree, you cant choose your skill set up, its fixed now !
When you play, you only can do the dailies for some minor progress in your Equipment, but queue times are between 10-30 min for 1 game :D
If you dont have the gear to farm the big Dungeons, you dont find a party right now and for thoose who play the easy Dungeons is like 0 progress.

The game was great once, but now its a waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198804646654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1658298576}
review:
Tbh,
There are a lot of mixed and or bad reviews for this game. Over-all I love this game, I started playing it when it was just through my.com. The biggest issues here is honestly for those of us that don't want to start over and have to jump through hoops just to be able to play our actual accounts. Steam really should make this game possible to use existing accounts. I've known a lot of people just to stop playing the game. I've already spent a lot of money on my main character and don't want to have to lose the ability to be able to also buy stuff through here like the dlcs. Something to think about.

review:
The game gets a lot of flack due to it's history of being bad.

But it's improved on a lot, join a good Pantheon(a guild) essentially and have them guide you through what and what not to do.
The game hands out premium currency like candy if you can get a group to take you as a new player.

The game does need a lot of polishing but honestly it's still a good game and deserves more attention here in 2019.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082571656', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1557943129}
review:
This is NOT a multiplayer!!!

Don't expect to just start playing with a friend. Somehow the developers forgot the MMO in MMORPG

Edit: The developer says you can just add your friends and play together but after 6.5 hours of playing solo I finally reached the point where the "invite to group" option appeared. It's still not clickable though and I don't intend to play solo any longer just to find out when it will be.

A game that I have to play solo for multiple hours until I can invite a friend is no multiplayer in my eyes.
developer_response:
Hello, 
I think there was a misunderstanding. Skyforge is an MMO :)
Once your friends are added to your friends list, you can form teams to progress through the game together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042462454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1558597870}
review:
Nun kurz und einfach.
 Grafik ja ist recht sweet. 
Sound Ok außer das einige Sachen gar keine Vertonung haben 
Steuerung ist Schrot für ein Action MMO einfach Witzlos cool Down von 9 min für eine Ulti ist Witzlos, zudem bleibt man bei jeden kleinen Müll hängen der Großteil ist mit der Leertaste zu machen so kann schon vorkommen das man Spieler wo rumhüpfen, sieht wo man eigentlich nur etwas anzünden soll oder einen Kokon öffnen. 
Tutorial ein schlechter Witz, den man zum Teil gleich mal wiederholen darf, um eine Ausrüstung zu verbessern zu dem ist es Chaotisch und unübersichtlich. 
Charakter Erstellung ist ganz ok, auch wenn einiges fehlt für die kleinen W:chser ist auf jeden fall, was dabei denn der Faktor für Brüste ist LKW Reifen möglich und man sieht die kleinen spasti damit natürlich herumlaufen und die NPC auch, Lara Croft würde neidisch werden angesichts der Medizin Bälle. 
Doch das Beste ist natürlich ist, das Game nicht Free to Play denn es sind nur 3 Klassen Spiel bar um denn Rest zu holen kann man sich denn AR.sch abgrinden da die Queste u Aufgaben aber ein tägliches Limit haben kann man nur Kozen bei sowas und 12 Euro für eine Klasse wo man dann nicht weis ob, die was kann, ist einfach nur ans Bein Pinkeln der Spieler. 
Jetzt lauf ich mit einer Klasse rum die mir Persönlich am wenigsten ankotzt und schau, ob ich in 1 Woche meine Klasse (die Hexe) bekomme, was ich kaum glaube, da ich für ein Quest 500 punkte bekommen habe und 22k aber brauche Tägliches Limit JUHU.

YOU WITH DOWN SYNDROME, BLIND AND MUTE, WANNA BE A GOD? WHAT YOU CANT HEAR ME?  DONT WORRY, BE ONE TOO

author: {'steamid': '76561198119286623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1484, 'last_played': 1557675918}
review:
good graphics, design and concept of world building. the particle and visual effect of spell very well made tbh. The presentation of this game on the first glaze is friendly and beautiful. Also being able to change class without changing your character is so nice!............now for the ugly filling under those beautiful graphic and interesting class, 

The UI is fine but it really can be better by add few things and fixing some bugs. The combat scene sometimes can be quite boring.....just spam the one or two main dps you have and kite enemy. The "might" system is absolutely BS IMO, I have spent whole few day of grinding for the "might" and I didnt felt like i accomplished anything. This game system and progress design have lost balance of the grind/reward/fun. Im ok with it being grindy as heck but the gameplay and system is no fun. the fun and joy of achievement just didnt add up to those grind. 


im just gonna go back to warframe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326050929', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1557671852}

author: {'steamid': '76561198279883105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1707684338}
review: This is a fun hack n slash action game and I wish there were more mmorpg's that used controllers like this game does. Trouble is the free to play model. I would gladly pay a monthly subscription if it were offered and it allowed you to bypass the pay to win elements. I had a fun time playing but when I hit that wall and I stalled to advance , it became quite clear it would take me FOREVER to grind the items I needed to unlock this to level that etc. It was then my passion to play left. The sad part is, the gameplay is good and what I really liked about it was that it  doesn't suffer from ability bloat and is a good casual action game with mmorpg elements. If someone took the core elements from this game and built a better consumer model around it this game would be legend. Right now I'm afraid its a bit of a scam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349601619', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1557426814}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070716065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 24937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8045, 'last_played': 1587527484}
review:
So in my honest opinion i think Skyforge is a great game, the combat is action based, classes are all fun and have their own uses, the fact you can switch to any class without needing to re-log is a huge plus, the added divine form makes it even more cool due to the set of abilities the form has based on what class you were playing before you changed into a god ( Tank, Healer, Damage). The story is pretty decent also, it even makes way more sense after you beat the campaign and then you do this portion called stories, it fills the gaps with information that the main campaign was not clear about. 

Now onto the dislikes, this all boils down to the developers and how they tweaked the game a while ago to kind of stream line things i guess and help them to make more money in my opinion. First we have the classes, earlier i said you could play them which is still true after you buy them in game with Transformation coins or actual real world currency in the form of Argents, yes they cost a pretty penny and yes it does take a while to save up Transformation coins to get even one of the older classes, they are free to farm though. Then you have the good old bugs and my oh my are there a lot of those puppies, for game that has been out for two years you would thing they would have had some performance patches and major bug fixes, i mean one area has a story quest which is the new dam area they introduced in the "Horizon" update, you can't even start that quest due to there being no marker to follow.Then you have the FPS hits, i mean im sitting at 105 then boom now I'm at 15, sometimes it's every 10 seconds and others times it just happens a few times in a run or region. Then we have the sound bug where you literally can't here shit but random noises, no character actions, no menu options, nothing but pleeps and the occasional ability sound, you're then forced to finish what you're doing with no sound then you have to log out and log back in to fix the issue. 

Now i know about probably 10 more major bugs maybe even more, but i won't bore you with all the details of them all. The game is good, but as you can tell the money hungry nature of developers these days has them doing nothing but focusing on tactics to squeeze us for all the pennies we own. If they release a major performance patch and bug fix, this game would definitely be a very good game to invest time in. Investing now though would only boil down to you being able to look past all that I've listed and see whats underneath the hood. I'm use to it though and my guild ( Pantheon ) needs me so i will stick it out, but i hope they haven't forgot that we still play this game and its only 2 yrs old so show it some love please.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060616666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 74521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6126, 'last_played': 1690759510}
review:
[h1] God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well. Voltaire  [/h1]

And this game doesnt help me live that well.
I really want to recommend this game, but its very difficult to do so, as i have a love/hate relationship with this game, and one thing it's already terrible at, it's the fact that you can't link your Steam account with an older account from MYCOM, a website from where this game (belongs) asks you to connect every now and then, so you are [u]forced[/u] to  throw years of progress and start from scratch. 
Another terrible thing this game as is that, everything seems nice and dandy at the beggining, but [u]as soon as you finish the tutorial, which may take you 2 days or so[/u], everything becomes almost instantly P2W, every monster become like super monster, you do not damage, unless you buy some weapons, which cost diamond, and diamonds cost real money, but you can get them by doing certain quests too (although it will take you forever).
The game forces players to do alot of things against their will, and btw, it becomes very grindy.

Tip: when you finish the tutorial, don't go into any quest as monster will destroy you, instead of that, [u]to become stronger without having to pay for anything, do some SQUAD or REGION DIRECTIVES missions [/u], or any mission where you see a cube design, they contain epic weapons that will make you skip alot of levels, i went from 42 to 145 in 2 hours, mostly because i also did some other quests, but you can do it in less then 1 hour.

Im giving this game a thumbs up, mainly because i spent some good time with my older squad when this game came out, im playing now because i kinda missed this, and also want to see where this game is heading.
And so far im not liking one bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328249156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 103484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12247, 'last_played': 1580195093}
review:
+Good fun, small community, good graphics.
-Small glitches are very common, and occasional large ones. Graphical glitches are common and often hilarious.
-It is very grindy after a few hours of play and almost requires you get help from others. 
+However, since everyone experiences the same thing in this community, most people are very understanding and will help out lower level players. 
+-The pvp is highly dependent on having decent gear but the rewards during happy hour make it totally worth it. There are leagues for pvp though and being in a lower one increases your chances of getting a match at your skill level. Also you can usually only get matches during the happy hours or when people tell you to que for it. That's just because the playerbase is small though. 
+-For group missions (5 or 10) the que doesn't get used. Instead people send out invites in the public chat and other chatrooms to solve this. 
+There is always a way around any pay to win content in this game and even if you do pay for most things it isn't very effective. 
-Some content is time locked
+The directive system makes catching up with the top people in pve very possible within a couple of months.
My rating:
With a clan (pantheon) 8/10
Without a pantheon 5/10
Also this is free and you can't really beat free stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169241405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1556640965}
review:
Man, I wanted to like this game, but there's just too much wrong with it.

The Good:

- Vanity: This game has a lot of great vanity options; body sliders and whatnot for making your character look good at the outset, along with a fair amount of aesthetic customization, via costumes, and other elements; much of which that remains accessible throughout the game. However, facial customization is way too lacking, and the body customization gets reset to default during quest conversations, which is jarring.
There's also a really great camera option for taking screenshots. It has some DoF options and looks great. My only complaint here being that the zoom (mouse wheel) is not responsive enough. It takes a lot of effort to zoom in and out. This even effects combat.

- Graphics: The overall aesthetic of the game is compelling enough for a bit, rather fun, if not a bit too sanitary. I ran the game at maximum settings, and it was overall great. No frame drops of tearing. There is some very minor inconsistency with shaders loading, but it's nothing that most games don't have. In fact, I'd say that this game is far better optimized than most MMOs, especially as concerns meshes, and textures. Further, the movement animations are well above average, with a lot of character, and even some minor customization available (stances and running animation).

That's it. That's all that's good.

The Bad:

- Networking: I have fiber Internet and I was getting kicked every ten minutes, to half-an-hour, for most of my experience. This doesn't happen with most other MMOs that I've played. There were a couple of stretches of time where I stayed connect for as much as 40 minutes, but that was like, twice. Either their servers are very sensitive to minor network hiccups; the network traffic is too much, because of their recent update, and promotional push (a lot of YT shilling going on); or their servers are just have problems. Either way, the kicks became rather intolerable.

- Movement: The movement in the world hub feels fine; appropriate, even. That said, in the mission/quest instances, this all falls apart. Movement feels floaty, slow, and sluggish. There's no feeling of responsiveness nor agency. With no sprint option, because of the in-combat dash, and dodge mechanics (which feels useless; look ahead to "Combat"), one feels like their always pulling against some invisible tether. Further, as one runs around the instanced environments, small rocks will stop your character dead in their tracks, forcing them to jump, which -- though nicely animated -- is another floaty, sluggish mechanic. One should have the ability to simply traverse over minor obstacles like this, without them becoming an issue.

- Combat: The idea of the combat is really great, but executed very poorly. It's sort-of beat-'em-up combat, mixed with ARPG touches. There are combos, finishers, and ultimate moves, even when using magic-based combat. Unfortunately, the floaty/slow/sluggish aspect rears its ugly head again. None of the attacks land with a feeling of significance, nor is there much to communicate when one is being damaged, outside of the HP bar in the underwhelming UI. One does not feel power, nor threat, during combat. Further, the zoom function on the mouse wheel is way too slow to help one get a better perspective during combat. This is something that many games with less visual polish get right.

- Environments: The hub area and its adjacent instances look good, but boring. Maybe they've been left bare-bones, because Allods Team expected there to be a far more consistently present idle population of players in the hub areas. I dunno. Either way, it feels sanitary, lacking in set dressing, and boring, despite having good aesthetics at a basic level.
The mission/quest instances, on the other hand, are a linear slog, with tiny areas to roam off the beaten path, with no reward for looking into them. Exploration isn't a thing. No extra details. No extra world-building. Nothing hidden. Just an awkward, linear area, where one trots from one enemy, to another, wondering when anything will feel significant. Further, if one does wander too far off of the beaten path, they'll be rewarded by invisible walls that can make one stuck, and forced to reboot the game to get loose. Oh, and don't dare let part of the environment get between your character and the camera during combat, because you'll not know what's happening any longer. Where other games make these beits of environment become semi-transparent, or temporarily disappear, in this game they stay solid, and you lose any sense of the fight. Combine this all with the movement problems and combat problems, and the instances all feel like a vague chore.

- Story/Premise: It's impossible for me to care about the world/mythos of this game. This game makes the idea of becoming an immortal deity seem really damned cumbersome and boring. The premise and first few hours of story in the game are convoluted, under-cooked, stupid, and clunky, all at the same time.
Did I care about becoming an immortal? No. Did I care about what all of the expositional NPCs had to say in the hub area or in the missions/quests? No. What I did find attention-grabbing, however, was the poor localization of the text, disturbing mouth animations, body customization resets, clipped audio dialogue, and click-through pacing of the cheap, cut-scene-esque story dialogue with said NPCs. Hell, the ambient NPC dialogue was far better than the story dialogue.
I didn't find the revealed backstory about the immortals in the first few hours to be compelling, let alone charming, in the least. In fact, by the time I was in the factory mission, I found myself wishing that I was a Reaper, or a Mechanoid, or any one of the other enemies that seemed far more interesting than the protagonist faction. Being an immortal seems like signing up to be a professional douchebag.

- Loot/Gear: It exists. I don't think that I got far enough into the game to give that aspect a good judgement. That said, it's not intuitive to someone looking for a more typical RPG, or even looter-shooter experience. Coming from WoW, GW2, Neverwinter, or even Warframe will not prepare you for how irrelevant gear feels. Maybe this changes later on. I hope it does. However, I couldn't be bothered to stick around to find out.

Conclusion:

This game is really good _looking_ and I wanted it to be fun, but it's just not. It's a good curiosity for about an hour-and-a-half, if one can remain connected to their finicky servers through even the character creation phase. Beyond character creation, the aesthetics -- though nice -- don't maintain enough of a compelling impact to carry one past the faults in the game-play, cringe-y story, and overall design flaws. There's no positive synergy between any of the elements of the game. On top of all of this, a lot of other people in the reviews have said that progression becomes an impossible grind after the opening quest line. If true, that would make this game almost impossibly bad.

Avoid it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002971411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1556659045}
review:
Game keeps crashing during tutorial, and when I try to submit a bug report it goes to a 404 page. There's no character select, so once I hit start game it loads me into an empty map with one NPC it wants me to interact with, but I'm "too far away" even while basically kissing him. It's telling me to go to the barn, but I can't enter or do anything. Sometimes "Space" will pop up and let me hit it. All that happens is my character runs away from the barn into a wall on the opposite side of the area. So I literally can't play or do anything in the game. Sad too, because it looked like a fun time. 

TLDR: Game bugged in tutorial, can't make a new character to start over, and can't submit a bug report because it's a dead link.
developer_response:
Hey there! Sorry to hear you are having trouble getting started in Skyforge. I would recommend sending a ticket directly to Customer Support from the MyGames website. They should be able to help you figure out what's going on. 
If for some reason the support page isn't directing you correctly you can also join the Skyforge Discord servers, reach out to the Community Management team directly, and we'll do our best to help you out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069178696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1606010185}
review:
This game is free and you can more then enjoy its content for no cost. I have played mmo's for years and I have to admit Skyforge looks great visually, the combat is smooth. and the story is not too bad! yes it can be a grind however I do not know one mmo that is not a grind. 

 There is something good to be had in this game if you just want to see some interesting content and go through casually. It is a shame there is not a large community from what I seen. Might be that there is some unknown reason to me why people end up stop playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073324804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1167, 'last_played': 1569179693}
review:
It's a great game, but only until you become a young god. Afterwards, the scaling is ridiculous. Suddenly, you're not strong enough to do... anything. You can go through and max out the bastions, maybe farm Flavious' Laboratory, but it won't be enough. 

    I STRONGLY recommend everyone stay away from this game. It has a cool idea and a combat system I like, but in order to enjoy the game after you become a young god, you're required to sink tens of hours or spend heaps of money to get up to a high enough level.

Edit:     After 10 more hours of grinding (note it would normally take MUCH longer, it was just easier because I had gotten an insanely lucky generation 19 purple gem in a random box when I was still in the tutorial as well as 2 generation 18 blue gems. Generation 19 is the highest from what I've seen, they just weren't maxed gems) I finally got strong enough to be invited to join a good pantheon (a guild); What does that mean? It means I get people who will carry me from time to time.

    Once I got to 144 might I logged out and suddenly logged in the next day to being scouted by a few pantheons instantly. Considering I hadn't been scouted by anyone before (even smaller pantheons), I'm assuming it's because I had finally gotten to a good enough might for good guilds to be willing to have me in their guild. After just 2 hours of being carried in missions from time to time while doing adventure areas, I got to 170 might.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969229810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2022, 'last_played': 1549945552}
review:
This game is awesome. The story, the gameplay, the action... completly awesome...
but why do I rate this negativly if I am so thrilled about it?
Because there is a point in the game when you reach the end of the introduction (what takes really long, so you could play it), when the difficulty rises to a level that you can do NOTHING anymore without a group. At first you had to hit an enemy 4 times, then 80 times. If you are really well skilled you can do simple tasks alone with a HUGE effort. But it is no longer of any interest for those that want to play alone. 
I really wanted to spend some bucks on this game, but I am glad that I didn't, because that would have been really frustrating at that point of game play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072154064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3072, 'last_played': 1692472725}
review:
Vou começar dizendo que o jogo não é ruim e que tem mérito essas avaliações que mostram:

“Within a few hours you’ll be trapped inside this unique fantasy and sci-fi blend.”
9.0/10 – http://gameslikefinder.com/skyforge/

“Everything is served by a dynamic battle system and compelling graphics.”
16/20 – http://www.jeuxvideo.com/test/442044/skyforge-est-il-le-mmo-nouvelle-generation.htm

“What really excited me was the combat system and the actiongame style controls.”
78/100 – http://www.gamestar.de/spiele/skyforge/49554.html

Enquanto você está conhecendo o jogo ele é incrível, apesar de estar cheio de bugs tem uma imersão legal e uma proposta bacana diferente de qualquer jogo que já joguei, mas o jogo muda totalmente após o "tutorial" que quando você termina todas as missões principais e vira um Junior God, o jogo escala todas as missões acessíveis para o endgame e não te prepara pra ele, você fica totalmente dependente de outros players te carregarem o que por si só já acaba com o jogo pra mim, ter que mendigar ajuda é péssimo. O jogo literalmente te joga no endgame e tranca a porta com você lá, a única forma de conseguir fazer qualquer coisa é usando a sua forma divina que da um boost no seu dano e mesmo assim ela gasta uma barra de fé que não é fácil de repor logo você sempre se vê preso e sem opções de grindar.

O jogo também possui o famoso pay2progress, armas endgame e moedas que sao usadas para aumentar sua força ficam a venda por dinheiro o que termina de matar o jogo pra mim, sendo ao fim do tutorial suas únicas opções: Chorar por ajuda por meses até conseguir upar tudo (correndo o risco de estar próximo de aumentar o nível denovo e vc ficar pra trás na próxima invasao) ou estourar seu cartão de crédito no jogo. Lamentável.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042645792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1547067072}
review:
Alright, so, this game says it's an MMORPG but what you need to know is that it's a bit more like a beat-em-up RPG. You might remember those sorts of games from the early 00s, where you'd play instanced maps, beat up some enemies with action combat, and then move stages? That's this.

There's a few open world zones, but overall, you'll be left feeling pretty hollow at the lack of meaningful loot. Nothing changes how your character actually looks.

But how do you do that? Oh come on, luv, you knew that one already. It's got a cash shop. Everything good's in the cash shop. There's some skimpy outfits you can buy with ingame currency, and you can unlock class armor + top rank class armor for vanity, but that's really it. Unless you want to look like a necromancer while playing another class, this game really doesn't care about your feelings.

Facial customization, at least? Well, it's barebones. Really barebones. You're gonna want that helmet.

The game handles leveling through a level assigned to each class, along with a "townbuilding" system, and if your eyes glazed over at that sentence, let me reassure you in no uncertain terms that yes, the townbuilding is EXACTLY like those old facebook games your auntie plays. Those classes? You have to unlock them all. Get ready to grind if you don't want the basic 3.

Translation? It was in Russian. Some might say it still is. Either way, voice acting is all over the place and the subtitles don't match anything being spoken.

Overall, this game is absolute rubbish. All it had to do was be a regular MMO and I would have eaten it up like pig slop, but nah, it had to be a cynically designed brawler that honestly may as well have macros, because you will use precisely two ability combos once you find out which ones are strongest on your class. Don't pick this up.

Warframe does everything this game does better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131259918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 68534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64872, 'last_played': 1656265529}
review:
One Big Grind!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Game sucks since last update, its one sided for vet players and new players you should only play this game if you have thousands of hours to sit like a zombie and grind!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


Was playing this game for a good year or more grinding up and getting far enough but was a big grind every invasion the prestige went up and up till I finally was lagging behind lucky I had a pantheon to help me or I would have left ages ago 

I maxed all bastions, all god paths, all halls and also 2 elder gods as well, managed to get to rank 240 and now I have left why you ask??

So this new update comes with a new planet which is crap it looks horrible and the enemies are way too strong for my level they one-shot kill you anyone new to the game would not survive in Terra I cant and you can't go god in Terra and if you can its nearly 700 faith.

This update is aimed to help new players haha yeah right new players would struggle more, they changed the directives system so you can't skip anymore so now new players are forced to do directives to get further up level which you cant cause your too low prestige and rank and nobody will carry you because half the players in the game are vets.

They messed up the game its no longer enjoyable to do my directive set and get my pantheon resources instead I have to farm directives in the hopes I get resources, before you think I am moaning cause I'm a newbie I was soloing content including icy P before I left I did not leave because I'm under level or geared I left because the game now sucks and the way it is being redone is aimed at elite players rather than those grinding along

author: {'steamid': '76561198044013713', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 2286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1953, 'last_played': 1636078267}
review:
Yeah...it's...fine, I guess? I wouldn't say "Don't Play It." Because it's not that bad. But, there's just something about it that made me stop. I haven't played on Steam exclusively, I have a few hundred hours compared to what's shown here. So, little things eat away at my liking of Skyforge.

The audio issues where the lines don't trigger in scenes, the very confusing aspect of the game after you complete the main campaign, the huge push toward giving some kind of money. I wouldn't say it's money hungry or greedy, but there's such a huge realization later on in the game where you feel that the grind is walled off by some weird progression block. I can barely word it, it's just this feeling that I had while playing.

The gameplay is fun, the world is beautiful and there's some definite fun questgivers/npcs. The concept is really cool, the blend of sci-fi and fantasy was really cool.

Honestly, I'm having a hard time with a review, there were just too many little ants that got into my mouth while playing. Give it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997155569', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1555346224}
review:
The game overall  feels nice and great for the casual adventurers that enjoy a little action around a nice graphical environment .
For me it feels like another destiny or at least a some sort of copy.

The biggest downside of this is the fact that even the game is free is closed around"DLCS" so that if you want  to enjoy the game for its full potential you eventually end up paying for it anyways. Good example are the classes which are locked cuz you need to buy them, for a free to play game that is a killer especially for new comers. The character is the base thing in a  game killing it while allowing only 3 of them that are not even 1 of each makes it sad (maybe this is more of a  personal opinion sine in any game i am the warrior type of person).

You should at least be straight forward about it describing whats free and not.

At least be like Black Desert Online a very great game with a diversity of classes and attractive to all types of tastes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973814719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3364, 'last_played': 1619012380}
review:
The last Update destroyed the complete game for me!

I can not enter ANY Province anymore! NO solo-game is possible anymore!
ALL missions and locations are locked with and deactevated with  grey background!

I have no idea, how do do ANYTHING in the game now!

What the hell did they do to the game?

How can you change a game in a way, that NOTHING is possible for a char level 36 ???

Additionally, you can not get any suport in this game any more! If you use 'Support',
a new "my.com"-window opens and say 'Game is unknown to this service!' !!! Great support !!!

Developers with no brain! That's how you ruin a game within 5 minutes!

I will delete the game and never play it again, I think!

This was the worst update I EVER saw in my 35 years of playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036173291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1555127186}
review: The game is fun for the first chunk of missions and most of the storyline. You can grind to get beyond the story and get into endgame, but that's when things get deeply grindey and unbelievably unbalanced. Suddenly, you can't even go into normal story missions anymore because they are all arbitrarily scale to some weird level where everything has about 86 million health (previously have 6k) and you barely hurt them while they just step all over you. There's dailies that can't be accomplished without you turning on your god mode "ultimate mode" but that runs off of a resource that you get very slowly.  What a serious shit show.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999802775', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1627659228}
review:
Und schon wieder ein Entwicker der unfähig ist die Steam API richtig zu nutzen, statt Retail/Steam zu verknüpfen braucht man auch hier einen Separaten Account/Charakter. Unfähig die Valve Developer Manuals zu lesen.

Auch Crossave bzw. Cross Account Progress wie bei Destiny 2 und Fortnite bekommen die nicht hin. Da sieht man was herausragende Entwickler von mittelmäßigen unterscheidet.

Das ist einfach nur peinlich als Entwickler nicht in der Lage zu sein das Handbuch von Steam zu lesen und die mächtigen Tools von Steam/Valve zu nutzen. Andere schaffen es doch auch.

Ansonsten ist es das BESTE F2P MMORPG Spiel was ich kenne. Thumb Down für deren Unfähigkeit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335999405', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 2470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2037, 'last_played': 1666284649}
