author: {'steamid': '76561198025438968', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2882, 'last_played': 1555023882}
review:
tl;dr: [b]Good for a short time, but don't bother spending any money or expect too much.[/b]

Skyforge markets itself as a "Free AAA Sci-fi/Fantasy Action MMORPG". In theory it has the [i]potential[/i] to be a AAA game, but it's clear at this stage of its life that it never will be - there are too many long-standing bugs and too few players left for Skyforge to get the financial resources it needs to fulfill its potential. Visually the game looks superb, and most NPC are fully voiced with conversation cutscenes, though the player is subtitled only. Voice acting is OK, but unfortunately the English dialog and delivery is pretty stilted at time and makes it clear you're playing the translation. The story lore has a lot of potential but the lackluster writing barely scratches the surface, so don't expect to be riveted by the story unless you're willing to fill in a lot of gaps with your own imagination.

If running around as an all-powerful beefcake/cheesecake is your thing, you're in luck. It's literally impossible to make a character that doesn't look like they stepped off a catwalk. Every character in the game, PC and NPC alike, is at least an 8/10 and looks to be in their early- to mid-20s, but this is unfortunately true even for the characters that are clearly supposed to be older, based on their gray hair and voice acting, so can end up looking pretty silly at times.

It's biggest weakness is grouping. In the time I've been playing I've never had the Group Finder queue system match me with a group, despite 20min+ wait times when I was feeling particularly patient at weekends, which should be peak busy times. Queues that would pop in a few minutes, if not seconds in other MMOs, are simply empty. If you manage to join a guild ("Pantheon") then you'll have more luck, but for the casual player you shouldn't waste your time. The one time I did manage to group up with one other player by asking on chat for help with one mission ("Factorium", which is well known for being almost impossible without a group), the other player was rubber-banding all over the place due to poorly-optimized server code.

Despite this, Skyforge is fun enough to be worth sinking some time into for zero money down. The 'tutorial' campaign alone will probably last you about 20-25 hours solo. There are 4 storyline campaigns after that, but at present I'm only partway through the first which unfortunately re-treads a lot of the same story as the tutorial, so isn't the most compelling. 

Lastly, Skyforge has very recently added a separate Battle Royale mode that runs parallel to the main game and has rewards you can spend on your normal character. Unfortunately it's been going less than a week as of writing this review and it already appears to be dead. The longest I queued was 30mins before giving up. Others on Reddit have reported similar, so that should tell you all you need to know about the player population.

Overall: 6/10, play it for a bit before it gets shut down. Frankly it's a miracle it hasn't entirely died already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198814406095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1534817133}
review: None of the "DLC's" seem to work correctly, the in game microtransactions such as simply buying the premium currency, take you to a url with a name spelled in the russian alphabet and rejects any payment saying it is impossible. The game is fun at first but quickly stalemates at around midcampaign. And is you still get through the full campaign, you can become a god! Although the game scales everything way way WAY higher than you. forcing you to take part in 3 to 5 man raids where you will still probably have to get carried, and said raids then drop nothing to really help level you. So in short, the developers made their own microtransactions impossible, the game becomes very stale half way through, and if you get that far, there is no enjoyable end game. Dont waste your hard drive space. Mind that I played this game for hours and hours on console and that was great, but pc is trash. Also mind that its mostly pay to win or grind to be semidecent. Spent around 50 bucks on 2 things, highly regret it. If you want a good game, click back to the games lists, and ignore this one next time youre scrolling. Anyways, yeah, happy birthmas, bye.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027242079', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 71966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62048, 'last_played': 1569149295}
review:
Vornweg: Diese Spiel macht ( süchtig ). Immer besser und stärker zu werden. Man fängt an als sterblicher und stirbt auch auf der 1 Mission. Wie durch ein Wunder wird man auf einem haufen voller leichen wieder zum leben erweckt. Der Immortal (unsterbliche ist geboren). Da fängt dann die ganze geschichte an. Und in dieser erfärt man,das man auch Gott werden kann. Das ist es was mich angespornt hat.Bis heute. Nächstes Ziel Obergott. Die höchste Stufe bis jetzt.
Mir persönlich gefällt es sehr gut. Gute Geschichte. Ab Stufe 11 kann man in Gruppen spielen. PVE und PVP und Pantheon Kriege. (pantheon= Gilde). Es wird einem vieles Geschenkt. Ja ich kan es auf jedenfall weiter emphehlen. Auf Steam oder My.Com erhältlich. Für PC PS4 XBOX1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061084408', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 6534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2763, 'last_played': 1662095386}
review:
This is a really good game, graphics are good, combat is really good. It took a little bit to figure the controls out, but that's fairly normal when changing from a different game.
I like the quests and the storylines, it does remind me of Vindictus though in a lot of ways, there's a lot of combat and such to level. It's not really the style of world like WoW, GW or ESO - those are more open world style.
With this game you go to places to complete missions and level that way. So it's very much like Vindictus in that aspect.

The idea of becoming a divinity, ascending and such is interesting. It's a step up from just being a chosen one, you're destined to become one of many gods. At least it's a bit broader than some were there are just a bunch of chosen ones... seems a bit much.

I play this one, like Vindictus, now and then. I'm more of an open world, discovery type and like more interaction with the world... there are places to visit here in SkyForge, but it's mostly go here or there and kick butt, then come back to base.
If you like that style, then give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198773478', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1502006337}
review:
Where to start about my grand love for this game?
The Gods? The Adepts?
I was just scrolling through and found this amazing game, downloaded and went to playing.
I barely remember the start, I enjoyed the game too much. I played my Lightbinder and joined a fun guild which showed me the god forms. I remember I was at 18k Prestige and God form was 20k. Then I took a short hiatus to play other games.
When I saw an update, I was like.. "Oh my, PLEASE!"
It ruined it.
Let me tell you my love of this game.

CLASSES -
It isn't an RPG in how you just select a class and you're stuck to it or anything like that, for every skill there is a way to buff it. You can use a equipment slot to buff this one skill, or you can buff another or maybe take a disadvantage for this skill to advantage this one. My two favorite classes present and in past was Paladin and Lightbinder for the sake of them not being  completely aligned to their intentional purpose. Lightbinder is a support class but can't heal health directly, instead you need to preserve your team since at any point they can die if they're not shielded. Paladin, sure. They have a shield and sword and invoke holy power, however it isn't just a click game. Nearly every skill you use chains into another skill which chains into another. Amazing and brilliant.
THEN THEY SCREWED IT.
The skills may be the same, but the PLAYSTYLE. There is nothing to it, the equipment always buffs ALL of your skills and maybe it may add a percentage onto one but its just stagnant. No stat change or lower, nothing. Just increases a percent on your skill and powers you up morphing it to an infinite grind.

SKILLS / ASCENSION ATLAS -
I was gonna comment on the map or maybe the dungeons but I couldn't wait while writing the review I just wanted to make it. THE ASCENSION ATLAS.
Oh my, this was the best way to implement a skill system. Cores to gain in every dungeon or specific ones that made you search for them. Sure, it was a bit grindy but since there were dungeons that give a specific amount larger or lower you could alternate between so it wasn't an abomination. Plus, it was worth it with the amazing animations and the linkings between all the classes you could see. On the Ascension Atlas, you start with your own class' I guess 'line', using cores you connect to other lines and gain skills through them. You can connect your own line with another class line and unlock that class and continue on the process(This was also how you got your god form.)
and when they removed it with this..oh my.
They made it a grind fest, literally all there is is to go forward and just unlock random things on the side, there is no builds, no youtube vid to search up to see how to power yourself up, no. It is just do this random quest, do this random quest and kill this. No fetching or anything remotely interesting, just kill this, kill this, and kill this.

If you play this game, don't play the game. It is a waste of your time as no one even plays PvP, and I'll bet money its unbalanced.
They ruined it, if you're a returning player then just don't play it. Don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107564859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1626747257}
review:
It took me about twenty-two hours to unlock one class (Kinetic), and that's because I only focused on the story missions to gather the resource-necessay for class unlocks-faster. The map nodes that take you to the "open world" where all the quests/objectives are located is probably the worst part of this game. It's the same thing every time; you just kill things or collect something. I'm used to grinding in an MMO, but gods be damned if it isn't boring as hell in this game. Other game, like WoW, manage to make the grind fun by keeping the story (something that can use work in this game) interesting, and many of the quests aren't simply kill this or collect that. Unfortunately, this is what you'll be doing for the majority of the game as it takes a good long while to complete all the objectives in one node. 

As I recall, the open map gets you very little to no resources for unlocking the classes, which is why I tried to focus on the story. However, I eventually hit a difficulty spike because my level was to low. Literally about fifteen minutes after unlocking the Kinetic, I uninstalled the game. I realized I just wasn't having any fun, and not even the class I coveted could change that. Honestly, I may have had a little more fun if I could start with a class I wanted to play. Having to play through the game with a class I have to interest in is a chore.

The dungeons were hard as balls, but looking back I probably liked that about them. My first dungeon had my party wipe at least ten times, and initially I was frustrated at how difficult they made it. However, I realize now that's probably the best part of it because dungeons are supposed to be difficult. Not many MMO's make their dungeons actually require strategy on your part to complete. Unfortunately, this is ruined by the fact that everyone and their mother past a certain point has the Immortal Prototype to use at the start of the dungeon. If you get even one person with that prototype, they will carry you through the entire thing.

Overall, this game has a lot of potential due to the idea behind it (a civilization so advanced that gods are a semi-normal thing, and you play as one of them), but these issues are deal breakers for me. Considering I haven't even talked about the pay to win nature of the title (something I'm willing to bet everyone knows about at this point), I would not recommend this game. However, the game is free to play (to an extent), so give it a try for yourself. Perhaps you'll like it more than I.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014464975', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5597, 'last_played': 1533500922}
review: This is all about the grind. The bigesr problem is the fact you have no idea what you should grind. The quests do not even tell you most of time what you need to do the complete them.Unless you have someone that has played the game a wile you will miss have the stuff you need to know. More then half the contenet can not be soloed, but no one uses the que system. Forget finding an updated Wiki to read up on stuff. author: {'steamid': '76561198139177837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2692, 'last_played': 1615545679}
review: O jogo é até legal , até pensei q tinha achado o "MMO" . Mas depois de um tempo tu percebe umas coisas chatas. O jogo é otimo , a campanha é maravilhosa , quando vc pega a forma de god , tu fica empolgado. O problema começa com esse escalamento do jogo q é ridiculo. Se vc n tiver um clã ( pantheon) , vc n consegue fazer quase conteudo nenhum do jogo. O jogador fica preso a ser carregado pra poder fazer alguma coisa . Achei isso mega frustrante. O sistema de classes é horrivel . EU lembro q cheguei a jogar do jeito antigo e realmente ali era bem legal com aquele Atlas e tal . O jogo não é bem um pay to win , mas é aquele Pay pra vc ter mais conveniencia . Enfim, parei de jogar por conta da frustração que tive . Entrar nas dg , uma ou duas pessoas rusharem e carregarem o jogo pra vc e pronto . Isso até vc ficar suficientemente forte. Quando eu pensava estar forte , entrava em certas invasões de 3 men , ou mapas abertos q antes eu fazia numa boa e os monstros normais do jogo simplesmente me apagavam . Interessante é testar. O jogo em si é fantastico , sistema de batalha , skills , animações , cenários , mecanica , mas a frustração foi tanta q n deu mais pra continuar.

review:
Hello everyone,
I'll 'get straight to the point 
THIS GAME IS NOT FREE TO PLAY.
If you weant to get anywhere in this game you have to pay real money.
for example best weapons in the game ... just go to the shop and buy them with some randomnes attached to it so if you're unlucky you will get weapons for classes that you don't even have unlocked.
You want to unlock another class ? well no problem farm your brains out ooooor pay up son.
Your might (the most important stat in the game) well gues what you can invest a few thousand dollars euros whatever and you're good. Oh and by the way the might almost doesn't matter since you will be downscaled whereever the fuck you go.
The class system pretty much doesn't matter either since if you join a dungeon some guy will go godmode and you will just tagalong.

well anyway the graphics are nice tho.

Do not play , do not waste your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042233478', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 10197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9214, 'last_played': 1535481834}
review:
Skyforge. Feedback from a new player

http://www.skyfork.net/the-basics/ is very useful. 

Here are my impressions after playing the game for a week or so.

First of all, the game [b]changes too fast[/b]. It is in development but, man, it sure needs a firm guiding hand because things change all the time so fast that up-to-date information about various aspects of the game is not available. Even half a year old guide can be totally useless.

Then there are [b]crazy damage numbers[/b]. The numbers are huge: not thousands or millions of HP or damage but billions and more. The game uses peta, giga, and tera prefixes all the time.

I hear the [b]progression system has been recently streamlined[/b]. Now you just have to follow the golden path of simple progression. After 40 areas or so you will be done with the Tutorial :)

If you deviate from the golden path of simple progression, you can find some areas with massive rewards in battle currency. But to get 10k or 20k in battle currency, you will have to clear the entire location and do all the quests. There are progress bars in every area like that to show how much progress you’ve secured. An area you’ve cleared changes its color so you know for sure it’s clear.

[b]Power scaling all the time[/b]
Your power grows in a relatively straightforward manner during the introduction but after that? It changes all the time and I don’t know why. Just to make things difficult?

[b]Pantheon of gods or guilds[/b]
After you become a junior god, the ability to find your pantheon is removed. You have to search for a pantheon in chat only. Beats me why. A test of your godlike powers? Might be a good idea to join a pantheon before the end of the tutorial chain.

[b]What happens after you become a god? [/b]
You become a drug addict. And the name of the drug is faith. You can never get enough of it because in order to switch to the god form for 15 minutes you need faith. Faith is hard to come by. Young gods cannot get one charge of faith for 15 minutes of godhood even after a day. Some people recommend farming 100 followers per day and getting faith instead of followers after 100. Sounds mind numbing.

[b]Progression after acquiring godhood[/b] relies on running dungeons and doing the same quests over and over. If you don’t get a god with enough faith to show its godhood in a dungeon, then you play as common immortals. But if some OP god comes in, the dungeon often becomes rush. It’s like playing with cheats all the time. But don’t worry: a junior god is only slightly more powerful than a regular immortal.

[b]In-game store[/b] is a big deal. It sells a lot and it sells at hefty prices. I didn’t like it one bit. First, if you buy a premium subscription, you get 100% more credits and the currency you get by killing enemies. Looks simple? But there are PREMIUM RANKS. Spend more and you will get more benefits at each level. I think there are ten.

If you think you get a good deal out of buying a [b]boost package[/b], think again. Because you are not. The amount of currency you get in a boost package is small in comparison with what the game needs you to purchase to get every bit of god power. And this currency is easily spent. You can buy items that complete your quests at a click of a button. I particularly didn’t like the talent tree for mounts. Some of the talents, which reduce mount summoning time or increase travel speed can be acquired only if you have dozens of mounts and each mount is expensive. So always wait for a sale and even then you will be ripped off. I’d prefer a spending cap: spend, for instance, €100 to get everything the game offers. Because right now I suspect that the cap is somewhere in hundreds of euros.

So is it a [b]fun game[/b]? Yes, it is. But before you buy boost packages or currencies from the in-game store, play it for some time, people. Don’t rush things.

PS: So many special effects go off in a dungeon with many people that the game’s sound engine often crashes.
PPS: I also like the idea that you need only one character and can switch it between classes and their roles.

[u]UPDATE 28.07.2018[/u]
I’ve learned that in the past it was possible to try new classes before unlocking them using in-game currency.
I’ve learned that the ultimate ability of some of the old classes I’ve acquired now has a long cooldown and doesn’t do damage.
I’ve learned that after the introduction tutorial, which includes dozens of areas and makes you a junior god, you have to complete the same quests over and over to increase the might from your bastions. Totally mind-numbing. I see no end to this grind and I am at 160 prestige out of 212, which is the cap right now. How do you like quests like “Kill 100 phytonides in this area”?
To give you an idea of how little value the credits available in some boost package represent, I can tell that you have to spend at least 400,000 credits per day to upgrade your cathedral.

I still recommend the game but be careful how you spend your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993919366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1534826517}
review:
First off, I Have been a huge MMO player since vanilla WoW and I tend to bounce around from game to game trying them all out and finding out the best and the worst qualities about them. Skyforge is unique in so many ways compared to other MMO titles and honestly I feel as though it deserves a little more respect than it seems to get! Since the moment I downloaded the game and started it up, I have been hopelessely addicted! The combat system is fantastic and makes fighting interesting, I truly love the ability to switch at a moments notice and advance them all on one character, and even though the game consists of several instanced zones in which you travel and fight/do quests it works like a dream! Seriously, this game is literally PACKED with all free content just waiting for you to play!

Skyforge isn't the best MMO I've ever played, but it's up there and has so much potential. One of the biggest drawbacks is that it is run by my.com and we all know their reputation... thankfully the in game store does not seem to be pay to win and everytime I hop into game there are plenty of people running around and talking in chat and plenty of active Pantheons (Guilds). If youre thinkning about giving the game a try I say go for it! I feel as though Skyforge's potential would skyrocket with an even higher player base! 

What do you have to lose other than maybe a few hours of your life?

author: {'steamid': '76561198387436663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1532009187}
review: Als MMO sticht das Spiel durch seine Grafik und die Openworld sehr heraus, jedoch ist das Spiel grauenhaft schlecht progammiert und optimiert. Es läuft selten über 60 FPS und erst wenn man die Effektsounds abschaltet kann man das Spiel mit hohen Frameraten genießen. Doch auch die Tatsache, das man nur einen Charakter für den ganzen Account spielen kann und es einem nicht möglich ist diesen ohne größeren Aufwand und Hilfe vom Support zu reseten oder in irgendeiner Weise zu löschen, macht das Spiel unangenehm anstrengend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127641711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1531858858}
review:
The game's basic concept is interesting, but the devs somehow managed to make almost every worst choice possible regarding all the other in-game elements.

Pros:
- You can access all classes with only one character and change between them easily.

Cons:
- You can only have one character per account/region, you can't delete your character nor your account, you have to pay for name change and can only change your character appearance for free ONCE.
- Customization is EXTREMELY limited. Character creation has less hair and color options than in can count in my hands, and all clothes in-game are one piece only, with no further customization.
- Most of game's content must be done solo, making it pretty much pointless to play with friends (at least early on).
- Few skills for each class, and no build options.
- Gameplay seems fun at first but gets repetitive quicly.
- Mostly pay to win (plus, premium users get double everything).

author: {'steamid': '76561198052547520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 55485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55194, 'last_played': 1529669827}
review: Skyforge could be one of the best games i have ever played: i like grafic, idea, invasions system, classes. But its totaly pay to play. If you want to lvl up - pay, if you want to participate in events - pay, if you want to use in pvp any class but revenant or gw - pay for weapon in shop. Meanwhile there is no pvp in game, you need 40 min to spam in chat for ppl to join 1 pvp match. So you need to pay every day to play pve game...  Also game is very noob unfriendly and each patch makes it even more this way, never saw so many low lvl ppl asking for help simply cus they cant pass lots of story parts alone. Human greed ruined a very interesting project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271146109', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1560605035}
review:
Joguei no passado (fora da Steam) por mais de um mês, o jogo era bem divertido apesar de repetitivo e as classes e customização eram bem legais.
Porém apos o Patch ASCENSION o jogou ficou uma porcaria, PayWall(e com uma desculpa esfarrada por sinal) é jogado na sua cara e se você não pagar ou grindar sua vida você não conseguira fazer os novos conteúdos.
Alem disso apos esse patch nada de customizar classes, afinal os devs acham que você é burro e precisa de tudo pronto..
Enfim pra te poupar tempo vai jogar um ESO, GW2, FFXIV que vale bem mais a pena, jogo ja foi bom mas hoje é uma porcaria e a comunidade está morrendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244518372', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5437, 'last_played': 1521980102}
review:
Насколько мне известно, в давние времена ходила легенда, что в этой игре не нужен был донат для прокачки.
Но времена эти прошли. До 70 уровня ты мчишь как на спидах. Но на этом все и обрывается. Опыта за старые локации не дают, следующее более-менее развлекалово ждет тебя на 160 уровне и менжду ним и тобой пропость, которую способен закрыть лишь тупой и беспощадный донат. От того игра и была заброшена в долгий ящик. И покуда система не предполагает бездонатного развития, увы, но ни о каком возвращении к ней речи не идет.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969070599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1530468582}
review:
Ok, I am giving this a positive rating because you can have some (a day or few) fun with a geroreous looking game for free.
But it's a very close tie. (others with a similar set of opinions give it a negative)
I will only put a few main points (there are more, see other peoples comments, both pro and con for more).

Pro:
- Very good looking graphics and on a top rating game system runs very smooth with maxed out settings
- novel game backstory and decent mechanics
- you get to unlock a decent amount of customisation and cosmetics for free

Con:
- Pay to progress, Pay for premium rewards (quest rewards scale with how much you pay), Pay for Lootboxes, Lootboxes, Pay to Unlock (the free classes suck compared to the paid ones).
While all of this seems optional at first, the fact that they rub the pay options into your face at every conceivable way (plus some i did not expect) makes it extremely annoying.
- Grind. (most content can be obtained for free if you spend lots of days grinding (beware of daily caps!))
- More Grind.
- And a constant remainder that you can lessen the grind if you just pay money now, Almost at every interaction within the game.
- Uses cancerous "my.com" launcher (almost as bad as ubisoft's)

But since it's base is free, i say give it a try! Just expect a game with tons of in-game intrusive advertisement of their Pay-to-Anything.
It also looks really good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198410787199', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1553457736}
review:
La couleur du pouce à changer. Par contre, il y a quand même des plus comme:
1. Rien à dire sur les graphiques sauf lorsque plus bas que intermédiaire. 
2. Gameplay varier entre les classes, mais pourrait quand même l'être plus.
3. Facile à jouer.
4. DLC STEAM WELCOME PACK utile.
5. L'action est basée sur une histoire riche.

Mais ce qui fait pencher la balance vers ce cher pouce rouge est:
1. Crash constamment
2. Télécharge à 1,5 Mo/secondes même avec une connexion qui télécharge habituellement à 6 Mo/secondes. (4h et 51 minutes pour 19 Go, qui à a base était 14 Go.)
3. Gros problème de launcher de GameCenter (il prends 10 minutes avant de voir une image et les actus du jeu.)

review:
Хз, че вы приебались к этой "Новой эре", а мне игра зашла. Конечно не сутками на пролёт, но часик-два в день с братом/другом играть интересно. В игру не доначу, очень сомнительное будущее из-за малого онлайна (играю сейчас не через стим, а через маил.ру клиент, так нихера не 400 человек, иныорматорий забит игроками, так еще данжи ищутся секунд за 5, при чем разные, игроки ПОПАДАЛИСЬ адекватные.
Люди, игра норм! Без доната тоже просто! Ну не пздите, что тут донат прям решает (да, прокачка в разы быстрее, используя прем, но он дается на 3 дня за прохождение сюжетки, так еще можно накопить кристаллы на ежедневных заданиях и снова его купить). 
Жду ваши здравые рассуждения в комментарии!)))

author: {'steamid': '76561198063002116', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4521, 'last_played': 1530174158}
review:
For first i don't know what to say, i never know lol..
But i'll recommend it for try cz it's free and see it by yourself what's inside the game.

Let's just start my opinion, pardon my judgement if i'm not agree with someone.

Pros : 
1. With not so new game mechanics this game was literral beauty, i mean the landscape, the environtment, effect, character, all of the grahical elements
2. The story kinda (Maybe? I don't know) good, not sure because i am too not finished all story, so far it was good.
3. Meybe because i already play this before steam version, the OST or Music was good, it's memorable.
3. Game Mechanism was good, kinda different with some other game out there
4. lot of content
5. Because it was based prestige so there is no level in this game, so it's kinda make this game easy but we talk it later
6. Customization kinda Lit, with many costume that you can unlock later, and it's easy unlock too
7. Fun Battle System
8. Many Jobs to unlock
9. A lot of time to grind

Cons :
1. Movemen kinda stiff, the battle is fun tho, but sometimes like your caharacter was bind to some invincible force that strict you to do someting else, not that fluid movemen i'd say
2. Unlocking Job it's easy, but collecting the medal for unlock it kinda hard and take times
3. Scalling is reallly bad, remember that i talking about Prestige? this is the cons, you can go easy until you reach junior god prestig around 50-70 became 100+ really quick, there you will hit the wall, like jump from easy mode to hard, either you have to do it solo very slowly or got carried by people in group mission.
4. PvP pretty much dead.
5. People seems play with party lock, so if you want to go dungeon just find party first because if you go traight queue you won't get any.
6. A lot of time to grind

Overall the game is good, but the scalling kinda bad, but maybe it just me because i watch many people can get 150+ prestige no problem, there is a lot of tips out there you can follow it, i suggest you finish all the story or something before move to Junior God tier, because if you go reach there before completing all you need to finish, well good luck for you.

It's been mixed for me after all this time too, i like it very much but the scalling kinda a big turn down for me, but maybe i just wrong at some points, that's why i rebuild a new character in steam mode, i recommend it to try, but you have to see far in the game before using real money in it, if you already pretty much sure you can invenst, though i don't really recommend it, so.. yeah..

author: {'steamid': '76561198337682203', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1529100020}
review: Great game! Considering it was just released recently (more than a year ago) it's got great mechanics and gameplay! The only problems (which are can be easiy fixed within the next year) are the graphics and the characters movement when they talk to you. Although. the graphics look great if everything is at maximum, when you put it to minimum, you get this really buggy look on your computer. Almost every character or weirdly shaped metal thing is trying to give you a seizure with an annoying, blinking-black and white polygons everywhere. The characters have ok voice acting but the way they move is extremely repetitive and cringey. The interface is a bit confusing as well as the gameplay in the beginning and can be a little rough on beginning players. If all of these things were fixed or at least improvised, I know anyone would enjoy playing this game for a long time. Until then, I won't be playing this until some things get fixed or improvised because the game is young. I look forward to playing a better updated version in the future.

review:
Ich stecke in der Klassenquest fest... Ich hab den Boss mit dem leuchtenden Klauen besiegt, der von einem Magier wiederbelebt wurde und soll nun "F" drücke, um zurückzukehren. Leider passiert überhaupt nichts, wenn ich die Taste drücke. Ich habe alle Tasten aus der Tastenkonfiguration durchprobiert.
Kurz gesagt, ich kann nun ab hier nicht mehr weiterspielen...

Jetzt wird es aber noch trauriger... Ich musste bei meinem Problem festellen, dass der Support nicht funktioniert, wenn man die Taste "U" drückt.

Fazit:
Das Spiel ist eigentlich toll und hat auch einen guten Eindruck hinterlassen. Da aber kein Support vorhanden ist und das Spiel so rumbugt, gibt es eben einen "Daumen runter".

review:

4 - As classes são VÁRIAS, que você desbloqueia durante a campanha.

Skyforge é um bom jogo para os fãs de PvE, tanto com amigos ou solo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024708829', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1528296220}
review:
TLDR
Too much grind for not so enjoyable gameplay. All while having acces to 3 IMO boring classes to grind for new ones.

Full Version
Used to play this game for quite a while on my.com launcher. Now went back cause were searching game to play with girlfriend. Came back happily on steam and there is where hell began.

Classes in this game was what seemed interesting and funny. Being able to switch and unlock them was really something. Now it is not. I went through 2 or 3 changes to the unlock system. Now it is garbage. You have to grind to unlock new class which you do not know if you will enjoy. This all while still playing one of three base classes which for me are not really nice to play. 
Also this game used to be somewhat "hard". Now as support class I roll through level with out thinking. In the end I only encounterd two types of enemies "hit till you get bored, cause they can't kill you" and second "one shot you to the ground".  To summary it this game as it is now is just boring and going from begining to end game is not enjoyable.

review:
Game was great as a campign, but once you've lived through it all. It just becomes repetitive and boring. PVP is dead, Classes are fun at first but get boring over time. Builds are basically tier based 1-9,10. It's just a grind to do the same thing to get bettr rewards out of it. Otherwise game isn't optimized well, i7 6700k @ base and Gtx 1070 struggles on some points. 

I wouldn't recomment it unless Devs pull up their socks and actually put in more content into the game that isn't just smacking shrubs and alien looking creatures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076478344', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1528145900}
review: Uważam jest jest to z najlepszych mmorp swojej kategorii , chodzi mi tu o pozycje typu vindictuś które jak ta gra są podzielone na lokacje a my wychodzimy do tych lokacji ze swojej "bazy". Nie rozumiem nagonki na system  wspomnianych lokacji bo dla mnie nie jest on jakiś strasznym minusem no ale rozumiem że komuś ciągłe  robienie lokacji i misji może sie nie podobać , ja takiego problemu nie mam. Gdy sie z kolei przełknie tego typu problemy wita nas prześliczny świat gry - kolorowe wypełnione lokacje , masa rzeczy do roboty , jeden z najlepszych systemów walki na jakie mogłem trafić w mmo.Najbardziej w oczy rzuca się luz na jaki na pozwolono ponieważ np mamy klasy postaci (3 na początek , a pozostałe 12 odblokowuje sie w trakcie gry ) które nie są zdefiniowane , czyli możemy wziąc takiego Paladina po czym zmienić go np na cryomancera . Podsumowując gra oczywiście odkryciem epoki nie jest ale patrzać na to ze to darmówka to dostałem o wiele wiecej niż prosiłem, bardzo przyjemną gre przy której moge sie rozerwać  - 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198199528089', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4046, 'last_played': 1528378400}
review:
Pros
- Game is beautiful, it's use of reflection reminds me of warframe.

- Combat is fun.

- The costume system is decent and the game gives you a few nice looking outfits to start with.

- Tons of classes to play.

- A lot of content.

- the event I played made it very easy to unlock some nice looking costumes

- emotes although limited there are some very neat event only ones

Cons
- There are meta classes like most games however the most most expsensive classes in this game are far better than everything else ( Revenant and Grovewalker) they are also the newest.

- Russian game, your voice likely wont be heard as they do not listen to the russian player base either.

- classes that are hard underperform compared to 1 click tricks.

- Scaling is really bad, once you get to Junior god which is achieved once you finish the main campaign 10-20hrs the games scaling gets really bad, you go from around level 50 to level 90+ and all of the missions in the game scale to level 170 which makes you underleveled for all of the content in the game and the upscaling the game gives you isnt enough to make you viable, You will have to solo very slowly or run everything in groups/get carried.

-pvp is dead, you will get daily mission for pvp, fuck you no one does it so pay to skip it ( There are free daily tokens but you can still buy more skips) also there is only 1 pvp type that scales everyone to the same leve and I found it fun however every other pvp mode is just getting detroyed by higher levels with better gear. Oh side note, when it comes to daily pvp missions I have sat in 3+hr queues only to be kicked multiple times for being afk because I didnt move my mouse in 10 minutes.

- Daily limits, All of your stats are multiplied by your Might, Might is gained by using the research and knowledge facilities which have daily caps to them so you will be forced to pay money if you want to make quick progress.

- Performance, for the most part the game keeps a stable 60+ but sometimes it dips to 30 fps for seemingly no reason ( Specs Nvidia 1080 Evga ftw, 16gb ram, i7 2600k quad core oc'ed at 4.5)

-Strange bugs from sound disappearing to not being able to sell items until you relog.

- lots of sound clipping.

- Social interaction is low. this is an mmo where no one talks and everyone just joins groups off of invite links and never says anything. you can try to talk to someone but there is a good chance that they do not understand english.

- no personal flair, although the costumes in the game are very pretty there isnt much you can do with it. Boots, gloves pants and chest are all 1 item so there isnt much mix and matching. Hats , masks and wings are seperate though which is nice.

- Finding info and relevant guides is impossible, this game explains almost nothing and once you hit junior god you unlock like 15 more building in your capital and several systems.

- No housing , I cant fault the game for this as most mmos do not include this however someone may find it important.

- the cash shop actually sucks, how is this a bad thing you ask? well anything you may want is included in a pack with a bunch of other shit you dont want but have to pay for as well. Prices do seem to be semi fair though.

- The god system is interesting but it falls short due to a mobile system limit. To use your form you must save your faith which mostly comes from your adepts ( think a mobile game system where you send workers out to get stuff for you) and they bring back various items one of the items being Faith. You spend faith to become god , the amount is based on the size of the content and you can get upgrades to make your god cost less / last longer however these are locked behind Divine deeds which are recieved anytime you complete a duty in god form. In short you have to play for a very long time so your god form can be used frequently, there is nothing you can do by playing a lot of hrs to get faith faster as it pretty much 100% comes from adepts and thats all timer based.

-God form is done wrong in my opinion, You pretty much activate god form at the start of a duty then carry everyone else through the dungeon etc. You are spending your daily alloted amount to carry randoms or you are being carried. I personally think the god form should work something like Limit breaks from final fantasy or really any game where you build up a super bar and activate a special mode for a short period of time, Giving everyone the chance to feel like..... a god during a mission is better than half of the players afking.

- Player models, although they are high quality there isnt a ton of customization you can do to make you stand out. Something about the characters in this game just makes me feel like they came from a 2005 ish porn game, really reminds me of second life.

Conclusion - I cannot recommend this game as a main focus as you will just be disappointed however it could make for a decent side game/mmo to just hop in do dailies and be done with. I don't see this game going anywhere and it already feels abandoned. Game was ported to consoles and it feels like the devs are just trying to get some money before shutting down development. It's free so you might as well try it however if this game doesnt satisfy your need and you aren't afraid of an anime art style then Kirtika Online may be for you, that game isn't perfect either however you wont be carried 24/7 and the devs actual seem to be working on the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104765158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1528001437}
review: I played this game 3 years ago before it came to steam. I really enjoyed the gameplay and progression it had back then. Not sure when, but they "updated" everything and the game is completely different. The menus are confusing, progressing through the story cannot be done with friends, and you used to be able to choose you path to gain new abilities and classes. Now it's story based and as you progress through the story you have to spend a specific currency to "buy" classes. It's all around a horrid "upgrade".

author: {'steamid': '76561198076724686', 'num_games_owned': 1257, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1527323959}
review:
Played this a few years ago. It was kinda grindy but fun.
Decided to give it another try, decided to go via Steam so I started over again, (you can't really get your my.com account progress over to your Steam account) and it's actually become kinda meh.
The starting experience has been... well I guess depending on your view dumbed downed or streamlined. Open World areas are now extremely easy compared to a few years ago (probably because they're also no level locked so you can't even go to a higher level area for a challenge). Where you use to be able to pretty much jump into Skyforge's dungeon equavalent right from the start now you have to go through several story steps (and skyforge isn't exactly going to wow anyone there).
The reason why I'm writing this review is that they removed the ascension atlas. Essentially it was heavily inspired by games like Final Fantasy X where you had to unlock nodes. This was actually extremely fun. You could decides which way to go, if you went far enough you could unlock new abilities and classes etc. Now you basically just kill stuff enough times and abilities unlock... What I hated most about the old system wa that the number of sparks (the atlas currency of sorts) was capped at a daily and weekly limit. 
I can't really recommend Skyforge because the combat (although mechanically unchanged) is extremely boring (because of how easy it is you really just need to bash some buttons and win now), your character progression has been made horribly linear and simplistic, and you can't jump into dungeons nice and early anymore (many seems to have been turned into solo story instances). My previous complaint was that basically all you could do in game to progress was grind dungeons, and a bit of open pve, but a proper solution would have been to add some variety not cut its legs off.

But don't get me too wrong, it is still a ok game, graphics are ok, mechanically the combat is still interesting, if let down by how shallow the encounters are, and I'd say if you have nothing better to do and you're very curious give it a look. But I can't promise that you'll like it, and probably if you're somewhat familiar with the MMO genre you'll find it doesn't really have much appeal any more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985848336', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1527007028}
review:
3 из 10. 
Якобы симулятор Бога, да-да-да который должен все бои мочить каких то мелких гномиков и чуть-чуть побольше. 
Пипец какое говно, но русские сделать по другому не может, какая-то дерьмо копия хер знает чего, те кто играют в это извращенцы. Играл около 2 лет назад. Неинтересно, тупо, мультяшно. Сделала компания принадлежащая mail.ru!!! А все кто работает в этой компании дауны, особенно директора, которым нужно работать чистильщиками картошки. Все что сделала эта компания всегда будет дерьмом и зашкваром. Если бы у директоров был хоть какой нибудь мозг то они бы снесли свою компанию нахрен и не позорились на весь мир, не выставляли бы себя наибольшими дебилами перед лицом мира.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275898838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1527026058}
review: Gondoltam találtam egy fasza játékot. Voltam olyan hülye, hogy megpróbáltam lejjebb venni a grafikát tutorial közben, annak ellenére, hogy a High beállításokat ajánlották. Nos, állítottam mindent, 4x újraindítottam a gépet, a játékban is kattintottam mindenhova hátha megjavul, de semmi. Highról mediumra raktam a játékot, kifagyott ÉS AZÓTA SE HOZ BE SEMMIT. Se képességek, se útmutató hogy mégis miafaszt csináljak, se semmi. Így kb negyed óra játék (+ fél óra próbálkozás) után feladtam, mivel odáig jutottam hogy class-t kellene választanom, de ugye azt se láttam, hogy hogy kell, a billentyűzeten végig nyomtam mindent, kilépni is csak ctrl alt del. Mint mondtam, High beállításokat javasoltak, ez azoknak szól akik szeretnek odaírkálni mindenhova, hogy nem krumpliról meg kenyérpirítóról kellene játszani. Sajnos videók alapján nagyon megtetszett a játék, és szivesen ki is próbálnám, de egyszerűen lehetetlen. Ha véletlenül olyan valaki is elolvassa ezt akivel történt hasonló, és meg is oldotta, annak hálás lennék ha segítene, akár komment akár bejelöl ismerősnek. Amíg ez így van addig az értékelésem egy -10/10es, elfogadhatatlan egy ilyen "bug". :)

review:
hát én ezt a játékot nem sorolnám a warframe-hez mert ott nem kell annyit szarakodni 1 karakterrért mint itt 
ezt nagyon nehéz megszokni hogy össze vissza kell váltogatni a karakterek között mert majd nem minden mapon össze vissza kell váltogatni a karakterek között és nem elég hogy rohadt drágák a karakterek de,még a felük 1 kalapszart sem ér.
azért az érdekes hogy majdnem minden karinak van gyengesége nem 1x volt hogy 1 pályán vagy 10x meghaltam  mire észre vettem hogy a buffer karaktert kelet volna be vinnem érdekes hogy azzal vittem ki a felét.
na mind1 level szint az nincs ne is számítsatok rá.
prestige -et kell növelni ami  baromi lassan megy fell és csak úgy lehet emelni hogy épületeket kell fejleszteni legalább is a klán szerint ami vagyok azt mondta.
és normális fegyvert nem lehet még farmolni sem benne azt meg kell venni mert milyen játék lenne az ha ki is lehetne farmolni ebbe a játékba nem lehet úgy játszani mint a warframe-ben hogy ki farmolgatsz dolgokat és erősíted magad vele vagy eladod ilyenre ne is számítsatok ha leszeditek magyar klánok vannak akik legtöbbször segítenek elmagyarázzák neked hogy mit merre meddig kell csinálni de.kb ennyi. sok sikert a játékhoz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036449598', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1525455353}
review:
Me hubiera gustado muchísimo poder haberle dedicado más horas, pero el que tengas que avanzar todo el tiempo de juego que llevo antes de jugar con tus amigos, que era el plan que tenía desde el principio, me hizo la experiencia muy aburrida. Me gustaría mucho que mejorasen ese aspecto, además del doblaje que, con todo el respeto, parece que haya venido enlatado.
Es una lástima, el juego estéticamente es precioso, pero la historia no tiene gancho ninguno y los diálogos invitan a saltártelos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062002473', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1557272783}
review:
É um MMO bem divertido, a variedade entre classes é muito divertida também. No entanto, pode ser repetitivo as vezes, apesar de instâncias lindas e até diferentes dependendo de qual província você está, as quests as vezes podem ficar muito iguais " Mate chefes, siga na fase, mate outro chefe..." 
Existem instâncias que são mais "mundo aberto" essas sim, tem várias quests bem mais abertas e até frenéticas. O jogo é gratis (já é um bom motivo para pelo menos testar o jogo), você tem maneiras gratuitas de ganhar dias de premium (o que é difícil de ficar ganhando toda hora, mas são bonus de 3 dias até 1 semana inteira), as animações/gráficos são lindos e é bem divertido, principalmente se jogado com amigos!

PS: Lembrem-se de criar a conta no mesmo servidor que o amiguinho, caso contrário, não poderão se encontrar no jogo e um dos dois terá que re-criar a conta de novo no servidor correto (aconteceu com meus abigos :b kkk)

author: {'steamid': '76561198095690408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 15046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8756, 'last_played': 1527956624}
review:
Постоянно делание одних и тех же вещей. Игра скорее рогалик, ты делаешь и делать, крафтишь и прочее и если бы не поддержка более сильных богов, это было бы реально долго. 
-Нет какого-то точно фага, и вам нельзя узнать что-то навярняка по некоторым вопросам. К примеру классы, на официальном сайте даже просто описния скилов нет. Зачем, почему? Кто знает. Про оружие вам тоже ничего не расскажут, где оно добывается с кого падает. Я имею ввиду точную инф типо шанса дропа.
-Классы можно только открыть за искры, которые добывается только фармом. Ну и вы можете купить класс который хотите. Все равно  большинство классов безполезны, используется в пве около половина(а в основном в обще три). А в пвп я без понятия, так туда и не попал.
-Нет маунта и ты не знаешь как его получить. Это  прям удар под дых. Я еще думал, ну не могут же они его сделать временным? А оказывается еще как
Меня здесь держало то что я хотел посмотреть на классы, но пока я их качал прошло куча времени. Сейчас наверно забью на игру. 
Маел ты снова сделал это...

author: {'steamid': '76561198094294633', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1503895820}
review: Oyunu steamden çok oynamadım ama kendi launcher ından uzun süre oynamış birisi olarak şimdi oyunun durumu biraz karışık. Oyun %80 grinding ama görev çeşitliliği çok fazla olmadığı için bir yerden sonra hep aynı yerleri dönüyorsun. Oyunda level yerine prestige sistemi var ve prestige sınırı yok ( sürekli artırıyorlar tam süreyi bilmiyorum ne aralıkla ) ama yeni başlayanların son prestige oyunculara yetişmesi çok zor değil güzel bir pantheon bulursanız size zaten görevlerde yardım ederler. Class sistemi oyunun en güzel kısmı herhalde. Bir class seçmiyorsunuz classlar arasında geçiş yapmak serbest classlara ayrı ayrı item diziyorsunuz hepsinin kendi loadout u var. (Gerçi classları normalde atlası bitirrken açıyorduk şu anda biraz farklı gem geldi galiba gemle alınıyor tam bilmiyorum.) Ve oyunun en büyük - si oynayanı olmaması evet oyuncu sayısı çok az. Oyunu bırakmamın sebeplerinden biri de buydu zaten. Şu dakikadan sonrada pek ilgi duyacağını sanmıyorum ama şu anki oyuncu sayısıyla bile gayet oynanabilir bir oyun.

review: Skyforge ist ein aktion geladenes MMO erinnert mich stark an Zeiten von Phantasy Star Online man könnte es bald als nachfolger sehen. Instanzierte bereiche mit top Grafik und gutem Sound in einer Technisch Weltraum angelegten zeit mit eindrücken von vergangenen zeiten. Es gibt viele hübsche kleidungsstücke und da es free to play ist leider auch einen Item Shop. Gut daran ist es sind nur Kosmetische teile zu kaufen die booster bringen vielspieler auch nicht weiter, Super spiel das meiner meinung nach unterstützung verdient. währe schade wenn so ein spiel unter geht. Und der neuste Phantasy Star Online teil  wird in europa wohl nie mehr erscheinen. Also für alle Fans der reihe schaut euch Skyforge einmal an. super gemacht und man sieht das viel Arbeit im Spiel steckt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083542779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1587383775}
review: Ther game is Beautiful in Graphics and in the background. The battle sequence is fast paced and fairly decent. The voice acting is inconsistant. The game itself has a lot of depth to it, and I belive it will get better as you play. However, the biggest issue I am having is the Servers. It seems the servers respond only when they want to. Everytime I try to log in the game is not responding or freezes while looking for updates. Or I have to iuninstall and then reinstall the game about 80% of the time when I want to play it. If they would fix the server login issues so we can actually play the game I bet it would be a decent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353006344', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1575175039}
review:
While the game does have its downside (e.g. Horrible hitboxes) the mojority of what I have to say is postive.
Upsides!:
1) It's difficult, but possible:
Early game you can enjoy killing your enemies with only basic attacks, but late game, you have to conserve your energy and use your moves wisely in order to come out victorious. However it is still possible to get trhough the entire game solo, unlike a vast amount of MMORPGs.
2) Story:
Its ability to make connections between gameplay and whats 'realistic' is amazing. Such as how the re-spawn system is based around how the character is immortal, and even some bosses reference it by saying how they'll kill you even after you resurrect.
And the dialogue is realistic in terms of gameing: it doesn't use too much slang, but it also doesn't sound like the voice actor is reading off of a an essay.
And the concept of reapers against gods may seem 'meh' to some, but it does win over the people who play games like Diablo.
3) Community:
This game has some of the least toxic community members I've ever seen, but then again, I spend a lot of time on PS4 R6S. But back on track, most people I've played with ahve been helpful and friendly as well as at least try to contribute when we're doing a multiplayer area.

Downsides:
1) Hitboxes:
There is the mechanic of dodging in this game, but a large amount of enemies and bosses have such ridiculous hitboxes for their weapons that they hit even after you dodge out of the realistic way.
2) Pay to win:
While the game is possible to complete without spending a dime (toonie, pound, euro, whatever) the game is heavily favored toward those who get premium subscriptions and buy additional gear.
3) (Personal Preference) Fanservice:
There is a large amount of fanservice in this game, whether it be the 'risque' clothing, or the jiggle physics that only ~half  work, there is a literal option to play in the character's underwear with no negative stats. And although it may not be a popular opinion, I do not personally enjoy such features, however the gameplay would keep you occupied the majority of the time rather than some MMORPGs where you just get essential free time to stare at your character.

But all in all, its a very fun and entertaining game, with a fun class system that makes you think on what class you should get because of how expensive they are. But I do highly recommend it for people who have gotten out of games like WoW or FFXIV online because there are similar features, but different overall gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100928746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1584975653}
review:
Okays first off, I don't understand why Steam version requires my Steam account to be the one I use instead of the account I already have on SkyForge that is now 183 prestige level with over 2,000 played hours. And there no way to really work around it  and be able to purchase anything from Steam to go on your older non-steam accounts... 


-----------------------------------
- Grinding and sorta P2W -
-----------------------------------
The game starts out being sorta enjoyable in the past when all you had to do after the Ascension update was follow the yellow brick road to unlock class temples, which unlocked the classes too. Now though, you have to either grind for sparks of transformation currency, or buy the class packs. This part sorta makes the game pay-to-win, because some classes are way more useful than the first three you get for free. Example most would play Grovewalker or Knight over Paladin as a tank. Most would choose Alchemist over lightbinder, especially if they had the Alchemist's Aelerium-9 skill. 



-----------------------------------
- The REAL P2W -
-----------------------------------
The game really becomes P2W (Pay-to-Win) when you realize that in order to make it to the 180s and the 190s of prestige you need to not focus on equipment to carry you that high only, but to focus both on equipment and hall of trophies, as well as completing all your bastions, tower of knowledge and followers for the Cathedral. The hall of trophies has a lot of trophies that modify the might received from those three sources (bastions, tower of knowledge, and cathedral). Some of these trophies only cost a few victor medals, with few meaning 2000, 6000, etc. victor medals. Those are easily gotten from doing directives every day, which can take anywhere from 1 min to 4 hours to complete. I'll get to why the discrepency in a moment. 

Back to the Hall of Trophies. The victor medals needed for it, can't be all gotten from directives. You'd be playing for the next 5 or 10 years to just get all the trophies that are there right now. And in coming months, can expect them to add another rank to that. So you have to buy argents via real world money to then use the argents to buy victor medals. This can mean that you could spend thousands of USD to just get to Rank 4 for all the Hall of Trophies that affect Might levels. NOTE: There other trophies that make it where you get more gear from dungeons, keep yourself alive longer, and bring in credits from weekly tokens that you only get when you have that companion skill. 



-----------------------------------
- Directives don't give any help to F2P -
-----------------------------------
So now for the reason as to the discrepency in the amount of time to do directives... It is because you can stim (Stimulant) them. Stimulants are an item you can get either via the weekly premium rank reward, may have a chance from chests, and mostly from the in game cash shop. Argents are needed to buy them from the cash shop and they can get to be expensive, just 60 worth is 14,400 argents when they aren't on sale. Stimulants allow you to skip anything that is a quest short of story like quests. Namely, the story quests you may have in your daily directives, and the story quests you have if you start the 3 stories up in the campaign window. :-( They are really boring and only 2 give you any sort of items, and they are both cosmetic. 



-----------------------------------
- NO Endgame -
-----------------------------------
Oh and if you think you'll be at endgame just by playing the game. Well, there is no true endgame in Skyforge, its just an endless grind for Might, currencies and gear upgrades. You won't be doing Distortions nor Champion Avatar runs anytime soon if you just starting, and might not even be able to even if you started months ago. It can be because of guilds requiring 190 or higher prestige to do it, or you can take a chance and pug it like I had to do to get my elder god unlocked. But until you get that grinding in junior god and the first 4 divine halls unlocked, well... You shouldn't run Champ Avatar.



-----------------------------------
- Challenge System Update -
-----------------------------------
The new changes with Challenge, Warmup and Nightmare modes, is pathetic. The game is now punishing anyone that doesn't pay thousands of USD in argents to up their MIGHT stat, in getting gear. Yes, that means you get gear that is one generation less than the current generation, which means you barely able to do the content solo. The system will upscale you to the content you trying to run in Warmup if you don't meet the requirement for it/Challenge mode of that content. This means that you end up with stats that look impressive with health higher than 220.0 G (billion) and Might in the Character window would read 750,000 Might or higher. But that's where it just numbers. The actual gameplay feel would reveal to you that the values are nothing but window dressing. 

What I mean is, you will end up getting hurt a lot, feeling as if you can't solo it. And it would take 15 to 30 mins for what you could have done on the older system in under 5 mins. Now, that's not all. Warmup only drops old gear and low amount of credits. Challenge and Nightmare modes drop current gear and a large amount of credits per run. Therefore, the game developers are trying to literally hurt players that are new and/or returning. 

Use to you could get a higher level to take you in to get the current version of the gear that was out, even if you didn't meet the minimum requirements, that no longer happens. And even if you do meet the minimum requirements now. If you can't keep up with those requirements then you'll be stuck again. 

 

-----------------------------------
- WORST OF IT ALL -
-----------------------------------
The pay to win in this game with the new challenge system forces players to either pay to stay relevant or eventually fall behind because they aren't putting enough money into their characters on the game. Example, me a weekago. I was just starting 182 prestige level, but I was according to the table of equipment for this invasion, able to run the dungeons to get the equipment I needed. I even ran the dungeon on Nightmare that Tuesday, note Nightmare requires 192 to have an easy time at it. I solo'd Nightmare of Tarlen Aquifer and got my Gen 13 bracelet from it. The next day, I was block out, and the Support stated that I shouldn't have even been able to play it and that until I met the minimum requirement prestige of 183 , I wouldn't be able to run it on that mode again. Then another person from support stated that I wouldn't be able to run it until 193. LOL, I grinded for 12-hours a day to get high enough to be 183. That took over 2 weeks to do for me as a premium player. And I can run Tarlen Aquifer now again under Challenge mode.

What I'm getting at is, the game is pay to win (P2W) and unlike games like Blade and Soul, TERA, and others, you will get to points unless you are max prestige where you get stuck and can't progress further. When that happens you are forced to pay or grind like there is no tomorrow trying to progress. 


-----------------------------------
- Would I recommend this game -
-----------------------------------
NO! And yes, it is that easy to say.

Nothing more needs to be added, but if you like the concept of the game, which I'm at over 2,000 hours on my account so there is something about it I liked for a while. Maybe try it, who knows maybe you can justify the funds needed to progress there ... but I can not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198371427430', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 24871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23787, 'last_played': 1587515107}
review:
[b]Update for April 21 2020[/b]:
Within the middle of COVID-19 Quarantine, this game has seen a (slight) revitalization in population due to a prolific bribery of various shameless YT channels that lack any sort of ethics/morals covering a MyCom game.  Then again, desperate times and income issues has everyone kinda worried.

For some bizarre reason, despite my character only being rank 120ish, everything is in the 300+ rank outside of regions (the open area zones).  I legit can't do a single other thing as EVERYTHING was scaled up significantly and even on my Knight and Paladin (I tried both) the enemies just eat me alive in a few seconds.

No wonder the game has such a tiny population if the devs are too greedy to even fix their broken scaling (which has been broken for close to 5 years now).

The hooplah over the 'Invasion Atlas' is just a load of hot air.  A pale pathetic former miniscule shadow of the original 'Invasion Atlas' and 'Ascension Atlas' which provided a reliable daily/weekly goal to work towards.  I'd dare say things are even more convoluted now than they ever have been.

You've got Directives, Story Missions, Tutorial (!?) missions, various side missions that pop up, and absolutely zero guidance on what to do or where to go.  As stated earlier, everything is 300+ scaled (more than double my 'power level' as it were) so they're nearly impossible without a group.  But whom to group with?  There's nobody.  Everyone I saw in the Divine Observatory was either too low (sub-100) or too high (250+) with nobody willing to help out.  Group Finder is dead as a doornail.

The only thing I could do was poke around the community, but apparently as a way of reducing latency (?) or just hiding their low population, the devs decided that one cannot see the 'online' status of anyone unless they are in your pantheon (guild) or on your friends list.  That's ok though, because I could visually see people as I ran around the various areas (visiting Thea and many of the newer zones) and hanging around the entry level camps as well as asking in Region and other chats.

The population is not horrible, but new players will struggle.  As one player put it 'this game has always been newbie-hostile and has only gotten worse, oh well just shrug and deal with it or pay up or leave'.

I don't know about you but just leave this game.  Uninstall and leave it far far FAR behind.  You think after 5 bloody years the devs might just realize their mistake or open a 'SkyForge Classic' server or something.  Nope.  They just don't care.

Ah well, neither do I ;)

The purpose of this review isn't to really bash on the game for much (it is still abhorrently pay to win with zero shame, severely newbie-hostile, brick wall of difficulty after you get your 'god form' that makes it near-impossible to progress, etc).

I just want to warn people away from this steaming dumpster fire.  I said it before but I'll repeat it here:  You want sci fi action game just go play WarFrame; that game has vastly improved the initial newbie/tutorial experience and starter gear :)

[b]Update for Dec 25 2019[/b]:
Wow has it been over a year and this game is STILL going!?  People must be really stupid to play this garbage.  Here's a very quick rundown of how the game is RIGHT NOW.

-PvE is dead if you are not a whale in the remaining guild(s) with other whales who spam godforms and are on the endgame farming treadmill.  The others in game are either hapless newbies or bots, most of them being the latter.  (Bots can airwalk, shoot/see through walls, and other neat tricks btw and this game's 'anti-cheat' is a joke).  There are still only one/two guilds on the NA servers and EU is not much better (a handful at best, most are language-specific).

-PvP is pay to win.  It doesn't matter how much you grind because by the time you grind for months to get something the newest stuff will outdo it in power level.  In anime terms it is like comparing DB original SS1 Super Saiyan Goku original up against Ultra Instinct Goku in a fist fight.  There is no comparison and no way to 'grind' to get up to that level.  You will get stomped.  The whales are effectively 'raid bosses' and it isn't fun.  Of course you won't even get the chance to get roflstomped because of massive PvP Queues that only pop when enough whales get together on Discord to coordinate a match together outside the game.

The early game is fun and becoming a 'god' is really cool at first, but they ripped out most of the story and scattered it across enough grind to make your eyes bleed.  [b]If you want to grind and play a FUN non-P2W game then go play WarFrame.[/b]  Avoid this trash please.  You only so many gaming options now that this trash game should DIAFF already.

If you want to ignore everything I've said, then just do this instead:  Go watch Twitch streams, archived videos on Twitch or YT, and see for yourself just how lame/dead the game is now on both NA and EU.

[b]Update for Sept 28 2018[/b]:
I felt like a bit of schadenfreude so I redownloaded & reinstalled this trash game just to see what all the Battle Royale fuss was about.  It is a flaming dumpster fire and it is absolutely beautiful to see in a macabre-gore sort of fetishy way.  Mere words cannot describe how buggy, glitchy, janky, and pay to win (yes really) they made the Battle Royale mode.  The golden icing on this frozen turd is having in-game RMT to purchase overpowered 'heroes' who are supposed to be mortal but are not really all that way; everything from an infinite-stamina cyborg to an infinite-duration stealth character and more.  Sure you could (painfully) grind out the hundreds of BattlePoints to 'rent' them.  You have to rent them at least 50 (!) times to fully 'unlock' them.  That's one 'hero'.  Out of well over a dozen.  Good luck with that grind lmao.

Aside from that, the main game is completely dead on NA server.  Like completely; barely anyone on even at peak times on weekdays or weekends.  Nearly every guild has entire lists of people who haven't been online in weeks/months or longer.  Almost all the remaining handful of whales left have banded together into one guild on the NA server and even that is a mess.  Anyone not in that guild can GLHF trying to grab together enough randoms wanting to attempt any group content in a game that has been digging its own grave for quite some time.

Dead game is dead.  PvP is dead.  Battle Royale is a janky buggy dead mess with lengthy queues and pay to win whales (yes, really, I'm still surprised too).  PvE is a joke.  God Form is basically mandatory to do just about any 5-man run because of how obscene the enemy scaling has become.  95% of population has left and only whales desperately clinging onto whatever 'value' they 'invested' into this turd.  Good riddance and RIP this damned game and this worthless trash Russian company.

[b]Original Review posted May 2nd 2018[/b]:
Not a fan of this game whatsoever.  The old pre-Ascension version showed some promise but terrible (Russian) developers ended up turning this into such a filthy cash-grab that it makes mobile games blush.
The devs are openly and deliberately player-hostile as well as lying & deceptive scumbags.  Do not give them ANY of your money or time!

They burned through the PC market and then proceeded to burn the markets for both consoles until nobody is left but whales.  Blatantly pay to win.  PvP is dead on arrival.  PvE is still a janky clunky mess with abysmal performance despite running on a custom-coded engine.  This game runs worse than nearly anything else on the market even on a high-end PCMR-worthy PC.

The story and premise seemed nice but this is just not worth your time.  If you really want a decent game to play then there are so many wonderful F2P games on the market now.  Or just play WarFrame like everyone else lmao.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118000721', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1642848985}
review:
Don't mind the hours here, I play mostly through my.com. But for now I have to give this a thumbs down. While the world is beautiful and the animations are not bad at all. This game lacks a lot, the voice overs are terrible and most of the time it ruins the immersion. Some are done very well but it is like they only gave a few of them good voices and the rest were done by extreme amateurs.

Also comes the fact that playing up to (Jr. Godhood) is fun and enjoyable even. Once you hit Jr. Godhood, you may as well just hang up your weapons and not play. Whatever they did, they screwed it up to where you can no longer solo at all. Not even the basic missions (not upping any difficulty) It is impossible to solo. I don't mind having to group up for group content, I fully expect that. But when I can't even do the  missions that suggest having 1-2 other people and I'm with another person and we die repeatedly because we just can't do enough damage, there is a big issue. I have the highest weapon I can get at this point, but we can't go further because A: for missions everyone says you either have to go divine or you have to be carried.

However to go divine you need to have your "followers" go on missions and bring back faith. **I sent all 8 of my followers on missions for over 24 hours, yes 24 RL hours, and they brought be back a total of less than 100 faith between them all** You need a CRAP ton of faith just to go divine, so don't expect to do this without paying money or begging to group up with full groups so they can carry your worthless butt.

This game went from being able to enjoy and solo and group when you want to. To being absolutely required to group or you have to pay money to continue leveling. Not worth it in my opinion. And unless you were a player before all of these changes, also don't expect to be able to afford getting new characters either without MASSIVE grind, or once again.. paying money. Stay away from this game for now, because it has become nothing but a whale game.

review:
Waow! jeg er vild med spillet :O jeg har ledt så længe efter et spil som dette som er i en Sci-Fi/future MMO verden! jeg kan næsten ikke beskrive hvor lykkelig jeg er for at have fundet dette spil....jeg troede seriøst aldrig at jeg skulle finde mit drømme MMO spil da jeg i forvejen ikke er særlig stor fan af MMO spil :)

review:
I find the game quite fun

SkyForge does have its bugs but if its anything game breaking you can

complete quests to unlock character skills and you dont have to commit to any
classes as you can change on the go (unless in combat).

review:

Pozitif yönlerinden bahsetmem gerekirse;

Animasyonlar ve skill efektleri hoş.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123588782', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1556988118}
review:
tanrı rolünde oynadığınız, dünyayı kurtarmaya çalıştığınız,evrendeki kötülükleri yok etmeye çalıştığınız bir oyun.


-----------------------içerik--------------

class:

oyuna 3 tane class ile başlayorsunuz  ve ilerleyen zamanlarda bir çok classa erişim sağlayabiliyorsunuz.

dungeon:

oyunda girebileceğiniz bir çok dungeon bulunuyor her dungeonun kendine ait düşman tipi ve boss mekaniği bulunuyor

açık dünya:

açık dünyada özgürce dolaşıp boss kesip görevler yapıyorsunuz.

pvp:

oyunun pvp arenalarında pvp yapabiliyorsunuz


------------------------------------+ları------------------------------------
+class çeşitliliği
+zengin dungeon içeriği
+emekle çok rahat bir yerlere gelebilmek
+harika grafikler
+güzel hikaye


-------------------------------------(-)leri----------------------------------------------------------

-yeni başlayan oyuncu azlığı sebebiyle ilerlemede zorluk yaşayabilirsiniz.
-istediğiniz classı oynamak için öncelikle açmanız gerekiyor.
-belirli süreden sonra tekrara biniyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071936831', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 4261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1997, 'last_played': 1534519905}
review:
+ Beautiful world. It's vibrant, pretty but you can't really go there because it's just a background though.
+ A lot of depth for a free pay to win game.

- Voice acting is inconsistent. Some are okay but mostly the voice acting are horrible.
- Dialogue was clearly written by some russian who took an english class for an hour.
- Optimization is bad. I couldn't maintain a 60 fps.
- It is incredibly P2W. If you don't spend money, you can't use the other class or weapons, basically blocking you from content.
- Story is bad.  You're thrown in the battlefield and fight some Virds(how creative) and you die and you are revive by some god and now you are a god yourself. They wouldn't explain some stuff that needed to be explain so you just be there confused. 
- Combat is boring, only a few attack powers, no innovation at all.
