author: {'steamid': '76561198124032735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5488, 'last_played': 1496252309}
review:
Alors j'ai commencé à jouer à SkyForge il y a environ deux semaines et le jeu m'a emballé tout de suite.
Je commence par les points positifs:

-Ce jeu est totalement f2P. Tout est optenable en grindant un minium et le système de "premium" est aussi optenable gratuitement. Il suffit juste de jouer au jeu un minimum.

-Les graphismes sont jolis, ce qui est un des gros points forts du jeu.

-Les classes restent relativement classiques pour un mmorpg (guerrier, paladin, sorcier etc...) et sont plutot bien balances, que ce soient en pve et pvp.

-Il n'y a pas de système de leveling classique, mais votre personnage scale grâce à des niveaux de prestige (quasiment illimité), ce qui beaucoup plus addictif et prenant.

-Toutes les classes peuvent etre jouer sur un seul et même personnage. Le changement de classe en plein raid, donjon ou quête rend le jeu plus dynamique. 

-Le jeu est plutot optimisé pour de la coopération entre amis/ guilde mais peut être aussi jouable en solo. Il suffit bien évidemment de tomber sur les bon pick ups.

-Skyforge est tout de même un jeu riche. Il y a beaucoup de quêtes à compléter, des donjons, des raids. Il y a de quoi faire!

Voilà pour ce qui en est des points positifs.
Je vais vous parler des points négatifs du jeu:

-Pour les débutants sur le jeu, Skyforge est très compliqué à prendre en main. Il y a  beaucoup de choses à prendre en compte et il n'y a quasiement aucune description explicites et claires. Il suffit de jouer de plus en plus pour comprendre le système du jeu mais cela peut en dégouté quelques uns. 

-L'interface est très brouillon. Il y a au moins une vingtaine d'onglets à prendre en compte. On s'y perd...sans parler des bugs.

-Le système de grouping est affreux et aussi très brouillon. Ce système nous oblige à stacker à la capitale en attendant un groupe. De plus, on ne peut pas inviter des gens à l'interieur des donjons et quêtes, ce qui est ridicule. 
On est obligé de passer par la case "Région" afin de trouver des gens avec qui jouer. C'est un bordel sans nom et tout le monde spamm son message. (il n'y a aucun modo btw)

-En parlant des raids et donjons, j'ai l'impression qu'on ne peut pas évoluer sans avoir un 'hard carry' dans son groupe. Je parle d'un joueur à plus de 200/300 millions de prestige qui nous rush la mission car sans ce 'hard carry' les donjons et raids restent très durs. Ce qui est très frustrant.
Le sentiment de PL prend tout son sens dans ce jeu...

-Il n'y a pas de véritable end-game à part les raids HM et les distorions. Son seul but est de monter son prestige et ses quelques items. 

- Par rapport à l'optimisation du personnage; c'est pas compliqué: si vous voyez une petite flèche rouge sur l'item, il suffit juste de le mettre. Cela s'arrête ici. Il n'y a pas "soft" theorie craft, ton build reste le même pour toutes les classes. C'est plutot "no brain" comme système selon mon humble avis.

-Pas d'hotel de vente, à part une sorte de magasin où l'on peut acheter toutes sortes de choses avec ou sans sortir son porte monnaie. Sans parler des skins proposés qui sont à mourir de rire.

-Et pour finir, le système de combat est très basique. C'est du hack n' slash. 
Quasiment aucune de vos compétences peuvent changer la donne, c'est-à-dire qu'il suffit de spammer vos sorts, faire du dégats (quand vous pouvez en faire) et cela s'arrête là. Je parle de cela pour les dps. Après pour les supports il y a tout de même un certain ordre à suivre et une connaissance du combat, comme pour les tanks (qui sont quasiment inutiles dans le jeu).

Bref voilà mon évaluation plutot transparente sans langue de bois.
J'ai essayé de parler de tout. J'ai surement oublié quelques trucs mais voilà, pour ceux qui ont eut le courage de tout lire, Skyforge reste un jeu addictif avec ses points positifs et négatifs.
Je vous le conseil avec un peu de réticence tout de même.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043236407', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 20629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10447, 'last_played': 1620780059}
review:
This is a great Free-to_play, mostly PVE orientated, MMO RPG hack n slash game. Not going to beat around the bush at all. 

So lets break down why:
1. You start off with a choice of 3 classes which you can switch between at any given moment in the game with no cooldown, no need to pay for it, if you feel like playing support, tank or damage, you can switch to your situation. In the end you have 14 classes - 2 support, 2 tank and the rest in DPS to have fun with at any time. 
2. The bosses are creative and beautiful not only in design but in mechanics as well. From the single player mechanics which ends you more in a hack n slash effect to the various new mechanics that come into play when you group up. The boss attack tactics change from single player to group/party
3. The graphics looks amazing - there is the few odd bug and some lip syncing is a little off with the standard quality of voice acting but overall, you will go ooooooooo and aaaaaaaaah while running around in the vast world of Aelion
4. You have a few choices on how to play - you can either just finish your "Along the yellow brick road" quest for which you can complete in groups or solo, you can do story as a single player or you can go run around in the pve open world areas that offer their own flair and challenges
5. Upon reaching your divine form, the game almost changes a little until you explore more and see what is there to offer. 
6. Game can be a little grindy - getting your prestige up and running can take some time to take some things on
7. Customization - granted you not looking at a Skyrim level of customization but from eye color, fun hairstyles and even height, boob, butt and alike modifiers, there is plenty to get your character looking like how you like it
8. Costumes - there is PLENTY of costumes - some you can buy from the ingame market with credits or things you collect , others you unlock with quests, event AND each unlocked class you receive 2 costumes that you can still go purchase more color schemes for in the market- there is no reason to spend real money unless you feel you want to give something back to the game
9. Spending Real Life Money - unless you want to be premium with those extra creds, chests and weekly gifts of a few stimulants to help skip over quests, the game itself limits you to NO NEED TO BUY unless you feel you want extra. So far we notices no difference between someone who has premium vs someone who dont. So its up to you. Since there is more PVE than PVP areas, pay-to-play isnt really a thing. You cant buy gear ANYWHERE in the game - its purely drop based. 
10. Party Mechanics - When entering an intance, the whole party scales up to the highest prestige player. Your power in game is determined by your prestige which is all equipment excluding your weapon. So its easy for higher members to carry lower ones through if they want to help boost them.

This has been what I've found so far. I am sure I am nowhere near the end of it but in all, its a really great game and cant wait to see what coming, happening and in store.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005389105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1494443699}

author: {'steamid': '76561198323492204', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 244468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235208, 'last_played': 1683026768}
review:
Skyforge is a fantastic idea, the combat is entertaining with a high skill cap. The content the game has to offer is horrid while still being extremely unique. They keep their playerbase somewhat active by updating the level cap and gear every 2 months and players fear the idea of getting behind since it's hard catching up either way mixed feelings since the game is stunning with a nice community. 

The lack of content is what's killing the game or what's been happening since invaders were here. They cycle through a series of enemies which you're able to defeat throughout the year, problem is that nothing new is being added. For me this contributed to my personal downfall of the game. Killing these enemies and reaching certain milestones feels extremely rewarding but when it's the 4th year of killing the same thing over and over again the game loses that spark. You're forced to play everyday to max a bonus rank which gives you extra resistance and damage against the current invader which resets when invaders come. Basically hard work wiped in an eye-blink. I am not against grinding but the levels on how repetitive a game can get are high after doing the same thing everyday. So much effort put in for little reward in the end especially if you've done all there is to this game. 

Skyforge is a grind heavy game, even though they made it easier to reach the softcap the items and skills are still locked by behind a currency that is low after playing for months. You'll need to play 70-100 hours to reach somewhere near the softcap. I want to recommend the game if you have alot of spare time since it won't be a problem. I seem to notice how people complain about the p2w items in the game. You don't need these items if you're not playing in the endgame. Simple argument is that you will play in a scaled environment so it doesn't matter if the items are from this generation or prior invasions since it's scaled. What matters are the gear stats and what not, either way they make your weapons weak after a few years reducing the damage they deal and obviously make you want to replace them which costs money. I am not against them earning money since every game/publisher has to get money out of any source but it doesn't feel rewarding in the end. 

While the game comes over as stunning, unique and refreshing after playing for a year you'll start to notice you will grind for the same thing which becomes tedious. It's like having a second job, I cannot recommend the game if you're bored easily since at some point you have the urge to quit which is fine since it's good to let the game for once in a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178620762', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1552042740}
review:
恩，我在游戏里创建了人物，转了职，刷了第一个副本，一切都很好，也很好玩。
但是，游戏需要加速器，不然延迟非常高
还有欧服是进不了的，只能进另一个。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097145490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1494311352}
review:
*Edit at bottom of review*
I would ask "why cant I merge my existing account that I've had and used for years with steam?", but I won't because I already know the answer. A bit of insight for all you newcomers, its the same answer for everything that doesnt make sense in this game: "Fuck you thats why". 

Review:
Combat:
     The gameplay and concept itself is solid and frankly the only thing keeping this game afloat. Each class has its own unique abilities and some of them have attack combos. The attack you choose is typically best suited for a particular engagement such as single target vs. a large group. You can evade heavy attacks from enemies by dogding out of the way or using a class skill which is useful for evasion. Alternatively you can just take the shot to the face if your class has an ability that makes them invulnerable or gives them a shield (not advised if the damage you're about to take exceeds shield strength. Each class also has an ultimate which, depending on the class, will deal damage or function as a buff. An important thing to note, this game does not have any healers or active healing abilities. You can use a regenerative consumable once every 5 minutes or so while in combat, or the alchemist can use its ultimate to heal you once every 10 minutes, give or take. If you get tired of one class, you can switch to any other you have unlocked at will as long as you aren't in combat.
     The game also has combat mounts, which differ from the regular mounts in that they wont disembark you as soon as combat starts and can actually be used to fight (we even have a spinoff D.va mech).
World Layout:
     The world is basically just dungeons, not open world as other mmos are. You go to the hub of the game, the Divine Observatory, where you can form groups for dungeons which range from doable as a solo run to 10 man operations. There are some open areas which are comparable to the size of a small map in... say battlefield but nothing like the open worlds of other games where you walk from one area to the next.
The main attraction:
     The biggest feature of the game is that you can eventually enter your god form for a limited duration. Your god form consumes "faith", a resource you aquire from sending out your [strike] vault dwellers [/strike] followers [strike] into the wasteland [/strike] into the world of Aelion. They start out with 100% energy and stop collecting things like faith and credits when they hit 0% or you cancel the journey. You will then collect whatever they have found. Not going to lie this new version of the follower system is basically a [strike] ripoff [/strike] spinoff of Fallout Shelter. There's even that text box like in Fallout Shelter where you can see what they've been up to and what they are thinking. While in god form you become many times stronger, and larger, than your normal self and become a reaper of the battlefield with special ultimates for each class catagory that have their own uniqe functions ranging from a damage buff to firing a giant etheral cannon from the sky.

As someone who has had this game for a long time I have seen this game evolve (or devolve depending on your perspective, say... not a blind cave lizard) at the hands of a dev team who REFUSE to listen to their playerbase. If i had to describe the path this game is taking, I'd say its doing a FireFall. So go ahead and play the game, enjoy what it has to offer, just don't invest your money into this game until the devs start listening to the people who provide them with their income.

Edit: with the new "Sparks of Transformantion" that have been implemented, this game has simply gone from "fuck you" to "fuck you, pay me". One of the game's main selling points, not being restricted to a single class, is now locked behind a massive grindfest unless you wish to pay the troll the toll to cross over the bridge past the paywall.

Final consensus: avoid this game until the devs realize that it's the playerbase that sustains online games, not the developers. Will be changing my review to negative until such changes are made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030781215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 67649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45394, 'last_played': 1565360759}
review:
Ich spiele es aber ich werde es nicht empfehlen. Es ist Pay to Win.

- Die besten Waffen für die aktuelle Season sind nur über Echtgeld erwerbbar.
- Premiumränge im Account geben im Spiel massive Vorteile. Dafür muß man allerdings Echtgeld in Prämiumwährung umwandeln (Argents kaufen), um diese Ränge zu erreichen.
- Um die Daily Sperre zu umgehen (also das man ein bisschen mehr machen darf,als das Spiel vorgibt), benötigt man Reizmittel, dieses kann man nur über Premiumwährung kaufen.
- Wer E1-E4 (das sind die aktuellen SeasonRaids) mitmachen will  um Obergott zu werden, benötigt einen vollausgebauten Charakter. Wer langfristig denkt und viel Zeit hat , erreicht das Ziel in einem Jahr. Wer schneller sein will, zückt die Kreditkarte.

Wer sich davon nicht abschrecken lässt, coole Graphik geniessen will. Und bissel zum Feierabend zocken will. Und nicht Progressorientiert spielt. Herausforderungen liebt - für den ist es genau das richtige. Quasi ein Diablo 3 in Unreal Graphik und Third Person Perspektive.

PS: Seid dem letzten Patch gibts 10% mehr Oberweite für die weiblichen Charaktere. Das soll was heissen. Die Russen wissen was gut ist. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198059166129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 18796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3309, 'last_played': 1529110172}
review:
What can i say about Skyforge? well this isnt like any other game you played lemme shoot that at you right now. It takes the fact you being a "God" to a whole another level... it really makes you feel like you are to put it simple. Once you reach a certain point your character comes from being a "Immortal" to being a "God" thats when even more fun begin.. you obtain a God form that makes you the size of a world boss and u hit like one and u have a chit ton of hp like one... do you know what fun u can have in pvp battlegrounds with that form? one person goes god mode than a person from the opposite team does to and u two fight it out while other players who dont have god form try to protect u like ur a npc god... cus u are a god well i wont Ramble on lemme tell you the pros 

Pros:
-Free(Cmon now guys? what can u lose from playing a free game but your computers memory space for the time its installed am i right?)

-Good graphics(For a game like this its graphics are truly good, i mean i seen better cus i used to play black desert online but for a game thats not as big as black desert online it did its upmost best to almost reach it)

-Fun content(Dungeons in this game are actually hard if u play them when ur supposed to meaning for instance im level 6 and im doing a level 6 dungeon ofc it will be hard cus ur supposed to play it at that level not when ur levle 50)

-Levleing system(Unlike any other game there is no true leveling system in this game.. you gain "Might" and thats basically ur level, u get might from having people pray to you, more people that do, more might you get, 1 Person= 1 Might)

-Classes(The classes in this game range from "Decent" to "Fcking christ this class is cool af" Word of advise "Gunner" class is fun af)

-PVP(PVP in this game is nice also, like i said before you are a god... more people that pray to you give you an edge on other gods(Players) so if u have 1mill people who are in your religion who pray to you and your dueling someone who has only 100... u will rek them.. just like a god they want to be praised.. if u dont have alot of people who pray to you the weaker u will be)

Cons:

-Published by "My.com"(*sigh* I know these guys are poop publishers, but i have to say this game i feel they wanna make it better, i may be wrong but this concept of the game is too good for them to go to sunder, as long as u dont make any micro transactions you cant lose anything from this con)

-Community(This is a serious part of any MMO, the community.. poor community means poor users.. well for this game i put community as a con because not many people talk, i found acouple people from my span of 2 days playing this game and they are pretty chill.. but at times i feel im the only english speaking person cus i dont see alot of people spamming chat with conversations

-Costumes(This game lacks ALOT of realling Stunning cosmetics and costumes that other MMO's have, u can overall gain almost every cool outfit just by leveling a class which is cool but i want more stunning costumes and they needa add more)

-Npc Conversations/Cutscenes ect(At times this feels a lil outa sync when i talk to an npc or watch a cutscene MY.com needs to fix this asap over every other issue they have to make the game more fluent.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Well thats all overall the game is complete stunning and great, ignore the hate the game is recieving because 80% Of the hate being recieved to this game IS CUS THE PUBLISHER IS MY.COM and that is NOT a good reason to send a bad review of the game cus majority of the reviews that are bad cling to the small fact the publisher is My.com and thats the whole reason why the game is bad.. if they want it to be better give a better constructive review of the game so they know the true flaws of the game so they can make an effort to fix it i dont wanna see this game go to shit because its a wonderful concept i have not seen in any game before.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965743254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 20563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20223, 'last_played': 1495028284}
review:
So. Leute.  
Jetzt schreib ich euch mal die WAHRHEIT über Skyforge!

Wo beginnen wir.

World:/  NO open World ..das heißt manche Gebiete sind etwas grösser aber im begrenzten Umfeld
Instanzen :/ mittels Port in Instanzen . Instanzen sind eher Linear . Linear heißt vorgegebener Weg.
Graphik:/  0815 , na ja etwas besser^^
Gameplay:/ von 10 Punkten 7/10
Level:/ Keine, das heißt : Hier geht es um PRESTIGE
Loots:/ 5x  wenn die aufgebraucht sind ..Pech ..warten auf den nächsten Tag zur freischaltung 1 >Loot pro Tag pro Instanz
Gear:/ Keines ausser 3 Waffen + 4 x Steine  pro Prestigeaufstieg
GOD:/ ist eine Overpowerte Gestalt in die man sich verwandeln kann .
Adepten:/ sind Anhänger die ihr freischaltet im laufe des Spiels. 
Events:/ Echtgeld benötigt... aber das ist meine Meinung.....keine anschuldigung an irgendwen oder was

Gleich mal vorweg...um sich in einen God zu verwandeln zu können...(vorausgesetzt ihr habt die nötigen Glaubenspunkte dafür)...könnt ihr nicht immer.
 Der God ist 3 x so Stark wie der ´´ normale`` Char. Kann aber auch Sterben.

Godverwandlung benötigt Glaubenpunkte. Die Glaubenspunkteanzahl die ihr benötigt, um sich verwandeln zu können hängt von eurer Skillung ab. Sie beträgt am anfang, sobald ihr den God freigeschaltet habt viele Glaubespunkte( sry ich weiß nimmer wie viele) an die man aber nicht so leicht rankommt. 
Dazu benötigt ihr eure Adepten.

 Adepten sind eure Anhänger die euch pro Tag xxxxx Glaubenspunkte bringen .Ihr könnt aber Max. am Tag 1000 Glaubenspunkte speichern. Pro Godverwendung kostet euch das so ca. 280 am Anfang und je nach skillung weniger Glaubespunkte.Also 3 x God verwenden dann is Schluss mit Lustig.
Und glaubt mir, ihr benötigt den God um in High lvl Instanzen vorannzukommen .
 Ohne den seit ihr 1 HIT.
Von Hardmodus will ich da erst gar nicht sprechen.


Prestige/
 ist quasi euer Level ,.. je Höher euer Prestige desto Mächtiger / stärker seit ihr. Prestige kann NICHT gefarmt werden. 1 x am Tag kann man mittels Quests Prestige aufwerten + in Instanzen aber das ist derart minimal das sich das farmen nicht lohnt. Das heißt 6 quest erledigen 1 x , xxx punkte an Prestige einstreichen. Was man dabei beachten muss ist das sich die Prestigewerte in Millionenbereich ansiedeln .
Also, mit zum beispiel 1 million Prestge seit ihr so ca. lvl 1. Spieler . Die  mit Prestige von 400 / 500 / 6/7/800 Millionen sind dann schon extravagant aber an die kommt ihr nicht so leicht ran. 
Ja ausser ihr bezahlt Euros / Dollars/ etc.
Ihr könnt zeitlich so ca. meinen ermessens, 20000 Prestige am Tag bekommen ohne zu bezahlen, also rechnet euch aus wie lange ihr braucht um an die Millionen ranzukommen .Die  Millionen an Prestige sind aber Wichtig da ihr sonst KEINEN Schaden (oder fast keinen , nur minimal  das bemerkt man kaum) an den Mops, Npcs etc.  macht,  also  fast gar nix. 

Die Mops haben Millionen von Leben .

Vergleich/
 1 Mop mit 2.574 G .das heißt ´´G`` ist BILLIONEN. Da gibts aber welche mit ´´T``.  T ist Trilliarden Points an Leben. 
Ihr könnt auch ´´G``haben ,also Billionen an >Leben ,aber ..ZAHLT  dafür Cash... ausser ihr spielt Tag und Nacht also (48)- Stunden am Tag ,nicht mal dann bekommt ihr so viel Leben oder Prestige zusammen , ausser ihr bezahlt. 

Macht/
so ähnlich wie Prestige kann aber nur in der Kathetrale 3 x am Tag mit Tausende Ingamegeld  bzw. 4x am Tag mit Premiumacc aufgewertet werden. 

Macht gehört auch zur Power, aber wie schon oben beschrieben 1 x am Tag aufzuwerten .
Um Stärkere Waffen  etc. oder Steine anlegen zu können benötigt ihr MACHT. Also am Anfang könnt ihr noch Waffen  und Steine anlegen  die nicht viel Macht benötigen. Aber dann braucht ihr 30000 Macht --50000 Macht ---/75000 Macht---235000 Macht---500000 Macht etc.  Sollte einer das erreichen um so Stark zu werden , muss er Tag und Nacht spielen ... oder ZAHLEN

Instanzen /Raids/
 zugang immer offen also kein tageslimit wie bei manchen MMOs etc.  Aber,...
Jetz kommts ..Loot gibts nur 5x.... egal ob 5er dungeons oder 10er Instanzen , plus 1 x am Tag wird wieder ein loot freigeschaltet sollten die 5 weg sein.
Das heißt wenn ihr 5 x gelootet habt könnt ihr erst am NÄCHSTEN Tag wieder 1 x was bekommen von den Bossen.;pro Instanz, oder ihr spart euch wieder 5x Loots zusammen, dann könnt ihr wieder 5 x looten ,aber dann ist wieder Schicht im Schacht.

Waffen /Equip:/
 es gibt nur 3 Stück Waffen pro Char zur auswahl, die ihr Pro xx Machtpunkte ergattern könnt. 1 Fernkampfwaffe , 1 Waffe mit burstdmg für 8 sekunden und ,..ich nenne es pvp waffe mit xxx Prozenten an Kontrolleffekten.
Ansonsten keine Stats ausser Prozentanzeige des DMG s.

Equip:/
 Keines ...dafür gibts sogenannte Steine. 4 stück an der Zahl,.. das wars. Was ich noch dazusagen muss.. pro neuangelegter Waffe / Steine, erhöht sich auch euer Prestige, aber soviel kann mann gar net anlegen um diese Millionen oder sogar Billionen zu ereichen in kurzer Zeit. ( vergesst nicht NUR 5 x Loots) 1x am Tag Questfreischaltung.
Ansonsten keine Stats ausser Prozentanzeige des DMG s

Premiumaccount:/
 Bezahlwert 3 Tage , 7Tage, 30 Tage , 90Tage etc.

PremiumRänge:  sind Ränge wobei ihr noch zusätzlich ´´ Geschenke`` pro Tag bekommt .. wie 25 % mehr Ingame Geld
3 plünderkistenoder mehr je Rang pro Tag, wo ein scheiß darinnen ist etc. Prämiumränge kann man steigern bis zu lvl 10  mit Kaufsteinen.
(Kauft zbsp. 15000 Steine um 12 Euro seit ihr auf rang 3  ( glaub ich) und bekommt 25 % mehr ingame chash  für instanzen oder raids etc. eben diese 3 ominösen kisten und  was weis ich noch für n´Plunder

Was ich noch zu den Premiumacc erwähnen möchte ist..Das wenn ihr mal keinen Premiumacc im Monat bezahlt.. dann sind auch eure Premiumränge/vergünstigungen / mehr ingamechash etc..weg . Was ich für echte Schweinerei halte, aber ich will mich da nicht näher ausdrücken. ,und ihr braucht Geld um die Kathertrale aufzuwerten. Also VORSICHT.
 
Caraktere :/
 Alle .. bis auf den Revolverhelden, den kann man ingame für 90000 Informationen kaufen, oder bei Steam Downloaden ..is aber gratis ...soweit noch
Caraktere kann man freischalten indem ihr `` Provinzen´´ freischaltet die natürlich immer anspruchsvoller werden

Events:
Im Spiel gibt es glaub ich 1 x im Monat so n ingame Event. wo man irgentwelchen Grimsgrams bekommt,.  man kommt nicht zur endstufe voran ..außer man bezahlt wiederum Euros/ Dollars etc. um das Event zu vervollständigen.
Hierbei gibt es manchmal Mounts ,  Kostüme , Heiltränke und so ein zeug wobei die Mounts  an letzer Stelle sind und nur zu erreichen mit Echtgeld.

ich mache jetzt Schluss mit dem review . Es gibt noch dies oder jenes zu erwähnen aber ich glaube ich hab euch das  wichtigste erzählt.

Fazit: 
Wer wirklich vorankommen will in diesem Game , sollte schon mal seinen Geldbeutel öffnen. Der Casualgamer oder eher nicht so betucht ist, kann gleich Bibi Blocksberg spielen.  

Chat/
Der Chat ist gut besucht da ja immer Leute für irgendeine instanz gesucht werden , wobei dies um ca . 10 Uhr am Abend abflaut.
Man benötigt IMMER Mitspieler um weiterzukommen. Also alleine Instanzen machen könnt ihr euch gleich aus dem Kopf schlagen.
Die meiste Spielzeit die draufgeht, ist die , Stundenlang vorm Pc zu sitzen um den Chat zu beobachtet , wer gerade wieviele Leute für ne bestimmte Instanz sucht , welche Instanz ich noch Brauche oder wo ich noch was abgreifen kann damit ich mich verbessere. Also, denke ich dieses Spiel ist voll der Stress,(würg) da man IMMMER uptodate sein muss um voranzukommen ,.und immer nach der suche zum nächsten Raid instanz( Prestige Quest erledigen um Prestige zu bekommen, Millionen an Prestige zu erreichen)

Noch zu erwähnen ist, das die Machtaufwertung und Prestigeaufwertung mit der zeit Immer mehr ingamegeld von 100000 aufwärts  oder Informationen die man von den gegern drops bekommt kostet.

Meine Meinung/
Ich würde das Spiel nicht mehr anfangen zu spielen.
Es gibt besseres

review: The game itself is fine, it does take awhile to actually level up and pvp is pretty much dead but the game is fun. But heres where I draw the line and why I quit. its solo play essitentially, theres no real coop unless you get in good with a pantheon, even then its then cause most ppl deem it as carrying. Thats not the worst part, Skyforge has pretty much ripped me off and then asked me for proof then says nothing in response. I dont mind contributing money to a game I enjoy as F2P games wont make it to far without actually money which like I stated before I dont mind doing it but its been over a month and my account has not been credited what I paid for and what makes it worst they deleted my ticket. So if you want to play this gam eI suggest whole-heartedly do not put money into this game the company will rob you blind and think nothing of it.  If you dont mind that part then the game itself is quite fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987795996', 'num_games_owned': 1056, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 2072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1561143228}
review:
So a quick "review". PROs and CONs first. Then some comments & random notes I have about the game.
(note, MY #/10 score = [b]MY ENJOYMENT[/b] + minimal thought of gameplay+graphics/sound+story etc.. )

[h1]PROs:[/h1]
+nice graphics
+polished gameplay
+female characters look nice
+dungeoneering that eventually will need tactics
+fluid combat
+many classes
+outfits (casual and fantasy variations are pleasing)
+couch gaming (rather good controller support)

[h1]CONs:[/h1]
-Even if overall it feels polished game, it's quite boring
-Lack of impact/weight in combat
-Feels dull and get's old real fast
-paywalls (to skip tens or hundreds of hours grind)
-COOP limitation not explained (once you go through story once, you won't able to COOP those who are still in first run stage per say "tutorial")
-Enemies become too much of a bullet sponges
-a bit odd/convoluted(not in a good way) stats/gear progression

[h1]Comments:[/h1]
Not much to add. Game looks aesthetically absolutely pleasing and sharp with really satisfying character design. As per usual in mmos I roll with female characters as I like fashioning em up. Anyhow point here is that not only female character models look great. The hair is splendid, beautiful face options, clothes selection is very pleasing and jiggle physical are nice addition (although a bit too much of a water balloons) for both ends of beauty aspects. Whenever breast or rear.

Moving to gameplay. Combat is rather smooth, there are plenty of class choices and areas to fight in. Although most feels rather polished. I feel the combat is rather weightless and does get rather dull quite fast. Aside that I feel that gearing up and such system is rather convoluted and with "dynamic" difficulty a lot of it feels rather useless as by the end of the day it just leads to stronger and stronger bullet sponges.

As most elements of the game are well designed, polished, they still feel rather weightless or pointlessly dull with the whole "scaling" element.

And obviously the worst aspects are rather big paywalls that essentially skip maybe even hundreds of hours playing in matter of money.

Long story short. Superb aesthetics, great waifus. Smoothed/solidified gameplay and UI, but very weightless combat with plenty of unnecessary leveling/gearing aspects.

As per usual for me. Co-opping wins hours as fun comes more with coop/chatting aspect than actual game itself. (but eh.. for me games that I actually enjoy solo playing for longer period of times are extremely rare)

[i]13.06.19 - returned to game since mate wanted too coop, thus updated my review as well[/i]
[b]DROPPED[/b]
[h1]5/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198045870135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1493852127}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056246537', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4136, 'last_played': 1522789867}
review:
I don't really know why people complain about grind in this game.

+ Game allows You to unlock every class for free 
+ 1 character 14 classes, and they are changeable at almost any moment.
+ You are given premium currency daily through temple OR events a little bit later in the game. Also costumes and mounts are given for free during certain events.
+ Graphics
+ Friendly and helpful community
+ Story

+/- Dead queques. I would actually say it's rather positive feature as it forces You to search for group on chat (which is always active) and lets You meet interesting players instead of randoms.

- Voice acting and unfitting face animation on some npcs
- Minor bugs

Thanks to the latest patch, progression gets much much faster than usual. I've been playing the beta version of the game and I must say that people who say "that it was better back then blablabla" must've enjoyed game that pretty much required You to pay for things that are completely free now.

People who complain about grind are either incompetent or lazy. To progress in Skyforge You need to do quests, those are mostly randomized each time and sometimes need You to go the places You've already visited. If something is too hard then You ask for help or skip the quest. Idk where people see problem in that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047641844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2992, 'last_played': 1494171451}
review:
In contrast to some of the negative reviews, I would recommend this game.  But first let me point out pro's & con's:

Pro's: 
-FREE to Play
-Classes have cool abilities
-Large PVE World
-Decent graphics

Con's:
-The game lacks content such as costume's, items, gear, etc... There's some, but compared to other games it is largely lacking in this area.
-PVE Grind contains little or no A.i. The last time I encountered disappointing predictable mobs was the ground missions in Star Trek's MMO.  
-PVE Bosses are too much alike, this makes defeating them very simplistic and easy.
-Grinding doesn't seem to get anywhere.  Unlike games like Diablo 3 which dice-roll for gear, this game doesn't "feel" like it is dropping any different items.


Overall, it's a game and it's FREE & it is an MMORPG.  I think people should give the game a chance because there is plenty of time for adding content & improvements of various kinds.   For anyone who played Runescape or Runes of Magic, look how far along those games came from when they first released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042424047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1493701499}
review:
Skyforge, you get to play as a God, an immortal hero called down to the planet by way of desperate NPC’s looking for help.

Loading up the game, the story doesn’t seem so bad, a little corny, but that isn’t always a bad thing. The character customization is a little limited, but better than most, with a choice of fun costumes and other character additions.

You are then introduced to the voice acting, and boy, is it bad. I tried to give it a chance, I really did. Coupled with terrible lip syncing, this did not help. It was a lot like being subjected to a bad movie, bad acting, bad lightning and bad makeup.

Let’s ignore this and move on. After the first cut scene, you are thrown into a relatively good looking world. Until you realise that there are a lot of graphical glitches, npc’s randomly disappearing for a second, and sometimes NPC’s and objects flashing black. This was a little hard to overlook.

However, the graphical options in settings weren’t so bad but the lack of anti-aliasing was very frustrating as the game looked very choppy with rough edges.

The story continues regardless of graphical glitches and mayhem, and we are thrown into a cut scene that is very similar to the origin story of Kingdoms Of Amalur: The Reckoning. Nothing wrong with that, though there were a few minutes where it felt like a blatant rip-off. You become immortal, a chosen one, nothing out of the ordinary. After talking to a few NPC characters about the main storyline, you realise that you have no choice over the fact that everyone is calling you a god, which I’m not entirely sure is necessary but it seems to give a relationship to the world hub in the game, which wouldn’t make sense without that.

The combat at the beginning of the game is very boring, and along with everything else, it is a struggle to stay interested. Thankfully, if you stick around, you will be rewarded with some beautifully animated combat and fun combat mechanics. You are able to switch classes any time you want, so if you’re bored of being a mage, be a warrior for a while. The classes that you can try at the beginning are standard of most RPG’s. It unfortunately feels like they only put all their effort into combat, which is okay I suppose, if you can put up with everything else.

The UI is very clean, your screen is free from the overwhelming information like most MMORPGS, which is very refreshing and if you are new to MMORPGS, this is something to be happy about. The quest giver and tutorial is very straight forward, and the quests are easy to follow which is again, refreshing.

Skyforge has a lot of potential but is sadly spoiled by bad voice acting, terrible graphical bugs and errors, and terrible animations (that aren’t combat related) but this isn’t anything new from My.com as a lot of their games are very similar and easily forgotten.

If you can stand all of that and stick around for the combat and easy questing and UI that you can understand, this is probably the game for you, if not, you should try it anyway to see if you like it.

With all its flaws and buggy-ness, I’d give this a rating of 6/10 simply because the combat is fun and the idea is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066248283', 'num_games_owned': 1101, 'num_reviews': 297, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1493940652}
review:
I feel like this game kinda disguises itself as an mmo, and being free on steam kinda warrants a little attention, and in the short time it's been out, to have mixed instead of all negative reviews is a bit of a feat, but for this game, I'd say it's unlikely, to me now that I have played it, over 4 missions; I can see why they are mixed.

-Pros-

Graphics - For a f2p game on steam, these graphics are excellent, they feel like the artstyle of SWTOR and Neverwinter came together to create a beautiful, easy to run, well optimized art style, the particles are alright but don't really match up to the environment, I wish the game was more of an MMO and exploring was possible.

Character creation - though it's rather shallow, it does offer some interesting features as far as a free "mmo" goes, you can choose between about 8 faces, customizable via nose, jawline, brow, eye distance / shape, makeup, tattoos on your face and accessories on your ears, head, and mask. 
body type sliders, I like these considering how easy they are and streamlined to make a character quickly, and still look alright. Not too much customization to make it overwhelming but not too little to give no creativity and individuality.
Selections for size as well as sliders to fine tune, muscles, hips, hands, head, bust, buttocks, chest, waist, legs, height.

Classes- There are 12 or 13 classes in game, 3 of which you can start as after the tutorial and allows you to unlock more as you complete missions. They range from ranged, melee, and mage types, bows, guns, magic wands, swords, spears, hooks. And varying looks for these same items you aquire through playing missions and getting loot. Which is honestly more like rewarding you for playing a mission rather than getting loot from dead bodies.

-Gameplay-

This aspect is kinda neutral to me, I like how they want to impliment combos into the game, it makes the game feel like Tera almost, a little more dumbed down and less emphasis on actually comboing to me. I feel like you really can just survive by spamming LMB and RMB with 1 and 2 rarely. The level setup is absolutely trash and it's the same throughout as follows

[Kill these little enemies, find bigger enemy, kill it, find boss win.]
[Destroy hive, remove banners, kill enemy, kill boss, leave.]

and it follows this through 90% of the missions.
the only aspect of an mmo in the game so far is the hub, which allows you to speak in vicinity, and region.
There is not a specific world to go to and play around it, missons are the basis for gameplay and progression.

-Cons-

Chapter missions - Go here, kill these, kill that, big monster, kill it. Leave. You go back to the hub, select new chapter, go here, kill this, cutscene, story elements in a game that has a poor setting for scifi fantasy God's, kill this, hub world.

"Pay to win"
I use this very, very lightly, the game offers packs to purchase, which the game really has no need for. You don't NEED it, the way loot drops I think would deter anyone from even worrying about getting more, you get a few weapons from a few missions and just fight stuff over and over and over. The game is very far from a loot grind.

Gameplay - as I said before, it's bland, boring, and samey.

Buggy - only slightly, here and there it shifts back and forth while doing certain attacks, interupts work odd considering the speed at which you can spam your LMB and RMB buttons.

OVERALL - I would give it a try if you like scifi elements, its been a while since we have had any good scifi games that are roughly open and MMO-Likes.
It's not worth sinking any money into however, and it's almost not worth anyone's time I would say if you aren't a huge fan of scifi-fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145439787', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1493863921}
review:
Alright It might look as if I dont know Jack Shit on the game.
Well you might be correct there.
I originally came to SkyForge to play a nice fun game that wont be complicated.
I was fine with the fact that the game was complicated and I was willing to adpt to how the game works.
Originally I had started playing this game once it came out, launch day with one of my buds playing it also.
The game is good to most people I guess, to me it is kinda hard.
After trying to adapt to how the game works for days I just gave up entirely.
It wasnt that my PC couldnt handle it it was just that well as said before I gave up because I could not adapt to the game and how it works.
If you come from MMO's ;like TERA and SWTOR this game isnt really for you.
Now if your into Elder Scrolls Online then you might like this game if you can deal with how some things work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097981987', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1492717236}
review:
То чувство, когда вроде создавали игру по большей части русские, а русского языка нет =) Ну в стиме нет...

Но незнание инглиша или какого-либо иного из доступных языков, может сломать интерес к игре, ведь в целом там есть интересная, по моему мнению, история. 

Графика - приятная. Классы - доступны все, но открывать их всё же надо, а потом меняй свой класс по настроению когда потребуется. Персонажи - их запомнить легко, но не так как они похожи друг на друга, а так как со своими характерами. Но по своему игра хоть и имеет много приятного и классного, но и свои недостатки имеет. Но на минусах заострять внимание не стоит. Игра стоит того, чтобы поиграть в неё. 
Но лучше я буду играть в неё на мыле, чем в паре. И да, да, да... Только из-за одной мелочи так сказать. Русский язык =)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997125058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1493655782}
review:
The game surely makes fun at the beginning, but after a few hours you will realize some stuff.

Please note you dont have Levels in this game, you have Prestige, that counts for all Classes and displays your strenght.
In the beginning you can upgrade as long as you have ressources. After reaching a certain rank (10 for a Building called Library or 1000 followers for the Cathredal) you can only Upgrade 3 times a day (except you pay 9 stimulants, which will reset the timer). These stimulants are buyable for argents (RL-Money Currency) or you get them from events, which seem to be pretty scarce amount, oh yeah and of course thorugh Premium (after you reached a certain Premiumrank (more money spent -> higher Rank))

Now lets get to the Playerbasesize and the resulting Problems:
I can only assume the real ammount of the playerbase. Steamcharts only say how many ppl play it over steam, idk how many play it through mycom-launcher. But either the playerbase is rly small or there arent enough newcomers (cant blame them though). I have waited for over 4 hours to make the first partyinstance, didnt found a group neither as Tank nor as DPS. 

The Guilds in this game are called Pantheons (they offer acedemys for new players). In an acedemy players get certain bonuses and can play some Guildrelated stuff. Well i would like to tell you more about it, but the Interface ingame is bugged (researching revealed it is like that for quite some time).  

The amount of money you need to even get to the point you can play with others, is ridiculous (trusting reddit users, about 1000$-2000$). And here i mean to be able to participate, not to reach the highest players. I think the game would have potential, with less paywalls and more love. Though considering it is 2 years old, i doubt this will change. So my last words to you: dont waste your time here

author: {'steamid': '76561198164260750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 13632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9421, 'last_played': 1547847316}
review:
Its a good game , you may encounter some bugs on it but its not that bad , you can get strong without paying money pretty easy if you work on your gear , do temples daily , bastions and directives , problem would be that you will get some invasion quests which can be done  while getting a little babysitting at lower might and prestige but after that you start get into gear , advancing into higher generation items which massively increases your prestige . The game is fun , the story is kinda eh but at some point you start to actually understand what is going on . My advice would be this : grow in prestige until 40k and then go find a pretty stable phanteon to help you with more tips and tricks to help you keep up with the rest of strong players , also ask them for help from time to time on invasion missions ( remember those missions are very hard and even if you try to find a group on region you dunno who is going to come ) , those missions must only be done with someone strong otherwise goodluck .
Right now as i write this review i managed to get to 300k prestige , everything i said above is all that i experienced in this game thus far , also the graphics are soo damn good if you love some good views but one problem remains since a long time , even if you manage to get everything to ultra , your char will still look pretty pixelated on some parts other than that its great , the world in the game is beautiful .
There might be more , the temples are much more accesible at the beginning after like 10k might you will start to see a limit for each day , i can only do 3 times temples like cathedral and tower of knowledge while getting boosts randomly for the day ( except tower of knowledge consumables , they stay there permanently until you use them ) also you only get 1 request for help for bastions daily and later on it starts to grow slowly as you progress but there is an end and after that you'll have all the symbols necessary to make builds as you'd like for your favorite classes and reset it as much as you want because credits in the game are soo ez to get that i use them as toilet paper to clean my *** :D .
Knowledge on enemies is ez to get too if you do the kinda ''open world'' maps , at first completion you''ll get a good amount of knowledge of enemies and will have soo much that you will forget this currency even exists ( u can get them from enemies too but very little ) .
Now lets talk about events ( they are called pay2win events ) and i will explain to you why : you get most of the time 1 point of event and some bullshit currency like credits , knowledge of enemies etc and pure luck to get higher points than 1 and  events lasts most of the time like let's say 1 week and 4 days and keep in mind that the soo called ''adept'' you send takes his time and comes back after 8 h everytime , this means u can actually send him 2-3 times a day if you got the time to enter but for those who don't have soo much free time its hard to even complete 15% of the event but there is a solution for those events and i will explain below .
The solution : save argents to send 10 adepts at the same time for the current event that you wish to participate in and like the rewards , they will come back and have all of them different rewards and points , save stimulants ( they can be farmed from THEA ) to rush so that the adept will come back instantly with the reward and points , 1 stimulant is used for 1 adept keep that in mind. 
If you save up argents and stimulant you will be rdy to make the whole event but 1 thing is certain , you can't make all the events , save only for the events that have rewards in which you truly like but you may require to do some research and seek the russian server news , there all the events and news come a month earlier than the english server .
That is all i can say for now , i might update the review as i will progress and experience more , its a good game if you have PATIENCE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001079724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1493805019}
review:
Seems fun. Have only played for a minimal amount of time so far, but the concept is cool, there also only appears to be minimal impact for not having a premium subscription.

The game looks incredible as well. Actually looking forward to getting into it more and seeing what its got.

Edit 2019: Having played this game extensively on ps4 I have to change my recommendation for it. Once you reach god hood it becomes painfully obvious that paying to progress is the model. The amount of grind that goes into progress after this point is incredibly unreasonable unless of course you front up hard earned.

Still there are some pros:
-Game looks great especially on mid range to high range systems.
-Fun concept that was refreshing to the standard MMO fare
-Good character customization 
-Combat was interesting and combo based which kept me engaged longer than other MMO's I have played

And the cons:
-Standard "go fetch this" mmo quests
-Repetitive end game content (if you manage to progress that far)
-Monetization, the difference between those players who have forked out and those that haven't is significant. 
-Progress almost stops completely once you have reached a certain point, with paying real money being the obvious incentive to move forward.

Obviously I know this game is free to play, but the monetization is shady, for instance you can't front up money and have one premium account because there are different levels of premium which is a big no no in my book. I hate these mobile style free to play games clogging up steam and the gaming industry in general. Make the game decent and make it monthly subscription or take a hit and make it actually free to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041076455', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1492479066}
review:
the intro is pretty comical. it does the slow-mo 300 movie thing, except theres no contact with any of the hits,unless the wind from the movement of the sword was doing it.  not a big fan of the starting classes...i wanted to learn how to unlock or play the other classes like beserker but they just arent clear. i get that you dont get all the classes at the start its just not apparent how to unlock them...
the interface bugs the crap outta me though. it just dosnt flow well and the map seems to be intergrated with everything meaning you need close other windows to get back to the map when you didnt even open the map to begin with...kinda annoying. you have to manualy unlock your skills through "quest" systems that arent really quests but more or less just "go kill 80% of the mobs in this level"...it became reoccuring pretty quick. 

it just trys to hard to get your attention. trying to show you all its cool features as soon as possible to keep you playing. "oh hey you might unlock this later!" sorta situation where it demos it for you; or lets you try it out regardless if you want too. there also seems to be a complete lack of important male characters. dunno what thats about.  i wanna know why theres no achivement for making a male character. i dont care for weird science, its not a great movie! 

a large majoirty of stuff seems voiced which i suppose is a nice change from some mmos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045566501', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 35919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14814, 'last_played': 1498279656}
review:
Gonna say this, all those with 1 to 40 hours worth of gaming in this game didnt even make it past tutorial, which is why they keep downvoting it, no dedication, obviously whines alot, didnt bother to learn the context and aspect of the game properly, those who wants a game where it spoon feeds you on a regular basis, stay away from this game.

I did something even better, they claim the community is crap and doesnt help and such, i up that by creating the community itself, i managed to get a guild of 55 going, constantly having at least 30 players online, not only that, i got 2 other guild leaders with the same concept and mentality to do the same, we even created a united discord channel that has no borders between guilds and in doing that, made sure we have an active grind group that helps.

Also like SWTOR and such, group finder is long dead as you have people who have lower might queing and dying, only premade groups exist here in this game, you have to find the acronyms on region chat, not group finder in which the vets of the game continue to emphasize but we still get these down voters who wont listen.

In the end they end up not finishing tutorial and asking stupid generic questions we keep getting in this game like "how to party with friend" and "how to unlock all classes fast" well im just gonna tell you, its a grindy, daily locked and above all non spoon feeding game, took me 2 weeks to reach 350k prestige and 24k might, and it wasnt easy.

im just gonna say this, this game is by far 9/10 for me, its just not for whiney kids, really it just isnt, you want to give this game a go, and a try thats by your own will but it wont do justification just because you ended up not finishing tutorial or gaining your divine form because this game is "p2w" let me tell you abit of p2w, it just increases your progress faster but sure as hell dont buy skills in this game.

those who keep raging on how its p2w is no better than putting a stick in the rim of a bike whilst riding yourself and falling down then blaming the game, you want to play this game and have fun, find me on the EU server where its less toxic so we can school you proper and at least have a chance to show you how to actually enjoy playing this game.

just find Shana NoShakugan ingame, or search around for a guild named Abstergo

author: {'steamid': '76561198080143356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1493534429}
review:
SO where to to begin... i guess ill start like this. As far as the NA server is concerned its as good as dead. YES there are players in the main area constantly but as far as quing goes it takes forever. As a whole this game as been "Blizzified" from its original identy which is what made it different and great. What used to be a rewarding grind to unlock the next class so that later on you could be a dynamic force on the field now you just run thru the campaign to unlock the class then spend 45 mins tops running thru a zone spamming kills to unlock all its abilities. what used to be a highly thechnical game now comparable to any button mashing arpg. the true leveling system of this game is unbelievable over complicated with different skill trees coming from each of the zone along with the skill tree of the class AND the skill tree givin to you after completing the campaign. SO in a leveless game how do you advance? GREAT QUESTION!!! grinding dailies.... yup. power up 2 buildings with credits ground out until you get them to a sufficient rank then run daily quests to advance further... oddly enough im not sure if this is better or worse from the previous format of grinding out 3 resources which were then capped weekly based on whether or not u were subscribed.... so i guess its time for a pro con list...


PROS :)
-visually beautiful
-not locked into 1 class
-actually feel like a powerful being once you kill a boss
-decent controller support

CONS :(
-lack of a player base
-LITERALLY THE WORST MENU EVER!!!!! (if you are in controller mode i couldnt find an exit game button, hidden info such as passive abilities and modifies that are on character that were at one point visible)
-as a whole the game is just a grind fest... grind thru campaign to unlock classes, grind thru kills to unlock abilities, grind thru everything to be useful
-outside of combat theres not any gameplay.
-has been oversimplified from what it originally was to become a game thats nothing like the original
-HUGE balance issues betwean classes to the point where IMO some are unplayable (atleast until high tier play {where theoretically the others are still better]}

over all id have to suggest not wasting the time to download this game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198262339853', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 4665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2806, 'last_played': 1535573381}
review: Определенно рекомендую! И именно издание от Steam, не от Mail.ru, т.к. они окончательно испаганили игру. Пусть без русского, но именно от Steam, тогда вы и получите море удовольствия. Ну а что касательно игры, то это для меня новое дыхание, в мире MMORPG. Вот, кто-бы что не говорил о ней, якобы донат тут есть, якобы для кого-то она не оптемизирована, то в плане себя, я всего этого не заметил. Все что покупается за донат, я уже смог купить накопив тот же самый донат, проходя миссии по карьере и на островах. Плюсов у игры куча, начиная от разнооброзия маунтов, заканчивая различными костюмами для персонажа. Очень радует то, что здесь просто уйма классов, которых вы ранее 100% не встречали. Алхимик, "Ковбой" и т.д. Но еще больше радует то, что вы не обязаны играть за один класс, вы играете за ВСЕХ, и качаете их по отдельности. Захотел, за 5 секунд переключился на другой класс, и все, играй! Способностей здесь так же много, на одни класс по 6-10 способностей. Радует. Боевка динамичная, особенно против боссов, которые так же могут похвастатся своим разнообразием, и уникальностью не только своего вида, но и тех-же способностей. Присутствует сюжет, при том с НЕОЖИДАННОЙ развязкой и драмой. Море миссий и просто условно-свободного мира, где вы отправляетесь на различные локации, коих много, и бегая по ним, выполняете миссии, убивая мобов и боссов. Вместе с вами бегает куча народу, выполняя те-же миссии. Онлайн огромный, на каждом участке 2на2, по 10 человек, это радует. Миссии кстати не из легких бывают, особенно если при полете на планету вы выбрали тяжелый уровень, поэтому, рекомендую кооперироватся с людьми, которых встречаете по пути, комьюнити тут доброе, и всегда поможет, проверено! Оружия так же не мало на выбор. Помимо этого всяческие вспомогательные средства есть, начиная от аптечек, заканчивая бустом на дамаг во время сражения с боссом. Стало скучно? Слетайте на развлекательную зону, и потанцуйте с другими игроками! :) Так-же очень хочется выделить ПРЕКРАСНЫЕ пейзажи, очень много скринов сделал на их фоне, очень радует вид. Игра сделана добротно, и видно, что с душой. Ивенты часто, и не сильно тяжелые. За неделю выполнения миссий по ивентам, забераю главный приз, кто-то даже и быстрей. Разработчики молодцы, главное не бросайте это дело, и не добавляйте уйму доната, ибо это погубит столь прекрасную игру. Кстати, я забыл сказать о фауне, она так же тут прекрасна. Из минусов, выделю лишь подлагивания во время жестких замесов, но это уже минус лично мной, т.к. ПеКа не очень ТОП'овый. Для фанатов PVP, тоже есть уйма карт под этот режим, где стабильный большой онлайн. Режимы там так же есть. Я бы еще мог долго рассписывать про эту игру, и про то, что есть уйма данжев, полетов на разные вылазки компанией, кланом или рандомными людьми, но это вам нужно увидить самому. Удачи вами в игре, в прекрасной Skyforge!

review: I honestly LOVE Skyforge. The starting classes have a unique spin on the traditional tank, DPS, and support roles that are in many other MMORPGs, and allow those roles to do their job splendedly while also making them easy to play in solo play. My only thing with the game is that the text can be very difficult to see when you are getting hints and such during the tutorial: I have to look to the sky in order to read the grey text that is there. Otherwise this is a splended game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083681085', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1613251637}
review:
Played 19 hours total, 14 of those in one stint. The combat is fun, the graphics are nice, the animations are amazing, but that doesn't outweigh the downsides.

Here's just a few:
- Tiered premium system
- Forced into daily play to be able to progress (comes to the point where you either pay or wait to level up, which is essential to progress)
- Awful grammar. I mean honestly, it's just awful. I had to read some skill tooltips multiple times, then play with them wrong for an hour, then read a lot more before actally understanding what they meant.
- Horrible UI/Inventory system. Clunky and slow to use, felt like it was designed for consoles. Made grouping more difficult than it needed to be
- Repetitive gameplay. Came to the point where it was walk into area, kill trash, activate objective, kill boss, rinse and repeat. Public areas weren't much different, most of them were "kill X many enemies and fetch X many Y".


Until this game gets a serious rework on a lot of the mechanics, someone that speaks English natively to redo basically every piece of text and kills the heavily mobile feeling premium system, I can't see it progressing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330457015', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 10507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9967, 'last_played': 1548400713}
review:
23 10 2017
Oyun bitmiş tekrar bir bakayım dedim hala p2w mi diye oyuncusu baya azalmış dungeonlarda oyuncu bulunmuyor 5 dk sırada kalıyorsun nafile , oyun güzel fakat yayımlaması kötü.
Oyunu nerde bıraktın dersenizde 170 saat uğraşıp 10 m prestij kastığımda bi türk oyuncunun para yatırarak 2 günde 100m prestij kastıgını gördüğümde bıraktım.
---------------

Öncelikle oyunu oynayanlar bana ulaşabilir beraber oynayabiliriz 

Şimdi gelelim incelemeye ben mmorpg oyunlarını hiç sevmem yok oraya git bunu al götür falan nefret ederim ama resimlerine baktıgımda bu oyunun farklı oldugunu gördüm 15 gb tı sabırla indirdim . Kısaca bahsedecek olursak :
-Bir karakter seçiyorsunuz ve bu karakteri düzeltme şansınız olmuyor fakat story geregi bi kaç kez size düzeltme imkanı sunuluyor başka bir karakterde açamıyorsunuz .
-Oyunda şuan 14 sınıf var . Zırh kasıyım hiç hasar yemeyim gibi birşey yok zırh görünüm sadece silah kolye gibi şeyler takılıyor onları elde etmekte kolay sınıf lar arası geçiş mevcut birinden sıkıldıgınızda digerine geçebiliyorsunuz
-Görevler çok akıcı bir görevi ard arda 5 6 kez yapsanız dahi zor sıkılırsınız ki birde grup olarak yaptıgınız düşünün
-Divine gibi bir özelligi var boyutunuz ve gücünüz cogalıyor 
-Eposide görevleri harita görevleri divine görevleri günlük görevler might görevleri gibi birçok görev mevcut yani oyun bitmiyor
-Ortamlar harika haritalar yaratıklar canavarlar bosslar muhteşem tasarlanmış sinir stress kalmıyor

Yaklaşık 60 saat oynadım ve sıkılmadım kararsız olanlara veya değişik oyunlar arayanlara şiddetle tavsiye ederim

review: This game is ungodly disapointing, from the very begging. The graffics are outdated and the lip movment are off. and the thing that pissed me off the most is the fact that you can only choose three classes out of like twelve (12), wich all look amazing! And you want to know how to get these classes? by playing through the game. that is the biggest fuck you from a game since elder scrolls online. author: {'steamid': '76561198037775724', 'num_games_owned': 1099, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 14753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3898, 'last_played': 1532922165}
review:
Juegaso <3 lml

Pros:
-Si te encantan los juegos con jugabilidad hack & slash con muchos combos este juego es para vos.
-Esta tan excelentemente optimizado el juego que si tenes una pc igual de porqueria que la mia vas a poder jugarlo tranquilamente entre 20 y 30 fps con configuracion en medio en graficos con resolucion 1280x720 y si jugas todo al minimo entre 30 y 50 fps garantizados con la misma resolucion (las especificaciones de mi PC lo podes ver en la informacion de mi perfil).
-Podes usar todas las clases en tu pj.
-Podes cambiar de clase las veces que queiras, en cualquier momento y en donde quieras.
-Las vestimentas no te dan ningun bonus para el personaje, solo sirven como decoracion.
-Es jugable aun teniendo 300 de ping.
-Cada vez que finalizas el mismo dungeon va aumentando su nivel de dificultad y las recompensa aumentan, tambien mientras mas jugadores son mas dificil es.
-Las vestimentas son gratis y desbloqueables a medida que completas ciertas misiones.
-Podes personalizar a tu personaje todas las veces que quieras, cuando quieras y en el momento que sea.
-Hay monturas de variados tipos.
-Los mapas son enormes.
-Hay una gran variedad de clases y habilidades.
-Las clases las podes desbloquear haciendo misiones como las habilidades tambien.
-Gran cantidad de misiones asi que tenes asegurado muchas horas de juego.
-Podes ascender a Dios.
-Las PJ femeninas estan bien zukulentas.
-Es facil encontrar los objetivos de la mision ya que te los marca el juego.
-Si moris haciendo una dungeon no pasa nada porque podes revivir las veces que quieras hasta finalizarlo.
-Si finalizas una dungeon en tiempo record te dan una gran recompensa.
-No es pay to win, items especiales, vestimenta, entre otras tantas cosas las conseguis facilmente sin pagar.
-No existen los niveles.
-Al estar en otro idioma no es problema a la hora de cumplir los objetivos y para que sirve cada item, entre otras cosas.
-Jugarlo en Steam te regalan una clase muy op.
-Se puede jugarlo con un mando de Xbox 360.



Contras
-Si moris en una dungeon los enemigos que no mataste pero le haz quitado vida se les llena automaticamente.
-Mientras mas tiempo pases en la dungeon la recompensa disminuye.
-Es recomendable jugarlo con amigos porque una vez que finalizas la historia se pone repetitivo.
-El pvp esta muerto.
-En la beta el juego era mas dificil en las misiones y era mas dificil conseguir desbloquear las clases.
-Al no haber textos y subtitulos en español no se puede disfrutar de la historia del juego al no saber ninguno de los 3 idiomas que hay en el juego.
-No se puede jugar con un mando cualquiera si no es uno de Xbox 360 por mas que le pongas un programa para emular  ese mando, solo sirve el Xppader pero no te alcanzan los botones para poder usar todas las habilitades.
-No es recomendable jugarlo con 2 gb de ram para abajo porque llega un momento que el juego se come toda la ram y se te cierra el juego dependiendo que tan lleno de cosas tenga el mapa en donde estas.
-Hay unos cuantos bugs pero no molestan al menos que seas un amante de lo perfecto.
-No es recomendable jugar al pvp si tenes mas de 200 de ping.
-Solo podes crearte un personaje por cuenta.
-Las vestimentas no te dan ningun bonus para el personaje, solo sirven como decoracion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970427649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3155, 'last_played': 1500802186}
review:
Been playing this game for a couple of weeks now and have generally enjoyed it.

The combat system is fairly intuitive and easy to get to grips with.

However there is a lot about the game that is less easy to understand...such as what all the various items and artefacts you collect are for and how you use them. The quest system can be a bit baffling too, with main "tutorial" quests, additional side quests, directives from the gods etc. There is also nothing in the game to tell you / show you your progess from Immortal to God. I had to search for forums and other reviews on external sites, to get a lot of my questions answered.

Plus I found it a bit frustrating having to re-visit the same maps over and over, to complete essentially the same quest with a couple of different objectives. I also found it impossible to do any of the group quests, as there were never any other players wanting to do them at the same time. Using the in-game chat function is pretty useless in this regard. Ended up using stimulants (one of the in-game resources you collect) to skip them.

So, if you're a fairly persistent kind of person that doesn't mind a bit of repetition, this could be your kind of game. Graphics-wise its very nice-looking and the variety of character classes can help keep things interesting when you find yourself going back to a map for the 5th or 6th time.

review:

- Enemy design is EXTREMELY repetitive and they have no interesting skills whatsoever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206904175', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1604389094}
review:
Hey All,
I did alot of reseach on this game before purchasing it.

First off let me say that yes I know it takes a lot of time, money,effert and resources to make a game.

With this game I find it wanting and in need of some serious envirmental feel upgrades ( when playing it I felt like I was playing it inside a plastic bag...not a good feel at all) hence this effected me threw out the entire game. It really needs a much better user interface. The one in this game kept making me wonder if I had missed an up grade on gear or a charactor upgrade or what?. And again this effected me by constantly causing me to wondering if I had better gear and how to go find out and so on while I was fighting the enemy. I am really thinking that I have wasted my hard earned money and should do more research on the next game I purhase.

Respectfully,
Kalixrii

author: {'steamid': '76561198006986577', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 467, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1492474766}
review: An mmo with a neat class system and instanced missions.  Being able to switch freely between classes is neat I suppose, but all the classes have pretty much the same abilities with slight differences.  Along with the generic mmo combat and not-so-microtransactions everywhere, I feel there's other mmos worth playing instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198225209508', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1493443895}
review:
Personally I am not interested in MMORPG games but I decided to give this one a try anyway because of its gameplay trailer. After waiting a couple of hours for it to download (I don't have the best internet), I run the game and notice an additional launcher in the game where I am then prompted to update and DOWNLOAD more files before getting the game to run, that was the first downside to this game. 

The gameplay itself is pretty quick, it reminds me of Warframe if you're into that, and it keeps the gamer interested in its content from the get-go.

The only cons I had here were the constant loading screens & the additional launcher (upon launching the game through steam). Other than that, as for pros wise, the story looks interesting, the graphics are pretty good for a f2p, and the fact that it kept me some-what interested in an MMORPG game even though I am not a fan of MMORPGS is a great reason to give this game a shot for yourself.

I would not reccomend this to the average modern gamer though, it feels like a PS2 game in my honest opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258465249', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1492658102}
review:
Um bom MMO, porém repetitivo, sem alguem pra jogar junto se torna cansativo, tudo que você consegue nele, vem muito fácil, perde a graça. Tem uma boa variedade de classes, areas para completar, quests, armas, mas tudo vem muito fácil. O jogo conta com 14 Classes, e cada uma delas tem suas habilidades, você pode trocar a hora que quiser de classe, pode ser tudo, o problema é que você libera tudo muito rápido e isso tira a graça do jogo, completa as Dungeons com muita facilidade, isso deixa o jogo meio "bleh".

A história do jogo é genial, tem sua própria mitologia e tudo mais, isso que me fez jogar ele bastante, mas chegou um ponto que eu não aguentei mais, de tão fácil que ele era.

Os gráficos dele são incríveis, é tudo muito bem trabalhado, inclusive o Level Design, mas gráficos não são tudo...

5/10 - "Bons gráficos, belo universo, mas é tão fácil que dá sono"

author: {'steamid': '76561197974578392', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1493273128}
review:
i played on release 100+ hours and now some years later some hours. (charakter was deleted so i start new)
last time it was really ok mmo with new feature no one else had but now its like playing a phone rpg

imagine the game is your family. you are born on release you grow and live is awesome.
but then comes the time where you leave your family and go on vacation some time and on your way back you had a car crash but ur not hurt. 
You come home after the hospital and everbody you know and loved thinks ur a braindead vegetable bc thats how this game will treat you now. like a complete moron. i dont know why they streamlined this game to a potatoe but it really hurts because it had so much potential

no atlas system, no "crafting"(i know but it was kinda like that), no more charakter building. its all gone. if your looking for unique features and new gameplay you are to late

you f*cked it up (i wish it was not the developers dream to become this abombination)

review:
Jogaço 9/10
Joguei muito antes de vir pra Steam eu até utilizava um atalho para jogo não steam para jogá-lo com 'vantagens" da steam.
Agora veio pra Steam com conquistas e cartinhas *que delícia*  
uma pena não poder seguir com a velha conta, assim sendo obrigado a iniciar uma nova conta no jogo. Bem triste ter q iniciar do zero e perder todo o progresso da outra conta. Mas de certa forma conquistas e cartinhas valem o esforço xD 

O jogo é muito bom e divertido, algumas pessoas sofrem com o ping alto pois existem apenas server EU e NA, algumas não configuram direito e caem em EU e o ping fica lá na catatoba, seria uma boa ter um server SA :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198124232896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 18246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10904, 'last_played': 1586426256}
review: Richtig, gutes MMORPG. Lange nicht so ein gutes MMO gezockt. Gute Grafik - ich glaube, dass man nicht mehr aus einem I5-System rausholen kann. Zum Glück macht mein PC noch mit. Einsteigerfreundlich und mit coolem, kostenlosen Starterpaket inklusive Premium. Was will man mehr? Und nach 140h habe ich keinem dringenden Zwang echte Kohle augeben zu müssen. Ach, und die Storys machen auch Laune. Nur für PvP sind die Wartezeiten in der Lobby relativ lange. Aber das ist für mich keine große Sache. Ich könnte noch mehr Details schreiben, aber es mag mal genug sein. Anzocken wer Interesse hat und sein Rechner die Systemanforderungen noch erfüllt. (Zur Konsolenversion kann ich nichts schreiben). ;)
