author: {'steamid': '76561198072486652', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 7246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2902, 'last_played': 1632576435}
review:
游戏概念很新颖，玩家都是神，需要拯救受难的世人。
想要看宙斯大战高达吗？想要机枪狂扫鱼人吗？想要……好吧我编不下去了_(:3」∠)_
AAA级游戏画面，恰到好处的打击感。
而且，星图没啦？好评！

游戏其实是P2W，花钱可以直接重置CD，也就是可以直接变强。[spoiler]怕啥，咱有钱(大雾)[/spoiler]
游戏内容略显单调，至今都是打副本和做任务，而且还是几个地图反复打。
PVP永远在排队中(除了6人混战)。
最让我不爽的是游戏键位设置相当脑残，F12是退出游戏（steam F12截图），每次退出都会拍一张照片；空格是跳跃，空格是互动，空格是跳过对话，空格是拾取物品。
每次想要捡东西结果就在那里跳跳跳有木有！每次想对话结果在NPC面前跳跳跳有木有！每次跳过对话狂按空格结果说完了在NPC面前跳跳跳有木有！[spoiler]宛如一个智障_(:3」∠)_。[/spoiler]
现在版本职业获取相当简单，买了职业包的我想要打死自己。

新职业Outlaw可以 Die Die Die! 和 It's high noon! 设计师不会是屁股中毒了吧_(:3」∠)_

[spoiler]那些玩欧美服游戏还嚷嚷要中文的，而且没中文就给差评的智障们，你们还是去跪舔你们的腾讯爸爸吧，腾讯的wegame适合你们。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032154124', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1206, 'last_played': 1493092092}
review:
I remeber playing this about 2 years before it came to steam but couldn't get any of my friends to join and at the time it had a good mix of squad components and thus got boring entirely solo. I saw it come back and now since its on steam some friends were willing to play it with me so I download it and so do they only to find out, they changed the old weekly limits to daily ones and the only way to progress at a decent rate is to sink money into the game. But that isn't what killed it for me.

What killed it for me is they used to have this huge skill tree called the 'ascension atlas' which you could infintely progress into since there was no cap on skill points, but they ENTIRELY scrapped it at some point now there is ABSOULTELY NO CUSTIMIZATION AT ALL, all the classes are unique but everyone has the same classes with the same abilites which is boring, the gear gives such minimal impact and all has the same stats anyway so every player is the same which is stupid as shit.

Overall I would say this game had potential but they wasted it all, its only fun for the first 10 hours then there is nothing to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048597173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4872, 'last_played': 1493816276}
review:
NOTA GLOBAL: 6,5/10 --> Divertido para jugar un par de semanas en serio y luego ir dejandolo morir.

TL;DR: Es un mmorpg instanciado de ambientación futurista, combate rápido y sin fijación de objetivos similar al TERA. Posee un sistema de progresión profundo y simple al mismo tiempo y tiene un pvp muy interesante ya que hay más de 10 clases jugables. Es el MMORPG con menos grindeo que he encontrado. Sin embargo, la mayor parte del tiempo lo pasaras jugando solo y al igual que el TERA (aunque gracias a dios, menos) abusa de las misiones que piden matar y matar. Por suerte, matar es bastante divertido. La historia no es ni buena, ni mala. Las mazmorras son absurdamente dificiles por no decir imposibles si vas sin grupos preorganizados. 

*Jugabilidad (8/10): El combate es muy agradable. Es fluido, relevante a donde apuntas y personalizable con habilidades  ajenas a la clase que juegues, tanto para tu forma normal como para tu forma divina, la cual desbloqueas tras pasarte la campaña. Esta campaña es crucial para tu desarrollo inicial en el juego. Explica casi todas las mecánicas y modos de juego.  Puedes elegir entre partidas en solitario, en escuadrones de 1-3 personas, mazmorras de 5 personas, de 10, zonas de mundo abierto, pvp de 3vs3/5vs5/10vs10, batallas de panteones (los gremios de toda la vida) y alguna otra variación de los anteriores, como las invasiones o las historias. Al mismo tiempo cuentas con la opción de gestionar a tus adeptos y enviarlos a hacer misiones para cargar tu forma divina con su fe, funcionando como un pequeño "iddle game" dentro de otro. Pero todas está libertad de opciones y capas, como puede haberos parecido, resulta abrumadora en ciertos puntos. Hay mucho que aprender. A mi personalmente, se me atraviesa que no haya más habilidades o clases con habilidades de sanación y creo que a muchos de vosotros os pasará también. En cuanto a la equipación; chapó. Solo necesitas un arma para cada clase el resto es la misma para todas ellas. En ambos casos las consigues solo por jugar, así que olvidate de andar grindeando distintos sets para un mismo personaje o para todos ellos. Las clases se "equipan" también, por lo que olvidate de andar leveando más de 12 personajes,

*Graficos (9/10): Mi PC es un truño asi que lo juego en medio-bajo y aun así puedo apreciar el buen diseño de animaciones y de la apariencia de los cosméticos. En un pc que lo corra en ultra debe ser absolutamente precioso, tanto por la buena iluminación que tiene, como por los espectaculares cielos. Muy poco se le puede reprochar, tal vez hay alguna zona demasiado "natural/real", pero por lo general siempre puedes encontrar algo especial.

*Sonido (8/10): La música es agradable sin ser intrusiva, pero los sonidos de las habilidades son sencillamente maravillosos.

*Comunidad (6/10): Debe ser por ser español, pero casi siempre encuentro gente hablando en ruso o aleman. Si preguntas algo por el chat en inglés muchas veces eres ignorado, aunque sin malicia. Simplemente es que cuesta que alguien te explique dudas o encontrar compañeros para misiones. El juego tampoco está traducido al español y aunque a mí no me supone un problema, las descripciones de las habilidades son jodidamente largas y lo seguirían siendo en español, pero así cansa el triple.

NOTA TOTAL: 6,5/10  -->Divertido para jugar un par de semanas en serio y luego ir dejandolo morir

EDIT: He bajado la nota 1,5 puntos tras 12 horas más de juego por los siguientes motivos. El juego tal y como está concebido es tremendamente repetitivo, pero el diseño de enemigos es muy pobre. Están tremendamente reciclados, prácticamente tienes la sensación de que hay 4 enemigos por cada facción enemiga. Eso significa que parece que hay pocos más modelos que 16. La sanación y la defensa son irrelevantes. Solo necesitas daño y vida, da igual lo que juegues que lo único que necesitas es prestigio y la forma divina para partir bocas. El pvp está muerto y por último, las diferencias de prestigio entre los jugadores que llevan jugando desde que salio o la beta rompen el juego directamente. He llegado a abrir el juego y pasar 45 minutos en la cola para una mazmorra de la tercera provincia para irme sin haber jugado. En conclusión, si quieres divertirte con la campaña y desbloqueando las clases puedes, pero ahí se termina el gancho del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006209718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1534511246}
review:
C9랑 비슷하달까... 다만 멀티클래스고, 아무때나 원하는 클래스로 바꿀수 있다는 점은 정말 편리하고 좋네요. 
레벨은 따로 없는거 같은데 각 클래스별 전용퀘스트를 통해 스킬을 언락할수 있습니다. 
락을 해제할때마다 종합점수가 올라가는데 그것으로 캐릭터의 강함을 알수 있게 해놓은거 같아요.

임모탈에서 진짜 신이 되기위해 사람을 도와 인지도를 높이며, 그로서 신격을 얻는다는거 같아요.
다만.. 딱히 뭐 우오오오 하면서 돕는건 없는거 같고 
그냥 메뉴에서 포인트를 써서 강화해주면 믿는이가 20명정도씩 늘어나네요 ㄷㄷ 

기본적으로는 스테이지 클리어 형식으로 진행이 되는데 일정 스테이지를 클리어 하면 필드모드맵도 하나씩 열리네요.
필드에서는 각종 자원을 채집도 할수 있고 수많은 퀘스트를 즉석에서 받아서 해결하고 보상도 바로바로 받는거 같아요 .

하루 플레이하고 3일이나 지나서 평가를 달다 보니까 구체적인 용어가 생각 안나네요
어쨌든 꽤 타격감?도 있는거 같고 재밌어요. 스킬을 때려박는 느낌? 
재밌습니다 ㅎ
다만 이대로면 컨텐츠가 조금 적어보이네요. 뭐... 좀더 있겠죠. 아직 하루밖에 안했으니까.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051975962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1495996668}
review:
日本語のレビューがなかったので書いてみる

課金武器やガチャガチャなどは無く
マウント系やおしゃれな服装
クエストの報酬を増やすためのＶＩＰアクセス
だけ課金システムになっている

クラスとかはストーリー進めればすべて使えるようになるし
クエスト全般はリストからクリックしてＮＰＣの前やステージに
直接テレポートできるので英語が全然話せなくても十分遊べる

ＭＭＯというジャンルだが装備できるアイテムも少なく
武器や防具を強化するといったやりこみ要素も今のところ調べてもなかった

純粋に外国人とチャットで戯れながら美麗なグラフィックで
敵を無双したりボスＭＯＢを協力して倒すことで爽快感を得られるゲーム

協力して＆してもらってフレンドになった方々は半々くらいで男女に分かれてたから
女性も多いゲームなのかな？プレイヤー層は
ＰＵＢＧやＧＭＯＤのヤベエ人間と違って大人しい社会人が多かったです

なんか万人受けはするけど長時間やりこむほどドはまりはしないかも

英語が理解できる人には友達を増やしてＶＣでわいわいしながら
このもの凄く長くて濃厚なメインクエが楽しめるかもしれないですね





追記

Steam版Welcomeイベント中ですので最初のうちから双銃使いが使えます
あと、ハイエンドＰＣを使っていても
ロードバグが多発してよくフリーズ落ちしますのでオープンエリアから
別の戦闘エリアにテレポするときはいったん街に戻ってから移動するとクラッシュしません
せっかくパーティ招待されて一緒に遊んでいても理解してない人がたまにやらかしてくれます＾＾

それとチャットで日本語をうつと文字化けします

author: {'steamid': '76561198018649569', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1492967406}
review:
I only played about 2 hours, but for what it's worth, here is my opinion on the content I had time to approach. So keep in mind I don't know about endgame or grouped gameplay.
NB : I played a closed alpha years ago, and I left the game witout regret. When I've been told about "Skyforge" lately I didn't even notice I already played it, ah. 

The first contact is about mapping keys. Some are locked by default, which already got on my nerves, but ok, let's pass on this. Then there is the graphic part, and for what i've witnessed in the trailer, I expected the game to run quite smoothly on my 560, just like TERA. And surprisingly enough, I got huge frame drops while it looked terrible, even on maximum details. So, be warned, the optimization is nowhere to be found, and honestly, I wouldn't bother buying a $$$ rig for such poor visuals. The engine is old and badly hardcoded.

Now the gameplay. Well, nothing stunning really, same ol' stupid m1 smashin with abilities doing almost all the same. The combo system is nice tho (I rarely play mmo's, so maybe i'm being too kind), but I felt the fights were way too easy and boring to be appealing. And what about the useless and ridiculous Dash system? I don't remember having used such short dash in any game ever. Even Lara Croft can do better than that nowadays. Having players to just smash the mouse like returds is unrespectful from a dev. Now perhaps the game is aiming for a casual player base, thus making any sense of progression inexistent. And so are the fights feedbacks. It's simply not satisfying to hit/kill anything because they either vanish, either drop on place. I wish the physic engine was a bit more interactive to give more impact in combat, but it's just bland instead. 

Talking bland thing, did I mention the uninsteresting story? Okay, mmo's are garbage at story telling, but this one is way further than others. Firstly because its background is just not coherent and believable (hipster gods, faery and nanotech, yeah), but mostly because the writing is overhelmingly average, just like the characters/npc who probly sold their charism out before they got implemented. I mean, they look like they were randomly generated with the character creation tool! How is that supposed to make them important? Playing Zelda BotW is sure not helping my opinion, but I remember FF XIV was fairly correct in the that matter. Skyforge is just sounding like a "mmo maker toolkit" you can grab for 9 bucks...

Now I didn't spent much time in the menus, but the little time I had in the interface was reminding me why I dislike most mmos. Too many tabs, menus, "interactions". Has no mmo rpg's ceo heard of the sentence "less is more"? Still, I don't think it's an important thing in the genre. We'd know if mmo had brilliant UI anyway...

All-in-all, I found Skyforge very generic to be honest, and badly boring on top of it. Bad art, bad feeling, bad "universe", bad optimization, and I read here and there it is p2w like most of My.com products. And if you are to tell me "you shoulda play further in order to enjoy it", I'd answer : it's the proper goal of a studio to make you like a game right away, if they screwed it in the first hour, then they are probly bad at doing games. I think it's cancer to think one can like a game only in the long run. You can "not like" it in first hours, but I litterally hated it and was wondering why I wasted my time on such poorly designed opportunist games, even as a f2p.
I think the game will fade, just like Warface did under My.com. Imo it has no potential for hundreds of hours, unless you are masochistic. There are plenty of good games out there, free or cheap, with original ideas, a real artistic direction and addictiv gameplay. Skyforge is a bootleg vidya.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158553757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1493032486}
review:
While the graphics are often enjoyable, the cutscenes can be entertaining, and it was easy to jump into this game, I encountered multiple negatives: I got trapped early in the game due to a glitch (stuck between a vehicle and a bench), the dialogue often seemed silly, and it appears significant sums of money are necessary to succeed in this game.

For the substantial download time necessary to play this game, I was hoping for something better. Still, it is free to play and there is quite a bit here to explore. I wish the player had more agency to interact with the detailed, epic-looking world, but the controls are good and felt mostly natural. I would rank this game as a 5/10 with the potential to be much more if they revised the $$ to be focused on non-performanced related elements (i.e. costumes, scenery), resolved movement glitches, and hired someone to work on the dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027792525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1237, 'last_played': 1565313271}
review:
I think this is an excellent game, if you accept it for what it is. I've played most of the big MMO's over the years, and I recently played WoW's Legion expansion, which I thought was excellent; however I am so done with the AP grind that I am not even bothering to earn flying. And the crafting was changed to the point where it's not fun for a casual player like me. I also played ESO recently, and while it's an excellent game, it requires a lot of time and daily busywork (such as upgrading your mount's stats, crafting writs, learning styles/patterns etc) and I just do not have the time or patience that these games require of me, at this point in my adult life.

Skyforge is much more of a casual experience. Like others have said, it's lobby-based, with instanced missions that you can run solo or with groups of up to 3 players. Each region has one or two "open world" areas where you will be running around with other players, and these maps remind me of Guild Wars 2, in that there are quests and objectives scattered everywhere, and you find them by exploring the map. Tagging mobs does not appear to be an issue, at least as far as bosses go. I've jumped in to defeat quest bosses with other players and it's a quick and easy way to finish a questline. The level designs are excellent: maps are detailed and look really nice. Quest text and dialogue are pretty much as bad as everyone says, but not so bad as to ruin the experience.

Combat is a lot of fun, it reminds me of Blade and Soul, but for some reason Skyforge combat is much easier for me to manage. Some classes are combo-based and some are not. Some have "forms" or stances that switch up your available skills. Class design is really quite well done, and it's something I rarely see mentioned. If you want super complexity you can play Monk or Slayer; if you want something easier you can play Cryomancer or Outlaw. I honestly don't think the devs get enough credit for the things the game does well, and class design is one of those elements.

Since everyone can easily unlock every class on the PC version, the pay-to-win arguments usually center on the daily resets of the temples and other buildings that directly tie into your character's power level. I don't know, for me this is just not an issue. You can contribute resources to these buildings and eventually, they reach a point where you can only contribute 3 times per day, unless you reset them with a cash shop item. I don't see this being a problem unless you NEED to keep building up, and you just can't wait for the daily reset. I do my three daily contributions and that's it, I just wait for the daily reset. I'm in no hurry. You can also unlock bag slots for in-game credits and you earn enough of those to unlock a few slots every day, so storage has not been a problem for me. I am taking my time and clearing all of the maps, I'm not in a hurry to reach end game because I know that "end game" is probably where I will hit a wall, and be unable to progress without a pantheon (guild).

So if you don't go in expecting the second coming of WoW, I think there's a lot of fun to be had with Skyforge. It looks great and plays really well, and is a very good casual option to get your MMO fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013905540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1492969483}
review:
Après une participation d'une bonne douzaine d'heures sur l'une des béta, je n'avais pas franchement été emballé mais j'ai tout de même décidé de redonner une chance à Skyforge.
L'aspect free-to-play / pay-to-win est moins marqué que d'autres mais... Ben c'est bien le seul point positif que l'on peut trouver à Skyforge.
Le scénario est nul, armé de dialogues soporifiques au possible, écrits avec les pieds et traduit dans un français parfois correct, parfois ubuesque. 
Les personnages "importants" de l'histoire ont été créés avec le générateur du jeu, on peut donc créer un perso et se retrouver face un clone présenté comme le grand général Machin ou la déesse Truc, ce qui donne des scènes assez grotesque.
Les environnements sont génériques au possible, aucune interaction avec le décor ( vraiment rien ), des bugs de collision partout.
Les quêtes sont catastrophiques, niveau MMO coréen bas de gamme : buter 10 bestioles, ramasser 10 babioles par terre ou activer 3 trucs. Aucun effort pour impliquer le joueur dans ce que l'on lui demande de faire.
Le "loot" est rare et déplorable ( faut voir la tronche des "bonus" des équipements... ).
Mais le pire, c'est le gameplay... Il est d'une pauvreté affligeante, les développeurs en ont d'ailleurs parfaitement conscience : toutes les aptitudes de chaque classe se débloque en maximum 3 heures ( TOUTES ). On se retrouve à activer en boucle 3 ou 4 skills en poussant de gros soupirs.
Skyforge rejoint la masse des MMO free-to-play foireux que l'on glissera avec les autres du bout du pied sous le tapis.
Mais je tire mon chapeau devant la persévérance des développeurs...

author: {'steamid': '76561198040301747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1492928898}
review:
This game is pretty garbage. Class ults that last up to 9 min for cooldown and most of them aren't even worth a 3 min cooldown (looking at you cryomancer). Upgrades to weapons and equipment are minimal in that a 5% upgrade for whatever the item improves is considered a major power boost. 90% of boss attacks have homing and are unblockable by nature. Don't even bother using any shield ability because at best it just mitigates a sliver of the damage you receive. You literally get 5-6 attackers (dps classes) in a row while lightbinder and paladin stay as the lone support and tank classes respectively. 

I hope their is more than one support class because lightbinder is useless and btw there is no healing, only reviving. You can hotkey items to a quick access bar but unless you remember what you put in which slot it's pretty much a guessing game of "what useless item did I just activate". Is it so hard to give me another bar along the side or at the bottom of the screen for quick use items. The UI also takes a plunge into the abyss randomly to a point where accessing the map is nothing more than a pipe dream.

Expect for a class to give you a cool new ability or two and then you'll end up realizing that the abilities are related to a mode or form your class utilizes. While that may sound like a "duh" moment the abilities 9/10 times replace far more useful ones such as with the necromancer. This class was massively disappointing to me because the lich form was practically god mode and then two abilities later I couldn't even regen 8% of my health bar in lich form as opposed to the full health bar I was getting prior to the change. I can't switch my abilities back and the class is dead to me because of it.

 Later missions become impossible to solo because the difficulty spikes without reason or logic and you'll end up getting slaughtered in about 10 secs in later missions if you aren't grouped up with someone. My friend has a problem where the game black screens his computer dam near every time he leaves the game and this has apparently been a problem for the last two years with no viable fix. It was fun until the stupid class mechanics, crappy loot and glitches got in the way.  Basically just stay away from this for now and give them about a year to get their crap together.

review: Game is good. Interesting features. But not big enough player pool making you que forever quests e.g. 3v3 or 10v10 game mode. And you cannot progress your character if you cannot do the quest. Or, if you pay to bypass the quest, that you can progress your character. So, I would simply say, P2W game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992328338', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1498809189}
review:
С чего бы начать... Начну с того, что в первые дни (ОБТ) игра была довольно приятной и интересной, и любые игровые услуги были совершенно бесплатны *с наличием возможности доната*. Любые медали, репликаторы и т.д. можно было приобрести в игровом магазине за основную валюту КРЕДИТЫ, а АРГЕНТЫ ((премиум валюта) или донат валюта) её можно было получить переведя КРЕДИТЫ (основная валюта) в АРГЕНТЫ (донат валюта) с 6% комиссией от кредитов. Со временем и с добавлением многих и многих обновлений Mail, впринципе как всегда, решили оторбрать возможность играть нормально без доната и подталкивать игроков на *вынужденный донат в игру*. Т.к.  многие услуги стали "донатскими" без возможности что либо купить за КРЕДИТЫ, только самую мало важную мелочь, и АРГЕНТЫ стали полностью донат валютой(без возможности перевода кредитов в аргенты) и конечно же кол-во донаторов с начала ОБТ и до нынешнего момента резко возросло. Хочу заметить ещё то, что активно стали штамповать наборы с костюмами, которые ограничены по времени.
1 набор = 600-1200р (1 костюм, 1 000 000 кредитов, 10 медалей, 15 стимуляторов). Лично как мне кажется, такие наборы своих денег не стоят, к тому же и костюмы иногда не самые красивые. Конечно дело каждого, покупать этот набор и вестись на развод от Мыла или нет. Но напомню что с начала ОБТ такого дибилизма не было. К тому же, говоря о костюмах, при наличии купальников и плавок в магазине, купаться в игре нельзя, ибо можно утонуть. И купаться скорее всего в SF нельзя будет никогда, так как врядли Мыло соберётся это реализовывать. А ещё то, что SF в игровом центре Маил.ру имеет наличее русского языка, здесь же русский язык напрочь отсутствует (озвучка, субтитры, интерфейс) Этой игре в Steam не место!
И конечно ещё не начавшим деградировать и спасшимся от деградации от этой игры не советую естественно ни скачивать ни возвращаться в это убожество!
А так конечно, дело каждого, решаться устанавливать Skyforge или нет. Я лишь говорю то, что знаю поиграв за 2 года.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994568253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1492903952}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967722327', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1498608553}
review:
​Ein echt Tolles Game.
​Ich hatte nach über 6 stunden spielen so ein spass da wusste ich das ich es weiterspielen werde.
​Ein Abo von 30 Tagen gekauft.
​
​Schön zu sehen das es kein P2W ist.
​Wundervolle Grafik

Top Story

Top Gameplay, wobei die animationen beim bewegen schon etwas "steif" und "ruckartig" rüberkommen. Das ist aber das einzig negative ;)
​

Was ich toll finde ist das man nicht stunden festsitzen muss um was fertig zu bekommen. Es ist nicht so Zeit-intensiv.
Auch hat man nicht soviel gefummel wie in WoW und co. (Spiele ich damals lange, aber nach vielen Jahren ist das einfach zu viel. Zu viele "Möglichkeiten" Skills etc.. zu unübersichtlich.. schwer bis nicht mehr möglich wieder rein zu kommen. (Kann auch am alter von mir liegen   ) Es ist sogar übersichtlicher was Skills angeht als TERRA. Das liebe ich hier sehr.
​
​Der einstieg ist Top. Man hat alle möglichkeiten. Dank den "Moba-Skills" die sehr übersichtlich sind kommt es auf den Skill an und nicht wer die beste Hose, Shirt und Schuh aus Epic ini xxx hat. Sehr schön zu sehen.
​
​Das die "Missionen" / "Quests" etc alle in Ini-artigen Maps sind finde ich Top. Das dir nicht jeder die Rübe weghauen kann auch.
​PVP gibts ja eh, in anderen bereichen.. die muss man nicht spielen, werde ich aber machen.. auch die Rennen.. ich freue mich sehr.

ps. In Max einstellungen konnte ich es in 4K x 2k auf 43 Zoll TV von Samsung mega Spielen. Sieht so schön aus.. die grossen sachen sind dann auch mal richtig gross.. ( Das ist mein Monitor ich sitze ca. einen halben Meter davor, Curved)
i7 3770k
Nvidia GTX 1070
16 Gb Ram (1666)
Auf w10 64

Frames bis ca. 50+ (bis ca 75)
Auf meinem kleinen Asus Moni mit 1080p sind es immer über 100 FPS (bis 170)

Xbox Con. geht so bescheiden das man damit nicht spielen kann.. aber den char lenken..oO
Egal.. Maus und Tasta ist hier super.

Ob allein oder mit 4 weiteren freunden.. ich bin extrem zufrieden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025197465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1492763090}
review:
This is a very well made game. The models, animations, and effects are top notch. The voice acting is superb for a f2p mmo. The combat is great. The game's progression is lacking, though. It's based on a single main stat (might) and that's it. Because of this, the game gets pretty boring after a few hours, but please, definitely give it a shot. I would *buy* this game if it was like the first five hours of gameplay. I'm uninstalling after 7 hours but I don't regret playing it for those 7 hours. 

Remember to pick up the free steam welcome bundle!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996959826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1555550707}
review:
Problems right from the start.
AA is horrendous. Even at high settings there is silver border on many objects as if AA is turned off and it makes everything look horrible. That's the smallest of issues I've encountered at the start.
First time visiting the hub world the game got stuck on the loading screen. Had to crash it and restart to get to the hub.
The last straw is that quitting the game normally still crashes the video card turning the screen to black and nothing I can do but to reset the computer. How is this still an issue?
I can't take this game seriously. The dialog and voice work are so damn cheesy I feel like I am watching a poorly dubbed Japanese cartoon. Lip syncing is so off, even in the cutscenes. How is it possible to screw up lip syncing in cutscenes?

I was hoping the game would improve with time, but nothing seems to have changed from the Beta.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974337118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1492827204}
review:
Pros: 
-Some of the combat mechanics are fun.
-If you like hack and slash games, this MAY keep you occupied.
-Character creation is as good as some of the most recent MMORPGs.
-Doesn't stray too far from the typical starting classes, they should be fairly familiar for new players to this game.
-Had some decent skillsets, interesting takes on abilities.

Mediocre:
-Voice acting. It's not great, but it's not complete garbage either, I suppose.
-Animations are alright, nothing ground breaking, and not near as polished as most paid games.

Cons:
-Story.  I noticed several blatant rip-offs of other games within the hour I played it.  (Portal, Kingdoms of Amalur, Destiny among them)
-Animations during speech.  Often the lip sync doesn't even come close, and frequently I noticed the lips continued to move for some time after the speech was finished.  
-Interactions.  Several instances where I was told to interact with something, my character jumped instead.  I would estimate easily 40% of the time, this happened, instead of my interaction with said object.  
-Combat. Yes, this probably changes in later levels, but the initial bosses I've encountered were nothing more than meat slabs that you hack away at, No bother dodging or anything, just stab a few times and repeat. 
-Graphical woes.  Lots of clipping, character models teleporting slightly, sudden twitches and just overall weird processing to make things appear/disappear suddenly.  

I gave this game an hour, which some people will probably cry about, but as far as the story and all else goes, it really just doesn't entice me to play longer, this was enough time.  It has all the staples of a generic freemium pay-to-win type game.  Characters are very generic, voice acting is generic, stry is copy/pasted from numerous sources, and combat just feels like a freemium game.  Not bad freemium, but not quite good freemium.  It's very in the middle of the road in everything. Most of the development in this game obviously went to very bad breast physics.

If you're absolutely at the end of your rope trying to find an MMORPG that you don't have to pay a monthly sub for, then you may want to give this game a try.  For all else, I'd say you can safely avoid downloading, and you won't regret your decision, or miss anything at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002050721', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1492755376}
review:
This game just breaks my heart. I LOVE this art direction, I want more games to get out of that lame ass Tolken fantasy safe zone and make crazy new worlds, but Skyforge's gameplay is just sooo weeeeak.
I went into it knowing it's not a true MMO, and was expecting something like a Phantasy Star Online or Warframe, what I got was this janky instanced psudo action MMO where the enemies just funtion like tab target mmo mobs with homing attacks, and no real reaction to being hit. 
It's not by any means difficult, or even engaging, it just becomes almost instantly tedious. 
I already heard about the complaints about the Stimulants and the limited amount of play unless you pay2win, but none of that shit even mattered to me because just 2 hours of the games lifeless combat system that neither has the depth of a tab target MMO nor the button mashy fun of an ARPG, has completely turned me off to even trying to play any more then the limited amount of time I had before just uninstalling and moving on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128192817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1692, 'last_played': 1636338662}
review:
Si quieres pasar un buen tiempo disfrutando de un vasto mundo repleto de interacciones, te recominedo este juego, además de sencillo es bastante entretenido, por más que la dificultad no sea mucha y es un MMORPG en el cual puedas jugar sin haber tenido conocimiento de otros juegos de este género,coneste tipode mecanicas donde elgrupo y la seleccion de clases en este hacen la diferencia entre completar la mision, o fracazar una y otra vez, este juego lo recomiendo mucho, no paro de encontrar cosas nuevas, y además imagino que irán agregando muchas más, el poder jugar contra otros jugadores, además te da la oportunidad de probar tus habilidades pvp, y esto te hace mejorar al momento de enfrentar los bosses 1vs1.
Repito que la dificultad no es mucha, pero este juego puede sacarte buenos momentos si tienes amigos con los cuales jugar, o sino, puedes intentar ser el inmortal solitario más poderoso del juego, buena suerte, y espero que le des una oportunidad a este juego ya que no muchos free2plays tienen la calidad que tiene este, tanto en historia como en mecanicas de juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966021471', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1492752704}
review:
As far as instanced based party games go this has to be hands down the worst group experience I have ever played.The "story" is uninspired drivel equipped with voice acting which does not even match the subtitles. The missions are rinse and repeat linear maps with a few offshoots for minimal exloration and the multiple difficulty mode repetition of every mobile game ever.

I could only stomach 2 of the games regions (campaigns?) and a group dungeon experience that I would never like to repeat. The action combat is abysmal dodge being on significant timers and the most effective tactic still being circle strafing in 2017. For my single group dungeon experience the support and tank roles were a joke essentially boiling down to a DPS race being more effective than any attempt at teamwork. There may be a deep meta that I am missing but I do not have the patience to sift through the garbage to find it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017076013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 2811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2648, 'last_played': 1494118392}
review:
UPDATE 2 - F*CK THIS GAME

Definitely not recommended, waste of time and money. Stay away, don't fall into their trap.

UPDATE 1 - HITTING THE PAYWALL

So around 15-20 hours I finally hit that paywall people are talking about. And it's a huge paywall, like, Great Wall of China huge.

See, at the beginning of the game you can upgarde your Might pretty easily to become more powerful and progress further. But after a while, even if you pay for premium, you'll only be able to upgrade your Might 3 or 4 times a day. You can bypass this limit using special tokens, you get a few by playing, but it takes NINE tokens to bypass the limit ONCE, and I bet the amount increases each time.

And the worst is that the speed at which you increase your rank becomes SUPER SLOW. Each research only gives you 4% progress towards the next rank, which means that you can only progress by 16% each day. If you don't bypass the limit it will take you days before getting a single rank.

Which means that you will be blocked for days or even weeks doing the same low-level areas until you are Mighty enough for the next ones.

The other thing which bugs me is that the PvP is kinda mandatory. When you reach the special quests "Directives of the Council of the Gods" ( what a name ), you will have to complete a certain amount of missions. Some are PvE, others are PvP. You don't need to win in PvP to get the reward of the Council, but you need to participate ( or skip them with the same tokens I spoke of before ), and you'll be matched against players who unlocked better classes and probably paid for special gear giving them an unfair advantage.

Getting killed by OP players just to get that daily reward isn't really fun. IF you can get into a match that is, because queue times are really long.

They give you free candy ( time limited free vehicle, 3 days premium for free, 1 appearance change for free, weapons for free, a few "argents", medals, tokens, wathever ) just to take them back later to make you pay.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
ORIGINAL REVIEW - THE FIRST 15 HOURS
--------------------------------------------------------------------

TL/DR : try it, play casual, it's free, and if you hit a paywall you can always decide to pay and continue or stop.

I guess it's a good game if you don't get in expecting too much and everything for free. After playing for a few hours I liked it so I took a 30 days premium for 9.99 to increase the resources/credits earnings.

When I saw "free to play" I was expecting the same crap as usual, a game shoving its store and microtransactions in your face even before you take control of your character. Well, it was not the case here. At first it seems really "free to play" with some limitations, but the more you progress, the bigger those limitations become. You can read some negative reviews to know more about this, because I didn't reach a point where they could bother me.

You earn credits and knowledge rather quiclky, I have 600K already even after doing some rituals to get more followers and Might. If you play the game "chill" and don't bother too much about trying to maximize your earnings like a Korean farmer, you'll probably enjoy it. Basically, it's a game you play 1 or 2 hours a day to unlock more classes and buy costumes while kicking a lot of mobs in the nuts.

Pros :

- graphics are nice enough for an "mmo" and the game is well optimized even in big areas. I noticed some frame drops here and there mostly due to FX and other players on screen. The characters are well done too. And the skill special effects feel really powerful and are well done, like the Cryomancer ultimate detonating into a bubble freezing everyone around with ice and frost covering the ground and enemies, etc.

- the mechanics are interesting : you are a god, and to increase your power ( Might ) you need more and more followers. The more mortals believe in you, the more a$$ you can kick. In the lore, Gods forgotten by mortals start aging and they die. You have two ways to get followers : you can pay with credits for rituals at the cathedral, and you can rescue mortals during missions.

The other way to increase your Might is by making research on monsters. To do that you have to spend research points that you get by killing monsters, simple enough.

- there's 13 classes in total, 3 at the beginning and the rest is unlocked when you progress through the missions. You can switch your class at will outside of combat.

- the costumes and armors are nice, at least the ones for the classes. The other costumes seem a bit out of place sometimes but it's OK if you don't take the game too serisouly. It's still far from some other games with really silly costumes.

- you begin with several costumes already unlocked and can change them as you wish. You can also change the makeup, tatoos, earrings etc of the character for free in your dressing room.

- there is a Glados-like voiced AI telling you stupid stuff and giving you more or less useful info about enemies.

- missions are generally short so you can just play one from time to time when you fell it.

- plenty of mounts and vehicles to travel with, you get one for free, but the others are expensive ( 18 000 "argents" each, and you don't earn a lot of argents by simply playing ).

- the loot from mobs is obtained by opening gray Pokeballs. I sh!t you not, it's literaly a pokeball and it opens like a pokeball, but there is loot inside instead of a pikachu.

- they didn't even try to do a real story, and that's good. I mean, there IS some kind of story but nobody gives a damn, you play this game to kill monsters and loot stuff, like Diablo 3.

Cons :

- the combat could be a lot more fluid, it's not as fun as Vindictus and other games like this. I think it's mainly due to long animations and the fact that there is some kind of delay between skill activation. Like, if you use a skill and then use LMB too quickly for a normal attack, it won't register because the animation wasn't over, which totally breaks the flow of the combat. There are also several skills requiring you to hold on a button to charge up, it's kinda slow and generally you don't even see the benefit, you could just have used an instant skill instead.

- voice acting isn't really good, and there is like no lipsync with english voices.

- some aspects of the game are not well explained. For example, I played for an hour without understanding why I didn't get new skills for my class. Thing is, you have to open the map, go to your class temple and accept a quest ( kill X monsters with your class, yay ! ), and only then the XP counts to unlock skills. And when the next skill is unlocked you have to accept the quest again, otherwise you're basically wasting your time.

Another issue was with the Bastions quests that tells you to kill X monsters of a certain type. Ok so I go to a mission and kill the monnsters, but the quest didn't update. In fact I had to click on the "Adventure" button which teleports me in the exact same zone, but now the quest is active... Really dumb game design.

- some things in the store seem a bit overpriced, especially anything requiring "argents" ( I wonder why they didn't call that "gems" or "diamonds" because the icon looks like a gem ). The costumes requiring argents instead of cerdits have nothing special, they're even worse than the class costumes.

- the "open world" areas are bad, with a ton of other players all playing solo and waiting for mob respawn, or quest objective respawn, or boss respawn. The normal missions are solo/coop, but those special areas are the "mmo" part of the game and honestly I don't see the point.

- despite the tutorial, menus and game mechanics are extremely confusing at first. 10 hours in and I still don't understand some stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116234220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4266, 'last_played': 1493395500}
review:
Played this awhile ago before it was on Steam and it's overly clear they replaced Weekly Caps with Daily Caps and those Daily Caps are huge Pay-Walls.

Pay to Win to an extreme amount. 

While some could argue you can accomplish anything in the game without spending a dime (and I'm sure it is possible) it would take you an unrealistic amount of time.

Virtually no one participates in PvP, yet you'll be given quests for PvP.
Virtually no one uses the Group Finder, you'll spend a staggeringly stupid about of time looking in Chat.
Virtually no real content can be done solo.
Virtually no real Mid-Game/End-Game content can be done without God Mode.

God Mode requires Faith. Faith is the slowest BS thing in the world to get.

If you want to dump money into a dying game to have a bit of fun then this isn't a complete waste of your time.
I spent nearly 60 Hours trying to just enjoy Junior God Mode till I realized that without spending money it would take me months to get to a point where the game was more enjoyable then tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163026566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1492704348}
review:
With all the f2p games out these days, you would think that most of the microtransaction ones would have learned the old bait and switch draw in by now.

I did enjoy the game the first night, communtity wasn't toxic, so I played a couple of hours, claimed my DAILY log in gift/reward, logged out. Logged back in 2 days later to play again, but no DAILY log in gift/reward this time. No biggie, not an entitlement type of person, still played for a little bit, logged out.

Logged in the next day, still no DAILY log in gift/reward. Now I am getting skeptical about the game, like they are only after a quick cash grab. Still played a few minutes, logged out.

Logged in today, yep, you guessed it, no DAILY gift/reward, logged out, uninstalled, and wrote this review to maybe help a few others avoid the install/unistall waste of time. 

It might have potential down the road, but due to many other alledged f2p games that I had similar experiences in, my gut was telling me GTFO now, so I did. 

One other thing to note, when I uninstalled, it removed the entire game from my Steam Library, which is the first game that's done that so far. So that's another, "DANGER! Will Robinson, DANGER!", to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038513379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1492695580}
review:
The PvE is decent at best. I tried to understand the story but the voice acting made me want to quit entirely. You get no introduction to the classes and their skills, but you can start the temple quests they come with to get a better understanding, which still doesn't really help that I spent 2 hours understanding one class and their abillities. I'd personally liked a way to get people to group up with me easier and complete the missions.

I've tried doing the first raid mission thing and succesfully went through it until the first boss. I got there twice and only managed to get them down to 6 bars. It's not possible to pass them when they keep spawning ten virds every 10 seconds. Maybe I just don't have enough might and I need better co-ordination with my teammates, but damn it is hard.

The idea of the capital is nice. It would be a good thought to add a sort of town managing game going on while you play the game, like two games in one. Since you are a god and people build civilizations around your name, it would probably make sense? Just a thought.

PvP is really bad. I've mainly seen a bunch of cryomancers picking off low-health people and claiming the kill for themselves. You couldn't at least make the map a little bigger and make it easier for personal fights? I haven't really tried the other PvP types since i waited 20 minutes and still didn't get a result.

It's fun for a while until you start getting bored of doing the same thing over and over, although I do admire the graphics and enemy design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020595897', 'num_games_owned': 2587, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1629619518}
review:
[h1] Nothing to write home about [/h1]

The game has improved quite a bit since I last played it. They removed the class trees which were quite confusing for some new players (I also had some trouble with them at the start) and also removed some currencies. The combat is pretty fun and I enjoy it quite a bit, but the quests are quite bland and unimaginative. Also the game is kinda grindy and you repeat the same shit over and over again. 

My biggest problem with the game's release on Steam is that they don't allow you to connect your existing account to Steam. I don't really see why they did this (other mmo's let you merge your two accounts, for example ESO). I personally won't be playing the Steam version because I invested some time and effort in the other account and starting from zero isn't  very appealing.

P.S.: I played the game casually so I didn't get to the end-game content. I can't really say if the game is p2w or not, but given the way they handled their other mmo, Allods Online, I wouldn't hold my breath. You should check some reddit/forum posts and see what other players have to say about the game if you plan to play it for more than a couple of hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046884259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1838, 'last_played': 1522109854}
review: Most of these negative reviews are so insanely petty. Listen if you like Action RPG/Hack n' Slash games this one is awesome. Its much more of a online co-op game than a mmo which is fine for me anyway. Theres a ton of classes and they all play differently so anyone could find something they like. The graphics are very nice and the skills are flashy enough to stay interesting. I dont know what the game was like before the big update, but right now I'm lovin it. About the pay2win thing, i mean if you just play the game and do everything there is to do youll be totally fine. I personally havent hit a wall of any sort and really dont see any real benefit of the p2w so many people claim there is. If you group up with people i mean things scale around so no one is underpowered. This is not an open world game of any sort. You could closely compare it Destiny in the way you have like a hub world and just teleport to missions and such. For me it works, i like it. This game is definitly worth trying. I'm seeing a lot of stuff about optimization issues. Well i got a gtx970 and an i7 and im runnin everything Max with no lag or any issues. I'm not the kind of person who monitors fps like a hawk, but it runs totally smooth for me. If you try it go ahead and pick up the free Outlaw class dlc (i had to DL it while the game was open for it to work), and just have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260029961', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1494023824}
review: this game isn't terrible but its pretty mediocre, the customization is very minimal due to the fact there is no armor system nor skill building system. the only thing that gives changes to your abilitys and playstyles are the classes which are unique however there are only 14 currently and they only have about 6 skills at most. there is no level up system, instead the only way to get stronger is to increase the amount of might you have. by spending the in game currency which in it self its pointless because you dont actually get to buy anything, you can gain more might which is the main way of getting stronger. the secondary way of getting stronger is to obtain accessorys  which because there is no market system is to grind  bosses by completing linear missions, due to the fact this game isn't open world.  the accessorys dont give special buffs, at least non that i encountered, instead they simply give medicore dmg multipliers which simpy like i said make you stronger.  to me the game seems pointless to play after a while if you already own another mmo such as guild wars or BDO.  the lack of any depth is what really turns me off from this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028149262', 'num_games_owned': 811, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1493087444}
review:
PvE is incredibly boring. all you do is mash whatever your class's low cd aoe is. Worse, you can't skip ahead to make things harder. I jumped to some adventure map 3-4 chapters down the line and the damn thing just raised my stats up to match the enemies.

Dashing doesn't appear to do anything. If an animation starts then the attack has already hit or not hit. A traditional mmo pretending to be a action mmo.

PvP is required in the daily missions, and those daily missions are the only way to get a few currencys. The missions are essentially impossible to queue for out of a combination of low player population and the ability to skip quests.
I never managed to actually play a pvp mission.


14 hours tho. Its not a good game, but it has that addictive grindy thing that good mmos have.
Give it a shot if thats what you're looking for

author: {'steamid': '76561198074755209', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1578314997}
review:
Как и любая другая игра Skyforge всегда найдет своего игрока которому она понравится. 
Лично мне понравилась еще с бета релизов на Mail.ru, конечно спустя два года многие моменты в игре повырезали, но игра не потиряла своего колорита.
Всем  игрокам которые хотят играть на русском не печальтесь русский язык можно настроить ниже опишу как:

1.В Steam заходим в библиотку, правой кнопкой мыши нажимаем на Skyforge и выбираем свойства.
2. В свойствах переходим на вкладку Локальные файлы и нажимаем просмотреть локальные файлы. 
3. Откроется папка с игрой в ней выбрать папку \Skyforge MyCom в ней папку \data\Packs
4. В папке \Packs находим файл de_DE.pak переименовываем егов 1de_DE.pak
5. Далее находим файл ru_RU.pak и переименовываем егов de_DE.pak.
6. Фйал переименованый нами ранее в 1de_DE.pak переименовываем ru_RU.pak.
7. запускаем игру, в лаунчере в пункте Language выбираем DE ждем пару секунд пока лаунчер сохронит настройки и можно запускать игру.

В игре изменится интерфейс, диалоги, субтитры на русский язык. Озвучка останется английская.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034367523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 6064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1643821446}
review:
Jeu sur lequel je me suis borné il y a un sacré bout de temps avant qu'il passe steam.
Le systeme était déja pas térrible et les personnages graphismes et autres n'étaient pas mauvais sans plus
Avec les changements accomplis après avoir arnaqué nombre de monde le jeu a été abandonné en masse.
La pauvreté du gameplay la linéarité et la répétitivité ont eu raison de lui en plus du graphisme revu à la baisse. De la chiantise fabuleuse pour la gestion tout aussi ennuyeuse.

je ne le conseil pas à moins d'être vraiment vraiment fan car ce n'est plus ce que ct au début et franchement c'est soporifique et frustrant et over kikoolol.

De retour pour voir ou ça en est, le jeu est graphiquement toujours plus moche, les serveurs totalement à la masse, les animations totalement bug. C'est un bordel immense d'interface à la pisse litéralement.
toutes les possessions ont disparu c'est bien la peine.....
Un systeme money money absurde.

bref ça n'a fait qu'empirer vers le kikoo lol money sans rien apporter. 

une vraie poubelle pour un jeu d'une longueur monstre à télécharger probablement le lot de bugs qui fait la moitié de celui-ci.
quasi injouable la plupart du temps avec des décalages et lags server.

répétitif/20 ciblage ridicule/20

même si le graphique a repris un peu de qualité, il reste très en dessous de ses débuts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094054901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1567847102}
review:
I've played this game on and off since beta, and without exception it's worse every time I try it again. In the current iteration of the game you're completely blocked from progressing, and aggressively so, by a pretty harsh timewall (that you can skip by paying into the game of course). After you hit level 10 in research and have like 1k followers you can only do research and pay for more followers 3 times per day. Add to that the stuttering fps, the randomly getting caught on the terrain and the repetitive gameplay, you have a mmo that I want to love, but just falls short of been even simi decent.

tl;dr:  Don't bother playing if you want to progress without paying in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095002399', 'num_games_owned': 1014, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 7953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2751, 'last_played': 1543262760}
review:
TL:DR below. Please don't listen to short-sighted, low time negative reviews on any game.

In order for a free to play game to stay alive and continue to provide stellar content, some in the playerbase have to spend money to support the devs. 

Most Free to Play games hit you with a paywall after about two hours of playing, where you have to spend money if you want to get any further enjoyment from the game.  This is not the case with Skyforge.  I've gotten a solid 30 hours of enjoyable content for free with no strong-arm tactics to make me buy anything. Many $60 titles can't give you 30 hours of content. 

Their model is based on a subscription where subs get double XP gain. You can spend money elsewhere but, I have yet to feel pressured into purchasing anything. The difficulty and progression curve for free players feels natural rather than grind-y. 

+ Pros + 

+ No crushing paywall. 
+ Tons of free content.
+ Characters are unlocked by easily beating map levels instead of grinding for hours (looking at you Rainbow Six Siege wtf...)
+ Solid, optimized graphics. Solid character creation.
+ Only a small amount of lag in hub areas (as a NA playing on an EU server)
+ Several ways to experience the game (solo, open-world maps, groups and guilds, pvp)
+ Pleasant community (easy to find groups or get questions answered)
+ Missions are similar but, do not feel like copy/paste. 

- Cons - 

- Confusing UI in places. 
- PvP is likely pay to win. 
- English voice acting is god awful. 
- Lots of daily activities that can be difficult to keep up with. (I view this as extra content but, some might not like dailies.  This may mean that MMOs possibly aren't your thing.)
- Some tutorials are more confusing than helpful. 

I think the most feelbads I've gotten from this game so far are as a new player trying to figure things out.  Many menus can be needlessly confusing but, make more sense once you figure it out.  

Questions? Reply to this review and I'll get back to you.

My rig for reference. 
CPU: FX8350 ~4.2ghz
RAM: 16gb
GPU: GTX770 4gb

author: {'steamid': '76561197986779581', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1492550560}
review:
I tried to like this game but in the end, I just can't.
No real questing, it's just "go there and kill X" or "go there and press space until you get the next waypoint". No character building, you can change your class when you unlock them (three classes at the start) but that's it. You get no talent/skill points to spend, nothing, even the gear is uninnovative and bland.
It was fun for a couple of evenings but it gets VERY repetetive and quite honestly boring very quickly. There's no real challenge, I died 4 times and two of those deaths when I ran into water (...honestly, year 2017 and my character can't swim?). The monsters are more or less all the same (tbh they feel like reskins of one monster type) and the bosses are just plain boring and unimaginative.

TL&DR: A Nice technology demo for a game but there's no game inside. Waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077029355', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 199857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54537, 'last_played': 1689181350}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198034083409', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 21435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18454, 'last_played': 1580570234}
review:
Edit 09.2017: The game improved much with how you progress and get loot. Much more enjoyable now! Also, I'd like to mention, there's really cool stories in game, like a solo campain. Very niiice :)

It's nice game, just don't spend too much.

Pros: Looks good, runs good even on older PC's, combat is enjoyable (but not with all classes), decent amount of stuff to do.

Cons: P2W or more like pay to progress million times faster, very strange business model, forced PvP - but can skip with some stuff you earn ingame (but can't earn enough without spending money) or can buy ofc, premium system is really awful, lack of solo content happens soon - in about 20-50 hrs (depends how hardcore you are).

Apart from the lack of a mount when playing as F2P and the fact that without buying things will make the progress ubelievably slow, it is still a fun game to check out, worth the short time even in F2P scheme for a short while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052232126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3263, 'last_played': 1501278558}
review:
It's alright to be honest.

The big complaint seems to be the pay-to-win factor. I will admit that if you pay you will level-up faster. However if you're up for a good grind a free player can do as much as a paying player, it'll just take a bit more time. I think that all in all the game is alright but if this puts you off then this game is not for you. 

I have personally had a positive experience playing with friends and making friends in this MMO. So that's why I recommend it. I can imagine that if you're a solo player the grind (you will do quite a bit of grinding) may be very boring though, so be warned.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998362614', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1492556931}
review:
MMORPG?  More like MOBA.  Instanced everything.  Ughs.  One day we'll see another good "real" MMORPG release.  My first impressions.  Another slack-jaw'd Dev group releasing a half-arsed product.

Dialogue seemed phoned-in and didn't match on-screen captions.  Seems they focused on graphics but did not focus much on ambient sounds or music.  A lot of generic sounds in this game I will soon forget.  Nothing stood out.

Optimization seemed really poor.  My system defaulted to medium settings.  I put it on high and there was stutter.  The game still did not look very impressive for 'high' settings.  I have ran multiple games with higher settings and they have looked much better with less stutter than this game.

Forced tutorial.  Ughs.  All that NPC chatter... ughs.  Same ol' same ol'.  Nothing impressive and some company just looking for cash IMO.  What does this game offer which is new, innovative, fun, and is going to keep me coming back day in and day out time-and-time again...?  Nothing!  A little under an hour of playing and I seen nothing impressive.  Got bored.  Was not expecting much for a F2P title, and it lived up to those expectations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031386412', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1492551007}
review:
Ehm... ja, simples Gameplay, simple Steuerung, simple Abstürze, weiss gott was da programmiert wurde. 6 mal gekickt... naja für das einfach gibt es 10/10 punkte weils jeder Depp spielen kann. Grafik gibt es 8 / 10 und Sound ebenfalls 8/10. Alles sehr linear. Preise sind günstig, auch Vip Status ist billig mit 10 euro für einen Monat. Die Edelsteine sind moderat und die Stufen zum nächsten Vip sind hoch. dafür gibt es 7/10
Durchschnittliche Unterhaltung bei der man auch ne Tüte rauchen kann, wenig Klassen zur Auswahl am Anfang nur 3, vielleicht später mehr KA. 
Ich empfehle dieses Spiel weil es gechillt spielbar ist und sich bei der Echtgeldausgabe in Grenzen hält, gutes Potential

author: {'steamid': '76561198021976118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 2541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1622718201}
review:
Skyforge isn't your normal MMORPG; the levels are instanced, you can change between each class whenever you want, you can unlock new classes.

The gameplay itself may not be cutting edge or new but it works, it's your standard combo based left click + right click combo for basic attacks and variants with skills being on keys 1 - 4 (incliding C, V & R) 

The interface is a little confusing at first but once you get used to where to find things it's fairly easy.


TL;DR
Solid F2P game, don't get upset when you experience any Premium advantages.
Everyone who write a negative comment saying its pay to win doesn't understand what a F2P MMO means.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377855347', 'num_games_owned': 5, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1492768834}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054791328', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1492531138}
review:
Want the tl/dr, skip to the end. Anyone still here? Strap yourself in. I played this game when it launched originally, and for the time I played it, I had a blast. I loved it, and would have GLADLY recommended this game even after I drifted away from it. It had just the right level of complexity, and the old ascension atlas was not the deepest thing in the world, but between it, the various skills you had, the passives, and other little things you could do to tweak and optimize your character, It gave you this feeling that you were making progress (Even if it was a bit of a grind. Lets face it, it's a free mmo. You go in expecting a grind.).

I speak of all these things in the past tense because they are dust in the wind now. The best way to describe it is, "Gutted" which is what has happened here. The ascension atlas is removed, skills are acquired through a canned simple "Kill enemies get bacon system". The overall number of skills has been sliced in half for many classes, and you can't mix and match skills given they don't exist and the option isn't there. Passives....what passives? Cryomancer, the most basic, and in many cases, first attacking class is now limited to 3, something I saw as soon as i grabbed the class and thought that more would open up, or reveal themselves ~there's only 3~. Graphically it has been dumbed down as well from early days of the game, and I think this is the first time I've seen optimization work backwards with the game running worse on the same system than before on lower settings. The icing on the cake is that there is only one stat that matters now when we talk about dealing damage, healing, anything that uses your skills. Might. There are other stats, but this is the god stat (badumtiss) and everything else is secondary to it by way of nothing else being there to make it tertiary.

Long and short is, this game is oversimplified now beyond anything that should be on pc, and yet games like this exist. By that I mean games so simple they could be ported to mobile if not for how pretty the developer (tries) to make them look. In this case, done in the favor of 'streamlining the game' but you can streamline a game without gutting it and leaving it to feel like a pinata not full of treats or angry bees, but rather a wet fart.The game still has potential. They've shown they can do creativei nteresting things with it (outlaw class), but right now that creativity is wasted on this when it could go to a better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136351564', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1693098956}
review:
Pros:

Graphics are great
Questing
Operations
Guilds aka. Pantheons
Lots of locations
PVE and PVP game play








GROUPING:
Social Grouping with friends is limited to after 3rd location of the first Province

Pantheons are available to join and if you want to create your own, you need 50000 credits and 2 members before the 7 days is up or it automatically disbands.

NAVIGATION:
Capital system is kind of like a facebook game UI click and upgrade format.
Both Capital system and Provinces seem to be this way of a facebook game UI.

The game is lacking the aspect of true open world navigation. 
In this game where one WOULD NOT simply walk to your next destination here you must go back to the Devine Observatory, then access the location via a connection system or the shuttle terminals.

-----------------------------------------GAME PLAY------------------------------------------------------------------------
COMBAT:
Abilities are limited to 9 on your abilities bar most have timers , so the combat is a lot of repetitiousness.
Combos are put in to try to eleviate this but it doesn't,due to the fact there are very limited amounts of combos.




FACTIONS:
Player chosen factions: NONE


------------------------------------------ CLASSES ------------------------------------------------------------------------
PALADIN:

The Paladin is a great tanking class but over all not effective because it has no self healing capabilities.
On your own if you're not paying close attention to the health drops that appear and sometimes even then not enough for the damage you're taking you could end up dead rather quickly.

OUTLAW: 

The Outlaw is very DPS heavy and over all excellent for dealing large amounts of damage very quickly. However, not very good when it comes to taking damage.

If your outlaw how ever gets over board and decides to go in first, he could end up pulling and dead before you realize this.





-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

CONS:
Hack and Slash/Shooter, NOT A TRUE MMO



OVERALL:
Just realized i was playing on EU 
10/10 best hack and slash shooter.

review: Just downloaded and installed the game to give future players a heads up on the game and company. I bought into the closed beta and open beta . My.com is that type of game company every single game they release is bought into , and everything they sell in the cash shop is 50$ min. mounts costumes ect all 50$ i bought the gunner starting off with . it was a fun game starting out but gets very boring after the first 30 hours, i had issues with a witch/necro pack i had purchased also , i submitted a ticket and posted the email confirmation of me buying the pack 100$ it was during a halloween event . i was told there was no record of the purchase and therefore no refund or compensation(even though i had attached the purchase # with paypal and the actual email from them)up till then i had spent close to 8-900$ on different stuff. you would think they would take the time to assist me but na lol no help at all , with thier latest release its the same conceptrevelation online 100$ buy in for closed beta and after open beta the packs are $4 less to compensate for no closed access now lol , everything in the cash shop is once again $50 min buy in , needless to say i had bought into that with out realising it was my.com lol . they had the cash shop active before the game was even playable (which also is a sign of gimme gimme gimme) i can not in anyway recommend this game even with over 500 hours and 12 classes unlocked. nothing about this company is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281816562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1514305063}
review:
先看一组数据：
截止2017/04/16， 我在美服总共玩了679小时。其中弓箭手玩了424小时。
[url=https://na.portal.sf.my.com/user/avatarstats/72147753992182426] 数据详见这里。[/url]

我想说我还是推荐这款游戏的。
优点：
1.美术很好，画面很棒
2.全职业免费且任意更换 （非神模式战斗后可切换职业，神模式下随时切换职业）
3.个性化内容十足（你可以解锁堡垒来获得符文，可以为你的追随者装备物品来提升自己的属性，可以自己选择神之力量的专精方向...）
4. 虽然有一些P2W的感觉，但如果你不是PVP控，差别还是不是很大的。（PayToWin，即RMB玩家赛高）
5. 游戏全程没等级，只有战力的衡量标准。非raid图大部分会平衡战力（低战力玩家的属性会等比上升到队伍中最高战力玩家的水平）
6. 此游戏对非raid的战斗策略要求较低，新手玩家可以快速入手。

缺点：
1. 自从大更新后，对新人的友好程度不够高。 老玩家（包括我）摸索了大概2个月才搞懂新的玩法。
2. 自从大更新后，取消了星图，删除了部分技能，个性化内容有所降低，你不再可以完完全全自定义你角色的成长属性.
3. 氪金元素增加。（不给钱你就多花时间吧！）
4. 属性跳动幅度太高，有时更换一个装备战力都会上升几百万，充分体现了Might（游戏内主属性）的重要性。 但是每日任务的数量有限，所以如果你想快速提升你的Might，你又得氪金。
5. 有的时候新玩家找团体刷本会等很久，因为没人刷那个副本。

给新入坑的玩家的建议：
1. 找一个活跃的公会/QQ群
2. 每日尽量完成 每日任务 + 堡垒提升 + 敌人研究 + 教堂招追随者
3. 有闲钱和多余的知识点尽量去大教堂和知识殿堂提升属性。
4. 尽量学会 至少一个dps职业（弓箭手archer/枪炮师gunner/亡命之徒outlaw/初始职业冰法师cyto）， 一个tank职业（一般都是骑士Knight），一个support（这里建议两个都学会）
5. 如果要氪金，尽量先购买月卡会员，获得的钱和道具大幅增加。 有闲钱可以购买他们的组合包。
6. 打不过怎么办？变身神模式！ 一个神不够？那就两个。两个不够就三个，总会够的嘛...手动滑稽

有任何问题可以留言。
可能还会追加评论。

附加:
COI副本教程：[url=http://www.bilibili.com/video/av9992913/]点击这里查看[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197973790430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1492364900}
review:
Skyforge ist ein meiner Meinung nach ein super Spiel. Es hat ein aktives Kampfsysytem, ein schönes erfrischendes Setting und ein echt gelungenes look and feel, was die Atmosphäre enorm steigert. Einziger, und leider auch vernichtender, Kritikpunkt für mich ist, dass es keine offene Spielwelt gibt, bis auf die paar kleinen Abenteuergebiete. Man portet sich aus der Basis in instanzierte Bereiche mit immer anderen Quests und Monstern. Wenn einen das allesdings nicht stört, hat man mit Skyforg eine menge spaß. Am Besten selber reinschauen und sich ein eigenes Bild machen, ist ja Kostenlos.
und wer nicht selber spielen will... hier ein Video meines Ersteindrucks
https://youtu.be/TaJyOqK3ixA

author: {'steamid': '76561198065141131', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1492334280}
review: I didnt like this much, You go into an instance.. finish it just to go back and use the map/globe to head to your next area, SAME AREA...---> wich you have to do very often.          Some of the classes are alright and it is cool that you can switch classes on the fly, I didnt like the costumes much, as it seems everyone has the same thing you cant change the shirt/legs/boots/gloves the only thing you CAN CHANGE is the Hat, instead the costumes are a full set that can only be colored different, the customization is not that great. The mounts you get are set on a Timer before they go away, in order to make them permant you have to collect tons of the Timed ones, makes no sense to me really. Creating your charecter is pretty decent tho it has sliders for all the basic charecter creation. If you are wanting a game with the same type of combat style but.. much better and better charecter customization give TERA a try, If you want a game simular to this with the instances but yet you have alot of open world to boot and tons tons tons of charecter customization give DC Universe Online a try.  As for SKYFORGE Im give this one a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050961001', 'num_games_owned': 1361, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1681922516}
review:
Die Beschreibung bei Steam lautet : 

"Skyforge ist ein kostenloses AAA Science-Fiction Fantasy MMORPG, das in einem brandneuen Universum voller Götter und Helden spielt, die mit futuristischen Technologien gegen unglaubliche Kreaturen kämpfen und ihren Planeten gegen Invasoren fremder Welten verteidigen."

Ich habe es etwas angespielt und mir gefällt es. Jedoch bewerte ich es nicht als MMORPG. In meinen Augen ist es kein MMO. Zumindest das was ich bisher gesehen habe. Jedoch werde ich es noch weiter testen, falls ich mich irre :)..

Am ehesten würde ich es mit Warframe oder Destiny vergleichen. Wobei das Rollenspiel hier ausgeprägter ist. 


+Es gibt viele verschiedene Klassen, wobei man mit einem erstellten Char alle spielen kann. Was ich schonmal sehr gut finde. Zu Beginn kann man sich für eine von 3 Klassen entscheiden. Meine Wahl fiel auf dem Kyromanten. Ein Frost Magier der für Schaden verantwortlich ist. Alternativ gibt es noch den Priester als Unterstützer oder den Paladin als Allrounder/Tank. 

+Das Kampfsystem ist Actionlastig. Wie zb Elder Scrolls Online oder TERA usw. Die Fähigkeiten sind super animiert. 

+Außerdem kann man es auch bequem mit einem Controller spielen. Ganz klarer Plus Punkt. 

-Es gibt keine Level, Ausrüstung droppt in den Gebieten ist aber im Prinzip immer das gleiche. Der Reiz zum weiter spielen ist nicht unbedingt groß, da man nicht wirklich weiß was man zum Anfang erreichen kann bzw. machen soll. 

-Die Story ist ziemlich flach aber voll vertont. Englisch mit deutschen Untertiteln. Wundert euch nicht : Man startet ohne eine Klasse auszuwählen, man spielt erst ein kleines Tutorial um die Spielmechaniken zu erlernen und stirbt... 

Man steht jedoch als Gott wieder auf und die Aufgabe ist relativ schnell klar definiert, wir müssen den Menschen auf unserem Planeten helfen, welche uns anbeten. Und so kämpft man sich Zone um Zone, Gebiet zu Gebiet durch. 

Was mich zum Punkt bringt der mir gar nicht gefällt und wesegen dieses Review auch ganz klar den Singleplayer anstelle des MMOs bewertet: 

-Die Karte ist instanziert! Es gibt verschiedene Zonen in den jeweiligen Gebieten. Und so gehts nach alter Mario World Manier  durch die Karte durch. Eine Zone nach der anderen. Die Zone ist jeweils mit der Quest verbunden. Und wirklich viel zu entdecken gibts dort leider nicht. Man wird stumpf, durch diese Zone geführt. Müssen Gruppen von Gegnern kaputt machen, Zwischenbosse mit viel Leben besiegen, und zum Schluss immer den Endboss bezwingen. Ist man fertig gibts die nächste Quest für die nächste Zone und das geht immer so weiter... Abwechslung sieht anders aus!

+ Das Spiel wird als AAA Titel beworben. Ein Witcher 3 ist es jetzt nicht aber die Kulisse sticht doch deutlich ab von sonstigen MMOs. Ich finde es stimmig. 

+ Bei Steam gibts einen kostenlosen DLC  : Free Steam Welcome Gift. Beinhaltet 3 Tage Abo, und eine zusätzliche Klasse den Revolverhelden. Schnappt zu solange man es noch umsonst bekommt. 

+ Da es ein F2P Spiel ist gibt es natürlich auch den Shop wobei ich hier sagen muss das es dort scheinbar nur Abos zum Kauf gibt. Wirklich was bringen tut es nicht. 

Alles in allem gefällt mir das Spiel aber ich sehe es nicht als MMORPG eher als Singleplayer/KOOP ARPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043347394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1492447236}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085971951', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1493909398}
review:
A fun and casual dungeon crawler that focus on it's combat. The great thing about this game that it's not shy about how ridiculous the enemy. From rats to mech, big to small, this game enemy is really great. The story itself is a letdown though and the voice acting and "dialogue" is weird and clunky.

The game got 14 class, though you can only get three and the other are on later mission. The combat is not that deep, the closest example is like smite but much more fluid and responsive. The game UI and RPG system is pretty easy to understand too. 

Remember that because this game is just released, there are not many people playing in campaign that you can join, so mostly you just play alone.
